...If you have something to funny to share with me, Tomoko, I would prefer that over trying to sneak glances at me.
...Is there something funny about me, Tomoko? I don't appreciate your constant glances.
...Tomoko, why are you avoiding my line of sight and grinning to yourself?
...Are you plotting some kind of prank, Tomoko? You're looking at me and smiling.
...If you have something to funny to share with me, Tomoko, I would prefer that over trying to sneak glances at me.
...Is there something funny about me, Tomoko? I don't appreciate your constant glances.
...Yes, Mejare is made up of all women, Tomoko. But I'm not sure what "lesbos" means.
...I understand if it's a shock for an Earth girl to picture life without men. Apparently "lesbos" is your word for it?
"Les"..."bos"? I'm not familiar with that term, Tomoko...but yes, you're correct. No men live on my homeworld.
Don't think that men aren't close by, Tomoko...we are at war with a planet of them. Does "lesbos" mean women isolated from men?
...A "prejudice against introverts." How did you come to this conclusion? No one is obligated to pay you any attention.
...Introverted women tend not to stand up for themselves, Tomoko. That may be why you feel discriminated against.
...Is that so, Tomoko? Mejare has a prejudice against pirates--and in either case, the only solution is for women to stand up for themselves.
...I assume you've experienced this prejudice firsthand. I understand being reserved, but there is a time and a place to act.
..."Otoh-may"? That may be Earth slang I'm not familiar with... and what's this about virtual male children?
..."Virtual boys"? I might require some more context for what an "otoh-may" game is...
...Is "otoh-may" a variety of card game? We do have virtual versions of poker and such, but..."virtual boys"?
...Tomoko, stop throwing Earth words around like "otoh-may" and "boys" without explaining them. I can't make sense of this.
...I appreciate the compliment, Tomoko, but what would you have me do? Intentionally throw hands?
Thank you, Tomoko...I suppose. Poker is meant to be a game of intelligence, you know.
...Thank you. I always appreciate it when my crewmates say I'm smart...are you telling me to sabotage myself for fairness?
...I can't change how intelligent how I am, Tomoko. But I appreciate you saying so...it's more experience than anything.
...Your room, Tomoko? Surely you know more about your own homeworld. What about the town you live in?
...You really don't leave your house at all, Tomoko? Where on this planet is your home located?
You left your house to come here, Tomoko. You must know about other places--what about your hometown?
...I'm sure your room is nice, Tomoko, but even you felt compelled to leave it for this place. What region do you live in, exactly?
...Mejare is quite familiar with humiliation, Tomoko. Women do not stop judging each others' hip measurements once they leave Earth.
...Mejarians are very much still human women, Tomoko. Humiliation is a part of our culture--such as for being out of shape or poor.
...Mejare's women brought humiliation with them from Earth, Tomoko. Ask any girl whose bust fails to measure up.
...Humiliation is universal among humans, Tomoko. A Mejarian girl can still be shamed for her parents' mistakes...or a scrawny build.
...Space travel did not eliminate embarrassment in our culture, Tomoko. Though with how Earthlings dress, I can see how you'd think that...
...Don't treat me like an alien, Tomoko. Mejarians feel embarrassment, despite our preference for tight clothing.
...Are you implying a Mejarian woman would not understand embarrassment? There is more to embarrassment than revealing clothing.
...My suit may put my body on display, Tomoko, but I still understand embarrassment. Earth doesn't have a monopoly on emotions.
"Magic"? If it's anything but that, then I've never seen energy manipulated like this. Obviously I'd like to know more--before I consider you a threat.
Don't toy with me after demonstrating such strange powers, "Yuelia." Either explain yourself or I'll treat you as a threat.
"Magic"...I know our protocol for unknown threats. If you refuse to explain further, I will follow it.
You've already shown yourself to wield dangerous power, Yuelia. I won't beg a potential enemy for an explanation.
Your "father"? ...Wait, men are parents of women here. That's what you mean, right? Not that it explains your transformation.
...Your "father" is your male parent, if I'm not mistaken. That does little to explain your magical powers.
...I admit I'm no expert on "fathers," but I thought they were male parents, not magical insects.
...I had to remind myself what a "father" was. But I know that an average man cannot give his daughter magical powers.
"Tanabata"? No, I haven't. Is it some kind of Earth custom?
"Tanabata"...I don't know enough about Earth languages. Is that a place, or some sort of event?
I'd be happy to hear about one of Earth's cultural events, Tomoko. Mejare might have something similar.
"Tanabata"...I haven't heard of that. Mejare maintained many of Earth's customs--does that one involve men?
...That seems to go against the spirit of the custom, Tomoko. What do you wish for yourself?
...Do you hang up a wish tag of your own, Tomoko? You should at least do that if you're going to read those of others.
...And what do people on Earth usually wish for? What about you personally?
...Do you make wishes yourself, Tomoko? Or...have you ever tried to grant one of the wishes you read?
..."Lewd artifacts"? I suppose there's ancient depictions of men and women having sex on this planet...Mejare isn't old enough to have "artifacts."
Because Mejare changed so many rulers to women in its accounts of history, any of their sex lives would probably shock me, hearing about Earth's men...
This may be a pilot's flightsuit, but skintight and revealing clothing is still popular on my homeworld. As for my favorite outfit...I have a sundress.
I was wearing a pilot's flightsuit earlier, but skintight and revealing clothing is still popular on my homeworld. As for my favorite outfit...I have a sundress.
...There's no need to overthink things, Aella. Just listen to your body and relax.
...Masturbation is a perfectly natural thing, Aella. Just do whatever feels natural.
I can't believe such a large girl would need to be coached through something like this...just behave naturally, Aella. There's no "correct" behavior.
How can a girl be so out of touch with her own body? ...Aella, just do what's comfortable. Whether that's spreading out or sitting upright...
As a matter of fact, our crew has been traveling across the galaxy for the first time. We've adventured past many of Earth's other colonies.
Up until recently, no--but our crew has been on an adventure across the galaxy due to a wormhole incident. I'd never been outside the Mejarian system.
Some would call piracy a daily adventure, but our crew had never left Mejare and Tarak until recently. I've learned a lot about other human colonies in the galaxy.
Our crew has only recently ever adventured far from home. It's let me gain perspective on men and women living together on other worlds...
Your can only fit so many books onto a pirate vessel, but there's an old section of our ship from Earth times-- with a book on men and women's physiology.
Recently, our crew discovered a book on human reproduction in one of our ship's storage rooms. It's helped me understand men's physiology somewhat.
I used to read more when I was a girl...and I actually had books. But we have recently found a book showing men's anatomy, which was an interesting read.
I've just read a book on how men and women reproduce, actually. It's the reason I've wanted to see men's bodies here for myself.
...You "died," Saki? What is that supposed to mean?
...What do you mean, you "died"? Earth slang for unfortunate events, I assume?
...A pilot faces bad luck in every dogfight. And at their conclusion, I'm always glad not to have died...I'm sorry about what happened to you, Saki.
...No matter how carefully we plan a raid, or I devise a battle formation, we always encounter bad luck. It can be overcome...I'm sorry you died from it.
...That's right, Futaba. I actually had an interest in Mejare's punk scene when I was a girl, but opera helps me relax now.
...Opera is quite relaxing, Futaba. Thank you. It's actually something I've grown to like more recently...I used to be into punk.
...Do you not shower with your clubmates, Saki? My team has plenty of opportunities to see my "butthole."
My pilots see me naked whenever we shower, Saki. Forgetting a battle formation would be far more embarrassing.
...I know, Lucy. That's just the way poker can be--it's a shame, since I won't get another chance to play on Earth.
...There's only so much I could have done, Lucy. I wasn't wearing much in the first place--but I wish I could have kept pace for my only game on Earth.
...You two know each other? You're wearing the same uniform...but Monika actually looks like an adult.
...Monika, don't bring your younger classmates to strip poker games. This is for adults.
The same uniform? ...Don't tell me this is some kind of perverted school field trip. Natsuki doesn't even look old enough.
I was about to comment on the look in your eyes, Monika, but I'm more worried about your underage schoolmate.
Seduction would be the proper word for your influence on Rin. Schoolgirls should have more regard for life.
..."Seduce" means to "lead astray." There's no better way to describe your effect on a young schoolgirl.
Seducing schoolgirls...at least I'm an adult. You should be guiding her, not trying to sleep with her.
...You can't be serious. You're seducing Rin? A schoolgirl doesn't need to participate in--orgies!
I'm not sure which schoolgirl fits in less here...the one who doesn't act mature, or the one who doesn't look mature.
Just what this table needed--two classmates that either look like children or act like children.
I'm not sure who tell to leave first--Natsuki, who looks underage, or Sayori, who acts underage.
I was afraid I'd get stuck with Earth schoolgirls in over their heads. Natsuki, you don't look like an adult. Sayori, you seem far too naive for this game.
...Being eighteen does not suddenly make you mature, Natsuki. Besides, you look malnourished...
...For a supposed eighteen-year-old girl, Natsuki, you look underdeveloped. Have you been eating enough food?
Eighteen years old...you don't look it, Natsuki. Even ignoring height, you come off as malnourished.
...Natsuki, you're being defensive. You may be eighteen, but you clearly need to put on some weight.
I think you're a bit mistaken, Daria. We're descendants from Earth people who colonized other planets.
Daria, how do you think we got to Mejare? Our ancestors were people from Earth who colonized it.
Jura and I are not inhuman, Daria. The first women on Mejare were settlers from Earth.
Daria, do you think we simply sprung up on Mejare? We're descendants of its original Earth colonists.
You think we haven't seen each other nude? The ship has one shower and one spa.
Nude women aren't exactly startling to Mejarians...especially crewmates with communal showers.
I wish I wasn't so comfortable seeing Jura nude.
We're not friends. We're colleagues...and pirates don't get private showers.
Show up to flight practice on time, and I couldn't care less what you tell her.
Jura is a lot more eager to be here. I would've given her permission if she cared to ask for it.
By all means, Jura, you don't need my go-ahead. Keep Daria busy while I work.
This is a perfect arrangement. You answer Daria's questions about Mejare, and I get some scheduling done.
Come home with--tch. You should try disavowing your military and working for us. That way you'd help women.
Nothing will make me come home with you, Sei. Your technological experience would make you a good asset for us, however.
Tch. Perhaps I'd warm up to you if you cast off your loyalties...our crew could use a tech-proficient medic.
...You should come home with us. We need more medical staff, and you could work with a clean conscience.
Great...they swarmed us with men. Happy now, Jura?
More men than I bargained for...wasn't hoping for more than one, out of sheer curiosity.
All men? I'm not afraid of you. Keep your sword ready, Jura.
The three men on our ship are enough for me. And they don't try to get us naked, or strip themselves.
Well, Jura, plenty of men's tubes to go around. Ready to collect that seed you want so badly?
I would've liked to meet an Earth woman here. But no, of course not.
Earth women would have been alien enough. You didn't arrange this on purpose, did you, Jura?
Something bothering you, Jura? Not what you had hoped for?
Oh, good, now we're both annoyed.
Perfect. Now neither of us want to be here.
I really didn't want to see a man's tube anyway...not in a seedy place like this.
I'd call this your comeuppance, but we still need to see this game through.
Men would have been a distraction anyway. This way we can focus on learning about Earth from the women here.
Exactly what you deserve, dragging me here. Have fun.
Just one man...well, Jura, I hope you're happy with him.
Watch yourself. Jura is looking for a man to have a child with...
You'd best take care. Jura's going to be needling you with questions all game.
A man? I'll try not to ask too many questions...Jura will do that for me.
A man? Well, Jura, looks like we'll be getting the anatomy lesson you wanted.
This one man had better be impressive enough for us to come all the way here.
Try to ignore Jura, the taller woman. She can be a little...forward.
Well, Jura, this is what you wanted. Satisfied with the crowd?
Meia Gisborn. The blonde is Jura Basil Elden.
Meia Gisborn, age twenty. I'll let my crewmate here do the talking.
Meia Gisborn. The taller woman is Jura, my crewmate...this was her idea.
Pleased to meet you. Jura here will be happy to speak for both of us.
Meia Gisborn. The taller woman is my crewmate, and she's a lot more excited to be here, if you couldn't tell.
...No, I'm sure that's quite possible, Ryuko. I was more aggressive at your age, too...but I didn't have any companions like that.
Thanks for the compliment, but I didn't pick it out. Squadron leaders all wear this.
Yours looks a little sleeker, honestly.
Expand your wardrobe? Bodysuits are as sensible as it gets.
...I'm sorry, what? Do I know you?
Gorgeous? That's...a new one.
...Blue hair is nothing special.
"Corps"? ...I'm a pirate...from planet Mejare.
...Sei, was it? I wouldn't call my armor "modern." We use whatever we can pilfer from Mejarian outposts.
...I wouldn't call my armor "modern"...but I wouldn't call yours "comfortable."
...You're Sei, correct? We do both have blue hair. Can't Earth women's hair be naturally blue?
Fun? ...I hope so. Jura wouldn't stop pestering me about this...
...I am Jura's superior officer, not her girlfriend. Do not misinterpret my coming here as more than security.
I am not Jura's girlfriend. Earth is a known hostile planet, and so I accompanied her here as a safety measure.
It would be foolish for Jura to have come here alone--she is an outlaw, and Earth is hostile territory. As Dread team leader, she is my reponsibility.
This was Jura's idea--I am only here to protect her. As long as her romantic life does not compromise our team, it is none of my business.
Jura is my second-ranking pilot--I came here with her for her own safety. Her flirting habits are beside the point.
...That's correct, N. I understand if you, as a man, might feel wary.
...Men still exist near my homeworld, N...on our sister planet, Tarak. But I have no intention of attacking you.
...N, was it? That's correct...but you have nothing to fear. We have enough male prisoners on our ship as it is.
...Yes, I imagine a man would find that interesting...or concerning. But I mean you no harm.
What the--an alien, here? No question. ...Meia Gisborn, home planet Mejare. Junior officer aboard the Nirvana.
F-floating? Are you addressing me? ...Meia Gisborn, of Mejare. Dread team leader...not that we've explored the "Vega" system.
Ah--! ...Meia Gisborn, junior officer and Dread team leader for the Magno Family. To meet a girl so obviously alien--!
V-Vega system? Just how much alien contact has Earth had? ...Meia Gisborn, junior officer. Mejarian...
No, thank you, Jin. I have to stay fit...and I wouldn't take food from a man.
I appreciate the show of peace, Jin, but I'm not about to accept food from a man.
I have a bad relationship with men...and an even worse one with Earth. Please understand if I don't want to accept food, Jin.
...Thank you, Jin, but I have several reasons to not take food from a man, particularly an Earth one.
I have to watch my weight to pilot, Jin. Besides...taking food from a man is a little too comfortable.
...A strange aura? I'll be honest...you look rather plain.
Are you sure it's not my bodysuit, Elizabeth? You're dressed more conservatively...
Is that so? ...Elizabeth, right? You seem normal to me...I've never heard someone say I have an aura.
...As far as I know, Mejarian bodysuits are rather risque on Earth. Since you're much more covered, maybe that's my aura.
Space woman? Mejarians are no more residents of space than Earthlings are.
Earth and Mejare are both planets. What exactly makes me a space woman and you not?
Why exactly is a Mejarian a space woman and an Earth one isn't? ...Never mind. You don't seem very sharp.
I'm a space woman, and Earthlings aren't? ...Well, this is the perfect game to treat me as an exhibit.
...To me, Ini, you're the space woman. It's a rather subjective point to make.
Natsuki...that's you, right? Young schoolgirls shouldn't be here.
What a diminuitive girl...I assume you snuck in here. You should leave.
The sign out front says "Adults Only," Natsuki. Granted, I don't know how Earth defines adults...
...I don't feel comfortable playing a stripping game with children, Earthling or not.
...Listen, Natsuki, you should stay in school. Don't go sneaking off to bars when you're still a child.
...I'm sorry, Sayaka, but I have no clue what you're talking about in the slightest.
...Are you making fun of me by saying nonsense, Sayaka? That's not a friendly welcome to this planet.
....Whatever you're saying, Sayaka, it's beyond my knowledge--unless you're just taunting me.
No, Sayaka, I haven't seen anything like that...I have no idea what you're even talking about.
...I didn't think a girl would bombard me with questions as soon as I got here. Or that I'd have no clue what she was asking.
Meia Gisborn. Pleased to meet you...it's not like me to bring this up, but today is my birthday.
Meia Gisborn, of planet Mejare...today is my birthday, for what it's worth. I usually try to avoid people for it...
Meia Gisborn. It's a pleasure...this may be a concidence, but today is my birthday. I'll leave it at that.
...I didn't think I'd end up playing strip poker on my birthday, but I suppose that's better than another surprise party.
Meia...Meia Gisborn. This may sound strange, but I agreed to come here to avoid my crewmates' attempts at a birthday party.
...I'm not sure if Earth uses the Mejarian calendar, but June 10th is my birthday. I figured I'd mention that.
Meia Gisborn. I usually try to avoid mentioning how my birthday is today, but I don't expect strangers to throw me ill-conceived surprise parties...
June 10th...it's my birthday today. I try not to remind my crewmates so they don't make a scene over it...
...My Oma was the woman who donated her eggs to splice with my Fama's. My Fama carried me.
Mejare is all women, Misato. Omas donate eggs, and they're spliced with those of the Fama, who carries the baby.
An Oma is an egg donator, versus the egg acceptor of the Fama. I understand that two women being parents is strange to Earthlings.
Both my parents were women, like everyone on Mejare. The Oma donates the egg...and the Fama carries the child.
I'm afraid books aren't the typical thing we're able to steal. There might be a few left over in the older sections of the Nirvana...
...Hm. Perhaps I should check the older sections of the ship...that's where Duero found his anatomy book.
I read a lot of books as a girl...but the ship doesn't have many now. Perhaps there's some in the old storage sections...
I know there's parts of the Nirvana from the original colonists' ships. Perhaps there's books there I could read...
If you don't mind giving them away, I'd love some books. Failing that...the Nirvana's older sections might have a few from the old colonists.
...I see. Well, I appreciate the compliments--and take it from a Mejarian that you're very beautiful.
So Earth culture isn't as rigidly man-focused as I thought. Well, Misato, you're very attractive yourself.
I can see why you're popular with men, Misato. If you were more willing to flirt with women, you'd be popular on Mejare, too.
Perhaps Earth isn't so foreign after all, then. Whether that was flirting or just compliments, you're quite beautiful yourself.
A child can be created from the DNA of any two people, Aella. Women's eggs suffice for this purpose--I believe men's sperm works, as well.
I can't believe Jura talked me into this. ...In a manner of speaking, Lucy. Jura is my deputy squadron leader, and I accompanied her here for safety.
Jura owes me a favor for coming here with her...we're colleagues in our Dread team, Lucy. I didn't want her going off to a hostile planet alone.
...I still feel comfortable, Lucy. This is training gear, not lingerie.
...I'm not sure what's given you that impression, Lucy. I use our ship's gym in this underwear.
...No, Deimos, I'm not. It's a sidearm.
This ring...is for my protection, Deimos. I wasn't sure if I'd need it.
...For a man, you're very polite, Steve.
Didn't expect this kind of politeness from a man. Maybe there's depths to your sex yet.
I was expecting a more rugged personality from a soldier, and a male one at that.
I can't believe you talked me into this, Jura.
Happy I'm here, Jura? You're getting next patrol duty for this.
How did I let you convince me to come here?
I'm not mad at you for talking me into coming here, Jura...I'm mad at myself for being unable to talk you out of it.
Is that a style for Earth men, or just part of your profession?
Didn't think men could be that interested in fashion.
I see. And you probably acquired it legally, unlike me.
I see. Everything I know about Earth, I know from old books on the ship...and that Earthlings want us dead.
I'll admit my experience with Earth has been limited to fending off its attacks.
Mejare isn't shy about sex, so I'm just inferring.
I see. One look at Jura or Barnette would put you in a coma, then.
Bodysuits are pretty typical on Mejare, yes...both my pilots and the soldiers we face wear them. I don't know how men feel about that.
I wear it for practical reasons, but yes, it's common to show your figure on Mejare. All the more reason to exercise regularly.
Maybe that's how the fashion trends on Mejare got started, but I couldn't care less what men think of my body.
And men are constantly judging you on Earth, then? Mejarians are equally guilty...but we certainly don't feel as much shame.
...Thank you, Nagisa.
...They must really value politeness where you come from, Nagisa.
...I suppose they're only small for Mejare's standards. But Mejare's standards are my standards.

This is my full figure, already on display.
...So, men prefer how women look from behind, Deimos?

Maybe I'd look better facing this way.
...Thank you, Deimos. If men prefer women's backsides, that's...useful information.
Oh, there aren't any men here. They must not let the sexes play together...do men have a reputation for sexual intrusion, Lucy?
...There's no men. That's for the best--I can learn plenty from Earth women's experience. ...Lucy, are men infamous for not leaving women alone?
Whatever you just called me, Marinette, I've heard worse from Mejarian soldiers...and in the common language, too.
I thought superheroes were supposed to be brave, but apparently you don't have the nerve to insult me in a language I understand, Marinette.
You know what I do respect, Marinette? A woman who can look me in the eye and use insults I understand.
Feel free to continue insulting me in the common language, Marinette. Or you could just be a coward.
...Perhaps we're thinking of different technology. I'll make a note of this, but learning about Earth is my mission here.
...This soul-fusion business is too complex for a reconnaissance mission. I'm no engineer...maybe Parfet can make sense of it.
I'm glad you're willing to share all this, Dust, but it's a lot to take in at a strip game...I'll make a note of it for our engineers.
...I can only parse so much about this soul technology. I'm a pilot, not an engineer...we can talk later.
...Anyone who's lived her entire life at war would desire peace. That isn't hard to deduce.
...Mejare and Tarak have been at war since before I was born, and now Earth has targeted us, as well. It's only natural I'd want peace.
"The City of the Sun"...if one can learn about magic, I should bring the entire crew there. It would be a useful asset.
...Is there a potential to learn magic itself from a city with a "rich history" of it? We need every advantage we can get.
...A city with a "history of magic"...perhaps the crew could all learn to use it. We'll organize a raid team.
...Magic seems like a useful resource. It is a pirate's way to claim such for herself...I should bring the crew to "San Miguel."
...I'm totally lost. She said something about controlled birth?
I'm lost. Earth women control birth? I think Tarak does something like that...
I'm lost here. What exactly is "birth control"? How would you control birth?
Protection? I have armor, but...you'd wear that during sex?
Protection? What the hell do men try to do to you?
Protection? You need protection during sex? I thought she was talking about birth.
A snowy temple? That sounds quite nice, actually...it hardly snows on Mejare at all.
Hakazura Temple, Ini? Hm...Mejare is actually very climate-controlled, so I've barely seen snow. I might go see it.
You said it snows at that temple, Ini? I've hardly seen snow in person, with how temperate Mejare is...
Haka...zura Temple. Mejare has little snow, so that sounds like a treat to see...thank you, Ini.
...I thought you might like sightseeing, Jura. This Earth is in much better condition than the mechanized one we know.
...I hoped you'd appreciate vacation destinations, Jura. Flying is something we both enjoy--and I can call it reconnaissance.
...I figured we'd both find a flying tour of Earth more agreeable than I would strip poker, Jura. Earth's ecosystem still seems healthy in this world.
I was happy to see that this Earth is not covered in gears like ours, Jura. Deserts, icecaps...we can tour the planet from orbit.
What? Of course I can hear you, Kizuna. Anyway, can you tell me more about this Japan region?
You're speaking at perfect volume, Kizuna--I can hear you. Do you have more information about "Japan"?
"Japan"...for some reason, I recall hearing that many of the women here are from that place. Can you tell me more, Kizuna?
...Yes, I can hear you, Kizuna. This isn't the first I've heard of this "Japan"...could you tell me more about it?
...I'm sure that offer was indeed generous, L'Arachel, but perhaps you could explain what Rausten is like.
I'm not sure what it takes to "win your favor," L'Arachel. What is the Rausten region like?
...I was planning to visit any suggestions alone, L'Arachel. If you would like to guide me, then elaborate on this "Rausten."
"Rausten"...I've never heard of an Earth region called that. I wasn't planning to bring a tour guide, but perhaps that'd be best.
...I don't understand. Why wouldn't you be able to feel your partner's skin?
Why are you getting all defensive? I really don't know what this "birth control" is.
Proper measures? What exactly are you worried about?
You're certainly not from the Earth I know. It's a wasteland, with the population living in giant gears. No ladybugs, I'm sure.
I've read about ladybugs. Seems like they were common on Earth...but now it's a wasteland.
Taking inspiration from ladybugs...you must be from a different Earth than the one I know, which is nearly devoid of life altogether.
Where I'm from, Earth's moon crashed into it long ago, and there's almost nothing left. Ladybugs included.
Well, at least you're honest. "Bitch" is tame compared to what I expected.
That's it? Forget soldiers...I heard worse on the streets.
...I can't stay mad at you, Marinette. You're a sweet girl for thinking "bitch" is harrowing.
...You're acting all shy about "bitch"? You've got a heart of gold.
Of course women can do what they want with their bodies. That doesn't mean I have to respect them for it.
Of course women can groom as they please. I just find it distasteful.
Pubic hair just strikes me as something a man would have, Marinette. Not for me.
...You said a pharmacist splices eggs for you, Miko? We use...well, geneticists.
It's not all that strange for women to splice eggs and have children, Miko. Well...using a pharmacist for that is strange.
I thought pharmacists handled drugs, Miko. We don't usually task them with splicing our eggs together.
Women on Mejare combine their eggs to have children, Miko, yes. But if you're using pharmacists for that...you must have it mastered.
Give it some thought--Dread controls are intuitive, even for fresh trainees. And being surrounded by women is quite comforting.
Think it over. We may be pirates, but the women support each other--you don't need men to feel fulfilled.
Perhaps you feel attached to men's presence. But a resourceful woman like you would be a valued member of our team.
I was a zero-experience trainee, as well, and I shot up through the ranks. Consider if you really need men's company.
...Wait. I remember reading that Earth used to be divided into smaller nations--is your "Land of Dragons" one of them, Mulan?
I think I understand now. The "Land of Dragons" is just one of Earth's factions, isn't it, Mulan?
Wait...I think I've misunderstood. Mejare is all one society, but Earth is carved up, isn't it, Mulan? Your "Land of Dragons" is just part of it.
...I just remembered something from school. Earth is divided into territories, isn't it, Mulan? One must be your "China."
Much of society is unnatural, Mulan. It's common on Mejare for young women to shave everything...
There's a lot more unnatural things societies do than shave pubic hair, Mulan. Mejarians shave for sleekness.
Why wear clothes when your nude body is natural? I think societies strive to go beyond that, Mulan...and so Mejare shaves.
I can't speak for all of Mejare, Mulan...but its young women prefer the sleek and smooth. I'm sure China does some things that are unnatural.
Do the women of Planet China wear makeup, Mulan? That's an unnatural effort for beauty, as well...not unlike Mejare's shaving.
To answer your question, Mulan, being shaved is actually very smooth...provided you're rigorous about it.
I understand your earlier concerns about stubble, Mulan, but Mejarians are very aggressive about shaving.
About what you said earlier, Mulan...the Mejarian ideal is a smooth, sleek figure. Like with suits, comfort is not the point.
I've seen men shave their heads for certain reasons, Mulan--Mejarians are the same way. Sometimes comfort is sacrificed for beauty.
Now I'm confused. Weren't you from Planet China, Mulan? ...Actually, I've barely seen snow.
Aren't you from Planet China, Mulan? I was hoping for Earth locations--though seeing snow again sounds interesting.
Hm? I've hardly seen snow, with how climate-controlled Mejare is...but still, aren't you from the planet of China, Mulan?
I'm sure Planet China is nice, Mulan--Mejare hardly has snow--but I asked for Earth locations.
...The "Zhangjiajie," Mulan? I do like open scenery like that...what does "phallic" mean?
...Mulan. How did you describe those rock formations earlier? "Phallic"...
...I might enjoy those mountain rocks you suggested, Mulan. But what was that word you called them? "Phallic."
...Mulan. "Phallic" isn't a word I've ever heard before...what makes the "Zhangjiajie" phallic?
"Singapore"...food is a plus, but I can't trust a girl who hasn't been there herself.
...Natsuki. Regarding my sightseeing requests, I would prefer a location that you've actually been to.
...Natsuki. If you haven't been to "Singapore", I'm not going to visit a potentially hostile location based off of rumors you've heard.
...If "Singapore" does have a food surplus, it would make a good raid target...but we can't go if you've only heard about it.
...I won't doubt your magic in the future.
...Rookies always picture me with a raincloud overhead. I never thought I'd see it manifest.
...Just make it stop.
...As if my suit wasn't already see-through.
...A week in Saga, you said? I was hoping to briefly tour the planet in my Dread.
...You're a sweet girl, Sakura, but a week in one Earth city sounds excessive...my Dread can cover a lot of distance.
...My plan was to survey the whole planet in my Dread. If you'd like to show Saga to me, I can fly you over it...
...I'm sure Saga is a nice town, Sakura, but I'm not looking for a vacation. I was just going to fly around the planet...
..."Glitch City" does not sound like a place for the technically minded. What's its namesake?
...If I were to visit a town called "Glitch City," I'd be afraid my equipment would malfunction. Why is it called that?
...Sei. Glitch City is where you live, isn't it? I'm not sure why a town would be named after software malfunctions...
...I can't say that a place called "Glitch City" sounds appealing. Will it make my Dread's engine fail?
...Sort of. Both my parents were women.
Mejarians are born from two women, Sei. The Oma donates half an egg, and the Fama carries the combination...
...If mother and father helps you understand, then yes. Though I can't picture a man being a parent.
A Fama is just like an Earth mother, Sei. But instead of a man impregnating her, an Oma's egg is spliced into one of the Fama's.
...You don't know the half of my reservations, Sei.
I'm sure there's Mejarians who'd be more accommodating if you wanted to jiggle them, Sei.
You're awfully forward for an Earth woman, Sei. I thought you mostly directed your sexual energy towards men.
...Well, I did need a shower.
My Dread is the fighter ship I pilot. It's powered by the Paksis...and none of us know how that works.
Normally I'm the one doing the protecting...my Dread is my ship.
My Dread is the ship I pilot. The only thing I dread is the Harvest...and maybe an aroused man.
I've never had surgery. I did undergo electroshock once.
No, just for killing.
On the contrary, I'd prefer to keep electronics off my body. The last thing I want is a distraction.
Some kind of bodily electronic going haywire during a dogfight is exactly what I don't want, Sei.
You're too reliant on personal technology. The enemy could easily disable it with the right signals...
You can wear techology, but it's foolish to rely on it. Malfunctions, tampering--I don't want that on my body.
A--surprise? What should I know about men's muscles? Is that tube a muscle?
...I don't like the sound of a "surprise," Mulan. Men surprising us normally means a Tarakkian raid.
...What? What would--surprise me about men's muscles? I'm not here on vacation...!
...A surprise? Men's muscles don't--bristle to the touch, do they?
..."Surprise"? Men are human, aren't they? Surely it's not strange for a woman to--caress their muscles?
...I appreciate your earlier curiosity, Dust, but I see no reason to trust a man with Mejarian technology.
...You made some comment about my laser ring, Dust, correct? All you need to know is that it's a woman's weapon.
...You were curious about my laser ring, Dust? Perhaps if you were a human woman, I'd show it to you...but a man is asking too much.
...I heard you bring up my laser ring earlier, Dust. Mejarian technology is not to be shared with men...so drop it.
...I'm working, Jessie, not goofing off. This tablet stores flight simulation data for my squadron.
...I've been analyzing my pilots' target elimination rates in different formations, Jessie. This isn't an entertainment device.
...Jessie, this tablet is for work. I'm comparing my pilots' resource efficiency to their ammunition choices at our Regisystem.
...Jessie, you were curious about this tablet, correct? Part of my responsibilities as Dread team leader is to analyze flight data.
...Jessie, you said there's a group of women who dye their hair blue? What is associated with doing so?
...Is there a certain type of woman that's expected to have dyed blue hair on Earth, Jessie?
...Jessie, is there a specific group of women with dyed blue hair on Earth? Or any stereotypes associated with them?
...Is there a lifestyle associated with dyeing one's hair blue here, Jessie? As opposed to being naturally blue?
...I am not going drinking, Jessie. I meant natural landmarks I could fly to.
...Jessie, if I wanted to drink, I'd start living in slums again. Surely Earth has cities or famous landmarks.
...Jessie, my Dread can circle this planet in a matter of minutes at top speed. I was hoping for tourism.
I...don't drink anymore, Jessie. There are bars on Mejare, anyway--what does Earth have?
...I don't drink, Jessie. I was asking more about natural landmarks than socializing.
...Jessie, I was asking about natural areas. This isn't usually where I--socialize.
...Jessie, you mentioned something about Earth history. Could you elaborate?
...You didn't sound entirely confident...but could you explain more of Earth's history, Jessie?
...Jessie, part of why I came here was to learn about Earth's history. You started talking about something like that...
...Mejare has very little record of Earth history. I...may need a second source, but do you know anything more, Jessie?
...Jessie, you were curious about my ring? It's a Mejarian weapon, though I'm sure Earth has similar technology.
...Jessie, you mentioned my laser ring. It is the woman's weapon of choice, as opposed to the antiquated mechanical guns of men.
...In case you're still curious, Jessie, my ring is a laser gun. It's less conspicuous than men's weaponry--which is useful for pirates.
...Mejare's superior technology is found in its laser rings, Jessie. Energy weapons have more penetrating power and efficiency.
...The "Houryuu-ji" Temple in Ikaruga, correct? A historical landmark would be fascinating...unless every exhibit is about you.
...Does your temple explain more about Earth's culture, Miko? You've been providing your personal history yourself.
...This evening has given me the full story of your reign, Miko. Can your temple teach me about Earth itself?
...Have your temple's caretakers maintained your version of events, Miko? It could prove informative...without your embellishments.
...The temple in "Ikaruga, Japan." If that's purely a shrine to your glory, Miko, this game has been enough.
...Let that be a lesson in human manners, then. Comments on our biology are deeply insulting.
...If that's true, Starfire, then I hope you've learned something about politeness among humans.
...Perhaps comments on inborn traits aren't rude among Tamaraneans, but Mejare looks down upon that. As do most humans, I assume.
...If there's nothing wrong with normalcy, then don't make comments suggesting the opposite. That is a human faux pas.
So, it's not Earth that's made you so casual about sex? ...I'd like to know more about how your species breeds.
...I was expecting to learn about Earth, and instead I meet a sex-happy alien species. How frequently do you mate--and how are your men involved?
...Starfire, humans mate for life. I'm glad to see that's intact on Earth--why are Tamaraneans so open?
I suppose a game like this would attract any sexually-open aliens living on Earth. What are your species' mating practices?
...Those tropical nations you mentioned are near the equator, correct? Our crew doesn't get much natural sun...it'd make a nice vacation.
...You recommended the tropics, Starfire? Our ship's women would appreciate them--sunbathing is mostly artificial on our homeworld.
...Starfire, you mentioned a tropical region. Mejare doesn't have tropics--do you know a beach or resort that can accommodate our entire crew?
...Most of Mejare is a city, Starfire, so "Jump City" may be redundant. Now, tropics we rarely see, given Mejare's terraforming.
...For reference, Jessie, what part of Earth do you live in? Your "history" doesn't sound like that of the whole planet.
...Are you sure you've been recounting Earth's recent history, Jessie? What area of this planet do you live in?
...Jessie, the historical record you've been giving me sounds fairly--local. Where exactly do you live on this planet?
...Jessie, have you been telling me the history of the entire Earth, or just where you live? And where is that, exactly?
...Jessie, you mentioned the "Space Center"? A history of early space travel might actually be fascinating--especially Earth's perspective.
...The "Space Center," Jessie? Museums about early colonists would be informative... Mejare has mostly scrubbed men from the record.
...Jessie, where is that "Space Center" you mentioned? Not that I'm "from space"--but an Earth museum might tell a different story than Mejare.
...I won't be visiting bars, Jessie, but a museum dedicated to early spacefaring could be interesting. Mejare has its own version of history...
...You said you're friends with a young girl, Jessie? There's a girl from Pluto on our ship who's made a habit of calling me "Big Sister."
...Could you tell me more about this "Zoey," Jessie? I've mentored a young girl myself back on our ship.
...Jessie, what is your relationship to that "Zoey" girl? I became the "Big Sister" of a girl on our ship without even meaning to.
...I didn't expect you to be friends with a younger girl, Jessie. "Zoey," was it? We have a Plutonian girl named "Misty" who looks up to me.
...Your enthusiasm is nice, Jessie, but I don't just hand out firearms. I'm sure Earth has the technology.
...You wanted a laser ring from me, Jessie? Earth has planety of advanced technology--I'm sure you can find one here.
...I'm sorry, Jessie, but our crew's resources are too limited to give away weapons. Does Earth not let citizens possess any?
...You must be able to get a laser ring for yourself on Earth, Jessie. It takes technology from its colonies, after all.
...It's quite fascinating to see how my various pilots perform in different situations, Jessie. But work is still necessary, even if it's boring.
...It doesn't matter if flight data is interesting or not, Jessie. Dread piloting is a matter of life and death.
...Jessie, if I don't know how my team needs to manage its resources, we'll be caught with no ammunition during a dogfight. "Boring" is irrelevant.
...I'm sorry you don't find my work stimulating, Jessie, but I'm not forcing you to do it. It's part of leading a Dread team.
...Saki, did you recommend a restaurant to me earlier? I have no Earth money to pay for it...I was hoping for landmarks.
...I'm glad there's a chicken restaurant you enjoy, Saki, but I can't pay for that. I meant natural landforms I can fly to.
..."Drive-In Tori" wouldn't happen to accept Mejarian credits, would it, Saki? Natural landmarks are my only tourism option...
...I'm sorry, Saki, but I can't afford any chicken. I don't have Mejarian money, let alone Earth...do you know any scenic flight routes?
...Misato, you mentioned your organization's headquarters? I'd like to see those "Evas," but aren't they under security?
...I'd very much appreciate a chance to look at the "Evangelion" units at your headquarters, Misato, but would I be allowed anyhwere near them?
"Tokyo-3"...and the "Geofront." Do you have the authority to grant me clearance, Misato? This "NERV" sounds rather clandestine.
Your technology does sound fascinating, Misato, but "NERV" sounds like they'd attempt to shoot down my Dread. Could you admit me?
...Chazz, you recommended the "Duel Academy"? Our ship has passed by volcanic planets, if that's the main attraction.
...Chazz. Does the "Duel Academy" you mentioned have other sights besides a volcano? Many planets we pass have volcanoes.
...Volcanic activity is a fairly common sight among the uninhabited planets our ship passes by, Chazz. What's taught at your "Duel Academy"?
...The "Duel Academy," you said? Plenty of planets have volcanoes--even Mejare's unterraformed areas do. What could I learn about "dueling"?
...Chazz, I don't appreciate joking answers to a simple question. What did you say about a "separate dimension of purple"?
...A "separate dimension of nothing but purple." Just when I finally start to ask men for advice, I get a snide answer.
...What's this about a "purple dimension," Chazz? Is Earth more advanced than I realize, or are you just making fun of me?
...What technology has allowed you to develop a "separate dimension," Chazz? I could believe it...if you weren't the type to tell jokes.
...I see. Wouldn't she gain more muscle by being the one who beats monsters up?
...That doesn't sound very regimented, Megumin. A brief session of squats might do more to help her--or just being on the offensive.
...Getting beaten up by monsters? I'm sure it builds strength to slaughter animals, but anyone can be knocked around.
...Do you mean "beating up monsters"? I gained much of my strength from streetfighting--and losing a fight just means broken bones.
...Yuelia, you asked about my tablet, correct? I use it to store and analyze the performance data of my pilots.
Dita's shot accuracy has been going up...Yuelia, you expressed interest in this tablet? I'm organizing squadron data with it.
...Yuelia. You wanted to know more about this device? It's a personal data organizer--Dread team leaders are given them to manage pilot information.
...Yuelia, you brought up my tablet earlier. It's just a simple personal computer--I track pilot efficiency and lethality figures with it.
...For the record, Yuelia, I don't expect my laser ring to malfunction. But as this is a hostile planet, I want to make sure I'm armed.
...If my ring were to malfunction, Yuelia, it simply wouldn't work. But Earth is too dangerous a planet to be without a weapon.
...Yuelia, you sounded worried about my laser ring malfunctioning. The only one who would be in danger would be me, unarmed on a foreign world.
...A pirate cannot afford to be stuck on a hostile world without a functioning weapon, Yuelia. This place alone seems to house dangerous threats.
...Laser rings are reliable firearms, Yuelia. I don't expect any malfunctions...but still, being stuck on Earth would be the worst time for one.
It's easy for you to say nothing bad will happen, Yuelia. Our crew has been attacked by forces from Earth many times now.
"Nothing bad will happen"...a likely story from an Earth woman. Earth fleets have attacked our ship numerous times now.
I hope you're only ignorant of my situation, Yuelia. I'm wary of this planet because Earth has regularly sent fleets after us.
I am an officer on a ship targeted by Earth for opposing its Harvest fleets, Yuelia. Don't tell me "nothing bad" will happen if I'm unarmed...
..."Have fun." From an Earth woman, any reassurance is disingenuous. This planet has made a target out of our crew.
It's not in my best interest or my job description to "have fun," Yuelia...especially on a known aggressive planet.
...I appreciate your wish for me to relax, Yuelia, but it's hard to do so unarmed on a hostile world. Earth does not tolerate our crew's resistance.
..."Have fun" is something my crewmates tell me, as well, Yuelia. But I am an officer of a ship resisting Earth--I'm vulnerable here.
...I am frequently busy, Yuelia, yes. Leading a Dread team is a lot of work, so I'm multitasking.
...It was not my idea to come here, Yuelia, so I am behind on work in addition to being generally busy.
...I am busy, Yuelia, but it's none of your concern. As Dread team leader, I'm accustomed to multitasking to ease my workload.
...It's true that my work as Dread commander keeps me busy, Yuelia. Being a pirate doubles that...so I'm taking advantage of lulls in the game.
...I don't have time to be playing this, Yuelia. But I can manage my workload--even if I may have to sacrifice some sleep.
...I don't have time for many hobbies in general, Yuelia. I do my best just to make time for exercise.
...My personal time is a low priority regardless, Yuelia. Leadership leaves little time for that.
...Thank you for your concern earlier, Yuelia, but my time management is not an issue. I exercise, eat, work, and sleep.
...Panty, what did you say earlier? Men have "flavors"? As in, different body types, or literal tastes...?
...Panty. I hope you didn't mean it literally when you said men have "flavors." What about them are you tasting?
...Panty, you said men have "flavors." Do you just mean their personalities, or is there some...oral aspect to being with them?
...Men have "flavors," Panty? Oral sex makes sense between two women, but...with a man? Do you mean their seed?
...I appreciate the explanation you gave earlier, Tomoko. It makes sense that Earth would have a term for women in love...if an insulting one.
...Based on the tone you took, Tomoko, "lesbian" doesn't sound complimentary...I suppose Earthlings wouldn't encourage Mejarian love.
...If men and women are supposed to live together on this world, then it's no surprise a word like "lesbian" exists to insult women who don't oblige.
...Is "lesbian" meant to be an insult towards Earth women who ignore men, Tomoko? It didn't sound like a compliment.
You may know more about men than even a woman who's dated one, Miko. In effect, you've been the man for Tojiko.
...I wouldn't expect a woman disguised as a man to have dated one, Miko. But you carry yourself the same boisterous way--haven't you learned anything?
...Tarakkian men don't seem to form couples, Miko, so your lack of experience doesn't surprise me. You told your subjects you were male.
You may not have dated a man, Miko, but presenting as one for years would teach you far more about them, wouldn't it?
...If violence towards men made them fall in love, Saki, all of planet Tarak would be obsessed with us. Then again... maybe they are.
...It's been my impression of men that violence garners their respect, Saki. Tarak sees Mejare's women as worthy opponents, after all.
...You may have revealed why Tarak continues to fight us, Saki. Apparently men seek women who are just as aggressive as they are.
...You may need to be even more aggressive to find a man, Saki. Based on Tarak and Mejare's war, men respect women who stand up to them.
...Wishing for everyone's wishes to be granted is very sweet of you, Tomoko. Not many girls your age would think of others in that moment.
...You asked if I had any questions, Jessie? Well...how forceful do men tend to be? How soon do couples start having sex?
...Jessie. You wanted to know if I had any questions about dating men...how quickly do relationships with them become sexual?
I'm not sure if you're the best person to ask, Jessie...but men seem so aggressive. Do they tend to pressure women into sex soon after dating?
...Rainbow Dash, you mentioned someone's male sibling making advances on you. Is it typical for men to approach women?
...I've only made acquaintances of men, as well, Mary. But what did you mean when your friend was "concerned with dying"?
...Your male friend was "concerned with dying," Mary? You said that so casually that I assume it's not literal...
...What did you recommend to me, Mary? An "anna-may" convention? I'm not familiar with that term, nor how to spell it...
...Mary. What is "anime," and why would I fit in at a convention for it? Is it a fighter ship design show?
...Erufuda. You said you had a concealed weapon? You certainly have ample space to hide one on your person... and it can't be a bow.
...Erufuda, fitness requires constant vigilance, and it is paramount for combat readiness. Negligence presents a far greater danger.
...Erufuda. I understand your concerns over excessive exercise and eating disorders, but a pirate's food is scarce, and combat is constant.
...Men are attracted to women smiling and laughing, Erufuda? I suppose that's one reason I haven't received much attention from our prisoners...
..."Smiling and laughing." Our male prisoners have each taken interests in other women, so your theory may hold some water, Erufuda.
...My own crewmates regard me smiling or laughing as a shock. If that's what men seek, Erufuda, it's no wonder our prisoners aren't fond of me...
...I think the man you know preferring overweight women is an outlier, Erufuda. You should still slim down for the sake of your health.
...I hope you're not seriously maintaining your unhealthy weight for the sake of one man's fetishes, Erufuda. No partner should demand that.
...I'm no expert on men, Erufuda, but I haven't seen much evidence that they like overweight women. Your partner may, but it's still unsafe.
...Erufuda, I don't have any Earth money to pay at a restaurant. I can fly to landmarks in my Dread, if you know of any.
...I'm not interested in junk food, Erufuda, nor do I have any Earth money to pay for it. Are there natural landmarks near "Tokyo"?
...A firm backside is important, Erufuda. You wouldn't want flab on such a commonly-used muscle group.
...Why would I not train my butt, Erufuda? Not only do women find it attractive, but it's a large muscle, constantly in use.
...Yes, Erufuda, of course. The butt is a strong, important muscle, even though a pilot spends most of her time sitting on hers.
...A fat backside isn't any use, Erufuda. Muscular butts are just as attractive, but with utility and strength. Of course I train it.
Mejare rarely teaches pre-interstellar history...Komi-san what historical events occured at the "Kyoto" site you mentioned?
"Kyoto"...thank you, Komi. I now know exactly how to spell that, as well...what is the history that occurred there? I know little of Earth's past...
...I think I know what a man "cumming inside you" means, Moon...but I don't expect a good explanation from you regardless.
...I'm not interested in your attempts to shock me with purposefully degenerate stories, Moon. I doubt two of those rods could even fit in a woman.
...Whatever number of men you've had sex with at once, Moon, I'm sure you're exaggerating to mock me. Don't answer if you aren't serious.
...I hope men aren't uniformly drawn to what you might give them, Moon. Surely some have a sense of romance.
...I'm well aware that men come in different sizes, Moon. The man in my squadron is quite short...but I'll take your word for it on how he might "stretch me."
...I'm surprised that got your attention, Moon. Tropical islands would be a nice vacation... but I won't be having sex with the wildlife.
...That was a more introspective response than I expected of you, Moon. Island ruins would be fascinating... I'd like to go there and reflect myself.
...Moon, how many women have told you that they enjoy the company of "horny ghosts"? I am not among them.
...If a strip poker bar is the best place this planet offers, Moon, then apparently Earth's devastation in my time was not much loss, after all.
...Tarak's "wild men" is propaganda from my homeworld, Moon. If you went there, you would be captured and executed for being a woman.
...Moon. Tarak's men aren't "wild" because of sexual prowess--it's Mejare's labeling of political enemies. You would be killed on Tarak for being female.
...To put your mind at ease, Erufuda, the men on our ship were captured, but we now treat them as crew members.
...I don't want to date our prisoners, Erufuda-- they're just a sample of men's behavior. Regardless, they're not treated as prisoners anymore.
...It's strange that you would group blue-haired women into some collective class, Cynthia. What experiences have led you do that?
...From your earlier comments, Cynthia, it sounds as if a specific group of people with blue hair have left an impression on you. I'd like to know the story behind that.
...I understand focusing on your work at the expense of relationships, Cynthia. Mejarians date other women, but I'm in the same situation...
...I haven't had much time for relationships myself, Cynthia. That's with other women, but still...I see it can preclude chances with men, as well.
...I appreciate your interest in our crew's exploits, Cynthia, but I can't justify bringing aboard another woman to just tag along. Our food is limited.
...Thank you for your interest, Cynthia, but the Nirvana is a pirate ship cut off from our supply lines. You would need to fill a role to be worth having aboard.
...The Nirvana isn't a science vessel, Cynthia. You'd be another mouth to feed--and as our quartermaster likes to say, everyone has to work to eat on our ship.
...Pure science wouldn't justify you tagging along in our current situation, Cynthia. Maybe if you were a refugee, but otherwise, you'd have to work in the regisystem to eat.
...As I understand it, Cynthia, our laser rings did go through numerous iterations to make them safe and effective. That research has paid off substantially.
You were talking about ring-based weapons, Cynthia? Our laser rings are superior technology to mechanical firearms, but it's true it took time to develop them to that point.
...If you're still curious whether I have any appointments, Cynthia, I am essentially always on call in case we need to scramble.
...I schedule flight practice and patrol timeslots on this device, Cynthia, but my work is otherwise on-call. Enemy fleets don't take out appointments for their attacks.
...I'm sorry that happened to you, Jolyne. I'd heard that men were a proud race who wouldn't sell out their companions.
...I'm sorry, Jolyne. It wasn't my intention to pry like that...would you say most men would do the same in his position?
I understand if you have other obligations, Pyrrha. It's a shame, though--a woman with experience on a combat team would make an excellent pilot.
If you'd rather be a "huntress," Pyrrha, I won't hold it against you. It sounds as if it's required you to hone skills that'd be useful for a pilot, however.
I don't mean to judge you about your romantic life, Pyrrha. Has a man ever caught your interest, at least?
...There's no shame in having limited romantic experience, Pyrrha. But even if you've never been with a man...have you met one you considered dating?
...There's no need to apologize, Pyrrha. I haven't had much time for relationships myself. Have you met a man that seemed like a good partner?
...Isn't this planet Earth, Pyrrha? Perhaps it's the historical name for it, and you've adopted a different one since.
...Pyrrha, this is planet Earth, isn't it? The coordinates match historical accounts. Or do only colonists call it Earth now?
...Is this planet not called Earth anymore, Pyrrha? You sounded confused--it might be an old-fashioned name that's survived among descendants of colonists.
...Pyrrha, did you ask about my laser ring? It's a standard firearm on Mejare. I thought they were produced here, as well.
...Pyrrha, you asked where I "got" my laser ring. Energy weapons have been mass-produced on my homeworld for years. Is that not true for Earth?
...Pyrrha, you mentioned this tablet before. Since poker has so many breaks in its action, I'm organizing some simulation data for my squadron.
...If you're still interested in my tablet, Pyrrha, I'm using the time between rounds to prepare future flight simulations. Our discovery of Vandreads has presented opportunities for new formations.
...Stella, did you say you've visited other versions of Earth? The one in my time is devastated and needs machinery to maintain an atmosphere.
...The Earth of this time is unfamiliar to me, too, Stella. Where I come from, the planet is hardly habitable at all, and its people can no longer reproduce.
...The "island of Cyprus," Galatea? Beauty is a perfect reason to go--my home planet Mejare is known for the same reason.
...There's no reason to denigrate your birthplace, Galatea. Mejare has its issues, but it's a beautiful blue planet.
...I'd be happy to visit "Cyprus," Galatea. My homeworld is beautiful, as well, but there are reasons not to go there.
...I don't begrudge you for not being familiar with men, Neptune. It was a question directed at Earthlings, since this planet is known to have men and women living together.
It's no issue if men aren't common on your homeworld, Neptune--I didn't meet any men myself until I was nineteen. I only asked because Earth has large male and female populations.
...I understand if you're dedicated to your position, Neptune. What exactly are your duties as "goddess"?
...I understand if being a fighter pilot is not as glamorous as a goddess, Neptune. On the subject, what are your responsibilities to your nation?
You seem like a smart girl, Komi-san, but I wouldn't have considered you for a piloting role unless you overcame your speaking issues.
We have many less dangerous roles on our ship, Komi-san, but most of them would still require you to speak to others. We all have to rely on each other.
...I wasn't really considering you, Komi-san. You're intelligent, but pilots can't communicate just by writing. That goes for jobs in munitions, engineering, and on the bridge, as well.
...I don't know much about computer games, Erufuda. We do run flight simulations, if that's what you were talking about.
Space Battles 4 would have to be a robust flight simulator with physical feedback for it to reflect much on your piloting potential, Erufuda. That's what we use on our ship.

condition.saying: So, Meia, what kind of ship do you fly?

case.state: ...I pilot a custom Dread assault craft, Mk IV. Earth may have similar fighters like your "B.E.S.", but Dreads are an Imperial Mejarian design.
Our team uses Mk IV Dread fighters with customizable parts, such as thrusters or missile capacity. It was developed on Mejare, so it may not resemble Earth's B.E.S. ships.
I appreciate your earlier confidence, Miko, but we're satisfied with our current leadership. You could potentially command a Dread subteam.
Our captain and commander are both respected members of our crew, Miko. Your leadership qualities would be needed at lower ranks.
...Miko. If you were suggesting before that I stage a mutiny against our captain, I have no interest in doing so. We need leaders at the junior level.
...I'm sure your military experience is impressive, Miko, but our current captain fulfills more roles than that. I need field commanders who can maintain the formations I call.
...I understand your concern, Deimos. We would not want to cause conflict with other armed groups by headhunting their members.
...It's for the best if we don't recruit from other organizations, Deimos. We have enough enemies as it is.
...Deimos. Are you saying defection would be met with punishment? We would prefer to stay out of Earth's internal politics.
...Yuri, you mentioned "Himeji Castle"? A "bird taking flight" is popular symbolism on Mejare...we keep them as pets.
...I'd like to visit that bird-shaped castle you mentioned, Yuri. I had a pet bird when I as a girl, like a lot of Mejarians.
"Mount Fuji"...capped with snow. That isn't a common sight on my homeworld, Yuri...thank you for the suggestion.
Mejare's terraformed areas don't have much snow or elevation, so "Mount Fuji" might be a good place to visit. Thank you, Yuri.
Your casual experience with men is enough, Yuri. Can you describe--the way they treat you?
...I've worked with men myself, Yuri, but they're like me--they don't know what to make of the other gender. How do they act around you?
You don't have to apologize, Yuri. Many of our crew members prefer to be in engineering or munitions. Still, you don't know what you have the courage for until you need it.
Most of the Magno Family would never have thought they'd have the nerves to be pirates in the first place, Yuri. But I understand not wanting to live that life.
...I understand why you'd want to learn more about yourself before leaving your homeworld, Galatea. Still, a pilot who could survive in a vacuum would be a great asset to our team.
...You should explore your homeworld if it's important to you, Galatea. An android would make an excellent pilot, though--you could survive accidents that would kill any of us.
...To answer your question from earlier, Brock, Dread fighters are personal gunships designed for space combat. Sleek designs, superior maneuverability.
...Brock. You asked what a Dread does, correct? It's a personal space gunship I pilot, preferred by women. Men tend to use bulky mech-types.
...Regarding what you said earlier, Brock, laser rings are very much designed to not be "crazy." They achieve the same lethality as kinetic guns without the noise.
...I'm quite aware that not only men use "bulky" weapons like shotguns, Brock. I have a subordinate pilot who collects antiques...and uses them in combat.
...When I said mechanical guns are for men, Brock, I was referring to what is typically used on Tarak, the planet of men. Some women are partial to them...I am not.
I didn't have any intention of recruiting a man, Brock. It's been enough of a struggle to integrate our three prisoners into the crew, and they aren't careless with explosives.
My question was directed at the women playing, Brock. Our crew works with our male prisoners, but they're not eager for me to bring more on board--especially dangerous ones.
I wasn't considering you as a pilot, Brock. As a man, you could introduce tension in our Dread team--not to mention your reckless weapons handling.
I didn't have any intention of recruiting a man, Brock. It's been enough of a struggle to integrate our three prisoners into the crew, and they aren't careless with explosives.
My question was directed at the women playing, Brock. Our crew works with our male prisoners, but they're not eager for me to bring more on board--especially dangerous ones.
I wasn't considering you as a pilot, Brock. As a man, you could introduce tension in our Dread team--not to mention your reckless weapons handling.
I didn't have any intention of recruiting a man, Brock. It's been enough of a struggle to integrate our three prisoners into the crew, and they aren't careless with explosives.
My question was directed at the women playing, Brock. Our crew works with our male prisoners, but they're not eager for me to bring more on board--especially dangerous ones.
I wasn't considering you as a pilot, Brock. As a man, you could introduce tension in our Dread team--not to mention your reckless weapons handling.
My family was wealthy, but my parents didn't want a maid to raise me. We did everything together...
I was an only child--my parents didn't need a maid to take care of me, and they didn't want one, despite their wealth.
You helped your mother...that's sweet. I always followed my Fama around the house, too... they didn't want a maid.
We didn't have a maid, either. My parents always gave me attention...I suppose you had a male parent, too, didn't you?
...Half? How exactly does your species breed?
...I'm trying to picture how only half of a man can be sexually inexperienced...
..."Half" of you has not had sex. Perhaps you're more alien than I realized.
...Dust, what is your companion talking about? Your race somehow reproduces in "halves"?
An Oma is one of two female parents on my homeworld, Aella. I understand Earthlings are usually born to one man and one woman.
Hm? Oh, yes, an Oma is a foreign concept on Earth. Mejarians are born from two women--an Oma would take the place of a male parent.
What do you mean? Oh, of course...women on Earth have male parents, correct? On Mejare, women form couples as "Oma" and "Fama."
...Are there no Omas at all on Earth, Aella? An Oma donates an egg so that two women can have children...surely women fall in love on Earth?
...You're just mocking me. As you've been doing, and did to humans in general.
...I don't need an alien's pity. Not after she's already insulted my species.
...I wasn't interested in the table's sympathy. Starfire. And I don't think yours is genuine.
...Just drop it. You've been patronizing enough already about me even being human.
...So, your species has extracted the soul itself? I was not expecting this sort of conversation...but it might explain our energy core's behavior.
...Are you not your own person? Perhaps the Paksis core is its own extracted soul...
...So, your soul is a fusion of two others? I never thought there'd be proof of the soul's existence--unless that's why our ship's core has sentience.
Soul fusion...unless our ship's Paksis core is conscious via the same technology, that far exceeds what Mejare has developed.
...It wouldn't be much of a secret if I were to tell a table of strangers, would it? And Earthlings, at that...
...It'll take a lot more than a wink for me to divulge secrets, Jessie. This is a hostile planet.
...Why would I reveal secrets here? Earth is dangerous enough already.
...My crewmates are happy just to get the time of day from me. An Earth woman won't be getting any secrets.
...Isn't my naked body enough of a secret? It's already Earth's main target, so I don't feel the need to share.
...That assumes that the implications of your lies are clear. You don't know what the other person is thinking.
...A small lie can have unforseen results. I have enough to worry about when dealing with the truth.
...It sounds as if you have something on your mind, Jessie. In my experience, lies can get much bigger than they seem.
...It is others who won't get hurt by a lie, or just you? And do you really know which before you tell it?
