No one on our ship has much opportunity to wear tailored clothes. Besides, having to fit into a pre-made bodysuit helps keep me in shape.
...I myself try to be more caring around a girl we took in from Pluto--she's an outsider. She's opened up around me a bit, as well.
...Many girls who ended up as pirates would rightfully claim to be unfortunate. As a crew, though, we've had our share of improbable successes.
...I've had to coach a few pilots whose confidence fell apart when it came time for actual raids rather than simulations. Talent doesn't equal courage.
We have some men prisoner aboard our ship, Yuelia. Circumstances have required us to make them part of the crew, much to our dismay.
It wasn't by choice that a man become part of our Dread team, Yuelia. I resented him at first, but his mech provides several tactical advantages.
I was told all sorts of lies. Mejare's government has a vested interest in keeping us at war with men.
...I'm sure "ECHOs" are useful, but I'm quite satisfied with my current work tools. And my eyepiece, for that matter.
You can't remember? ...I'd like to forget my first time, but I could never imagine doing so...
...It sounds more like there is a stigma here against same-sex cell combination. You and your family would be welcome on Mejare.
Based on the ships I've seen, Earth is capable of anything Mejare is, including egg-splicing. I suppose using men and women's cells is just ingrained here.
...Earlier, you were trying to convince me to use an ECHO. Yet you only have yours by coincidence? Make up your mind.
...Our "desires"? I would gladly answer questions about my job or homeworld, but I despise that level of nosiness.
...My crewmates insist I keep my heart well-hidden, Miko. That's because I hate nosy people who claim to know others' desires.
...I understand. I could never afford the tools I use, either--our crew has accumulated supplies through raids.
...Don't think I'm criticizing your scavenging for tools, Gaige. Our crew does the same thing, raiding military outposts.
Raids are nothing to be excited about, Gaige. Much of our technological advantage is lost on foot, and the chances of death are actually higher.
...By "raids," I mean raids on foot. Those missions are much more dangerous, especially for a pilot crew.
...It's one thing to endanger yourself, Gaige. I have a team of pilots that I need to keep alive each mission.
..."To Hell with danger." It's easy for a lone raider to say that, but not one who's responsible for the lives of a dozen women.
...In the "days of war"? War is still very much alive, Brock. "Antiques" refer to the primitive mechanical weaponry of the past, like yours.
...If you have a colleague who specializes in energy weaponry, you would do well to respect them, yes. It represents modern technology.
...It's not "overkill" to respond to a space attack fleet with fighter crafts of one's own, Brock. Perhaps Earth has hidden that technology, too...
Men's bodies are quite bulky themselves, so your preference for angular shapes isn't surprising. Women are slender and build ships to match that...
Men are stronger and bulkier than women, so it only makes sense that your weapon and craft design would follow suit. Dreads are much smaller than Vanguards.
...A pickaxe? That isn't even a weapon--a man using an unwieldy mining tool for its raw strength is quite appropriate, as well.
...My home planet would consider men too dangerous to be kept alive. I know better now than to treat them like that.
...I hope you don't decide who's worthy of slaughter from the words of others. Mejare would put all men in that category.
...There isn't much to the story, Cynthia. Mejare sees women's history on Earth as a primordial afterthought.
...Mejare is more concerned with painting men as savage animals than presenting accurate history, Cynthia. I would look elsewhere.
...Mejare is not as free a society as it claims, Cynthia. It was founded upon separating from men, and its accounts of history reflect that.
...I'm sure interstellar travel is not afforded to every citizen on Earth, Cynthia. Your government does not want unmonitored contact with colonies.
...The world reborn...I don't like the sound of that. Perhaps some sort of site for the Harvest's organ preservation.
Over a thousand years...Mejare is only a century-old civilization. "Japan" is a region of Earth, yes? What sets it apart from the others?
..."Japan's" capital. I've read that Earth was once divided into many smaller regions...if that's true, can you tell me more about Japan itself?
1,075 years...as "Japan's" capital. It's hard to believe a single small region of Earth has more history than all of Mejare...can you tell me more?
...The "portal between worlds"? That's a fanciful name for a nature area...or are you actually serious about "your world" versus Earth?
...It wouldn't be like your archaeological studies. Mejare's history as a civilization is short--some elders have been alive for its entire existence.
Mejare's history is brief enough that some first-generation colonists are still alive. I'm not sure if you prefer searching for clues to ancient times.
...From what I understand, Earth's history is very old. There must be countless examples of revisionism to villify an enemy...
...Is it human nature to define an "enemy" and seek its destruction? Mejare with men, and Earth with its colonists...I've come to respect the former.
...If isolating an "enemy" is part of human nature, then surely forming bonds must be another part. All men were once my enemy...
Even trade is a luxury many planets lack. Mejare and Tarak, for instance, had lost all contact with other colonies.
I'd like to see Earth's colonies have even that small level of contact...perhaps Mejare and Tarak could find peace.
...You'll have to forgive me. We've encountered people who hold sacrificial rites for the sake of Earth being "reborn."
...Our crew has learned to regard a world's "tradition" with skepticism. Earth has convinced them to self-sacrifice for its renewal...
...If you have no need of it, then a textbook would prove fascinating. I've certainly pored over the anatomy textbook we discovered...
I don't intend to take your school supplies from you...but if it's no trouble, then a history text would make a nice side to our book on sexual reproduction.
...What do you expect me to see you as when you take that as a personal insult? Don't define yourself on a race of sworn enemies.
...If you're going to play the victim, then I have nothing more to say to you. Hating men used to be my duty as a Mejarian until I met them for myself.
...If you see an attack on your beliefs as on attack on you, then nothing I say will make a difference. Peace only comes when you try to understand your enemy.
...Who your culture chooses to brand an enemy and slaughter is not your identity, Aella. I once saw any word in men's favor as an attack on my womanhood.
You aren't listening. Don't you realize I'm saying I once had enemies who turned out to be reasonable? We're repeating ourselves.
...Should I recount how I once thought men were impossible to reason with, as well? This is going nowhere.
...You'd be surpised who is capable of being reasoned with. I can only hope my fellow Mejarians prove more easily persuaded.
For God's sake...we're talking in circles. If I thought I couldn't reason with my enemies, I would now be without some of my closest allies.
I hope you're doing your part for the present as you study the past, then. Earth has undoubtedly villified its colonists in recent history.
I wouldn't be surprised if Earth has recently altered accounts of space colonization to paint itself as the home of "true" humans, Cynthia.
I'm hoping our crew can set a precedent for men and women coexisting, then. Our mutual destruction is assured otherwise.
...Well, Mejarians believe men are diseased, and Tarakkians believe women eat them. We'll both be killed if we can't achieve peace.
It doesn't surprise me. I'm inclined to agree with my captain on this matter--"legend" and "tradition" are convenient excuses for the indecisive.
These are people who sacrifice themselves for a false promise, all in the name of "tradition." It's sad to watch someone refuse to take hold of their own fate.
That's my point, Erufuda. You would keep your weight down if you engaged with any particular exercise beyond the surface level.
That's because you keep changing your routine, Erufuda. Your body can't find any rhythm to what you're doing, and you can't increase the intensity properly.
...I never criticized Jura's butt, Erufuda. Regardless, softness can be achieved by relaxing muscles. It is not an excuse to be overweight.
It's a misconception to to equate fat with softness. Muscle is only hard when tensed. In any case, Jura's butt is not my concern.
There are many women who hold the same misconceptions about building muscle, Erufuda. It does not harden your body unless you flex them.
...It's nothing, Jolyne. Just a family memento...has a relative given you anything?
...It was a gift from family, Jolyne. That's all...do you have something similar?
...Are you saying you're a target for some hostile organization, PA-15? Well, you may have disarmed yourself, but I have not.
You only have yourself to blame if you're attacked after unloading your weapon, PA-15. I still have mine, if providing assistance is feasible.
"Sangvis"? ...I happen to be armed myself, in case this enemy of yours attacks indiscriminately.
"Sangvis"? You have an enemy, and you've disarmed yourself? Now I'm regretting having done the same...
...I didn't realize you were the target of hostiles, PA-15. I should retrieve my laser ring before this situation worsens.
...PA-15, are you expecting an enemy attack? I shouldn't have disarmed myself--but at least my laser ring doesn't require ammunition.
...Thank you, Lucy. It's the crowds and the alcohol I don't like--I'd gladly sit down with you one-on-one, drinking coffee.
...I appreciate that, Lucy. If you're willing to talk individually, I'm sure I could learn a lot from you. I'll just order coffee...
That's not unbelievable, Lucy. I'm descended from Earth colonists--the genetics for blue hair had to come from somewhere.

condition.saying: Kingdom of Fiore has a queen

case.state: You're friends with royalty, Lucy? ...Technically speaking, I may be, as well. Though he wasn't aware of it at first...
...No, Orendi, I haven't. I've seen what becomes of a race who augments themselves beyond recognition.
Unnecessary augmentation would compromise my humanity, Orendi. I've seen it play out among others--they're left unable to reproduce, or even live peacefully.
That's a fruitless pursuit of power, Orendi. I've witnessed a planet fall into madness because its inhabitants traded their humanity away.
...I just was a girl when my family dealt with the media, Pyrrha. It wasn't really my responsibility.
...I can't provide much advice for media appearances as an adult, Pyrrha. I was just the daughter of a famous couple. I had to wear a dress and smile.
...I only know how to deal with publicity as a child, Pyrrha. I smiled for the camera...any photos of me now are in a raid suit, behind a mask.
...It wasn't me they were covering, Pyrrha. It was my parents. They were scientists contracted to develop living systems.
...The press were covering my parents' work in urban development and energy conservation, Pyrrha. I was just a cute face to put on posters.
One bad decision will lead to more in an attempt to justify the first, Orendi. It occurs even with less serious issues than cybernetics.
Each indulgence makes it harder to control, Orendi. You don't need to observe cyber augmentation to see that.
..."Insta-health"? I've never heard of these things. But there is no treatment for a woman's death.
...Are you saying you have self-service first aid stations, Gaige? That's nice, but death is a real and irreverisble threat.
...A pirate can't be picky with her food, Erufuda. But when we have them, I enjoy fish and wheat toast.
...Our food options are too limited to say I "can't live without" something in particular, Erufuda. But fish are a lean source of protein, and wheat toast for carbs.

...Komi-san?
...I see. So this is some sort of condition...I should be the one apologizing, then.

...Komi-san?
...So, you have a communication disorder, I take it. I'm sorry for being rude earlier.
I was speaking to my second-in-command, Cynthia. She's elsewhere in the building, and I want us to be aware of each others' safety.
My deputy ensign pilot is at another table, Cynthia. Her safety is my responsibility, so I'm maintaining a comm line with her.
...What is it you protect your subjects from? Is that related to "macro management"?
...I'm not sure what you mean by "macro management." Is that setting policy, or is it related to what you protect your people from?
That's right. As you open up to others, you start to change without even realizing it. I recently met a colleague I hadn't seen in a while, and she couldn't believe it when I laughed.
...I think I've become better for it, Laevatein, and so could you. I surprised one of my fellow officers the other day just by giggling.
It was her idea to come here, Cynthia. I agreed, both to ensure her safety and because it was an opportunity to learn about our ancestors' homeland.
...She caught wind of this place and asked me to come along with her, Cynthia. She knows I'll protect her without gossiping later--and for me, I can learn about Earth.
It's not my goal to humiliate them, Erufuda. I try to be terse--their personal laziness endangers their crewmates.
Dressing-downs aren't meant to shame girls, Erufuda. All I need to say is that they're being unfair to their teammates by not taking their own health seriously.
...I don't hound them about it, Erufuda. I give advice when they ask for it. In turn, I trust them to tell me when they have concerns.
...I meant that my pilots can ask me for diet advice, Erufuda, not that I force it upon them. I trust them to make clear any issues they have with my leadership.
I don't personally measure them, Erufuda, but we have regular weigh-ins and fitness tests. No one wants to be the "chubby girl."
I don't organize them, Erufuda, but we have shipwide weigh-ins. Being measured in front of one's peers naturally leads to scrutiny--girls will always judge each other.
Our crew was thrown across the galaxy in an instant thanks to a wormhole--is that what you mean? You've created a stable one?
...There's a cross-dimensional portal where you live, in a stable state? That's incredible technology-- wormholes are short-lived!
That was my personal communicator, Jessie. I came here with one of my ensign pilots, and we need to stay in contact in case danger arises.
I'm having one of my ensign pilots report to me, Jessie. She's at a different table, and I need to monitor her safety.
We have a history of conflict with Earth, Jessie. While this doesn't appear to be the Earth we know, we can't rule out potential threats.
Earth is a known aggressor against our ship and our homeworld, Jessie. The chance of danger may be slight, but it isn't worth the risk.
It's not this game I'm wary of, Jessie--it's Earth. In our time, it's become hostile to colonists like us, and that may still be true here.
Much of our crew is the same way, Laevatein. We became sick of that hypocrisy when it led to power failure in their homes.
I understand the feeling, Laevatein. Our pirate group was formed because girls were sick of the double-talk from authority, especially when it left many of us homeless.
It wasn't a sister I lost, but...I understand how you feel, Laevatein. Most of the Magno Family has lost loved ones.
Laevatein...I can relate to losing a loved one, at least. My parents. A lot of our crew has gone through something like that.
...It's funny you say that, Chazz. An accident with our energy core recently gave us the ability to fuse our Dread fighters with one of the men's Vanguard mechs. We call them Vandreads.
...Actually, Chazz, our Dreads can combine with a male Vanguard mech to produce the much more powerful "Vandreads." We've already seen that Earth also possesses this technology.
Fusing ships together is indeed technology we never considered, Chazz--until recently. Our combined Vandread mechs have been our crew's most powerful weapons.
Fusing Dreads and Vanguards into powerful Vandreads is exactly what's allowed us to survive, Chazz. Earth has a Paksis like we do--"XYZ Machines" might be your term for the same technology.
...I'm sure you're proud of them, Chazz. There isn't any need for hostilities with the Earth of this time. It seems like it's an in earlier age, anyway.
Neither of us has even seen the other's mechs, Chazz. The Earth of this time doesn't even seem capable of space combat.
You shouldn't underestimate your opponents, Chazz. In fact, this Earth seems more primitive than the one we're currently battling. It might be best for you to avoid conflict.
It's possible to combine women's DNA via machine, Chazz. Whatever "wieners" are, they're not necessary.
..."Wieners"? Women's DNA can make children, Chazz. We just need to fuse egg cells artificially.
...Yes, it is, Deimos. Mejare's firearms tend to be compact energy weapons.
I understand that the kinetic weapons men use are usually larger than ours, Deimos. It fires energy beams.
...At least this bar is clean. I don't care for bright lights, or constant chatter.
I can appreciate this bar, at least. I wasn't expecting a dim alcove for us to play in...
At least this place had the courtesy to seclude us. I couldn't get work done in a crowded casino hall, much less strip naked...
...I have to admit, the space they gave us to play in is perfect. Secluded...dim...quiet.
..."The Inventory." What are they stockpiling here to give a bar that name?
Perhaps Jura and I should raid this place before we leave...calling it "the Inventory" is tempting.
...I was actually worried they'd make us strip in a large hall with tables everywhere. This is much better...
...What kind of joke is this? Am I the only one not named Alice?
...Three women named Alice? This is some kind of practical joke.
...For convenience's sake, maybe you all ought to call me Alice, too.
...Three women named Alice...and me. I'm not dignifying this.
...How did I end up in a three-way confrontation? ~player~, don't tell me you know these women.
Ten minutes on Earth and I'm in the midst of an impending fistfight. At least they're all in shape.
...Are you sure you want to taunt these women, Juri? It seems they're ready to gang up on you...not that I know why.
Are you three...familiar with each other? If a fight's about to start, I'm leaving.
...Well, I got the one table where violence could break out at any moment. You're all attractive, at least.
How'd I get stuck with classmates on some perverted date? ...One's even a man.
...I fly all the way to Earth, and I end up on a table with three awkward classmates. Including a man.
...Why did you two bring your male classmate along? Why are you even all here together?
...Classmates? With a man among them...this is already a waste.
...Why am I on a table full of schoolchildren? I already babysit my pilots...
...Schoolchildren? You all know each other? Even ~player~? ...This isn't what I expected from a visit to Earth.
What's this all about? What kind of strip bar lets in groups of schoolgirls? This is obscene!
...Why am I with four classmates? Listen...you should stay in school. These sorts of places are for women who've lost their way.
I'm the...only woman?
...What is this? If I'm the only woman here...then don't try anything funny.
W-wait a minute! Not only are these games between the sexes, but--you'd put me alone with a group of men?
I--was expecting a few women here. Maybe even a table full of them--!
All men...? This is more than I bargained for...
This--this can't be right. They would put one woman on a table of men?
...Agh! Is this--I have to play surrounded by men? Be aware that I'm armed--!
Uh--! I...I didn't expect to be playing with a group of men! One would've been enough to observe his--rod.
Is this...necessary? I would have preferred one man, with other women to help me understand his anatomy...!
Ngh! I-is this--some kind of ambush? Stripping surrounded by men--it's a Mejarian's nightmare!
...Don't get any ideas! I don't know how I got stuck on a table of men, but I'm well aware of what they do to lone women...!
...Are there no men playing? I thought Earth was home to plenty of them...
All women...well, it's familiar. And I feel a bit safer...
...Oh, I see. They must keep these games single-sex.
...Hm. I really thought I'd see a man here...but I can still learn about this planet from women.
...I suppose if I had a choice, I would have picked a table like this--all women. Though a man would have provided the most interesting sights...
...Oh. I suppose they don't allow men and women to play together. And to think I was so anxious about seeing a man naked...
...Are there no men at the table? That's actually a relief, in a way...
...Hm. No men...that's no concern to a Mejarian, but I thought Earth women were only interested in them.
...I wasn't sure how I'd feel seeing a man naked, but it seems I won't get the chance. That's fine--on Mejare, there is only the female body.
...This should be it. The final hand...are you ready?
...Our captain has a favorite saying for moments like this. "Hit or miss... either way, it's our destiny."
This is the last shot--for both of us. Hit or miss...it'll either hit or miss.
...This hand will decide the game. I talk a lot about piloting skill, but even then, facing down the enemy takes some luck.
...It looks like this is the hand that will determine our destinies. Go on...line up your shot.
...This is as far as we go. I'm ready to show my hand when you are.
...This is it. I always use my Dread, or my laser ring, or my fists--something I have control over in a fight. Here, it's all up to chance.
So a man is playing...and only one. That's perfect...
...I likely couldn't have asked for a better setup than one man on a table of women...I can take notes without feeling outnumbered.
...Well, then. I was hoping to see a man here, and I found one...just one. That's ideal.
I only know a few men...keep in mind that I'm armed, and that you're alone.
Any more than one man playing would have been unnecessary, anyway...and unsettling.
I hope the one man playing is a good representative of his sex...
Meia Gisborn. Pleased to meet you.
You're all from Earth, correct? ...I wouldn't expect a welcome for interplanetary travelers here.
Earthlings...you're all looking healthy. Fresh organs, no doubt.
Meia Gisborn, Dread pilot commander of the Nirvana.
Meia Gisborn, home planet Mejare.
Earthlings...I'd hate for the crew to see me sororitizing with the enemy like this.
Meia Gisborn, age twenty. Pilot.
Meia Gisborn. I come from Mejare, one of this planet's colonies...a strange one, as I understand.
Meia Gisborn, junior officer aboard the Nirvana, flagship of the Magno Family.
Meia Gisborn. As a fair warning, Earth is not my home planet. I was born on Mejare, the woman colony.
Meia Gisborn, Dread team leader in the Magno Family Mejarian pirate group.
...Hello. Meia Gisborn. I've come here to learn about Earth's culture, if you'll permit me...
...Meia Gisborn. I command a Dread team aboard the Nirvana...if you've ever considered becoming a pilot, please let me know.
Hmmnn...I didn't think things would take this long.
I won't be getting much sleep tonight, with how long this game has been going...
This game has been going long...pirates don't get days off.
I didn't expect this game to last so long. I suppose that was the picture I had in my mind of Mejarians and our scant clothing...
...I would have preferred a strip poker game among Mejarians. None of us wear much clothing, and it'd be over quickly.
Hmmmn...I'm fortunate to have made it this far. I didn't come here wearing much...
This has been a good game so far. I'd hate to have crashed out of it too quickly--I won't get another opportunity to play on Earth.
...Hah. Does this bar serve coffee? I need to stay alert.
Hopefully this helps me understand our prisoners a bit better...I can't exactly ask them to show their rods to me.
Women have lived with men on this planet for thousands of years...I hope I can gain some perspective on how to coexist with our prisoners.
I wonder...if I were actually bold enough to ask our prisoners to show me their tubes, would they have done it? Instead, I'm here...
...I still haven't lost. I wonder how much of that is pure luck...
...For the record, I'm not afraid to strip. I just haven't lost yet.
It's lucky I've had such a good streak to start this game. I didn't want to strip before even sizing up the table...
It's funny...I'd rather be an observer of this game than stripping in it, and so far, I have been.
I can't believe Jura talked me into this.
Jura's getting next patrol duty for talking me into this.
How did I let Jura convince me to come here?
...You should know that I didn't seek this place out. My top-ranking pilot has grown fascinated with men lately, so I accompanied her here.
...It's not something I usually point out, but...I like the way my butt looks in this suit.
...My chest may not be impressive, but a leader is most often seen from the back.
It'd be a shame to lose too quickly just because I came underdressed...underdressed by Earth standards.
...I like how my suit doesn't get in my way, but you can see how it leaves my figure completely exposed.
...I'd say this side is better. My back, my thighs and calves...my ass.
...So, how do I look? My shoulders aren't hidden anymore, and nothing else ever was.
...I wonder how often my pilots' minds wander when I tell them to follow me from the rear.
...Is there really anything left for me to show you?
...Our standard flightsuit has a reputation for being a tight fit.
...Each time I zip this up in the morning, I feel it tighten around my backside.
Wearing suits like this encourages our pilots to stay fit--on both sides.
I once had a rookie complain when she first tried her suit on that it felt "vacuum-sealed" around her butt.
...Maybe I don't need this.
...I suppose...this planet is trustworthy.
Perhaps I...should show more trust.
...I can't make a scene of taking this off...
Perhaps I can disarm... I'm no stranger to using my fists anyway.
...I can't keep this on forever...an attacker would have struck by now.
...I suppose I should recognize...that this isn't the Earth of my time.
...I'll have to keep this close, but...this isn't the Earth I know.
It's a bit breezy in here...I never noticed it in the Nirvana's training room.
I could use more sets of this underwear...it needs to be washed quickly, or I'll have nothing to exercise in the next day.
A well-designed game would make us all wear the same amount of clothing.
I hope I'm looking toned. Exercise is something every woman can do to improve her beauty...
...I'm still feeling comfortable. You may be strangers, but my crewmates see me sweating in this underwear...
Damn it...my suit always wedges these shorts into my backside. But I couldn't wear nothing under it...
...This is a game about stripping naked, but having to pull my shorts out of my backside is probably more embarrassing...
Tch...I knew this would happen. My suit made my shorts ride up...
...Ah. All my pores can breathe, and my blood is circulating better...
...Well, I'm glad losing my eyepiece didn't fluster me into making an easy mistake. It's been a while since that loss...
If I'd be happy to take off anything, it'd be my armor. And yet it's stayed on longer than I thought it would...
...Is something the matter? You're right, I haven't lost in a while. I have no intention of making this easy for you.

state.text: There's no one left for you to hide behind. Now you deal with me.

case.state: And then there were two. Perhaps now I'll finally lose.
Now it's just you and me. I hope you're OK with that.
One-on-one...maybe I'd be excited if you had made me lose at some point.
One-on-one...and considering the challenge you've put up so far, this is probably over with.
You haven't been much challenge so far. Is that trend going to continue?
...It's down to just the two of us. I haven't even lost yet...but luck is cruel in this game.
And then there were two. Let's get this over with.
It's just you and me...I'm not going to go easy on you, nor should you want me to.
One-on-one...and since you cost me my eyepiece, I'm not feeling generous.
One-on-one...I want my eyepiece back, so I'll make this quick.
And then there were two. You certainly haven't given me a reason to worry.
...Are you the only one left? Well, I've lost one hand--I'm not invincible.
And then there were two. Are you ready to begin?
It's just you and me now. I prefer it that way...or with a squadron at my back.
...So, it looks like you're this table's last hope of seeing me naked.
One-on-one...I don't plan on having to strip naked if I can help it, you know.
And then there were two. I have experience in these situations...do you?
It's about time this game finished. I'd like to get through it without exposing myself.
And then there were two. You've made me lose twice...anything could happen.
It's just you and me. I'm not going to go easy on you...it would be disrespectful.
One-on-one...perhaps you'll finally manage to make me show some skin.
One-on-one...you're not about to back down from a challenge, right?
And then there were two. I certainly haven't felt as if I've been "stripping" so far.
We're at a showdown now. I'm used to playing cards this way, since our quartermaster makes them solo affairs.
And then there were two. Would you feel more confident if I were wearing panties?
Just you and me...you've certainly pushed me beyond my comfort zone.
Now it's just the two of us. The worst of my stripping is behind me.
...The two of us, facing off. If it takes you staring at my breasts to win, I can live with that.
And then there were two. I still have one line of defense, and I intend to keep it.
I'm ready when you are. After all, I'm bearing the proud symbols of the woman.

state.text: It's just the two of us left, Lucy. I don't plan on handing the game over, even to a "wizard."

case.state: It shouldn't be much challenge for a "wizard" to defeat a normal woman, should it? Let's finish this, Lucy.
...Would anyone here be interested in joining our crew? Ideally in a combat role, where you would serve under me as a Dread pilot.
...Our crew is shorthanded at the moment. If anyone is interested in joining my Dread team, I would give you individual attention for training.
...Our pirate group, the Magno Family, is happy to accept new recruits. If you'd like to become a pilot, I would be your commanding officer.
...It's not often I get a chance to talk to civilians. If any of you are sympathetic to the Magno Family, I'd be happy to consider you for a piloting role.
...Jura, come in. My game is underway. Let me know if a situation arises.

...Jura. Can you approximate the location of your table? I was escorted at least thirty meters from the entrance.
...Jura, are there any men at your table? ...Did you bring something to collect their seed with?
...What is it, Jura? ...I'm down to my underwear. I agree, Earthlings dress more heavily. I hear their winters are colder in some regions.

...Jura, are you there? Did you bring a weapon? ...You shouldn't have gone off alone if you only brought your saber. Be careful.

...This is Meia speaking. Jura and I are currently located on what appears to be a past version of planet Earth. I am sending this message in the event that we do not return to the Nirvana by tomorrow.

Meia speaking. Jura...?
...Yes, I believe that's what their seed looks like. Some kind of viscous fluid.

...Jura? Jura. Are there any deformities or surgical marks on your tablemates' bodies?
...I see. This Earth may not yet have engaged in organ-harvesting.

I enjoy piloting, Emi, but I had limited options. I was taken in by a pirate crew as a teenager, and it was a choice between that and grunt work in the munitions hold.
...I was living on the streets when the Magno Family pirates recruited me, Emi. Piloting was the only way to make a name for myself among them.

Most women on Mejare don't seem to have any trouble forming relationships, Emi. Even if a girl were more attracted to men, she wouldn't realize it without meeting one.

...I am not enlisted in Earth's military, nor familiar with its branches. I serve the crew of a ship in the Magno Family pirate outfit of planet Mejare.

I've piloted several crafts, Flutter, but Dread fighters stand out. I took a liking to their speed and power, and I was among the fastest learners.
Oh, I enjoy piloting discussions. Dreads are my main areas of expertise, and mine is the fastest we have. I'm learning mechs at this time, as well.

...Largely, I am here at my crewmate's request. There is no ulterior motive.
...I am making sure my second-in-command is safe here, Leggy.
I am not shy about men. They're the enemy to me...and what does gay mean?
Shy? I've fought against and alongside men. And what did you call my parents?
...I think you've got the wrong impression of me, Natsuki. I'm not afraid of men...and I don't know what "gay" means.
My parents were not--I don't even know what that means. And men don't scare me.
Tch. It seems Earth women have inherited men's complete lack of subtlety.
...Do not lump me in with Earth women's perversion. This must be from centuries of men literally pressing down on you.
...Living around men makes such perverts out of women. Our raids on Tarak make me feel men's weight...I'm not sure if I want to literally.
Perhaps you're right, Zone, even if you're vulgar about it...but I think it's very human to rise above your primal instincts.
...You were trying to convince me I liked men by professing your own perverted lust for them.
...Can't men do something besides press their weight onto you? Earth women are perverted to be into that...
...I am not an alien. You would do well to learn your own planet's history of space colonization.
I am "remarkably human-like" because I am human. My ancestors came from this planet...like yours, I presume.
Aren't you taught anything about Earth's extraplanetary colonies? Mejare is one of them--we are not aliens.
...Earthlings are quick to label those born on other planets as "alien." I am every bit the human you are.
...Yes, Natsuki?
...Natsuki, why are you staring at me?
...If you have something to say, Natsuki, then say it.
...Yes, Natsuki? You're like how rookie pilots are afraid to ask questions.
...You speak as if having "superlative prowess" is normal. You shouldn't look down on others for their biology.
...Is that how those on Tamaran assess others, on the possession of "superlative prowess"? I hope Earth hasn't taught you that.
...In human culture, it is considered rude to judge others based on factors outside of their control, such as "superlative prowess."
...I should've known a floating alien woman would look down upon those without superpowers. Humanity thrives on overcoming those odds.
...There isn't much to see, Starfire.
...It's standard flight armor, Starfire. Nothing worth inspection.
...You were interested in my armor?
...I wouldn't expect an alien with "superlative prowess" to be fascinated by human armor.
...At once. To do otherwise would be cowardly.
...Is that a common strategy in the games you've played, Starfire? It sounds underhanded to me.
...It's one item of clothing, isn't it? I didn't depressurize my armor and try to count that.
Mmh...that should be obvious. Piecemeal removal is completely arbitrary.
Didn't you hear what I said? I am a human. A few centuries on another planet wouldn't change that.
...Are you implying that a few centuries away from Earth would change human anatomy, Jessie? Evolution is much slower than that.
...Maybe if Mejare had a harsh climate, a few centuries apart would make us different from "modern humans," but the planet is terraformed.
Earth would have you believe Mejare and other colonists have devolved from "current humans," Jessie, but I'm just like you.
"Extra"? Mejare prides itself on having extra beauty, and nothing more. I hope I can represent it well in that respect.
I can't claim to be an expert, Jessie. Perhaps you'll see a muscle in my rear that you lack--but Mejare's pride is in beautiful, human women.
Mejare's claim to fame is feminine beauty, Jessie, not strange female anatomy. But maybe we have marks on our backsides that you don't.
I think you'll find Mejarian bodies to be quite normal, Jessie, but hopefully very shapely. That is my homeworld's pride.
...I'm sorry? I don't understand what you're asking. Why would pirates have a particular accent?
...Could you repeat that, Fidget? Are you implying all pirates have the same accent?
..."Arr, Jim-lad"? Is that some sort of Earth stereotype about pirate women?
...What are you saying, Fidget? That I speak in too educated a fashion compared to most pirates?
...I'm not our ship's captain. And I have an eye decoration, as you can see...not that I understand what you mean.
...Our captain is an old woman, Fidget. With both of her eyes...I don't follow what you're saying.
...You're mistaken, Fidget. I'm a junior officer, not the captain...and I don't wear this eyepiece because I'm a pirate.
...I lead our Dread team, not the whole ship. As for the eyepatch comment, I don't understand where you got that idea.
..."Parrot"? Is this a setup to an Earth joke?
...If this is setting up a joke, Fidget, perhaps an Earth woman might have more context for it.
...I don't have a parrot. Nor a boat. Are you trying to make me laugh?
...My "parrot on the boat." That must be some sort of joking phrase on this planet.
Our "pirate captain" is an elderly woman named Magno Vivan, Fidget. And scurvy is a disease. The relation escapes me.
...Scurvy is a disease caused by Vitamin C deficiency. I don't see what that has to do with our captain, who I am not.
...I imagine a "scurvy dog" is a dog that's contracted scurvy. For the record, I am not the captain of our ship, nor the commander.
I command the Nirvana's Dread team, Fidget. That only makes me an officer, not captain--and what's that got to do with scurvy?
"Shanties"? ...Our crew actually is fond of singing on special occasions. "To Faraway Times" is a favorite.
...They're not necessarily "pirate" shanties, but singing is the one shipwide activity I enjoy participating in.
...You may be expecting otherwise, Fidget, but I actually do know some songs. The Magno Family enjoys singing during holidays.
...Are you familiar with "Spacy Spicy Love," Fidget? I actually sang a verse for the crew--much to everyone's surprise.
...If by "islands" you mean "military outposts." Largely the ones in low orbit.
We conduct our raids in space, where we frequently hold the advantage and can make quick escapes. Why islands?
...Why would we raid islands? Neither Mejare's nor Tarak's armies have much presence outside major cities.
...There isn't much "booty" to be found on uninhabited islands, Fidget. We target the military.
You...watch Mejare, Yuelia? I thought its empire would keep better track of satellites... unless you've conspired with them.
Mejare's problems are equal parts Earth's fault and our own, Yuelia. Have you set up some kind of undetected satellite?
What do you mean, you watch my homeworld? If you've slipped monitoring equipment into orbit without imperials noticing, I'm impressed.
Is that "watching" with Earth's resources, Yuelia? It's difficult even for us pirates to monitor what's happening on Mejare's surface from orbit.
Hm? Our main crafts are Dread fighters, which are built for speed and accuracy. Recent events have given me experience piloting mechs, as well.
I'm glad you asked, Yuelia. The Magno Family's fleet consists largely of Dread fighters, designed for quick raids and escapes.
I've piloted several crafts, Yuelia, but Dread fighters stand out. I took a liking to their speed and power, and I was among the fastest learners.
Oh, I enjoy piloting discussions. Dreads are my main areas of expertise, and mine is the fastest we have. I'm learning mechs at this time, as well.
...Leadership is overwhelming until you've seen and heard everything young girls can throw at you. I was given the job to be more level-headed.
...You may not believe it, Yuelia, but I used to be much more aggressive. I was thrust into a command role to make me more mature.
Being responsible for a Dread team's worth of girls makes your own problems seem small by comparison. It's calmed me down considerably.
Command matures you quickly, Yuelia. I rose through our ranks quickly because I was brash, but I was made an officer to quell that.
Senior officers will tell you that responsible women are given leadership roles. It's the opposite--I was made an officer to keep me in line.
Leading others is all about controlling yourself, Yuelia. I kept starting fights and taking needless risks until I was named a junior officer.
...It was just a fashion accessory, Yuelia. My Oma's company designed it...alongside living units.
...My eyepiece doesn't do anything, Yuelia. I believe it was a model for a product made by my Oma's firm.
...From what I understand, my eyepiece was a model of a new scanner design, Yuelia. My Oma designed products like that.
...I understand it looked like a scanner, Yuelia. My Oma's company made it...it was just a prototype design.
...It was just a family memento, Yuelia. Courtesy of my Oma...don't concern yourself with it.
...My Oma give it to me before she died. There's no need to dwell on it...
...It was a gift from my Oma, Yuelia. That's all...I didn't want to make a big deal of it.
...Yes, it was important to me. A gift from my late Oma...that's all there is to it.
I see every competition as a chance to improve myself, Yuelia. I can't do that if I don't give it my all.
Poker is all about reading your opponents, Yuelia. If I can succeed here, it will help me improve my piloting skills, as well.
Healthy competition forges rivalries, friendships, and self-improvement, Yuelia. I can't improve if I don't take this seriously.
Piloting is just a more serious competition, Yuelia. Here, I can practice predicting my opponents without the same life-or-death stakes.
You can't let the enemy see weakness, Yuelia. Besides, I'm lucky enough to have a normal body...
Part of leadership is keeping a straight face, Yuelia. And compared to many women, I have nothing to be embarrassed about naked...
It's my job to be calm, Yuelia. Besides...what right do I have to be embarrassed? I don't have any scars.
...It's arrogant of me to act embarrassed, Yuelia. I know younger girls who've suffered burns...nakedness is no issue for me.
Our quartermaster, Gascogne, has put me through many poker games when she sees I need to vent. Here, I'm analyzing others...
...It's strange to be playing poker with peers. I usually find myself in games with our quartermaster as she teases out my frustrations.
...It's nice to be able to question people from Earth, Yuelia. Usually in poker games, our quartermaster is the one questioning me.
Card games are our quartermaster's favorite means of shaking down me and my crewmates. I often need that...but this is a nice change of pace.
...I come from a planet of women, Mary, if that's what you mean. Why does that sound hellish to you?
...My homeworld has its issues, Mary, but you seem to be implying that the lack of men is the reason for that. Why?
..."Hell on Earth" for having no men around, as I understand? I figured Earth women would be attached to men, but you would go that far?
...I'm sure you're accustomed to men, but it is not "Hell on Earth" without them. If that's indeed what you're referring to...
That's fair. I'm not from this planet, after all...go ahead.
I'm prepared to answer, Amy. I understand Earth's mixed-gender culture is very unlike Mejare's.
I'm used to answering questions, and I expected some given my unusual homeworld. Go ahead, Amy.
My home planet and my outfit both seem to invite questions. I'm listening.
...I'd rather discuss my suit than my personal life. What I'm wearing is a common pirate flightsuit, though Mejarians do love form-fitting clothing.
...There isn't much time when I'm not working, Amy. That's thanks to being a pirate--and pirates wear these suits the most.
...This is more a pilot's suit than anything else, Amy, though some young Mejarian civilians like the feel. They're cheap, so our pirate crew wears them.
...I'll focus on the suit questions. Bodysuits are both practical and efficient, which makes them low-cost uniforms--useful for a pirate crew like ours.
I think you'll find my underwear quite standard, Amy. What would be the sense in overcomplicating it?
"Fancy underwear"? An undergarment's job is to provide support and protection, Amy. What would you add?
...I'd describe "fancy underwear" as lingerie, but you seem to mean that there should be mechanical parts on my bra. I don't see the use.
Even my "space stuff" isn't fancy, Amy. Something as simple as underwear isn't improved with electronics.
...I used to streetfight, either for money or just to survive. Still, I wouldn't think it's made me muscular enough to be called a "brawler."
...I pilot a Dread ship. That places me firmly in long-range...we're taught to not fight men up close if we can help it.
...That depends what a man's definition of a "brawler" is. I fight with my Dread ship, as well as small arms...and formerly my fists.
And you would be mistaken, Brock. Women's weapons are inconspicuous, as opposed to men and their rocket launchers.
..."Max" sounds like a man's name. I can assure you my experience with men is limited. Do you actually wear bodysuits here?
...Who is "Max"? Another man, it sounds like...the only men I know personally are the three prisoners aboard our ship.
..."Max"? A man, I assume--why would a man wear a bodysuit, let alone give me one? Men's bodies are too angular.
...No, I don't know a "Max." I know very few men in general...do men really consider bodysuits a fighting outfit?
...Are you implying our pilots sometimes lose limbs in combat, Gaige? Dread crashes are very dangerous, yes.
...Is Earth still divided into countries, Megumin? I was born on planet Mejare, an Earth colony known for having no men.
...I come from Mejare, an all-female Earth colony. Are you saying Earth isn't united as a planet, Megumin? That would probably lead to a violent culture.
"Evil gods"? As if Earth weren't dangerous enough already...I was hoping to visit some secluded beaches, not a primitive village.
..."Evil gods" aren't what I had in mind, Megumin. Famous landmarks would be much easier and safer to observe than your village.
...Do you mean "execute a prisoner," Fidget? It'd be easiest to just throw them out of the airlock.
..."Walk the plank"? That sounds like a euphemism for executions...we have an airlock for that.
...I used to. But I wasn't a pirate then.
...No. I stopped drinking rum when I became a pirate.
...Our ship has some rum. I haven't drank since I came aboard.
...When I say classical has survived, I mean we have the most records of it. I actually took an interest in punk rock when I was younger.
More classical pieces were preserved when we settled Mejare than anything else. That's all I meant..when I was a teenager, I got into our punk scene.
Mejare still has other musical genres, Revy. My Fama gave me stern looks when I entered a punk rock phase...
I only prefer classical music now to relax. Mejare has underground punk bands I once took interest in, much to my parents' disapproval.
...That's correct, Saki. Is there something you'd like to ask about Mejare's culture?
...I have had relationships. To call any of them "girlfriends" would be quite generous.
...No, Saki, I didn't. If women's bodies operate on a cycle of reproductive viability, it only seemed natural that men's would, as well.
...If men and women are really part of the same species, Saki, I'd expect our bodies to have similar cycles.
...Saki, the period is an integral part of women's reproductive cycles. For men to have no analog to that makes them seem so...alien.
...I am a human, Mary, so no, it's not weird at all.
...I "look identical" to a human because I am a human, Mary. I understand Earth has framed Mejarian colonists as otherwise.
...Mejarians are human women, Mary. At no point did I imply I was an alien.
...Men have settled their own planet, Mary--Tarak. It's in the same system as Mejare, which has led to armed conflict.
...I know little of how women are treated here, Mary, but there exists a colony of men, as well. It's a desert world called Tarak, near Mejare.
..."Kama Sutra"? I'm not the one to ask about Earth literature, Yuelia...but if women are hesitant to share details, it's probably sexual in nature.
...I'm not familiar with Earth's literary canon, Yuelia, but that book is probably sexually explicit. Why else would women hush about its contents?
...I know you aren't serious, Erufuda, but artificial gravity has been commonplace technology for centuries.
...Aside from the obvious answers, women haven't been weightless in space for centuries, Erufuda. Artificial gravity is standard.
...No one is weightless in space, Erufuda. Even my Dread has an artificial gravity system--only the most antiquated ships don't.
...Truthfully, most of my pilots are in fine shape, Erufuda. But I don't want them to get complacent...and I don't want to lose any of them.
...Every bit of excess fat could mean the difference between life and death, Erufuda. My pilots do take good care of themselves... but I worry.
...I think some of my pilots actually appreciate my strictness, Erufuda. Many of them were aimless before joining our crew...
...I know better than most that many young women need structure in their lives, Erufuda-- especially pirates. I want to provide that for my subordinates...
...I'm trying to set an example for my pilots, Erufuda. Complacency is the most dangerous threat we face...and nothing is worse than losing a team member.
Erufuda...half of our recruits are drifters off the Mejarian streets. I want to give them goals to strive for...and a greater purpose.
...I see this game as an opportunity to learn about Earth. I assure you, my crewmates can hardly get a greeting out of me.
...I care little for a man's opinion. But you should know I talk far less when I'm among crewmates.
Komi-san? ...Our crew's travel through the galaxy has been beset by Earth's attacks, but yes, we've found places of striking beauty along the way...
Yes, Komi-san? ...Well, we've all done our best to appreciate space's beauty in between attacks from Earth's Harvest fleets.
I see you, Komi. ...It's true, space is full of wonders and mystery. Of course, Earth's fleets have distracted us from that...as have the men.
...I, too, don't concern myself with escalating conflict because of perceived personal slights. I used to, when I was in your position.
I'm not interested in a delinquent's posturing, Saki. Don't project animosity where there is none...like I used to.
...That's understandable, Saki. I'm glad you've found something positive in your life--too many delinquent girls just drink and fight.
I'm not denying our differences, Saki. You should be glad you don't have to fight to survive...it's difficult for delinquent girls to break that cycle.
...Are you implying women strive for beauty solely to please men, Erufuda? Even if that were true, it's no reason to pretend obesity is beautiful.
Coddling women who make poor fitness decisions is not "inclusive," Erufuda. Men's presence wouldn't change that--I hope.
What do men have to with that, Erufuda? Women pursue beauty to impress each other. Obesity shows a lack of self-control, nothing more.
...Is something wrong, Galatea?
...Galatea. If you have something to say to me, then do so.
...That's correct, Galatea. There may be men aboard our ship, but Earth has a society in which men and women have coexisted.
...Yes, Galatea, that's right. I was hoping to gain the perspective of a culture that's accustomed to men and women sharing space.
That's right, Galatea. Both men and Earth are technically my enemies, so this should help me learn about both--men and women live together here.
I'm sure you still have some insight to provide me as an Earthling, Galatea. Mejare has lost much knowledge of planet Earth in general.
...Even if your circumstances are unusual, I would welcome your insight on this planet, Galatea. In fact, you may prove to be less biased.
...Space travel is well-established at this point, Cynthia. Our elderly captain might have a similar perspective to your grandmother.
...The first recorded spaceflight is several centuries old at this point, Cynthia. Our captain was a first-generation colonist--perhaps your grandmother is around the same age.
...Do you have a close relationship with your grandmother, Cynthia? Our captain is quite elderly, and she speaks of our planet's founding in the same way.
...I'd imagine there are as many women living on extraterrestial settlements as there are men, Cynthia. Apparently it's commonplace for them to live together.
Most of the settlements our crew has encountered have a roughly equal proportion of men and women, Cynthia. I believe even Tarak and Mejare's populations are close.
I pilot a Dread fighter as the leader of one of the attack fleets on the Nirvana. It is the flagship of a neutral pirate group in the Tarak-Mejare conflict.
I serve the Magno Family pirate outfit as Chief Pilot of our Dread team. That armor I was wearing signifies my status as Wing Commander.
I serve the Nirvana pirate ship as a junior officer and Chief Pilot of its Dread fleet, Cynthia.
I am one of several wing commanders in the Magno Family pirate outfit, Cynthia. We are currently separated from our remaining crew, making me the full-time Chief Dread pilot.
..."Fool you"? I freely admit that I'm part of a pirate outfit, Shantae.
...What other pirates have you encountered, Shantae? I've made no attempt to deceive you about who I work for.
I don't lead the entire ship, Jolyne. I'm Chief Pilot of our Dread fleet. Though I do have a reputation for strictness, even to our upper command.
I'm only a junior officer, Jolyne. I lead our Dread fleet. In fact, our captain is probably more laid-back than I am.
I serve as wing commander, not captain. There are several women who rank above me, Jolyne...though they're often more relaxed.
It's funny you say that, Jolyne. Our captain and quartermaster both feel I can be overly serious at times. I command our Dread fighters.
...We don't seem alike at all, PA-15. Unless you mean how we've both brought weapons.
...Aside from both being armed, I don't see a resemblance between us, PA-15.
...The Magno Family was formed after an energy crisis shut down a living district on Mejare, Cynthia. Many of our recruits are refugees from that incident.
...Until recently, our pirate group hadn't left the Mejarian system, Cynthia. We raided military bases for supplies after an energy crisis left many civilians homeless.
...I joined the Magno Family because I was living on the streets, Cynthia. It was formed for girls in situations like mine after a major civilian disaster.
It's not, Lucy--Earth is the organ harvest. We've had to repel the fleets it's sent to collect ours.
Earth's other colonies are its organ farms, Lucy. Mejare is designated for breasts and uteri, so we've been attacked by Harvester fleets.
...In my time, Myriam, Earth is already doomed. It's attempting to give my homeworld a similar fate.
...I serve as a wing commander, Myriam, but that's irrelevant to this game.
...You're a reporter, aren't you? You would do well to gain a better understanding of space travel than some vague "degree."
Mejare is in a state of open conflict with Tarak, Cynthia. And that conflict is based on us being women. Tarakkians believe women eat their intestines, and so would execute us on sight.
Tarak is all-men by design, Cynthia. If we were to try to land there, we would immediately be captured and executed.
We have a base of operations in low orbit around Mejare, Cynthia. If we were caught there, we would risk prison. So much as approaching Tarak would mean execution.
Tarakkian men would not welcome us as allies just for opposing Mejare's empire, Cynthia. They do not believe women to be human beings.
Yes, I am, Pyrrha. I serve as a wing commander for my squadron.
That's right, Pyrrha. I have a fighter craft of my own and command several other pilots.
Mejare is an extraplanetary Earth colony, Pyrrha. It's quite some distance across the galaxy, so it's understandable that you wouldn't know of it.
Mejare is an Earth colony in a distant sector of this galaxy, Pyrrha. It has a sister planet nearby, called Tarak--which is a colony itself.
I actually came here to compare the two, Pyrrha. What roles do men typically fill in your society?
This is my first time observing a mixed-gender society, Pyrrha. I'd hoped you could shed some light on the subject, such as men's function within it.
...I'm not a biologist, Pyrrha, but evidently genetic disorders are not a concern using our artificial process.
...When two women are ready to have a daughter, Pyrrha, their eggs are artificially spliced together. Perhaps disorders were originally common, but the process has been refined for decades.
...Is that the stigma Earthlings associate with women having children together, Pyrrha? Our eggs are spliced together. If disorders were an issue at first, it's been resolved.
...I suppose you view a man's involvement as more natural. My education is limited, Pyrrha, but couples on Mejare donate and carry spliced eggs. Whatever disorders you mean have been dealt with.
...I do, Pyrrha. I never associated with my crewmates much outside of my duties, but in the past, there were at least other junior officers I shared those duties with.
Our crew is currently isolated from the rest of the Magno Family, Pyrrha, so those feelings have been stronger recently. I'm the only one of my rank aboard our ship.
...I serve as a part-time wing commander, Pyrrha, but the others who share that rank are cut off at the moment. So any feelings of loneliness have been exacerbated lately.
I serve as a junior officer, Pyrrha, which is an odd middle ground of rank. It doesn't help that the others in my position are currently absent from our ship.
Mejare is an Earth colony settled around a hundred years ago, Neptune. It's known for having an exclusively female population.
Mejare is my home planet, Neptune. It's one of many settlements founded by Earthlings in recent centuries, and only women live there.
My homeworld is a planet known as Mejare, Yunyun. It's a remote Earth colony populated only by women. I recognize that you're being friendly, if you were concerned.
...I know that showing interest in others is friendly, Yunyun. I come from Mejare, an all-female Earth colony in a remote sector of the galaxy.
...Can you describe a "monster" to me, Neptune? Mejare has mild surface conditions due to heavy terraforming, though its exosphere has dangerous debris.
Mejare is a terraformed, temperate blue planet surrounded by twin asteroid belts, Neptune. Can you explain what you mean by "monsters"?
Mejare is a blue planet settled late in the frontier era, Yunyun, roughly a hundred years ago. Only female colonists and their descendants inhabit it today.
Mejare is a temperate Earth colony, Yunyun. It's been home to several generations of female colonists and their descendants, such as me and other members of our crew.
I'm far from perfect myself, Galatea. But that's very flattering.
...You don't need to flatter me, Galatea. I could point out more flaws on my own body than yours--but thank you.
Mejare exists in an isolated system, Jim, so we've only recently explored beyond it. Our crew is Mejare's first contact with many other colonies in the sector.
Most of the colonies in Mejare's sector are isolated from each other, Jim. That includes Mejare itself--we didn't even know other human settlements existed besides Earth until we left the system.
Most of my experience lies in Dread assaults around Mejare's system, Jim. We became explorers by accident--but we have found other human settlements.
...Thank you, Jim. Until recently, our crew was more an assault team than an exploration one. But a wormhole accident sent us across the galaxy, which has led to new discoveries.

It's funny you mention that, Erufuda--since the Nirvana was formed in a fusion accident, we had trouble with climate control at first. My suit was sticking to me one minute and failing to insulate me the next.

Climate control is something we often take for granted on modern ships, Erufuda. The Nirvana has an old section, and our power core malfunctioned at first--my flightsuit wasn't ideal for fluctuating heat and cold.

Funnily enough, Erufuda, I had to keep a straight face when the Nirvana first formed and we couldn't regulate its temperature. I was nearly sweating through my suit, and then it froze to my body a few minutes later.
I'm not the one preparing my food, Erufuda. We have a cooking team who enjoy seasoning and decorating dishes for us.
I probably wouldn't bother seasoning it myself, Erufuda, but our cooks do. They take pride in making our food appealing.
They're have some flair, Erufuda--it's a point of pride for the cooking team. Much like regisystem staff, they want to provide the best for the Nirvana's pilots.
...I'm not sure if you're just making fun of me at this point. I know mass is conserved in the universe, but beyond that...I'm not a scientist, let alone a portal one.
The same weight...? This is already hard to believe, Erufuda. I'm no scientist-- maybe our chief engineer Parfet could relate that to conservation of mass somehow.

Yes, Komi-san?
...I resented the men early on--relying on other women was bad enough, and they challenged my authority. But I couldn't ignore the value they brought to our crew.

Komi-san?
...Having to rely on men as crew members hurt my pride at first. But I realized I was being foolish...it's strange how quickly we became used to them.
..."Nevada"? It's possible there are other all-male planets like Tarak that we aren't aware of. Has it always been that way, Deimos?
...Are you not from this planet either, Deimos? We haven't encountered a colony called Nevada in our sector. Was it settled solely by men, like Tarak?
...That's correct, Jim. Our captain was a first-generation colonist and recalls that men and women were separated when their frontier ships arrived at the two planets.
...As I understand it, Jim, Mejare and Tarak were both settled at the same time around a century ago by colonists who separated by sex. Our captain was among the passengers.
...This is the standard flightsuit our pilots wear, Megumin. Its flexibility and simplicity make it useful for combat roles, which I assume Darkness fills for you.
...By "crusader," I assume you mean Darkness is some kind of fighter. Our pilots wear these suits so they won't fumble with their clothes when the ship is under attack.
...No, Chazz, I wouldn't. The Magno Family has not been active on Earth, nor on any private shipping companies. We attack military.
Those attacks were likely from an Earth pirate group, Chazz. The Magno Family only operates on Mejare and Tarak, targeting military ships.
...I'm here to learn about this planet, Chazz. Men and women coexist here, and it's where my ancestors came from.
...Earth is my ancestors' homeworld, Chazz, and I'd like to see how they lived and worked with men. Your family's company is not my concern.
Yes, Chazz, that's correct. There are no men to exclude, so we don't typically think of things in those terms.
That's correct, Chazz, but they wouldn't be called such. To Mejare's society, the only concept of a human is a woman.

condition.saying: What would you say is the biggest thing you've ever stolen?

case.state: Most of our vessels were stolen in steadily bigger heists, Chazz, and the one I currently serve on is quite large. You don't need to know more about our forces.
It's enough for you to know that our most recent ship is impressive, Chazz. We've progressively stolen larger ones.
...No, Chazz, it isn't. This is the planet where humans originated, and it's much different than my own.

I knew one mistake would lead to another...
...I'm blushing, aren't I?
...I've had time to think about what to strip next, but there's really nothing to consider.
...You broke my streak. Of course, that's inevitable in poker...
With every successful round, the pressure seems to build on the next one...even though each is as random as the last.
I was doing well, but it seems I'm still in the middle of the pack. I prefer leading the charge.
Something about being in public is making my face feel naked. It's not as if I shower or sleep with my eyepiece on...
...Street gangs on Mejare aren't above forcing women to strip for their own amusement.
It's hard to know what mistakes you're making in poker sometimes.
...Our captain insists my biggest flaw is not forgiving myself for my mistakes.
That's a shame...I like the way my suit feels without the armor.
...That was quick. As the pilot of our fleet's fastest Dread, I understand the value in that.
There's always the odd attack where you can't even get your bearings.
You caught me slipping. In a dogfight, that'd mean death.
I wonder how the Paksis would feed off the aural energy of a tense poker game...
Damn. I was doing well, too.
At least this proves I'm comfortable in my suit, to do so well in it.
...I can accept this. I'm starting to sweat under this thing, anyway.
I finally lost another round...give me a moment. I'm filling out pilot profiles.
Tch. I feel like a novice player, back when our quartermaster was just using it to get me to socialize.
Something about going topless is more humiliating when it accompanies a losing streak.
My normal strategy is to play for safe hands and avoid bluffing. This poker is so watered-down, even reckless behavior gets rewarded.
Maybe this is for the best. If I'd lasted long like this, I'd start to fret about my showing my breasts...
Right away...? I was still dealing with my sweat, and now I'll have to fix my hair once my bra is pulled past it.
Damn. Not even two rounds in my exercise gear--I'm certainly not doing any reps without breast support.
...Alright. I know it's my turn, yes--we often seem compelled to tell the loser that.
I end each successful mission by reflecting upon what I could have done to improve. That round is going to stick out to me after this.
I'll have to talk about Deluna about breaking her sub-team's formation...is it my turn? I'd rather keep working than pull off my bra...
That lucky streak created a lot of buildup for a B-cup at best.
I was doing well up until now. It helps that most of you announce your hands' quality.
...What is it, ~player~? I know it's my turn--you're just staring.
I made the best exchange I could have that round, as I did with the last several. Part of my job is accepting bad luck.
...It's hard not to feel targeted like this, even if momentum is all imaginary in poker.
...My cards must be written all over my face.
Tch. I should have worn one-piece underwear for how long that lasted.
...Am I playing too safe? Reckless play might be appropriate if we had a betting pot.
So quickly...? I haven't even fixed my shorts properly.
...This doesn't display my poker skills well. I would have folded in a heartbeat if I could.
...I was starting to believe I might make it through this without exposing my whole body.
Agh...my heart was racing that hand. I knew sooner or later my luck would run dry.
Damn. I was nearly slipping away with this game--now it's just my shorts slipping off.
...My turn. It's been a while since my bra came off--I'd started to get used to it.
...It's me. Let that streak be a warning. I'm not out of this until the very last shot.
When I'm normally the center of attention, I have an agenda prepared. That's still true, if you count my backside.
...Now that I'm here in this moment, I can't believe I came to the homeworld of the Harvest and agreed to put my organs on display.
...I see my mistake now. I thought I could maintain the same focus I have in a cockpit when I was half-naked with strangers.
...So, my back's against the wall now. Well, I'd never dream of backing down--this planet is the enemy.
...It was nice to have my shorts on for security. I think I would have valued them even more if a man's rod were swelling neaby.
Mejare hasn't been a colony long enough for us to speciate, so I should look fairly standard.
...It's said that each of us is put on a stage in life, forced to prove our existence for a judging crowd. Mine is now laid bare.
...My last line of defense. Tarak has its minefield, and Mejare its asteroid belts.
Damn...well, I knew this would happen. I'll start small...
...Fine. I know I need to feel consequences to appreciate them.
...This had to happen eventually. Both losing a hand, and...well.
...I wasn't looking forward to actually partaking in stripping.
...I suppose I should start small. Small by most standards...
...My turn. I should just get this over with...
...I know what's first.
...I've given some thought to what to strip first...
Some of my crewmates would be curious if I could maintain my stoicism when stripping for an audience...
...My armor should go next. There's little else that can.
...With my eyepiece gone, my strip order is almost predetermined. Unless you'd like to watch me attempt to peel my suit off under my armor.
I'd like to think I was maintaining my poker face on that hand...
...Next, my armor. I probably wear it too much already.
Tch. Well, complaining is pointless--I'll make sure my work is done first.
I should've worn more clothing, but I certainly could've worn less. I sleep in a chemise and panties.
Maybe this game is a Harvest plot to not have to sort clothes from organs.
I'm not concentrating...I didn't think this would be so distracting.
Our crew is certainly eager to jump into hot springs. I wonder if strip poker would encourage group bonding...
...I didn't spend much time as an ensign pilot. I don't like being stuck in the middle of the pack.
Hm. At least this will let my body breathe even more.
It's a shame this whole suit is one piece. Well, it's a shame here, anyway.
Ugh...my suit is sticking. Perhaps it was the right time to remove it, anyway...
I would have benefitted from a shirt and pants...they can be removed separately.
I hate reckless behavior, especially from my subordinates. Maybe that's why poker irritates me--it rewards it.
...The reality of this has finally caught up with me.
Maybe I should have come here in one of our clunky spacesuits. I'd have a mask, thrusters, the suit itself...
...I feel flushed. If only I owned some makeup to improve my complexion.
Upstaged by someone taking needless risks...somehow it's more charming when it's the man in my squadron doing it.
...Should I have brushed my hair before coming here? I'm not usually appearing in front of strangers, especially naked.
Tch...I'll follow the rules. This game is a constant shift between giving and taking orders to strip--a bit like being a junior officer.
...Maybe I should've installed this thing with one of the programs that calculates favorable card exchanges.
Damn. If I have to lose my bra, I should really put this away and focus on the cards.
When I'm normally the center of attention, I have an agenda prepared. That's still true, if you count my backside.
...Now that I'm here in this moment, I can't believe I came to the homeworld of the Harvest and agreed to put my organs on display.
...I see my mistake now. I thought I could maintain the same focus I have in a cockpit when I was half-naked with strangers.
...So, my back's against the wall now. Well, I'd never dream of backing down--this planet is the enemy.
...It was nice to have my shorts on while certain tablemates' organs transformed before my eyes.
Mejare hasn't been a colony long enough for us to speciate, so I should look fairly standard.
...It's said that each of us is put on a stage in life, forced to prove our existence for a judging crowd. Mine is now laid bare.
...My last line of defense. Tarak has its minefield, and Mejare its asteroid belts.
Tch...my favorite job is scouting ahead of the ship. This is like getting ambushed...
So much for surveying the room a bit... although I can say I'm wearing the least here.
...I hoped I'd go a while before losing a hand...
...After one whole round of reconnaissance, I've concluded you're all very conservatively dressed.
Damn. Not even a round in...and looking around, this flightsuit feels very thin.
You all wear too much clothing...young women on Mejare barely dress at all. The planet is terraformed, with mild seasons...
So much extraneous clothing...if I were to walk the streets of Earth dressed like this, would women be scandalized?
I started with a streak, but you're all still ahead, it seems... wearing more clothing must be the best way to win.
I know my suit isn't much clothing, but Earthlings sure dress heavily...perhaps it's because the opposite sex is wandering around.
...That was a nice run to start with, but I have so little on that it doesn't seem to have helped much...
...Earth has cold winters, correct? That would explain your abundance of clothing...or you're shielding yourselves from men's eyes.
Ugh...I won't learn anything if I can't keep pace with the group.
Damn it...this is what poker does. It riles you up while leaving everything to chance...
Tch...the genius of poker is how it demands you not betray your emotions, yet puts you at the mercy of luck.
I'd say I should've worn more clothing, but...I own almost nothing at all.
I was afraid of a bad-luck string. I won't have much opportunity to study the group if everyone is busy studying me...
Earthlings certainly wear a lot of extraneous clothing...but I hear the seasons can vary dramatically on this planet.
Unbelievable that I still seem to be in a bad position...
You're all very well-dressed. Any extra clothing...should be personally meaningful.
I shouldn't complain after that streak...but I seem to be losing purely on layer count.
It's been some time since I lost, but I'm still dressed lightly. In fact, you could probably tell what's next just by looking me over.
...Believe it or not, this is about the most clothed I ever am. I'd need one of our spacewalk suits to improve my situation...
Saddle me with extra patrol work, and I'd gladly do it...this is just irritating.
...I think I know why our quartermaster likes to put pilots through poker games. It's so she can see how we deal with helpless situations.
Again? My own stripping wasn't supposed to be the main show tonight.
Maybe my suit's too tight...and I can't breathe or think straight.
...I hope there isn't some xenophobia at play, Dealer.
Outside of a dogfight, I don't care much for being the center of attention.
...After all that, I'm still the lightest-dressed here. I didn't expect this game to feel like a desperate struggle.
I see that only did so much for me. Well, I fly better under pressure.
When you're an Earth woman with pants and shoes, I guess it's only natural to outlast a Mejarian in a flightsuit.
Just when I thought I was mounting a comeback. You've done well to keep the pressure on me.
This is exactly what I didn't want to happen tonight. I can't make cultural observations when I'm stuck naked, alone.
Ugh...now I really feel like a foreigner, having to expose myself after humiliating consecutive losses.
Tch. If my crewmates were watching this, they'd be fearing my for my safety. If my old gang members were watching, they'd be laughing and jeering.
I have to resist the urge to make risky exchanges. Chasing a straight probably would've put me in this situation, too.
The last thing I wanted was to be the center of attention tonight...
I'm hardly in a better position now than a few rounds ago. And my shorts are out of position in their own way...
I needed that streak to last longer to be in a favorable position. Now is more like when I'd order our Dreads to fall back.
...The bra comes off. I should've spent more time in the Nirvana's hot springs so my breasts would grow, and I wouldn't fret about this.
Right when I start playing well...it still wasn't enough against these extensive Earth wardrobes.
That finally puts me out of what I might consider a full outfit.
...Tch. I'm still not doing well...I should go bottomless just so my shorts stop riding up.
...Shot down in flames.
Tch. I suspected I would be at a disadvantage in just my flightsuit, but add bad draws on top of that...
...I should really consult Gascogne on how she always manages to draw a full house when she needs one.
The man on my Dread team couldn't hold back his feelings if his life depended on it. You should see him play poker--it looks a lot like this.
Normally I do well in poker games. But you're not forced to play your bad hands when there's chips to bet...
...It looks like my plan to hang back and observe everyone else has been a failure. I guess I'll have to do it naked.
This is quite the comeback I'm going to have to mount naked. Well, I'm not one to back down from a challenge.
...My turn to strip. I'm still curious if Earth people see me any differently, even if we're all human.
I think I've gotten better about accepting my mistakes. There's a lot I'd do the same a second time--but I'd definitely play some of these hands differently.
If you think stripping excites me...well, maybe it would if I weren't losing pathetically.
Even after a string of good luck, I'm still on the backfoot--and down to my last reserves. If this were a dogfight, Gascogne would be calling me back to the platform.
Stripped down is never a good situation to be in. Even our Dreads have minimal armor before we customize them.
Damn...I see I'm up against a lot more clothing than is typical on Mejare.
Hmm...perhaps I should have worn a more elaborate outfit. Everyone else has, apparently...
Everyone's well-dressed compared to me, it seems. With no betting, I see that's the real strategy at play here.
...Could you see the cards on my face? Serves me right for playing like a certain shorty...
...At a glance, you all appear to be wearing much more clothing. I suppose that's the best way to win a game like this...
Earth people seem quite overdressed by my homeworld's standards. I have crewmates who walk around in even less than I do...
...It seems it's Earth standard to layer much more. Maybe it's cold...or you're all much less sexual.
I see we don't all have to wear the same amount of clothes. That puts me at quite the disadvantage...
Tch. Well...it's a leader's responsibility to take charge, even in bad situations.
...Was that luck, or do I actually have a tell?
...That eyepiece I wear is a lesson. This game represents another--I should come to strip poker better-dressed.
I should consider myself lucky that the cards on this planet have familiar symbols...
...I shouldn't be losing at all. I prefer the skill and control of a cockpit...
If only I had all the elaborate dresses from when I was a girl...and not this revealing bodysuit.
...In times like this, one tactic is to sacrifice armor for evasion. I do prefer the latter when piloting.
I could have put myself in a much better position had I asked for a few of my crewmates' trinkets before coming here.
Even accounting for luck, I should be doing better than this...
...On my way here, I was only picturing all the Earthlings stripping. My own nudity barely crossed my mind...
