I remember playing the occasional card game in bars years ago. It wasn't strip poker, though my outfit actually had more to it back then.
...How many of these losses could I have avoided?
This is really putting Mejare's scant layering into perspective for me.
Maybe this game is a Harvest plot to not have to sort clothes from organs.
It's true I don't wear much, but if you think you've gotten me naked...not yet.
Tch. I'd hoped to at least stay competitive, but this is just embarrassing.
There goes my breast support...as if I was getting much support from the dealer.
Even with the little benefit it'd give you, I'm trying not to comment on my hands' quality. This is terrible luck.
...I try to maintain perspective on things like a poker losing streak. It isn't as bad as having one's living district shut down and evacuated.
Maybe I'm not used to playing so fairly. A pirate's standard plan here would be to burst in at night and strip you all by force.
Once, I had as much to wear as you all do...now that suit is one of the few things I own.
...What am I doing wrong? If this is really just a bad luck streak, it's made even worse with this being the one game I'll get to play on Earth.
Maybe I should just stay quiet as our hands are dealt altogether. I'm not sure what's compelling me to talk to much.
...There's something to be said about a pilot's inherent luck they wield in a dogfight. Whatever mine is, it doesn't seem to have translated.
I need a few more practice rounds with Gascogne, apparently...her coat would be helpful, too.
...Hmph. When we strip a station bare, there's usually some kind of security.
If you told the captain I lost this badly...well, she'd recommend I borrow her priestess robes for next time.
...I always hate when pilots are out of position. I've been putting cards out of position all night.
Planet Tarak's last line of defense is a minefield. Mine is training shorts.
Another loss...it serves me right for underestimating Earthlings. You turned your colonies into unwitting organ farms, after all.
There has to have been a way I could've played this game better...besides wearing more clothing.
...What can I say? Mejarians don't wear very much. But I'm not finished yet.
...Plenty of our enemies come out with a relentless assault. If I have to win this naked, I can accept that.
...Well, I didn't think this would be easy. It's a mission on Earth--the lion's den.
It's a shame Cupids are known for their stoicism. Otherwise this costume would fit you much better, Jura...
Kicking off boots, undoing the garter belt...my suit has shoes built right in.
Perhaps this'll convince you I'm more woman than monster.
Gascogne won't be happy if I misplace any pieces of this...and there's more than I'm used to.
No, I didn't grow out any pubic hair for the occasion, either...it'd be foolish for just one day.
This thing was irritating anyway...it doesn't have any meaning to me like my eyepiece.
This was not a gift from my Oma...so I'll part with it just fine.
Most Cupids I've seen simply have hair covering their eyes...I wasn't growing my bangs out for this.
This thing has made me appreciate having both eyes. Not all pirates are that lucky.
Women always assume my eyepiece is some sort of scanner. Now I'm just hindering my sight.
I've heard a few crewmates fantasize about being carressed by silk gloves...specifically mine, sometimes.
With no bodysuit to get your attention, accessories will have to do...
Feel free to stare at my cleavage if you don't consider my gloves a worthy strip.
I've heard mixed opinions from women on gloves...I wonder if men like the feel of silk on their tubes.
Lastly, the beret...I won't waste any more time teasing after this.
I have to wonder why Gascogne even had a costume like this lying around...maybe she wore it when she was younger.
I could probably stall further with my boots and belt...but the beret should suffice. It is Valentine's Day.
Do men enjoy this sort of decorative dress on women? Practicality is usually my preference.
With my chest's reveal, I might as well remove the top...and the quiver.
Lace is too delicate for my tastes anyway. Suits keep my breasts supported and stay strong.
This outfit puts a lot of emphasis on my hips...which is to my benefit, I'd say.
Cupids serve the Goddess Eros...I'm not sure what she'd think of me baring my breasts on the job.
It's a shame Cupids are known for their stoicism. Otherwise this costume would fit Jura much better.
Kicking off boots, undoing the garter belt...my suit has shoes built right in.
Perhaps this'll convince you I'm more woman than monster.
Gascogne won't be happy if I misplace any pieces of this...and there's more than I'm used to.
No, I didn't grow out any pubic hair for the occasion, either...it'd be foolish for just one day.
...It sounds as if you take in stride whatever Emi demands of you. I hope you feel satisfied with that.
...Perhaps you should ask Emi to let you make decisions for once. Unless you're truly happy following her around.
...I see. So Emi tends to take the initiative, and you follow. For some girls, that works...if you're happy.
...I suppose that makes Emi the leader, and you the follower. Not every girl can be a leader... but that's your choice.
...You're not the only young girl to find my demeanor tiresome at first.
...New recruits have a similar first impression of me.
...Rookie pilots often see me in that light. Or they're frightened by "the weird thing on Meia's face."
...I was teased in that sort of way when I first took the position, but only fresh trainees do it now.
...I'm glad you have a good relationship with her. Unfortunately, Earth's current inhabitants see them as resource farms rather than heritage sites.
...Earth's government sees it fit to strip colonies bare and eradicate them, including their inhabitants. I'm glad not all its citizens agree with that.
...It's encouraging that some Earthlings see value in the extraterrestial colonies. Your leaders do not, beyond organ harvesting.
Maybe sexuality on Earth is more flexible than I realized. Inhabitants of other colonies always seem appalled when they learn Mejare has no men.
Whenever we encounter colonists from other worlds, they're taken aback by our all-female crew, like men's absence is unnatural. I guess I expected the same reaction here.
..."Straight" and "gay" people? I guess Earth would need extra vocabulary with the presence of another gender.
...Well, we haven't encountered sexes beyond men and women in our travels. It might exist, but if it did, I'd expect Earthlings to know all about it.
I suppose that's possible. Though we haven't discovered colonies with a third sex anywhere--men seem to fill every aspect of reproduction that Mejarians use machines for.

This is the first time we've explored outside the Mejarian system, and the first time we've seen men as human beings, so a third sex is possible. But if even Earthlings don't know about it, then it's unlikely.
I'm glad I've kept myself clean for this...is something the matter, Pyrrha? You look concerned...
Fortunately, I'm coming off a fresh shave...is something wrong, Pyrrha?
I've been working on building those connections. Aren't you part of a combat team yourself?
Recent events have caused me to rethink my attitude, so I've been trying to reach out to others. What's your relationship with your teammates?
I've realized that it isn't healthy to try to isolate myself from them, even if I'm their superior. Are you the same way with your teammates?
It took time for me to come around...you're part of a "huntress" team, right? I've found that others are usually happy to open up to you if you start.
I could see how a man pantsing you feels more threatening than the locker-room game it is between girls. Normally, I'd have no underwear for him to grab.
I see. None of our prisoners have tried to rip our underwear off, thankfully. Tonight is a rare time I'm actually wearing some.
That sounds like the bizarre strategies the man in my squadron comes up with. We're pirates--we'll accept any plan that works.
"Underhanded tactics" might be inherent to men's battle strategies, based on my male pilot. Our pirate crew welcomes that if we succeed.
Are these tactics effective? We left our honor behind when we became pirates--the male pilot on my team has won battles for us in creative ways.

condition.saying: nowhere near as interested in men as she is

case.state: ...No, I don't. Trying to deceive you would only mean we'd learn less.
...This visit is our one chance to learn about Earth. Lying about what we want would waste it.

condition.saying: Your blonde companion can come along too

case.state: Jura and I are both in the assault team, not command. You would have to make that request of our captain.
Dread pilots don't accept missions for the crew. Our captain makes those decisions.
Neither of us have the authority to order the crew on a mission. We're the pilots sent to carry them out.
I'm not looking to have children, either. The mechanics of even doing that with a man are...not clear to me.
...I appreciate that a man might be similar to me, but I'm not interested in having children with him, either. However that would work.
...It's not heavy at all, actually. What good would armor be if it weighed me down?
Heavy? It's bulky, but all armor is lightweight. I've read that ancient Earth armor was heavy...poor materials, I assume.
Most of my armor is lightweight padding, Penny. It's only so effective for a pilot...hence why I don't make Jura wear it.
Why would armor be heavy? It's just pressurized. Metal armor is the stuff of history books... even this is hardly effective.
Maybe Earth armor is heavy, but Mejarians build for lightness. Or don't bother at all...it's not much help for a pilot.
...Zizou, she dragged me to strip poker game. Jura already doesn't respect me.
That's implying she ever respected me. Remember what kind of game this is.
If Jura had any respect for me, she wouldn't have made me strip naked in public.
She already dragged me here. Jura and respect are like men and women...they don't mix.
...She seems to think we're part of a religious cult on her planet. Be on guard.
...I don't know what a Buddhist is, but acolyte implies religion. She's mistaken...and she might get violent.
Miko seems to think we're rival religious cultists from her world. Knowing politicians, she'll start a fight soon.
Be careful. If she's calling us acolytes, Buddhists must be religious fanatics she seeks to eliminate.
...Is Nirvana a "Buddhist" term? Probably just a holdover...we're not cultists.
...No, it wasn't. If only my eyepiece completed the costume...
Unlike piloting, there wasn't a terrible need for depth perception. But I still would've preferred my eyepiece.
Just count yourself lucky that I didn't wear my eyepiece alongside this. But no, it wasn't easy...
It was certainly easier than piloting with one eye...it's a shame my eyepiece's colors clashed with this.
...If you have any moral code, you would side with us against Mejare's government. And Earth's, for that matter...
...I'm aware that Earth is as hostile to our crew as Mejare is. Both have their injustices--I hope you realize ethics are more important than orders.
...It shouldn't be your schedule that keeps you from attempting my arrest. Both Earth's and Mejare's governments are corrupt...
...Space is quite empty, yes, but crewmates are like family. One can feel just as alone and helpless down on a planet's surface...
...I have my crewmates for companionship. I've felt far more alone on Mejare's surface than aboard our ship, even in the vacuum of space.
...I'm not familiar. Perhaps you could show me a picture...is this some kind of animal, or cultural icon?
...Perhaps Mejare has lost the cultural inspiration for Cupid. I've never heard of "Clefable"...it sounds like an animal.
They're creatures with supernatural powers? That's quite the omission from our historical records--as well as from our societies. Something may have gone wrong when space travel was developed.
...I have a hard time believing all the colonies we've encountered would have left behind powerful symbiotic creatures on Earth. Perhaps an accident took place.
...I'm not the Nirvana's captain.
...Our captain is Magno Vivan. I'm the squadron commander...
...I lead our Dread pilots. That doesn't make me the captain...
Don't make a scene...and I'm not the captain, Daria.
...Haru's not bothering me, Jura. Don't go yelling at women on my behalf...
Leave her alone, Jura. It's not Haru...I'm just making the practical decision.
My eyepiece is the least important here, so I'm starting with it. Don't overthink things...and don't start blaming nearby schoolgirls.
Haru has nothing to do with my decision-making...don't start antagonizing her. Where's a safe place to put this?
..."Get it back"? This bar has no right to my belongings. Jura, can you take care of this?
...I'd rather have Jura hold onto it than surrender it to the bar, as you suggest should happen.
I won't be "getting it back," because no one should take it. Maybe you should hold onto it, Jura...
...Penny, you're far too trusting if you'd give anything to the owners here. Jura, could you hold onto this?
She's just overreacting...it was a gift from my Oma.
Jura's just a bit concerned for me...my Oma gave this to me, and I usually keep it on.
Pay her no mind, Ryuji...my Oma gave this to me, that's all.
This was a gift from my Oma. Jura doesn't see me take it off very much...
I'm not...looking for romance. Especially not from a strange woman on another planet.
An interstellar relationship is even more than I bargain for than usual. Drop it.
Jura...don't play matchmaker with me as your test subject. She's from a different planet regardless.
Unless you plan on recruiting her, Jura, we'll never see her again anyway...not that I want a relationship.
I see absolutely no reason to be friendly with this woman...she's done nothing to alleviate my fears.
The very first thing she did was threaten me. Why should I give her a chance?
Sei clearly enjoys escalating situations. She had her chance to prove me wrong and wasted it.
Maybe I'd be more respectful if she were the bigger woman. Instead, she tried to start a fight...
You're very friendly, Yang. Blondes always seem to be...wouldn't you agree, Jura?
You seem like you'd get along with Jura just fine...both amiable, as blondes always seem to be.
Between you and Jura, I have to wonder if blonde hair has genes for friendliness...
Blonde hair and energy seem to be intertwined. Jura was proof enough...and now Yang supports that.
Yes, we're pirates. We only do it to survive...well, I do. Let Jura speak for herself.
I try not to bring up my piracy unless asked. It's not glamorous...though Jura tries her best to make it so.
Yes, we're pirates...I try not to bring it up. Jura sees it as a point of bragging rights.
I try to keep my piracy private unless asked. You never know what someone's reaction will be...
The only other people we typically interact with would kill us for being pirates...so I try not to bring it up.
...Whatever a Buddhist is, the Harvest has already proven to be a fierce enemy.
...Buddhist? We've had our own issues with the Harvest already...and its fleet of evolving machines.
Earth is already at our throats with its Harvest ships, and now you're warning us of "Buddhists"? All the more reason to be vigilant.
Care to explain what a Buddhist is? Our enemy is the Harvest--Earth's fleet of mechanical drones sent to kill us.
Your occupation is reason enough to stay defensive.
Among crewmates, I might relax...but around a soldier, no chance.
A drunken, belligerent soldier is nearby...I'll let you decide if I relax.
My defensiveness is up to how you conduct yourself, Sei...and whether you swear off your loyalties.
It isn't armor that makes a woman defensive...it's the company she keeps.
...Jura, I'm sorry for ever calling you vulgar. Hearing this woman speak is making me feel dirty.
On and on with your sex-talk...at least Jura has some class about it.
Cameltoe? I need a shower after this game...even Jura's never made me feel that way.
I should've expected a disgusting drunk making passes at me tonight. I never realized how subtle you were, Jura.
"Tight long johns." That's a new one...go ahead and explain, Jura. You love fashion more than I do...
..."Bodysuit," Aella. Or flightsuit...Jura loves talking about clothes, so I'll let her explain.
...You mean my flightsuit? They're certainly popular, but... well, Jura is the expert on these matters.
..."Long johns"? Interesting name for a flightsuit...but I'll let Jura discuss fashion. She'd actually wear different outfits if she had any.
We're not a wealthy enough crew to have private bathrooms, so yes, she has.
We have a communal bathroom, Penny. It's not so awkward when everyone is the same sex.
A ship's crew is like family, Penny. We don't get much bathing privacy--even in the gym, I'm down to my underwear.
We all share bathing accommodations, Penny, as well as anatomy. Jura's seen me naked--and worse.
Earth women are more reserved about their bodies, even to each other, right? Men's presence must do that--we share a bathroom and spa.
Jura being here is easier. At least I have some authority over her.
We shower together. Undoing this bra is more awkward than Jura's presence.
If you're going to admire my resolve, I'd prefer it be from putting up with Jura's laziness for several years.
I couldn't care less about Jura's opinion on my breasts. I'd prefer if she had criticisms of my leadership.
Jura, don't even think about...messing around. The squadron needs you and Barnette happy together...
Cheating shouldn't even be crossing your mind, Jura. I know how you flirt...and trouble with Barnette will mean trouble for the fleet.
...She's in her own little world. Listen, Jura, don't you dare endanger your relationship with Barnette...you'll be arguing during dogfights.
Miko...? She's ranting. Jura, fidelity is important...and arguing with Barnette during battles would be dangerous.
Vaginas, yes. I don't know why Earth culture seems to skirt around the issue.
Even if we hadn't, it's not as if genitals differ from person to person on Mejare. We could wager a guess.
Yes, we've seen each others' vaginas. I don't know why you consider that a watershed moment.
...Yes. Would you say most Earth women are like you, Elizabeth? Few Mejarians would shudder at the word vagina.
Our commander, B.C., came up with it. I couldn't tell you if she's a Buddhist...I'm not sure what that is.
B.C., our commander, named the ship. B.C. is many things...but what a Buddhist is eludes me.
What exactly is a Buddhist? Our commander, B.C., came up with the name...for the record, I suggested the Sonnet.
Our commander came up with it. I don't know what a Buddhist is, but we all submitted names...Jura said "the Luxury Night."
You're mistaken...whatever Saiyan technology a scouter is, this isn't it...
...A "scouter"? ...I'm sorry, but you're thinking of something else...
...I don't believe this is the scouter you're thinking of...but my Oma never did tell me what this was called.
...This is just a decorative piece...so it can't be a scouter, whatever that is.
Forgive me for not being in a hurry to satisfy you, "Veran."
I always planned to remove this first. The fact it irritates you is an added bonus.
...Is my eyepiece not good enough for a shadowy Oracle woman? I don't value your opinion.
...My apologies, Veran. But you give me little reason to please you.
Women have been having children on Mejare for generations. We have machines for splicing eggs together.
The only thing that stops women from having children together is biology. We fuse eggs to create babies...then carry them as normal.
Two eggs can produce a child just fine when artificially spliced. The process works just fine, and Famas carry the child as normal.
It's simple Mejarian technology--we splice eggs together, and a couple can have children. Stop shouting.
Mejare has a sister colony called Tarak. It was settled by all men...we're at war.
The men are on the nearby planet Tarak. The two have feuded for a long time...usually staging military raids on each other.
Men are the sworn enemies of Mejarians--and they're on neaby planet Tarak. I've killed plenty myself in armed conflict.
If you want to find the men, they're not far from Mejare--planet Tarak is the male colony. We've been at war with them for almost a century.
...Don't patronize me. What is the extent of Saiyan technology to expect so little from humans?
You should never underestimate what humans are capable of, Caulifla. Just how advanced is Saiyan technology?
It seems you don't expect much from human creations... which makes me wonder just what Saiyan technology is capable of.
You're quick to dismiss us. What have Saiyans built that stands above human technology?
...Do you mean that sincerely? If your strength was attained through effort, I want to earn it myself, as well...
Is that an offer? I thought your strength was inherent to your species, but I would gladly train myself the way you do.
Are you really saying a human could wield the power you do, Caulifla? I'd like to believe that...and attain it myself.
...Is the limit of human strength really the same as a Saiyan's? If you really mean that, I want to know how to reach it.
If simple armor would have been enough to stop you, Veran, these shadow powers of yours are less than impressive.
If you were worried about my armor, Veran, a fistfight would probably be enough to subdue you.
You shouldn't be making threats if my armor was a worry for you, Veran.
If my armor is a concern to a shadow woman, Veran, then clearly magic is not as potent as I thought.
You can believe whatever you want to. I'm not wasting my breath justifying myself to you.
If telling yourself a pirate can't take care of herself makes you feel better, Revy...well, I can't stop you.
I have crewmates, Revy...women willing to help each other. There's no reason I can't be groomed.
I never called it a small pirate band. We do our best to help each other achieve some comfort...
I'm sure your personality is much more attractive here on Earth.
...You must be very successful romantically, Revy.
If stoicism drives women away, I imagine you must have your pick of partners, then.
Men and women both must flock to you, then. Hence your experience in vulgar language.
My Dread is advanced...nothing about me needs to be.
No, it's not. Technology is for using, not wearing.
...My armor deflects lasers. That's about the extent of it.
You'd be surprised how simple it is, actually. Basic form-fitting material...for the hungry eyes of passersby.
Being sure doesn't mean you're correct. How crude do you think I am?
Naked under a bodysuit? That's just indecent.
There's plenty of Mejarians who wear bodysuits over their nude bodies...I think that's obscene.
Your certainty was misplaced, then. I understand it's a style...but I aim for comfort.
...Can the body really be trained to withstand gunfire? Perhaps with the power the Paksis wields...but from our own spirits?
And I could withstand lasers through this "Ki" you speak of? The raw emotional energy of the spirit...our ship's core has those properties.
I find that hard to believe, Caulifla...if "Ki" is spiritual energy, how could a race of heartless warriors unlock it?
And what makes Saiyans so in tune with the "Ki" that can repel lasers? If it comes from the heart...you seem to pride yourselves on not having hearts.
Slow down. "Resurrected"? You can resurrect people, let alone an entire civilization?
...Now we're discussing resurrections? Just what is this all about? Are you trying to confuse me?
...You're just toying with me, aren't you? Multiple universes, resurrecting the dead...what are you talking about?
What's this about "resurrections"? You shouldn't assume a foreign species would know your jargon.
...Just my eyepiece...what is it, Tomoko?
...I'll just take this off...it's an accessory, Tomoko, if you mean to ask.
...Is something the matter, Tomoko? Don't concern yourself with my eyepiece...
...I'll start small...this is just decorative. ...Tomoko, what's wrong?
...No "fancy machines." Monitoring a planet is a trivial engineering task. What are you trying to say, Flutter?
...I wouldn't call a satellite "fancy." What do you use, then? Or do you live that close?
...My Dread is a fancy machine, Flutter. A basic orbital satellite is not...how are you watching, then?
...Only a primitive people would call satellites "fancy." And yet you can "watch" Mejare? Either you live nearby, or you're trying to confuse me.
...Erm. I'm sorry if I was overexcited just now, Flutter. I command a Dread team on a pirate ship.
...Excuse me. I shouldn't act overeager like that...I've gotten my piloting experience working for a pirate crew.
...Ahem. I'm sorry about that, Flutter. I should be more composed. I'm not actually formally trained--I'm part of a pirate group.
...I'm sorry. That was a bit much on my part. I wish I could've gone to school for piloting--I actually work for pirates as a squadron commander.
That's...a nice outlook to have, Flutter. Thank you...I'm accustomed to seeing function first and foremost on our ship.
...I suppose you're right. Perhaps I'm too used to practicality thanks to piloting.
...In a sense, yes, that's still doing something. I've tried to avoid being too sentimental... broken equipment is dead weight for pirates.
A life of piracy will cause you to judge machines on their function. But you're right...a memento is meaningful.
...There's no danger for an Earth woman. Our crew is a known target of this planet.
No danger to you, maybe. My job demands constant vigilance, especially on an aggressor like Earth.
...Flutter, part of my role as officer is to patrol and scout ahead for danger. And Earth has attempted to kill us before.
As long as I'm here on Earth, danger is always present. I do enough scouting for their attack fleets when we're lightyears away.
I don't like how luck-based this form of poker is. There's no betting to make things interesting...but I can still try to read each of you.
It's true that the primary strategy here seems to be "wear more clothing." Still, I can reflect upon whether I judged my opponents correctly.
Even in a dogfight, there is an element of luck. It's far too high here, I agree...but I can still make predictions based on body language.
I agree, Flutter... especially since there's no betting. But even if reading my opponents isn't much help here, I can still practice doing so.
...You, a butterfly? I'm still not sure what to make of you, let alone your family and personal belongings.
...What personal possessions could a butterfly have? I can't believe I'm having this conversation...
...I didn't expect to be casually conversing with a butterfly about our family mementos.
...Thank you, Flutter. Though I admit it's hard to picture what a butterfly's family looks like, or how you'd remember them.
...Why do you keep calling everything I own a "space" object? Women wear bodysuits on Mejare...and this eyepiece was made there.
...Do you think I live in the middle of space? It's just an eyepiece, not a "space" eyepiece.
It's not a monocle. There's no lens...and there's nothing "space" about it, I assure you. It's from Mejare.
"Spacesuit," "space monocle"...I'm from a planet, just like you--Mejare. There's nothing "space" about it.
I'm afraid you're mistaken, HK416. A pirate is no professional...she's doing what it takes to survive.
I might command a pilot squadron, HK416, but that doesn't make me a professional. A pirate is just an outcast.
A professional has a salary, HK416. I'm given rations and a squadron of other young pirates.
I'm no professional, HK416--I'm a pirate. I think the only thing we have in common is our disposition.
At least you're polite...especially for a man. I must confess I can't see where your hat ends and your hair begins.
...Thank you. Your hat is certainly unusual...it doesn't seem to have a back.
I didn't expect a man to be so understanding. If only I could understand where your hat meets your hair.
Strange I'd have so much in common with a man...and that a man would be polite. Still, your hat blends into your hair oddly...
A man being sympathetic? Strange indeed...strange like your hat's edges.
At least you're polite...especially for a man. I must confess I couldn't see where your hat ended and your hair began.
...Thank you. Your hat was certainly unusual...it didn't seem to have a back.
I didn't expect a man to be so understanding. If only I could understand where your hat met your hair.
Strange I'd have so much in common with a man...and that a man would be polite. Still, your hat blended into your hair oddly...
A man being sympathetic? Strange indeed...strange like your hat's edges.
It's no big deal...
Don't draw attention to it...
...It's fine.
...Don't say anything...
Don't make a big deal of it if I don't.
It's clothing all the same...just keep it safe.
You said it yourself...I don't wear much. It has to go.
Well, considering my limited wardrobe...it has to be first.
Best to just get it over with...
Best move I have...
It's small...it should go first.
Technically it's the least valuable...
Best to get this over with. If I wait, it'll seem strange...
...Don't start making a fuss.
...I'm not making a scene. Don't you start.
Smallest item I have...it has to be first.
...Yeah.
...Glad you understand.
...Thank you for understanding, Jura.
...You read my mind.
...Maybe you know me better than I thought.
...I should do this. It's small...
...It's got to go first...
...No excuses.
...Can't let sentimentality get in your way.
...You have to make sacrifices to win.
Give it a rest...it's no big deal.
I appreciate your concern, but I'm fine.
...See? You're capable of caring about other things...
Just getting it over with. It had to come off sooner or later.
...Maybe if you forced me to do this, it wouldn't feel so bad.
...Be quiet...
...Just go back to thinking of Barnette, or whomever.
...I said, stop it...
...My idea of fun is winning.
It's not going anywhere...and public indecency isn't what I'd call fun.
I'm just going to set it down. Don't panic...
There was no way I was having fun tonight regardless.
...Why are you conspiring with ~player~, and so openly at that? Do you two know each other?
...I wasn't aware you were such an open ally of ~player~. You two don't seem very similar.
...~player~ certainly isn't a fairy, so I question your relationship with them. You aren't shy about it...
Isn't ~player~ also your opponent? What is your connection with them that you'd announce your intentions and throw the game to help them?
Don't give me orders, Raven.
If you're going to bark orders at me, maybe I'll keep it on.
Don't order me around. There's only two women I answer to.
I give orders, Raven. I don't take them.
...I see your maid doesn't know much more than I do.
...For a moment, I thought your maid was going to clear that lifelong mystery of mine.
...I was hoping your maid would know. It would have made coming to Earth worth it.
...When you asked you maid, I'd hoped for some insight I couldn't have given.
I can assure you it's nothing special. If it's a technology talk you want, my Dread might be more interesting.
It's funny how Earthlings always assume there's function to this...Mejarians assume it's fashion. My Dread might be of more interest to you.
Earthlings really do adore technology, don't they? I understand the appeal...but my Dread is a better topic than my eyepiece.
My eyepiece has no function. I pilot a Dread ship, if you want to discuss technology...
Mejarians are not aliens. And I'm not familiar with Life Fibers, whatever those are...
I'm as human as you are, like all Mejarians. Perhaps if you explained what Life Fibers are, we could reach an understanding.
I lead a squadron of pilots your age, Ryuko. Stop shouting and explain what Life Fibers are...I assure you I'm human.
You're as excitable as our average rookie pilot...just relax and explain what Life Fibers are. Mejarians are human women, just on a colony.
I have ancestors from Earth, Ryuko--I'm not an alien woman. If these Life Fibers are hostile creatures, I'm sure you can explain.
You're certainly friendly. I've never met a blonde woman who wasn't...
Blonde hair must be reserved for amiable women...my crewmates Jura is the same way.
You're as cheerful as I expected...blonde women typically are.
...I'm glad you're interested, Yang. Blondes always seem to be fun-loving...you should meet my crewmate Jura for another example.
I'm glad you're here to do the bragging for me.
At least you're here to speak for me. I'd rather not talk much...
I wouldn't advertise this armor much. It's just whatever we could steal...you know that.
I'm sure Earth's armors are more impressive in places...or at least legitimately obtained.
Give it a rest.
...I can't stay mad at you when you're actually showing genuine concern.
At least you're not making fun of it...so there's more to you than just flirting with passersby.
Maybe I am all pent-up in this armor. Can't focus...
Maybe I'll feel better...after I win, and we leave.
We'll see how I feel, but this night's not off to a good start.
Don't worry about how I feel. You do your job, and then you report back. That's it.
We should be about even now...that's not making me feel better.
It's substantial...unlike everything you've removed thus far.
I don't have the accessories you do, so it's time for the armor already.
There isn't much to this flightsuit. Don't ask me what the point of this game is when our layer counts aren't standardized.
I thought everyone had to wear the same number of items...so I just came in my armor, as always.
Maybe I will. I've been on edge since I got here, but I don't see how being more vulnerable will help.
I am in a decent mood. I can be more miserable if you'd like.
You may be right in that this armor just naturally puts me on edge...
I didn't pick out an outfit for coming here...maybe it's the armor that's got me irritated.
I can't see why you're so relaxed, with your dress ready to go any moment...
I'm your leader, no matter what...unless you feel like working enough to be promoted over me.
Hard to be yourself when you're out of your element...of course you're comfortable here.
We'll see if my mood improves without this bulky armor on. Don't expect me to reach your levels of comfort, though.
Am I really any different than usual? Did you think I'd keep my eyepiece on when it's just a game?
I can't even picture you in anything but that dress...or stark-naked, apparently.
It does its job, and it signifies my rank. So I don't complain...best if you don't, if you hope to wear it one day.
You're more into the idea of being squadron leader for the attention than the outfit, I imagine.
A pirate has to work with what's given to her. Surely I've told you that...it applies here, too.
Your lecherous comments aren't making this more enjoyable.
Can't believe I've been reduced to my crewmate's pornography.
Please stop talking. You're making this worse.
At least you appreciate my body. That makes one of us.
Your commentary is riveting.
I've never given the suit much thought. Covers everything, restricts nothing.
My bodysuit...I suppose some people would find that stimulating.
I wouldn't sing its praises too much. Technically there isn't much skin on display.
That's correct. Even my own pilots seem to assume otherwise, so don't feel bad.
It's a common misconception. My rookie pilots always think it's scanning them...
You aren't the first girl to think so. Even new recruits think I'm about to focus a laser on them.
Don't fault yourself for thinking so. I know it looks intimidating...my rookie pilots always eye it nervously.
It attaches...and I don't just float around in space. We have artificial gravity.
...Do you think Mejarians just float around in the vacuum of space? Artificial gravity technology is commonplace.
I have a ship, Sei. With artificial gravity...
It's pressurized...so it would stay on, even if our artificial gravity failed.
...It probably was. The quartermaster gave it to me when I joined...
Possibly, but I wasn't the one who stole it. Gascogne gave it to me...
I have Gascogne, the regisystem's master, to thank for this. Whether she stole it, I'm not sure.
Our quartermaster gave it to me...and I'd have stolen it right beside her if I could.
I noticed.
You have me to thank for that.
That's because you've been seeing double for some time now.
Yes, you are. Poker faces are hard to maintain while drunk.
April may have found counting her bodysuit twice acceptable, but I do not.
I'm not making any excuses for myself. My bodysuit counts as one piece, even if I'm allowed to make it two...
I abide by my own standards, not the precedents set by others. My whole bodysuit is one item.
I understand now that I can count this as two. But it doesn't feel right, and I'm sure no one will argue if I don't.
I'm still counting my suit as one item, even if I don't have to. That should make up for me not removing my bra beneath it.
Gwen may have established that doing this in two pieces is allowed, but it doesn't sit right with me.
The whole suit is one piece, so I'll be treating it as such...even if I don't have to.
I lost, and I can't justify counting this as two...even if Gwen did.
Gwen set the precedent for this counting twice...but it doesn't feel right. No one's going to complain if I strip more, I'm sure.
Have some patience, Jura...seems as if nudity comes to us all, here.
Normally I'd say I was sizing up the enemy, but you'd see right through that...
I could definitely be playing better, but don't forget you're outdoing everyone else, too.
Perhaps your cheerful indifference is really just another kind of poker face.
There certainly isn't as much strategy to this game as I'd like.
Luck or not, I lost...so it's time for my suit.
There's strategy in everything, right down to reading your opponent's face...I suppose I'm not very good at that.
Poker is a game about reading people...at least this game gives you more of them to look at.
Give it a rest already. They're here to see you strip.
I just have the zipper in front to make it easier...it's not meant to be sex appeal.
Yes, it all comes off at once...think nothing of it.
What good would a bodysuit be if I had to struggle with a back-zipper?
Of course it comes on and off easily. I can't waste time fiddling with it when it's time to scramble.
Is there a reason you're trying to sell me to everyone here?
I'm sure everyone's enjoying your commentary.
Never knew you'd want talk me up so much in mixed company. Do you need a favor?
...You're going to ask a favor when this is over, aren't you?
Just ignore her...I don't dress to impress.
I think they can tell neither of us wears much clothing. It's just how Mejare is...
I suppose my outfit does put me at a disadvantage here...but challenges are good.
I suppose when you don't wear much here, it puts all the attention on you...that's true in general, really.
I guess this scant outfit makes me a pushover in this game, doesn't it?
Of course I wear underwear. Wouldn't want this suit rubbing against me all day...I'd chafe.
I'm surprised you wear underwear, frankly.
Everyone's always so surprised I wear underwear with this suit on. I'm not some...harlot.
I wear this suit for ease of use, not sex appeal...so yes, I have underwear on.
I suppose no underwear beneath would make for a good reveal, wouldn't it? Shame.
If you want an example of my generosity, I'd say my agreeing to come here fits the bill.
Yes, all at once. I don't know how you'd count it as anything else.
I hardly even own a shirt and pants, so my options were limited anyway.
What else do I even own? A sundress and a swimsuit...they wouldn't fare any better.
I really can't tell if you're being serious or not...I'll assume the latter for my own sanity.
Do whatever it takes for you to finish quickly.
If this'll help you finish faster, I suppose it's all for the best.
At least this'll help my skin breathe. Masturbate to the sweat on the suit if you're going to be all depraved.
I have admirers, do I? Well, they'll have to stay that way.
I have a hard time believing any of that. What's your evidence, my surprise birthday parties?
Is that a fact? Well, it's good to be loved...and I appreciate the service to the crew.
I'll keep that in mind...but it's best to stay professional.
I'd rather stay professional with crewmates. I know from Barnette that you don't agree...
Yes. Earth women seem to find the idea preposterous...but don't you tend to stick with each other regardless?
Yes, Mejare is all women. Even here, women seem to prefer the company of themselves over men, so I don't understand the shock.
No Earth woman I've met has had a glowing opinion of men. I don't know why you're all surprised at the idea of abandoning them altogether.
You aren't the first Earth woman to find the notion surprising, Remilia. But none of you seem to consider men worthy companions.
You have the sharp eyes a soldier needs, Sei.
Very observant, Sei. I can see why the White Knights picked you.
Those are the sort of observation skills I'd expect from the White Knights.
...You don't drink when you're on-duty, right? I'd hate for a medic to be seeing double.
I'm far more annoyed about losing this badly.
Perhaps normally I'd be incensed about revealing my breasts...but really, it's the losing that's doing this to me.
Can't take this off quite as smoothly as the suit...not that I want to.
Whatever insecurity I had about my breasts has switched to my poker skills.
You make me uncomfortable for other reasons.
I'm perfectly comfortable with nudity...but not with losing.
You'd be comfortable nude in a Harvest mothership.
Well, Jura, some of us have a professional bone in our bodies.
You can tell? I suppose I'm not as stoic as I'd like to be...
You look even happier than usual, so I suppose we even out.
Excuse me for not being thrilled about public nudity, especially when there isn't much for me to show.
Meanwhile, your only emotion is "pleased with yourself."
I hope you don't think I'm going to end up with one of these Earth women...or men, God forbid.
I don't see the point in playing up my looks...especially with you around.
No need to brag when you're willing to do it for me, disingenuous as it may be.
Why do you insist on acting like I'm some sort of model? Just to hype yourself up later?
I'll be sure to shower your breasts with praise when it's your turn.
It's a shame you're immune to humiliation, or I'd try to pay you back for this.
Hard to retort when you'd love nothing more than to get your breasts out...
I'm not going to make a fuss about it...you're doing that for me.
I'm not complaining, am I? Don't make me out to be some whining idiot.
I don't wear a bra for the express purpose of taking it off in front of people.
I'll leave the theatrics to you, Jura.
You could use a bra's support, Jura. They'll start to sag one day...
I figured you didn't wear a bra because it would clash with your dress...not that that dress doesn't have issues itself.
Your lecherous commentary is more distracting than your body, Jura.
Yes. We're all very distracted. Just like you wanted.
Must be nice having no decency at all. You certainly lead a carefree life...
Well, you're cheerful, in a relationship, and still highly-ranked. Maybe you've got the right attitude about your body...
A gorgeous body goes a long way. It's good you have that to be proud of...
Always good to hear your support, Jura.
Cute has never been a word I wanted to describe me...
Cute. Right. What I've always aimed for.
I'll just let you continue talking...maybe it'll distract everyone.
Valore? What's she got to with this?
Valore? ...Don't make any assumptions.
Any relationship with another squadron leader...would just spell trouble.
I can't be with Valore...it'd distract us both from work.
Valore? I'm not going to endanger our pilots due to...potential relationship issues.
Valore? We--we can't do that...
...Right.
Finally, you understand. This is all a pirate has.
Yes...and clearly, it's no match for your equipment.
The Blue Hair Club? I'm not interested...
I'm not sure I want to be a part of any organization that includes you.
Blue hair is about all that makes us similar, I agree.
I'd rather you dyed your hair and left it.
The Nirvana's artificial gravity is equal to Earth's, as is Mejare's. You probably just exercise more.
Gravity has nothing to do with it. I just need to work harder.
I'd have a more impressive chest if the gravity were actually lower...it's the same, and you must train harder.
I assure you, we live in the same gravity. You're just more disciplined than me...somehow.
If this rattled me, I would've been shot down and killed a long time ago.
I should hope I'd be able to handle this. I don't expect these Earthlings to bear down and harvest my organs.
You know good and well dealing with the Harvest is much worse. Considering these are Earth people, maybe it's good you still have your sword.
Would you be equally as calm? It's a good trait for a squadron leader to have, if you're looking to be promoted.
Is pubic hair common on Earth? Any we see here might just be coincidence...
She's right, I shave...almost everyone does on Mejare.
I expected you to tease them about that, not just spell it out.
I mean, I don't consider shaving a badge of honor...just seems more sensible to me.
No use complaining about the hand you're dealt...metaphorically speaking.
Fate's just an excuse people make for their failures...
If it's fate for me to be fully nude as you lord over me in your dress, then I want nothing to do with it.
Why defer to destiny when you can take charge of your own life?
I'm not embarrassed. It's called decency.
I wouldn't expect you to understand why someone might not enjoy showing off their body.
I have to wonder if you'll lose your nerve when it's your turn...probably not.
You're half-naked all the time regardless...but then, that suit always shows my figure. Keeps me humble, I suppose...
Don't worry. Soon you'll have to join me, from the looks of it.
You're talking like you had respect for me before. I never got that impression.
You can't let shame stop you from finishing a mission...or keeping your word.
It'd be far more embarrassing to back out like a coward.
Projecting your indecency onto me only shows your own insecurity about it.
If I liked being stared at, why would I keep that a secret from you?
It's nice to be appreciated, but I'd like women to respect me for my leadership...something I've earned.
You're right, I'm really a lecherous, exhibitionist nymph. You've got me all figured out, Jura.
Even if that were true, I wouldn't give you the satisfaction of admitting it.
Never thought you would be one to spoil a surprise.
Is there anyone on our crew with pubic hair? Barnette doesn't...Dita, maybe? She's absentminded enough to forget...
Shaving is one of the few cultural quirks of Mejare I subscribe to.
It's aerodynamic and clean. Why wouldn't I shave?
I suppose Earth people would find blue pubic hair fascinating. Sorry to disappoint...
I think the Harvest would agree we're quite the team, as would the Mejarian military.
Well, I've defied death more than a few times with your help. So we're certainly a team.
I'll be honest. I'm not feeling much solidarity with you at the moment.
I think I may have had a stronger bond with you before playing this game, actually.
My idea of helping you is shooting a soldier that's got you pinned down...not giving you a body to ogle.
Shouldn't you be thinking about your girlfriend, Jura?
You're the one who dragged me here, Jura. And I couldn't care less if the state doesn't want me nude in public.
I don't care what the state thinks of me. My body is my own...though you've basically appropriated it tonight.
Forget the state...I don't want to be publicly nude.
Somehow I doubt stripping in public is Mejare's biggest issue with our lifestyles.
Our commander, B.C., came up with it. I couldn't tell you if she's a Buddhist...I'm not sure what that is.
B.C., our commander, named the ship. B.C. is many things...but what a Buddhist is eludes me.
What exactly is a Buddhist? Our commander, B.C., came up with the name...for the record, I suggested the Sonnet.
Our commander came up with it. I don't know what a Buddhist is, but we all submitted names...my second-in-command said "the Luxury Night."
...This came from my Oma's company. You shouldn't regard it as typical human clothing...
...Even on Mejare, my eyepiece is unusual...that's why I wear it. It doesn't represent human clothing...
...My rookie pilots ask me what it is, too, Alice...it's hardly a human decoration.
You're looking in the wrong place for human fashion, Alice...most eyepieces would have some kind of function.
...My Oma gave it to me. I agree I shouldn't be making a fuss.
It was a gift from my Oma...but I'm just being sentimental.
"Silly trinket"? Most women just call it weird...but it's a memento of my Oma.
It was a gift from my Oma. You're the first to choose the word "silly" of all things.
...I think you're mistaken, Catria. This isn't a lens...
...I'm surprised there's women you know who wear something like this, Catria, but this isn't a visual aid...
...This eyepiece has no function, Catria. Your sages must wear something else...
...They're wearing something different, Catria, I assure you. This has no function.
...The "spoils of battle"? If that involves wearing as little clothing as possible...then I'm not sure I want an explanation.
...To our crew, the "spoils of battle" are ammunition stocks and food. What do you claim that involves...undressing?
We're pirates. Finding fuel is a perfectly good spoil of battle...one we don't have to throw our clothes off to collect.
...Mejarians may dress revealingly, but we don't cast off our clothes to claim the "spoils of battle." I thought you ate men.
...Class? I was rich as a child...but now I'm a pirate. If you'd like to call that a warrior, then it's certainly a poor one.
...I'm quite poor, Catria, as pirates tend to be. I suppose pirates also tend to be warriors.
...It's a bit rude to ask a woman how much money she has, Catria. I'm a pirate...a warrior, maybe, but with no money to my name.
Class? If I were a soldier, then perhaps I'd be wealthy...but I'm just a pirate with no pay. Does that still count as a warrior?
A photo? Well, this game is meant to be social...and no one on this planet knows me.
I'd rather you take a photo with us both fully clothed, but we're far past that point...and I'm on a foreign planet anyway.
...Well, on a planet of strangers, I can accept a nude photo. Besides, this game was meant to make me more social.
If you promise it never leaves this planet, Mahiru, then fine...I don't want my pilots seeing me like this.
A nude photo...well, as long as my subordinates never see it, then no harm will come from it.
It's slim and efficient. Being one piece is only a detriment here.
I really doubt you have what it takes to strip me further, Pit.
It's decently comfortable, actually. Shame about that being a flaw here.
My underwear isn't easy to pry off of me.
Do you mean me losing, or your own masturbation?
It's a little late for that to matter to you, Pit.
Your masturbation, you mean? I suppose men can appreciate a woman in her underwear.
Living vicariously through the remaining players, Pit?
Do you mean me losing, or your own masturbation? I thought that was over.
It's a little late for that to matter to you, Pit. Or can men do it again?
Your masturbation, you mean? I thought you were finished.
Living vicariously through the remaining players, Pit?

state.text: There's nothing enjoyable about crime. Not street crime, anyway...well, it was leading the squadron that made me "get my shit together," Sei.
...Well, leading the squadron is leagues above streetfighting... yes, Sei. Leadership tends to make you "get your shit together."
Streetfighting is not the brand of crime I'd like to return to. Piloting is better...actually, Sei, I was given command so I'd calm down.
You make a life of crime sound fun...I used to streetfight before I became a pirate. ...I fought on the crew, too, Sei. Leadership calmed me down...
If accepting gifts from your Oma is girly, so be it...that's not exactly an insult on Mejare.
I would call a dress girly before a "Sec-Monocle," if that's indeed the name...I wear it because my Oma gave it to me.
I'm capable of being feminine, Sei. But I don't wear it for fashion--my Oma gave it to me.
You're quick to jump to conclusions, Sei...it was a gift from my Oma. Mejare has much girlier accessories.
...You like massages, too, Sei? Well...I'll let Streaming-chan deal with that.
Yes. Massage Sei instead...and stop asking me questions.
...I actually enjoy the stress relief massages provide. Especially my lower back...but I'll leave you both to it.
Sei seems a lot more willing than I am, Streaming-chan. Massage her...I'll just ask our spa attendants.
...Er...well, how about you provide some general details? Their...size, longevity... preferences.
...Well, I did come here to learn about men. Once their tube stands up...how big is it? When does the seed come out?
...I suppose you could teach me about men. What are their...tubes like? Do they fit easily?
...I have a few questions about men. How easy is it to handle those tubes of theirs? ...And what do they like in women?
Any similarities I bear to an Earth celebrity are probably coincidental. ...Something "happened" to her?
..."Rei Ayanami." My ancestors were from Earth...perhaps a relative? Hopefully not, if something "happened" to her.
I don't know who that is--or even what an "Eva" is. ...But I'm sorry if she met some awful fate.
...As you might expect, I'm unfamiliar with Earth women, including "Rei Ayanami." ...Sei's concern doesn't bode well.
...With a man? Here? Don't be ridiculous...that goes for you, too, Sei.
What? I wouldn't do that here with a woman, much less a man. ...Did you hear what I said, Sei?
...Perhaps I dress like a whore to an Earth woman, but I'm not from Earth. I don't pursure strangers...male or female, Sei.
What makes you think I'm willing to prostitute myself for your audience? ...That goes for you, too, Sei.
...I like large, open, empty spaces. ..."Cozy" is a word I rarely use.
The only small space I feel comfortable in is my Dread. ...And I wouldn't call it "cozy."
...I like open spaces. And I dislike crowds for filling them...no, Sei, it's not cozy at all.
The Nirvana can be cramped, with so many of us packed onto an old ship. I don't like it...and it certainly isn't "cozy."
Since they look like men's tubes, Mejare's government cracks down on toys...well, Sei, you're just used to having them.
The government prefers toys be kept small and simple. ...Otherwise, we'd be like Earth women and love men's tubes.
The Mejare Empire fears us growing attached to the shape of men's tubes...well, we hardly know what we're missing, Sei.
We're trained from a young age to avoid toys...they resemble men too much. ...If you're used to having them, Sei, then I suppose it would be boring.
...You were right, Sei. What an awful woman...
...Dwelling on death makes it impossible to live. Sei, this woman is insufferable...
...Sei, this woman makes you look much more tolerable.
The captain keeps a shrine of crew members who've passed. ...But that won't be enough for her, will it, Sei?

case.state: ...I knew what you meant. Keeping one's hair short is definitely less common on Mejare...but more common among pirates.
I know, Marinette. My hair looks nothing like the female Corrin's...or indeed like most women's.
I know, Marinette. I used to think about hairstyles much more...and I know that keeping it short is not very womanly.
...I wasn't confused. The female Corrin wears her hair long...which is a more feminine trait. Pirates are less likely to do that.
No, I'm not. Who's this "Rei" you both know about?
Both of you know this "Rei"? Is she some kind of Earth celebrity?
First I lose my eyepiece, and now I'm completely lost in this conversation...who's "Rei"?
I command the Dread squadron for a group of pirates on planet Mejare. ...Do you know who Futaba is talking about?
Do you know the woman Futaba mentioned, Natsuki? If she dresses like me, maybe she's a pilot, too...that's what I do.
Natsuki, is "Ayanami Rei" some Earth celebrity? You seem to know who Futaba means...I pilot for a Mejarian pirate crew.
...I used to live on the streets on Mejare. Then a pirate crew took me in, and I pilot for them. Is this "Rei" a famous woman, Natsuki?
I don't find it hard to move in my suit at all, actually...or maybe straining against it improves my fitness. I'll take either.
Bodysuits are constrictive at first, but they soon become just another part of you...
I can understand why, but I'd rather not let anything get caught or grabbed while in combat...I've gotten used to the tightness.
Tightness is both constrictive and comforting. And it encourages me to stay in shape...
I find suits much more practical once you get used to them...as you can see, Jura agrees with you more than I do.
...At least your male friend is equally confused. Perhaps you should introduce Ayanami Rei to him first.
I see you don't share much with your teammates, either. Please enlighten Ryuji first, and then me.
...Ryuji, do you not know "Ayanami Rei," either? I didn't think I'd have more in common with Futaba's male classmate...
...That makes at least two people unfamiliar with "Ayanami Rei." I suggest you share more with your supposed teammates, Futaba.
Yes. I command the Nirvana's Dread squadron. This armor signifies such. ...Why is that so surprising, Misato?
Yes. It's...interesting, to say the least. But dangerous, hence the armor. ...Is that another similarity, Misato?
I command the Nirvana's Dread pilots, actually. That's why I have this armor, to signify that. ...And apparently, Misato finds this thrilling as well.
I don't think you have much to learn from me about flirting, Akko...my job involves denying women.
There's a good chance you're more experienced at flirting than I am. You're willing to bring it up, after all.
I have more experience telling women to stop flirting and get back to work than I do flirting myself.
There's...better candidates for that sort of thing, Akko. I always shoot rookies down if they start staring at me...
You don't care much for the words of others, do you, Daria? I told you I'm a human woman.
No matter how many times I tell you I'm a human woman, you insist otherwise. I see you're more critic than skeptic.
I'm beginning to think you're just calling me an alien to antagonize me. I've heard worse, I assure you.
I'm not sure if continuing to call me an alien is Earthling xenophobia or your own personal need to taunt others.
I'm sure you could. You seem intelligent, and Sei seems promiscuous.
Your knowledge and Sei's experience will prove an enlightening combination, I'm sure.
By all means. You're likely well-read on the subject...and Sei seems as if she's slept with quite a few of them.
By that, do you mean you'll parse Sei's drunken recollections of men into a cohesive explanation?
I'd also like to know what an AT Field is, for the record.
Whatever this "AT Field" is, it sounds more interesting than my breasts. So does how you know about them...
You two are strangers, correct? I'd like to know how she's heard of them, too...and what they are.
Public nudity isn't my idea of fun. Drinking is even less so.
I don't handle alcohol well...that's the farthest thing from fun I can imagine.
There's other ways to have fun besides drinking and stripping. That's just vulgar...
Never did I think I'd be playing this game with two drunken soldiers. At least you two have a lot in common.
I'm afraid I can't provide that...I try not to initiate relationships.
...You're a beautiful woman, Mulan, but I'm not forward at all...not anymore.
...Contrary to my commanding tone as a leader, I'm not forward when it comes to relationships. I can't afford to have one...
If you like women who are forward, Jura has surely proven herself worthy by now...even though she has a girlfriend already.
...I really don't mind discussing men, even with them around. I didn't think Earth women would be so deferent to them.
...Why are you so shy about this? I thought living with men would make Earth women more comfortable...
...I think you could do with asserting yourself around men, as well. Earth women don't often seem to do that...
...I came here for Earth women's perspective on men, but I was expecting more confidence. You breed with them.
...Having no men around is all I've ever known. They're like another species to me.
It's not something I have much perspective for. To a Mejarian, the only kind of human is a woman...
It's hard to notice the absence of men when you were never taught that they should be there.
I imagine that would be strange to an Earth woman...to a Mejarian, having men in your midst is like sharing space with aliens.
...Feel free to explain what soon-dare-ay means, Natsuki.
I might agree with that if I knew what soon-dare-ay meant.
...Is soon-dare-ay an Earth word for a woman who dislikes men?
...If soon-dare-ay means "hates men," then I'd understand why it's not a Mejarian word.

state.text: I used to start streetfights for money. Leading the squadron commands more respect...and is more enjoyable.
It's not the crime I enjoy...but there is a certain thrill to piloting my Dread.
You make it sound like I enjoy being a criminal. I used to fight on the street...piloting is more glamorous.
Piloting has its perks. My leadership role has earned me respect I never had doing streetfights...
I doubt it. My Oma's company made it, but it's just a fashion item...a gift from before she died.
There might well be some Earth analog to it, but my Oma gave it to me before she died.
"Sec-Monocle"...that might be the name for it. My Oma gave it to me and died shortly after.
Women always assume it has a function. It was just a gift from my late Oma...a decorative piece.
...A massage is "girl-on-girl" to you? Well...that does sound nice.
...Oh. Your conception of "girl-on-girl" is even tamer than I thought...maybe.
Is that all woman-woman sex is to you? Massages? ...I wouldn't mind one.
...I do enjoy that kind of stress relief. But there's more to Mejarian love than rubbing...
...Hm. Alright, then...how long do men--last, exactly?
...I was hoping to just observe men...but since you're so eager, how big do their--tubes get?
...I figured. Well, then...when a man inserts that tube of his, does it--hurt?
...Right. OK...what do men find appealing in women, personality-wise?
Perhaps she's famous on Earth, but no, they haven't. I'm curious what an Eva is...
..."Rei Ayanami." I'm afraid not...I wonder how a Dread compares to an "Eva."
"Evas" must be some kind of Earth craft. I pilot a Dread...I'm not familiar with this Ayanami woman.
I assume Rei Ayanami is an Earth woman? I thought blue hair was rare here...and what's an Eva?
...No. I wouldn't approach a female stranger, much less a male one.
Who do you take me for? Just because I dress revealingly does not mean I pursue strangers.
...You can't be serious. Here? With a stranger--and a man?
Don't bother. My sexuality is not your plaything to boost viewership.
...Quite the opposite.
No, I like open spaces. Preferably empty ones...like windswept plains.
...Life on a ship is cramped. I don't particularly care for it.

case.state: Provided there isn't a crowd in them, I actually prefer open spaces...

state.text: As far as I can tell, Earth women are much more obsessed with toys. That must come from a love of men's tubes...
Sex toys aren't very complex on Mejare. I suspect the government doesn't want women getting attached to tubelike objects.
Making sex toys resemble men's genitals is not in the Mejarian empire's best interest. They're kept small...
...Toys tend to resemble male anatomy. The government encourages women to form couples and be romantic...
...Too many.
...It's impossible to work if I dwell on that. We hold funerals and move on.
...I'm not going to share the number just so you can make light of their deaths.
...The captain keeps a shrine for them.
Provided if there isn't a crowd in them, I actually prefer open spaces...

case.state: I go out into combat in my Dread with the other pilots, commanding them during the battle. Our captain is an old woman who remains on the bridge.
Well, captain is the highest rank on a ship--ours is an older woman who commands from the bridge. A wing commander is a pilot in her own right.
The captain is the overall leader of our ship--she doesn't partake in direct combat the way I do. She's too old to do so, in any case.
Our captain is an old woman who's in no shape to go out into direct combat. But that isn't a captain's job--she sits on the bridge and is the final authority on our next action.
...My parents could afford nice clothes for me, Pyrrha. I just grew out of them.
...I did tend to get my dresses dirty playing outside as a girl. But eventually, I just got too big for them, Pyrrha...that's all.
...My parents could afford nice clothes for me, Pyrrha. I just grew out of them.
...I did tend to get my dresses dirty playing outside as a girl. But eventually, I just got too big for them, Pyrrha...that's all.
...Why are you talking like that? I didn't think telling you we're pirates would make you more excited.
...I expected that to be deflating news, since pirates don't have the same luxuries soldiers do. And who are you imitating?
...I don't understand what you're saying. Are pirates actually romanticized on this planet?
...I think "pirate" might mean something different on this planet. Why are you speaking like that?
...I don't know what a strange voice has to do with piracy. What do you think a pirate is?
We've learned a lot about the nature of human settlement in the sector. Part of that has been from fending off unmanned Harvester attacks.
Our travels have been met with attacks by Harvester robots, so survival is a constant struggle. But we've also learned much about the galaxy from the experience...
You were...sculpted by a man, correct? Are you meant to represent men's image of the ideal woman?
Well...your creator was a man, wasn't he? Do you embody Earth men's ideals of feminine beauty?
I'm glad you decided to tell me about it, then.
A worthy inclusion in our video game discussion, it would seem.
Now that's amusing.
...Your wool is form-fitting, as well.
...It broadcasts my figure. Much like your...wool.
...It shows the shape of my body. Your wool is short enough to do the same...
...Thank you. Your...wool is a sort of natural bodysuit, I assume.
So is my hair masculine, or Corrin's feminine?
Out of all of men's attributes, I don't think I've ever thought much about their hairstyles.
Universal, is it? I suppose Hibiki's hair doesn't differ all that much from mine.
...What is a conventional pirate on Earth? A woman in a bikini?
...I'm not sure how this makes me conventional...you're not wearing one yourself.
...Are you not a pirate yourself? What Earth pirates should look like is unknown to me...
...I was told you were a pirate as well...perhaps Earth's definition is different. Or its climate...
..."Lesbian" must be an Earth insult for our lifestyle. I should have expected as much...
..."Lesbian"? Coming from you...that must be insulting. Whatever it means...
...What is a "lesbian"? If I don't understand, there's little point to your insults...
..."Lesbian"...an Earth word? I lack the context for what you're ranting about...
...Are men unpopular on this planet, as well? I thought men and women formed families...
...I don't understand. I thought Earth women enjoyed men's company...or at least tolerated it.
...So men's company can start to wear on even an Earth woman after enough time.
...I understand men treat you quite...roughly. But I didn't think an Earth woman would be open to alternatives...
...Chiaki, Mejare doesn't use Earth years. How long ago was 1958?
I have heard of tennis...it's a spectator sport. Why not just play the real thing?
Why play tennis electronically? Exercise is good for you...
I see these video games needed time to develop advanced enough technology for doubles tennis.
Perhaps this would be fascinating if I had context for what any of it meant.
1958...in Earth years? Even the timeframes are confusing me now.
If we encounter alien life, we will communicate that discovery to Earth...being fellow humans.
...Mejare was settled by Earthlings, Leggy. We are all descended from them...even without male parents.
...Fortunately, I am not an alien.
...My ancestors were from Earth, Leggy. We have no need to study livestock.
...The Nirvana is a spaceship, and even among those, its design is strange. It's the result of a fusion accident...
Our ship, the Nirvana, was actually formed by accident when a male and female ship were fused together. We're constantly discovering design quirks.
The Nirvana is a very strange ship, but that's because it was formed in an energy fusion accident...not built by engineers.
...Sailing...? The Nirvana is a spaceship, Nami...and technically, it wasn't designed at all. Our energy core fused two ships together...
I am a junior officer in the "Magno Family" pirate band. Most of our work is in raiding the Mejarian military, but the men of Tarak are also a target.
Mejare's imperial army is at constant war with Tarak, the planet of men. I am a Dread team commander in a pirate crew that raids both sides.
Mejare's largest band of pirates is the Magno Family, of which I am an officer. We raid Mejare's army, as well as planet Tarak's...
I am a Dread pilot for a crew of Mejarian pirates. We would rather raid both sides of the Mejare-Tarak war than perpetuate it.
...Mejare's waste of resources in its war against Tarak has spurred many women to form pirate bands. I lead a team of Dread pilots for one.
I'd like to be bought separately right about now...
Not much of a trivia piece if both situations are applicable.
Weren't you sleepy before? What happened to that?
This is the last time I make small talk with an Earth woman about her hobbies...
Serves me right for faking interest to be polite...
...Mejare has all sorts of hair bows and accessories. I don't need one from Earth.
...I did not fly several lightyears to accessorize my hair with Earth bows.
I do not need a bow in my hair, nor did I come to Earth for that purpose.
I was not aware Earth was well-known for its hair bows.
...Wait, now I remember. "Dads" are male parents...I didn't have one. Mejarians are born from two women.
...Actually, I remember now. The men spoke about how they'd be "dads" as parents. Both my parents were women.
...Wait a minute. You must mean a male parent. My parents were both women...I can't even imagine a man with a child.
...Wait, aren't "dads" men with children? My parents were women...so I didn't have a dad.
...Would you like me to explain Mejarian parenthood again? To further your extensive knowledge of language.
Yes, I've mentioned them. I'll gladly explain what the terms mean again...since that seems to be my job now.
I should've known I'd become an emissary of all things Mejarian here...
Normally I'm giving orders to experienced pilots...now I'm a cultural ambassador for Mejare.

state.text: Photograph me if you want. Nobody knows who I am.
Take pictures if you want. I doubt they'll reach Mejare.
Are you taking photographs? If this reaches the ship, Jura will never take me seriously again.
I have bad memories of my picture being taken...or good, in a way.
Are you taking photographs? I'd like to see you try to blackmail a pirate.
Take pictures if you want. My Wanted mugshot is outdated anyway.

case.state: It's true there are pornography producers on Mejare, as well...but I've never seen any videos featuring "tentacle friends."
From my time on Mejare's streets, I can tell you there are pornographers there, too. But it's usually just women embracing...
...I am not suggesting Mejare is without pornography, but its subjects do not include "large insertion."
...Your idea of pornography on this planet just seems far more explicit. Mejarian videos don't feature "tentacles in every hole."
...I'm sorry? I don't know what "Pokuh-mon" are...
...Did you mean to say "Poker-mon"? Otherwise, I have no context for that...
..."Poke-a-mon"? ...I'm sorry, I'm not familiar...
..."Pokuh"...what do you keep saying? I'm sorry...
...I'm not familiar with those terms, but from what I've seen, we live similarly to Earthlings. It's the men on Tarak who don't form families.
..."Patriarchy"? I don't know what that means...but historical records show Earthlings forming couples. We do that, too.
...Don't men and women live together on Earth, as families? Women on Mejare do that, too--it's the men who form castes.
From the few film reels I've seen of Earth, you form couples and families here. So our societies aren't too different--it's just among women.
...It says a lot about you that you'd even ask that, N. Every society has a hierarchy...even if Mejare hides its own.
Mejare does an excellent job of appearing egalitarian, but there is no freedom. Tarak isn't free, either...but it's honest about that.
You ask that like there exists a human society without leaders and subjects. Mejare tries desperately to maintain that illusion.
...It's strange to hear a man ask that when Tarak is so stratified. As is Mejare, beneath the surface...I am a pirate, after all.
I'm the squadron leader of the Nirvana, a ship crewed by Mejarian pirates. No pay, but there is food.
I'm a pirate from Mejare. That might sound criminal, but Mejare's government is worse.
...Have you heard of Mejare? It's one of Earth's colonies...I'm part of a pirate crew from there.
I'm from Mejare. When I was a teenager, I joined a pirate crew...and now I lead its Dread pilots. Does that answer your question?
...It's not technology in the first place...
...That implies it was meant to work...
...No. I'm sorry to disappoint...again.
...It's not ancient...it's decorative.
...It's just ballistic padding and insulation. What need does a pilot have for sophisticated armor?
...This is basic flight armor, to protect me in collisions and to signify rank.
I am a pilot, Starfire...a repulsion field would be a waste of resources. It's standard padding.
Dread team leaders wear this armor to show authority. It's basic otherwise...
...According to my homeworld, they would be doing that to feast on my liver.
Isn't one man undressing me enough? I was told stories as a girl of men pinning women down, passing us around...for food.
You sound excited about that. I've heard too many stories about men putting women on spitroasts.
I wouldn't know much about whether men would want to undress me...I was taught they'd pin me down and eat me.
...How many hominid planets are in the Vega system?
...Just how far away is the "Vega" system for us to have missed all these alien species?
...Just when I thought we would never discover alien life, you know about a whole system's worth...
...Hominid species alone are common enough in your system to know all this?
...In this case, normal is better.
Hm. Breasts are one thing, but an abnormal vagina is usually for the worse.
...Would you really want to see something "abnormal" here, Starfire?
"Exciting" has never been my aim, especially concerning my groin.
...There'd be no need for that...not that it's a camera at all.
It's not a camera...I'd rather not have evidence I was here.
...I'm just here to observe Earth, not record it...this is just fashion.
...It's just a decoration...this is not a reconnaissance mission.
...If anything, it exaggerates my breasts. Between that and the large shoulders, it does a lot to hide my form...
I would say the bulky shoulders my armor gives me detract from any form-fitting...or padded breasts.
...It's padded, so it does more than show my form. Your chest has no need for that sort of flattery, meanwhile...
It's meant more for flight shocks than anything else, Jessie...and it fakes my form more than shows it.
It's more of a woman's outfit, Dust. Men's bodies seem too angular--you'd probably tear holes in one. That, and your tube...
I can't imagine any man wearing tight clothing. Wouldn't that rodlike organ of yours be pressed up against it?
That doesn't surprise me. Women's bodies are smooth and curved, making them ideal for tight suits like this. A man couldn't fit inside.
With those unwieldy tubes sticking out of your bodies, Dust, I can see why men wouldn't wear tight suits like this.
...All the men I know wear baggy clothing, Dust. It makes sense--your bodies have more pointed edges than women's.
...Is "Mustang" your commanding officer? You should always attempt to understand your leader's perspective...
..."Mustang"? A strange name for a woman...does she hold authority over you?
...If "Mustang" is your commanding officer, then you should observe her carefully. Leaders have their reasons...
...Leaders usually want what's best for their subordinates. If "Mustang" is yours, study when she is harsh and why.
...I think it was what I needed, and our captain saw that.
Command is...what I needed, if not what I wanted. Our captain is an old woman who's met girls like me before.
...I recognize how command set me on the right track. Otherwise, I'd probably have gotten myself killed in a reckless maneuver by now.
...I enjoy the respect it garners. More than that, it's given me perspective on how aimless I was beforehand.
...Leading the Dream team lets me focus on something other than proving myself. The captain probably wanted to keep me alive.
...And where is your home? Some clandestine base on one of Mejare's moons?
...How can you see Mejare without monitoring equipment? Do you live on one of its moons?
...I see. I wasn't aware Mejare's moons were inhabited. It makes sense--the Magno Family has settled in the nearby asteroids.
...Have you made your home on a Mejarian moon or asteroid? There's no other way to "see" it without satellites.
...No "fancy machines." Monitoring a planet is a trivial engineering task. What are you trying to say, Yuelia?
...I wouldn't call a satellite "fancy." What do you use, then? Or do you live that close?
...My Dread is a fancy machine, Yuelia. A basic orbital satellite is not...how are you watching, then?
...Only a primitive people would call satellites "fancy." And yet you can "watch" Mejare? Either you live nearby, or you're trying to confuse me.
...Erm. I'm sorry if I was overexcited just now, Yuelia. I command a Dread team on a pirate ship.
...Excuse me. I shouldn't act overeager like that...I've gotten my piloting experience working for a pirate crew.
...Ahem. I'm sorry about that, Yuelia. I should be more composed. I'm not actually formally trained--I'm part of a pirate group.
...I'm sorry. That was a bit much on my part. I wish I could've gone to school for piloting--I actually work for pirates as a squadron commander.
...Ahem. Well, it's been the focus of my life for quite some time now. I work for pirates, so there is little time for other pursuits.
...Excuse me for that. If I were a pilot for Mejare's empire, I might have time for other hobbies, but I'm a pirate--it's my passion by necessity.
...I'm sorry. I was overenthusiastic there. I do enjoy piloting, but I'm a pirate--I couldn't pursue much else if I wanted to.
...Erm. I shouldn't oversell my situation. It was a meaningful role I could take with the pirates I fell into, and piracy allows for little else.
That's...a nice outlook to have, Yuelia. Thank you...I'm accustomed to seeing function first and foremost on our ship.
