I'm perfectly fine, thank you. A Mejarian pirate is used to being in her underwear around other woman...I don't know about Earth ones.
...Thank you, Elizabeth. You're a sweet girl...even if I disagree.
Couldn't you see what my figure was like already? My suit doesn't exactly obscure it.

That's the nicest way someone's ever put it, actually.

As a prelude to the more typical way men and women combine, correct? Nice try.
Combining our fighters would seat us in a rather compromising position--one I'd rather not be in with a man who called me cute.

What is your interest in bodysuits? This is just a Mejarian style...

I couldn't exercise in this underwear if it weren't modest. That's how I got this body.

I doubt a man would understand the importance of breast support in training gear.

...Well, I'd hate to be a pirate my entire life. Maybe one day I'll be able to settle down, free from the law...perhaps here in the offline version.
Uh...thank you, Rinkah.
I try to exercise regularly...I have to stay fit in order to pilot effectively.
Exercise is important...I have to set an example for the pilots in my squadron.

Her own body is something all women should take pride in. Call me brave for commanding a fleet of gossiping young women.

Mejarians take pride in their bodies. I'm not ashamed of mine...and any bravery I've displayed is in commanding our fleet.

...You know, Zizou, I expected a goddess to be more...dignified.
Words worthy of a goddess. I'll come back next week and report how much ass I've tapped.

To a man, I suppose any amount of breast tissue is a lot, isn't it?

...Thank you, Akko. You remind me of one of my pilots-in-training with how earnest you are.

...My breasts aren't that much of a distraction. You really are just like Dita, with your constant encouragement...

Mejare's standards for breast size are high...I don't exactly measure up. It's hard to gauge this planet, either, especially when you're not all Earthlings.

I'm used to comparing myself to women from Mejare...and most of them are more impressively endowed than I am.
Mejarians have different standards for size than Earth women, I suppose...not that your breasts aren't nice.

No frame of reference? Aren't there women where you live?
No frame of reference? I thought you worked for a woman.
No frame of reference? I thought Earth men and women couldn't get enough of each other.
...Thank you. But don't you know any women where you come from?
I tend not to bring it up, but it's only natural. Don't tell me they feed you some indoctrinating nonsense about sex.

You seem rather shy about something so natural. If this school is trying to indoctrinate you, it's quite similar to Mejare.
You're just like my crewmates, trying to pry sexuality out of me...but yes. I hope you're not being told that's unacceptable for a girl.

Gynoid alchemist" or not, my breasts aren't hard to measure up to...not on Mejare.

An inflated ego can only be a detriment. Best to stay humble, no matter how hard you work.

...Is she the type to show her backside to complete strangers? I didn't think I was until tonight...maybe we'd get along.

This "other witch" is starting to sound like a better match for me than for you. Does she appreciate a toned butt?
Is this why you're condescending? Insecurity over your body? I recommend exercise...
I see. So you push others away because of bodily insecurity. Try exercise...I do squats.
Insecurity or not, putting others down won't make you feel better. You should spend some time in the gym...
I use exercise to work through any insecurity over my body. As you can see, it's more beneficial than making snide comments.

Ehehe...mhmhmhm. I really thought I was done for there--but men are nothing if not surprising.
...Even with a high card, a man finds a way to lose to me. I see why you stick to fighting.
Mhmhm. Look at my cards--you were this close to knocking me out.
...I had a high card. The last thing I'd ever want is a man's pity.
...It's a good thing men are so muscular. If you couldn't fight, you'd be left with your wits--this is the result.
...I guess men's good fortune only expresses itself on the battlefield.
...I can't get much closer to defeat than that. Good luck next round, ~player~.
...I'd resigned myself to losing just now. I forgot what I've been learning for some time now--with men around, anything can happen.
A man...
So, a man has to strip...
~player~...a man. Before you get any ideas, I'm armed.
Your turn, ~player~...you're what would be considered a typical man, yes?
A man stripping is sure to hold my attention...
Men and their mysterious tubes will be this night's most interesting find, for sure...
I can see women nude in our ship's showers. You are a different matter.
~player~...I hope I can learn something about men from you.
I hope nothing about you gives me a false impression of men's bodies...
~player~...I've only known men as enemy soldiers. I wonder what your impression is of women...
One step closer towards an enlightening evening.
Learning more about men can't be a bad thing...
There's a lot you could teach me, ~player~...I wonder how much men understand their own bodies.
Men don't seem to hide their emotions well. You looked worried...
...I may be attached to that eyepiece, ~player~, but I won't suddenly forget how to play cards.
Your turn, ~player~. I intend to study your male anatomy once you've stripped to that point.
It's a good thing this is strip poker, or a man losing would offer me nothing...
You may feel like an average man, ~player~, but that's precisely why there's a lot you could teach me.
By our quartermaster's account, men are far too emotional to play poker effectively.
Good, a man's turn. I don't even have to ask you questions to learn something.
Men are known for keeping their word, aren't they? Then you should have no qualms with this.
I don't think my pride would let me just ask a man to strip for me. Forcing you through a game is much better.
I haven't had much chance to compete directly with a man. Losing would be quite embarrassing.
It's your turn, ~player~. I'll be watching this closely.
Go ahead, ~player~. I know from experience that men like to lead a charge.
...Go ahead, ~player~. I'm not interested in coaching a man in poker.
...Why are you hesitating, ~player~?
I've heard that men are competitive to a fault. I get the same criticism myself.
You always seem to glance around the room when you lose, ~player~. Do you really need our confirmation?
I told you that being down to my underwear won't faze me. You'll have to be smarter about your cards.
Standing here in my underwear next to a man, the cards really do feel like a sideshow now.
If nothing else, ~player~, you take your losses with dignity. I'd expect angry shouting from a man.
Your hand is the worst, ~player~. But you probably knew that even before we showed our cards.
I'm curious how a man decides what cards to exchange. I'd learn even more about your psychology if we were betting.
I wonder how you might fit in with the other men we're holding prisoner. They did seem to bond with each other quickly.
Men can be as inscrutable as the strange letters you write with. Kanji, I believe they're called.
...Have you heard of sortieing, ~player~? It's to attack from a defensive position.
Our ship's navigator is a man. He tends to make excuses--I hope you're not the same way.
Poker is unpredictable, but men can be learned. Let's see if I'll learn more about you this round.
I've faced down Harvest motherships in a Dread, ~player~. I can face down a man in my gym shorts.
Even without the nudity, this game gives me a good opportunity to study men's behavior...how you think, how you respond to pressure.
...What? Is a woman exposing her breasts to a man a form of submission on this planet? Well, not on mine.
It's a Mejarian's duty to put men in their place, you know.
...It's your turn, ~player~. Or does staring at a woman's breasts make men feel better?
...You're very quiet. It's as if you're a Tarakkian--they believe speaking to women destroys their vocal cords.
Thoughtful silence isn't a bad trait in a man. Our male doctor is the same way, and he's easy to work with--if a bit nosy.
If there were betting rounds, I'd learn more about how men hide things--useful for reading the enemy. But I can't complain when the tradeoff is seeing how you hide your body.
I guess I shouldn't try to characterize all men as being sociable or not. One of our prisoners is quiet, and the other two constantly run their mouths.
There's one thing I can relate to men about with no issue--we both hate to lose.
...You're not beating me so easily, ~player~.
I've dealt with men, and Earthlings, more aggressive than you.
I guess this is sort of like an unarmored Dread against an overconfident Vanguard.
It's a shame I've had to rely on luck for so many things tonight. Seeing a man naked, keeping myself clothed, and keeping the game close.

...~player~, do you find my body distracting?
...I mean that.
I'm more of a calm mind than a strategic one. But one trick I know is to make your opponent believe you're beaten.
I've noticed that if there's an opportunity in front of them, men will never back down.
When I came to play this, I pictured a man standing here naked while I slowly caught up.
Maybe I'm more like men than I realize if you're a competitive race. Ever since I was a girl, I got into fights with shady characters.
I think our situations would be reversed if this were, say, Strip Shooting.
...You lose the round, and you look to me? Is it just because I'm naked?
...Is something wrong, ~player~? You can't delay stripping forever.
Good. Satisfy my curiosity.
That's what I needed.
Make this worth it for me, ~player~...
This is too much...!
Help me out here, ~player~...
Hah...a man might just push me over the edge.
I hope you realize the effect a man would agh have on me in this state...
Just do it, ~player~...it's hard for a man to bore me.
I really enjoyed that rush. Make my instincts flare up again...
After all that, you still have some clothing?
You stayed clothed through my entire masturbation session?
Getting it over with is much better...even for a man, that must be true.
~player~...I have no right to order you to show me anything. Not with how I've treated you for being a man...
(Look, Meia, it's ~name~. Handsome, isn't he?)
(You can insist men aren't for you all you want, Leader...I can see the curiosity burning in your eyes.)
(You don't fool me, Meia. Men make you excited, too...with their beastly ways.)
(If Mejare's finest woman can appreciate men, I think you can.)
...You two are classmates? ...Is this some kind of date? Between--male and female?
Classmates? ...Well, Mejarian girls date in school, too...men and women must do it on Earth.
Interesting location for classmates to date each other. That is what you're doing, right? ...Men and women?
A young man and woman, from the same school...not what I'd choose for a date, but then, I wouldn't date a man.
...You two are classmates? Men and women in school together...unthinkable.
Classmates? Futaba certainly seems like the booksmart type...I have a hard time picturing men in school at all.
I can't believe men and women could function in school together...and that they'd play strip poker together afterwards.
You're classmates, and you'd play this together? It'd be awkward enough just attending school with men...
..."Kazuko"? I remember a man named Kazuma who looked just like you--a man who was not above disguising himself as a woman for his perversion.
You take orders from this man, Rinkah? ...I guess this is a clash of cultures. No man is commanding me.
Hmhmhm...I'm sorry. It's just that...I would never take orders from a man.
Corrin's your commanding officer, Rinkah? I've fought beside men, but taking orders...no, thanks.
I knew Earth would bring some culture shock, but watching a woman take orders from a man is...well, laughable to a Mejarian.
Jura, don't go flirting with strange men. Especially ones with dangerous looks in their eyes.
Jura, stop flirting for one second and actually evaluate this man's character.
Don't go near him, Jura. Something's not right with him...
Jura, you need better presence of mind than this. Not everyone here is friendly, and I certainly wouldn't trust a man.
...I've heard that men and women can be siblings on this planet. Are you two sister and..."brother"? Your faces look alike.
Jotaro, is that woman your sister? I suppose man-woman couples can have both male and female children...and you resemble each other.
Two large men at this table...and they both give off such imposing energy. Hopefully they draw each other's attention...
...I don't know why, but both these men have a dangerous presence about them...fortunately, they don't seem to be on good terms.
...These men have such menacing auras. I've read that aggressive men sometimes fight over women on Earth... hopefully they take each other out.
Two large men at this table...and they both give off such imposing energy. Hopefully they draw each other's attention...
...I don't know why, but both these men have a dangerous presence about them...fortunately, they don't seem to be on good terms.
...These men have such menacing auras. I've read that aggressive men sometimes fight over women on Earth... hopefully they take each other out.
...Kira, do you know why Jolyne is staring at you? I'm already wary of the auras you're both exuding--Jolyne, I invite you to explain, as well.
...For some reason, I feel the same strange presence from both Jolyne and Kira...a man might be intimidating, but why her? ...Jolyne, do you know this man?
Judging by his attitude, men are a lot more shy about nudity...which only makes this more curious.
You two must be close, then. It's good to know men and women can be this comfortable around each other...I suppose.
It's definitely a unique coincidence. But being nude together is no issue for us...I wonder if that's true for these two.
Jura and I shower together, since the ship only has the communal bathroom...is that true for you two, as well?
The same person, both male and female...guess that cements it. Men and women are the same species.
I wonder what I'd look like as a man...horrifying.
Male and female...you two would make perfect test subjects for Mejarian scientists.
The same person, one born on Tarak and the other on Mejare.
I'll be honest...you both look like women.
...That's a man, Jura.
...I'm no expert, but I think Corrin is a man, actually.
...I think Corrin's a man, Jura. Though he does look feminine.
I hear you're good with a sword. Jura, do you think you could learn from this man? Perhaps nonverbally?
I see you value words about as much as I do.
...Is this some primitive men's language?
You don't seem too talkative, but I'm told you can handle a sword. You could stand to learn something from this man, Jura.
Barely talks, skilled with a sword? Look at that, Jura. He's everything you're not.
Wait, you two work together? That's...very awkward. Jura and I split up when we came here...
I see even on Earth, the superiority of women is clearly entrenched.
You take orders from this woman? The captain is quite a bit older than I am...
You take orders from this woman? I sure wouldn't want Hibiki playing this with me.
...This is your wife's armor, you said? It's certainly big for you...I wonder how you'd look in Gascogne's clothes.
...Is men dressing in women's clothing a show of romance on Earth? Your wife must be much larger than you...
...Your wife must dwarf you, the way her armor just sits on your body. I've seen men dress as women, and I wish I hadn't.
Bart tried to dress as a woman, too...but at least the clothes fit him. This wife of yours must be enormous.
...You're wearing your wife's oversized armor for Valentine's Day? I don't think I'll ever understand man-woman relationships...
...So, you're "Dark" Pit? What exactly is the difference between two short men in different clothes?
Men tend to all look the same to me--you and "normal" Pit in particular. What makes you different from him?
Perhaps I have untrained eyes for spotting men's differences, but you look like Pit with a change of clothes, "Dark Pit."
...This is just a Halloween costume, yes? I have a hard time believing "Dark Pit" is his own man--not that I consider any two men unique.
It's nice to see a familiar man--and in such casual clothing. All the men I know wear military uniforms.
...So, is this how men dress for summer? I can't picture any of my male crewmates wearing something so relaxed...
The men I know wear a mechanic's outfit, officer fatigues, and a doctor's labcoat. You're a far cry from any of that at the moment.
Hello again, Ryuji. I thought your original outfit was casual, but men continue to surprise me...our prisoners dress for practicality.
...You're Kazuma, that perverted man who claimed to be a warrior. Why are you dressed in women's clothing? Is that how Earthlings celebrate Halloween?
Kazuma...? You're wearing a woman's dress. Is this...Earth Halloween custom? I knew girls on Mejare who dressed like men, but we thought they were monsters...
...I remember you. Kazuma, the pervert...why are you dressed like a woman? Do men and women wear each other's clothing for Earth Halloween?
...What are you insinuating? I'm only focusing my attention on who lost the round.
...There are numerous interesting things about you, even beyond being a man...but you shouldn't flatter yourself.
...What is that supposed to mean, Dust? I told you that you look unusual, even for a man...
...Your sense of fashion and excess body hair are worth looking over, Dust, but don't get the wrong idea about my attention.
Why are you blindfolded? Don't you want to see the cards?
Why are you wearing a blindfold? Are you really that confident?
...Are you playing on a bet? Take your blindfold off and play seriously.
Your outfit is one thing, but to be wearing a blindfold? What's wrong with you?
What is that "Pod" you keep giving orders to? What does it do?
...Are you going to explain what your "Pod" is doing over there, or are we all supposed to ignore it?
This is a good time to learn about Earth technology. What exactly is the function of that "Pod" drone?
...I'm curious about that "Pod" of yours. I suppose you wanted us to ask about that, since you keep talking to it.
That "Pod" drone you keep giving commands to is a lot like Pyoro, our own robot assistant...though he has more to say for himself.
Now are you taking off that ridiculous blindfold? Or...tactical visor.
So are you forfeiting, or are you finally deciding to let yourself see?
Attached to that blindfold? Either give up the game or take off that thing...your move.
Please tell me you're not so attached to that thing that you're finished off now.
Deja vu indeed...unless it's April Fool's today. Mejare's cars are much more advanced.
AE86? Good, ~player~ is just goofing off...so I can, too. There's no useful engineering in an ancient Earth car...
..."AE86." I deal in Dreads and spacecraft, so a twentieth-century Earth car isn't exactly a technological marvel.
I wonder if this "Toyota" group was responsible for any of Mejare's automobile engineering... I'm not impressed with this.
...Coming off of a fusion ship powered by the Paksis Pragma, an internal combustion engine fails to impress.
You're...a man? Not like one I've ever seen.
Why are you speaking through a translator? Is that some archaic Earth language?
...Earth languages besides the common tongue are a mystery to me. Even Tarakkian code is not something I've ever concerned myself with.
...Facial markings? Like Rabat's people. I'll keep that in mind, Earth-man.
I never thought I'd meet a man shorter than Hibiki...but you might be the one.
Who let this...child in here?
Men really do come in all shapes and sizes. You might as well be a woman.
Who are you? You look like a child. Get out.
I'm no expert on men, but you look like a prepubescent one...never mind the cat ears. Children aren't allowed here.
We shouldn't be playing with this child here. This is wrong...
Never thought I'd meet a man with my fashion sense.
I'm told you were frozen for decades. Hibiki was that way, too...
I'm told you used be small and weak, but were scientifically altered. Hibiki could certainly benefit from that...not that he'd ever accept.
I'm told you used be small and weak, but were scientifically altered. Seems unbecoming of a man to take the easy way out.
If everyone on this America planet is built like you, I'd hate to see the women.
Are you really a captain? You seem built more to take orders than give them.
You don't need to strip for me to tell you're fit. They'd worship you on Tarak.
And I thought Hibiki was outgoing...
Well...you're certainly enthusiastic.
We're all right here. You don't have to shout.
Is "captain" an actual designation, or just what you call yourself?
I heard there's a female version of you. What kept her away?
And I thought Bart's outfits could be garish.
You dress more garishly than Bart. I wonder how you'd look bald.
...Can't you take this seriously, ~player~?
~player~, you're better than this. Pick a real character.
You put Shaggy Blanco on a table with me? Do you really hate me that much?
I wish I could understand what you're saying. Maybe then I'd get something out of this joke.
At least you started working out. You're still all unkempt.
White's not a popular color among Mejarians...you can imagine why.
Not sure how to take this. You picked me...but apparently I'm only worthy of playing with Shaggy Blanco.
Thought I wouldn't have lines to a joke character? You underestimate me, ~player~.
So, you solve mysteries? Duero's the only man I know who's smart enough for that.
So, you solve mysteries? The Paksis is one big glowing mystery...
You might be handsomer if you grew your hair out. Duero makes it work.
...I've seen enough men to know you're not human.
What exactly...are you?
So gay is the term Earthlings use? Sounds sort of derisive.
They told me you're an agent, but an agent of what, I'm still not sure. Perhaps you could elaborate...and take off your weapon.
Don't think I don't see that weapon. I'm trying to be less wary of men...but an armed "agent" puts me on edge.
It's my understanding you're an agent. Well, I'm a pirate...and I didn't come armed, so perhaps you should remove your weapon.
An "agent" of a man with a weapon at his hip is making this an uncomfortable experience already.
For a man claiming to be a soldier, you have a very casual attitude. Who or what have you fought?
Perhaps you could put me at ease by explaining what you do. You don't have the eyes of a man who's been under fire.
I know very few men, but they're primarily soldiers--and none of them so laid-back as you. Have you seen combat?
Have you actually seen combat? You have a soldier's poise, but not his gaze...maybe I don't know men well enough.
You look dead-serious...and you're built sturdily. It's not unlike our ship's male doctor, Duero.
Stern...flowing hair...tall and strong. You remind me of Duero, the male doctor on our ship. The only doctor.
I never liked how men grew to be bigger and stronger than women...at least you take yourself seriously. You're like Duero, our ship's doctor...a man.
...There's a man on our ship--our doctor, Duero. He's got a similarly large build, and is stoic like you, too.
Based on my prior impressions of men, I'll guess by tearing your clothes off, returning to a primal state.
Mejarians have long considered nudity to be men's bestial natural state, so I assume you strip quite readily.
...With your hands? Up until recently, I wasn't sure men wore clothes at all.
...By all means, Kamina, enlighten me. Mejare views men as beasts who barely wear clothes in the first place.
...I'll try to ignore your apparent feelings towards me. There's a man in my squadron learning to pilot...perhaps you could teach him.
...So. Is it true you're a mech pilot? One of our male prisoners is learning, and he might benefit from a male instructor.
What kind of mech do you pilot, exactly? I'm having a hard enough time teaching the one man in my squadron.
...Kamina. If it's true you pilot a mech, there's a novice pilot in my squadron...a man. You might be able to help him.
Bombastic...and wearing little clothing. Since you're so adamant about being a man, do you have experience with women?
You seem willing to speak on this subject, so...can you give an Earth man's experience regarding women, Kamina?
Hmm...perhaps you could tell me what Earth men think of women, Kamina. After all, you're very proud of being a man...
It's clear you take pride in your gender. If that includes any experience with women, I'd like to hear an Earth man's perspective...
...Who are you? You have a hungry look in your eye...
...I've always regarded men as simple...but you look a little too complex.
...I've learned that men aren't really animals...but something about you reminds me of one.
...You have an analytic look in your eye. That's more complex than I've come to view the average man...
...What are you staring at? I don't appreciate a man looking me over, especially one with calculating eyes.

state.text: Am I supposed to ignore that bizarre costumed man you keep summoning? Who is he?

case.state: As if I needed another reason to distrust you, now you're summoning strange costumed figures...! Who's that behind you?
Is Killer Queen who you call the mute man in costume behind you? What's he doing here?
I might be more inclined to trust you, Kira, if you explained the identity of the masked man standing behind you.
...Really, ~player~? You picked Kool-Aid Man?
...Really? Over 100 characters and you pick Kool-Aid Man?
I've seen men. You're Kool-Aid monster.
...Have some respect for yourself, ~player~. Kool-Aid Man?
Unless it's April Fool's Day, you shouldn't be picking this character.
If this is what Earthlings find attractive, I'm glad the colonists left.
I'm not sure how to feel about being picked by the same player who'd choose Kool-Aid Man.
You must really hate me to stick me on a table with this idiot, ~player~.
I hear you're good with a sword. Maybe you could talk to Jura...if you seemed capable of talking.
I see you value words about as much as I do.
...Is this some primitive men's language?
So you can speak. What was that all about?
So you were just making fun of me...
Grunting and screaming around women is what I'd expect from a Tarakkian.
Why are you masking your face? It's something a Tarakkian man might do around women, frozen in terror.
I thought Earth men would have the courage to look women in the eye, but it seems the Tarakkian way runs deep.
If you're so ashamed to be here that you'd hide your face, you should leave before you lower my opinion of men any further.
Your frame is very slight for a man...but I've seen smaller ones. You're not afraid to make eye contact with women, are you?
Maybe I just lack the experience, but...are you a man or a woman?
Men and women have always looked pretty distinct to me...and then there's you.
So, you live underground? Sounds claustrophobic...
You were created in a lab? So was I, technically...
So, you were made in a lab...like every woman on Mejare, and every man on Tarak.
...Well, I've never seen men as the symbols of cleanliness, but I support it all the same. Women have outdone you there.
Mister Clean...you men aren't fooling anyone. Women make cleanliness a species identity.
My picture of men as a girl was dirty, savage animals. You're certainly a step in the right direction--more like women.
It's strange how some men shave their heads...our navigator does, too. It's the least men could do to be as clean as women.
I'll be honest. You don't look like much of a man.
I thought men were supposed to be tall and strong. Of course, Hibiki proves that wrong...
Why do you have wings? I thought men were human, but maybe not.
Children aren't allowed in here, even male ones.
A "Street Fighter"...I've been in street fights. Nothing to brag about.
"Eternal Fighting Champion"? You shouldn't rest on your laurels.
I came to see a man here...you're certainly a lot of man.
Ryuji, correct? Normally I'd be curious about your athletic training...but with a man, I'd rather not.
I was interested when I heard an athletic trainer would be joining us...but it's just a man.
Is it true you conduct athletic training? Admirable...but I'm not comfortable doing that with a man.
You should know I'm into athletics myself...but you're a man, so it's best we left it at that.
You solve mysteries? Duero's the only man I know who's smart enough for that.
You solve mysteries? The Paksis is one big glowing mystery...
You solve mysteries? You look like you can barely get yourself out of bed.
Man or woman, unkempt appearances don't impress me.
...You're an "alchemist"? I knew men weren't as advanced, but to subscribe to ancient pseudoscience...
The fact that "alchemy" is still considered science on Earth is evidence enough that it's too far gone to save.
I've read about ancient Earth "alchemists" haphazardly mixing chemicals in their basements. It doesn't lead to spacecrafts.
...Who are you? I'm wary enough of men, and meeting one who claims to practice "alchemy" nonsense doesn't help.
So, you help that girl fight vampires? I work with a few men...out of necessity.
I wonder what the blood colony's people must look like. Probably blushing all the time.
Vampires suck blood, huh...there's probably an Earth colony for blood out there somewhere.
These "vampires" of yours sound fearsome. The Harvest probably wants blood from somewhere, too...
You seem immature...but then, Hibiki makes that work for himself.
..."N." A codename? It's strange that a man would dress with such personal flair but hide his true identity.
...You wear so many personal decorations, but you won't share your full name with us? Men are a strange race...
Simply calling yourself "N"...men are nothing if not efficient. Or if it's a codename, why decorate yourself and stand out?
...Highly decorated dress...a short name...quiet. You're not like the other men I know...they wouldn't hide their identities.
...A fur coat... and a tail. I was taught men were animals, but I thought I knew better at this point...
...How bizarre. A man who's just as bestial as I was taught they were...are you really human?
...On my homeworld, women are raised to view men as savage beasts dressed in rags. I was not expecting to see the very image of that on Earth.
...What are you? Some wolf-man hybrid from an Earth genetic facility? Just when I thought men weren't the animals Mejare said they were...
...When I was told there'd be a male adventurer here, I expected someone more... muscular.
Don't men tend to be taller and more muscular than women? Civilians are one thing, but I was told I'd meet a warrior.
...Is this what passes for warrior men on Earth? I'm used to them towering over me on ground raids.
...I wonder if Tarakkian soldiers have given me a false impression of men's size. You're scrawny for a "warrior."
...A device for holding cards? It could probably be used as a bludgeon, and that's if it isn't hiding something more lethal.
..."Chazz," was it? I hope you don't think you're fooling anyone with such an overdesigned card-holder.
If that ridiculous contraption is your idea of concealing a weapon, men are even less subtle than I thought.
I have a hard time believing the hardened, practical male species I'm used to would wear a device to hold playing cards. That's a weapon.
...You're the leader of a criminal organization, correct? I'm an officer in a Mejarian pirate group--our main targets are military bases. What about you?
I'm told you lead a syndicate on this planet known as "Team Skull." I'm part of the "Magno Family"--we typically raid army stockpiles. What do you do?
I should've expected Earth's criminal element to complement me here. A man, and a syndicate leader, is interesting...what does "Team Skull" target?
A man leading a criminal group...you're certainly not as aged as our leader. Who are the main targets of "Team Skull"?

state.text: It's just like a man to bring such a conspicuous weapon--what are you doing with explosives? You'll kill us all if you fire!
What kind of incompetent security does this establishment have, letting a man bring a rocket launcher inside? Are you trying to kill all of us?
Why do you have an explosives launcher in such close quarters? Are you insane? Or do men have no sense of self-preservation?
What's the meaning of this, casually slinging rockets over your back? Don't think insane recklessness will intimidate me!

case.state: You're a soldier, correct? We're currently holding several male soldiers prisoner aboard our ship...you seem more relaxed than any of them.
...You were introduced as a "Grand Caster." I'm not familiar with that title--is it unique to Earth culture, or just men's?
...You keep referring to yourself as the "Supreme Leader." To be fair, I'm accustomed to seeing young male children as Earth's leaders...
...What exactly are you the "Supreme Leader" of? You wouldn't be the first young boy in a position of power on Earth...
...I suppose calling me, or any Mejarian, "gay" wouldn't be incorrect. In fact, it's our entire culture's lifestyle...
...A haunted plush doll that calls others "gay." Mejare wouldn't even have a word for same-sex romance... that's just romance to us.
...I'm afraid I don't have a "dick" for you to suck. I see this "gay" insult is more directed at men...but it would apply to Mejarians.
...Do Earth children really play with such a grotesque doll? Mejarian girls' toys are all beautiful dolls...or model imperial ships.
...If Mejare ever decided to manufacture a "man" doll to teach girls the horrors of the male species, I imagine you're what it would look like.
...Hm. Is this the evil alien Earth children are taught to hate from a young age? You could be repurposed to show Mejarian girls what men look like.
...I'm surprised a boxer would show up to strip poker in his actual ring attire. But the thought process behind men's decisions still eludes me...
You aren't wearing much...not that I would expect a boxer's outfit to be elaborate. Why you're not wearing street clothes is another male mystery.

...I know it's been some time, ~player~, but you lost. I can give you orders if you'd like.
One of the first things we learn as pirates is that it only matters how a fight ends.
I guess my nudity wasn't distracting you very much. Girls who seem oblivious to sex tend to get made fun of on Mejare.
...You were doing well, ~player~. I don't have a rank over you, but stripped down to nothing like this, I feel like I can address you as just--me.
A good poker game gives us time to work through our thoughts. I remember Gascogne sitting me down for one when I was fighting other recruits in reg.
Stuck naked like this, I think I was worried about you the most. You hadn't lost in a while.
It's not just ability that matters, but your attitude. I always watch how my crewmates handle a sudden downturn.
I'm not used to a civilian holding such an advantage over me.
You really have been playing well, ~player~...
You've outplayed me all night...
I needed more runs like yours...
You had a streak...now close this out.
That was an impressive streak. I should introduce you to Gascogne...
Don't stop now...a pilot goes for the kill.
...Oh, I didn't lose the hand. Take a look--I had full expectations to.
I won with a high card...that never feels right.
I don't enjoy winning because my opponent had something even worse than I did...
...Hm. We both had just a high card...I once won a hand against our quartermaster like that. She praised me, but...
...A high card. That's about as satisfying as an enemy dodging into your misplaced shot...
I wonder how battle-sharpened the average Earth woman is...winning with a high card is certainly unsatisfying for me.
...I won with that? I should've spent the hand working...
...I won with a high card...I hate winning on a fluke. Games should be about dominating your opponent.
...It's not often I'm afforded a break. Your hand managed to do it.
With my only small item gone, that was a lucky break...
...Hm? I expected to lose that hand...you'll have to wait longer to see my shoulders, then.
That's unfortunate luck, ~player~. I can't honestly say I outplayed you that round.
I'll be honest--that was a lucky break on my end. You can see how my own hand wasn't much better.
My hand wasn't strong myself. The line between victory and defeat was as thin as my flightsuit.
I see you're not as strict as I am, ~player~. I make sure to punish my pilots' mistakes.
I had already resigned myself to losing that round. I shouldn't be so defeatist next time.
Mhmhm. That's why you never give up hope, in poker or in piloting.
Oh...? You had a high card as well, ~player~...it really could have gone either way for us.
...It looks like you were just a bit out of position, ~player~.
...I really thought I'd be showing my breasts this round. Just look at my cards.
How considerate of you to rescue me from removing my bra, ~player~. It's almost like being saved by a squadmate.
...That was close, ~player~. My bra will be staying on for another round.
Oh? ...I had to double-check our cards. It doesn't get much closer than that.
...Hah. I was fully prepared to take the hit that hand.
...Did you throw that hand to make fun of me, ~player~? Maybe the women here can be just as vindictive.
...It looks like you saved me from stripping fully naked, ~player~. I'd only make that sacrifice for a crewmate-- maybe men have forced women to stick together here.
...How ironic that an Earthling would save me from baring my body further. The forces I've met want to tear me to pieces.
...That was a tense round. Look at my cards--I nearly lost.
...I didn't expect to survive that round. Playing a high card is like flying out with the kamikaze set--full missiles, and only enough fuel for one trip.
...Just a high card. I wouldn't expect to succeed on a mission if I flew out with one missile.
Ehehe...mhmhmhm. I really thought I was done for there--I need to be more optimistic.
...I had to double-check our cards. I just barely won that hand--I'm sure that's small comfort for you.
Mhmhm. Look at my cards--you were this close to knocking me out.
...I had a high card. Are you looking down on me, ~player~?
...I still won. I guess even a pirate's worst can beat a civilian's best.
Mhmhm. I made a habit of edging out my crewmates for higher piloting positions, too.
...I can't get much closer to defeat than that. Good luck next round, ~player~.
...Oh? I thought I'd lost for sure. Earth finds new ways to surprise me all the time.
...I trust this sort of thing doesn't embarrass you.
I wonder if Earth women feel shame...the way that men must treat them.
...If you're nervous, know that women aren't always as judgmental as you might fear...
You've lost, ~player~...a rookie pilot of mine might start making excuses here.
...Don't delay things, ~player~.
I keep having to stop myself from giving you orders...
I'm so used to our crew...either I'd be ordering you to strip, or being ordered to strip myself.
To see women strip, I need only to shower after a mission...
...For the record, I'm scouting for any potential pilot candidates here.
I can't imagine Earth women take stripping lightly. Men are always around...
I wonder how competitive Earth women get...or if this is all in good fun for you.
You cost me my eyepiece...I'm not feeling so sympathetic anymore.
...Move us along, ~player~.
Half-nude women are not a rare sight on the Nirvana...one of my finest pilots essentially wears a swimsuit with shoulder pads.
You can't have come here and been that embarrassed to strip...
I'm not sure if Earth is a strange planet, or if this place just attracts unusual women...
I feel much more involved in this game now that I've lost clothing myself...
Poker is a game of wits, you know...now that I think about it, whichever planet is Earth's brain colony would be quite fearsome.
...Was that poor luck, ~player~? Or did you take an unneeded risk?
...I'm sure your body is fine, ~player~. You're very beautiful.
You aren't hard to read, ~player~...it is my job to sense what girls are thinking, you know.
~player~, you're up. I'm curious how you'll handle high-pressure situations.
Even though this game is mostly luck, it's not a helpful mentality...
You've got the worst hand, ~player~. Did you expect as much?
Almost any game will boil down to skill. That said, I'd much rather make this a target shooting competition.
Singling women out of the group like this reminds me of our pilot rollcall. Speaking of which...
Every round, there's a part of me that has to remember this is strip poker...
...Are you ready, ~player~? You should have chosen what to strip ahead of time.
...You may not say much, ~player~, but you look frustrated. I suppose you expected an easy victory.
...Is something wrong, ~player~? Just take some deep breaths.
If you'd like, I can offer advice about what cards you should have swapped.
~player~'s turn? ...I should put this away. She won't be speaking much.
...Have you played this game before, ~player~? On my homeworld, it's considered a lowlife pastime.
I'm grateful for every round I survive with my bra on. There's only so much one can do here.
Earth's Harvest cubes can be intimidating. Its women, far less so.
~player~, did you exchange the same sort of cards you usually do?
If nothing else, ~player~, you take your losses with quiet dignity.
Let's see how an Earth woman handles herself when the stakes rise...
Maybe sharing a sex is enough to feel camaraderie on this planet when men surround you. On Mejare, it takes more than that.
...It takes a moment to check everyone's cards, doesn't it? If we could trust a computer, electronic poker would be quicker.
...It's strange to talk to a civilian woman. I haven't spoken to anyone but a pirate, outlaw, or soldier in a long time.
I do appreciate an Earth woman's insight. We have a refugee girl from Pluto who seems to know about men, but she's fourteen--I can't ask her.
...I'm so used to ranking either above or below the women I speak to, always trapped on the ship. But here, we're both just...girls.
It'll take more than the looming threat of nudity to rattle me, ~player~. I lead a squadron because of my cool head.
...Is it rude to look another woman in the eye while your breasts are out? My homeworld considers it quite intimate, but pirates can't get hung up about that sort of thing.
...Whenever you're ready, ~player~.
Playing cards with the breeze on my breasts...our typical tactics are to surprise and flank the enemy. Earth has a knack for putting us on the defensive.
...It's a nice change of pace to not have to give any orders. Everyone just follows the rules.
Always riding up...don't worry about me, ~player~. It's your turn, anyway.
I guess it's been a common trend for our crew to be forced to retreat several times before pushing back.
...It's your turn, ~player~. I don't know why you're looking at me, but it isn't strange where I come from.
...You shouldn't write off a weakened enemy, you know.
This really isn't so stressful compared to my job. With crewmates, it might even be mundane.
I might've been more prepared for this than I realized. Managing a fleet of excitable young girls versus a table of embarrassed ones.
Maybe I could play one-on-one poker games with my pilots to get to know them better, like Gascogne does. Jura would be a good start.
The pessimist in me sees all the ways I could lose each round. I'd been getting better about that--it must be the men rubbing on me.
...It's you, ~player~. The cards speak for themselves.
...I liken this sort of thing to piloting, but it used to be fighting. I think I could impress if we had crew sparring sessions.
Maybe I should call formation delta-four. That's when our lower-ranked pilots fall in behind me.
...Are you ready, ~player~? I can't say I was happy seeing you clothed at this point.
Another woman. That's a lot easier.
Another woman. Not a problem for me.
Let me get something out of losing tonight...
Give me something to see so my mind doesn't drift to my crewmates...
Good thing someone loses every round...
It's like I'm back home, watching women strip...
Agh...~player~. W-whatever I let slip out, please don't think too much of it...
It's OK, ~player~...don't take losing as hard as I do.
At least the pressure is off me for once...
Losing here isn't so bad, ~player~. I feel better now...
No one likes a whiner, ~player~...
I've lost and masturbated to completion...you have nothing to complain about.
(Ooh, Meia, look how cute she is. You've been staring at ~name~...I noticed.)
(This is strip poker, after all. Women won't mind if you stare...)
(Feel free to ogle the cuties. Our rookies always ogle you, after all.)
~name~...ah.
...Mei, Mei, Mae, and Meia. Never have I felt so unique.
What's the meaning of this? Who organized this table to be as confusingly-named as possible?
...Let me make sure I understand. You're named Mei, as are you, and you. And my name is Meia. Earth was confusing enough already.
Is this the bar's ridiculous idea of a prank? Are there any other "Meis" I should know about?
...Mei, Mei, Mae, and Meia. Never have I felt so unique.
What's the meaning of this? Who organized this table to be as confusingly-named as possible?
...Let me make sure I understand. You're named Mei, as are you, and you. And my name is Meia. Earth was confusing enough already.
Is this the bar's ridiculous idea of a prank? Are there any other "Meis" I should know about?
...Mei, Mei, Mae, and Meia. Never have I felt so unique.
What's the meaning of this? Who organized this table to be as confusingly-named as possible?
...Let me make sure I understand. You're named Mei, as are you, and you. And my name is Meia. Earth was confusing enough already.
Is this the bar's ridiculous idea of a prank? Are there any other "Meis" I should know about?
...Women always say it's not the clothes themselves that determine fashion, but the body within them. I think that applies here.
...Is that you, Misty? Next to the old one...we can certainly see who wears it better.
It really is the beauty of the woman that makes clothes work...I hope I could wear my old outfits better than I used to.
...How bizarre. A woman wearing her girlhood clothes, and the very image of her girlhood...you look better now, Misty.

state.text: Tharja...? Are you planning another attack? I've given my warnings!

case.state:
...It's your turn, Jessie. Stop flirting.
...Why are you irritated this time, Tharja? Jessie must be nearly twice your age.

state.text: ...Stop shouting, Tharja. Or--not again. Another breast-shrinking spell?
It's not your turn, Tharja. Why are you--wait, because Jessie dared to flirt with ~player~? If you cause another scene--!

case.state: ...You two are classmates? ...Is this some kind of date? Between--male and female?
Classmates? ...Well, Mejarian girls date in school, too...men and women must do it on Earth.
Interesting location for classmates to date each other. That is what you're doing, right? ...Men and women?
A young man and woman, from the same school...not what I'd choose for a date, but then, I wouldn't date a man.
...You two are classmates? Men and women in school together...unthinkable.
Classmates? Futaba certainly seems like the booksmart type...I have a hard time picturing men in school at all.
I can't believe men and women could function in school together...and that they'd play strip poker together afterwards.
You're classmates, and you'd play this together? It'd be awkward enough just attending school with men...
...I'm well aware that no technological advantage is needed here, Rinkah.
It's true that even ancient-looking women can win here...poker requires no technology.
In combat, I might think little of your ancient technology. In poker...you have a chance.
Fiercely confident in your friends...a good trait in a woman. Our technology is superior, but in poker, that matters little.
Oh, perfect...not a few minutes in and these women are already at each other's throats.
Am I intruding on something? Who are you two, and why are you fighting already?
Do you two know each other? Or is it just in Earth women's nature to fight like this?
I'd prefer if we didn't start this friendly card game with a fistfight. I came a long way to Earth just to deal with you two.
What's the meaning of this? Are you two enemies? I didn't sign up for two women going for each others' throats.
If you two have a personal--or professional--squabble, you can take it outside. I didn't come to Earth for this.
These two...I should've known a fight would break out right away. It seems as if they've fought before, though.
...Did I walk into a streetfight in progress? That's not something I want to go back to...actually, you two seem familiar with each other.
...I'd compliment your figures--both of you--but you seem ready to pounce on each other. And may have done so in the past.
...Sayori, are sure you want to hang around this girl? She...seems off.
I'd be wary if this girl is your friend, Sayori. It's my job to spot threats...
If this girl is who you'd call a friend, Sayori...then I'd say you should work on your character judgment. She isn't trustworthy.
I lived on the streets for a time...I know when a woman is manipulating others for her purposes. Monika isn't your friend, Sayori.
...Do you two know each other? You're speaking professionally...and you're both...er, fit.
...What's the meaning of this chatter? Do you know Chun-Li from somewhere, Cammy? ...You're both very muscular, after all.
Did I come down to Earth in the midst of an investigation? Two muscular women who seem to know each other, and talking about crime...
I didn't expect to see...such well-built women here. And the two even seem to have a working relationship...
Hello, Misty. It's nice to see you again... apparently this is an outfit you wore as a girl? I lost all my old dresses and skirts...
If I had to bring something I wore as a girl here, it'd have to be my old school uniform...I suppose you spent your time outdoors?
Hello again, Misty. I see you wore athletic outfits even as a girl--believe it or not, I used to wear sweaters and skirts.
I hope you've been well, Misty. I see you're reconnecting with your youth--my parents certainly didn't dress me in shorts and overalls.
Hello again, Elesa. I trust you're well--that's a nicer look than last time. Slim, efficient, and simple.
Is that really you, Elesa? You change your look as much as the average Mejarian--I prefer this one's simplicity.
...Elesa? I almost didn't recognize you with a different hair color--and outfit. This looks much sleeker and more practical.
Hello, Elesa. I see you've opted for a more practical side of fashion--it's better to move around like this, isn't it?
You're...a little thin on clothes to be playing this, don't you think?
Are you making fun of me? You've barely got anything on.
I've heard of Valentine's Day...but that's for love, not indecency.
Shouldn't you have come to a strip poker game...clothed?
That's about how much Barnette wears with her apron.
Hello again, Nami. I'm glad you've adopted that short hairstyle--it's more befitting of a pirate.
Is that you, Nami? You almost look younger since I last saw you...but I approve of your haircut.
Hello, Nami. As you might imagine, I recommend that any fighting woman cuts her hair short...though yours was beautiful either way.
I see you've taken after my haircut since we last met, Nami. It's quite practical--and it even seems to have made you look younger.
Not you again. What is this new fascination with appearing "normal"? It doesn't fit that garish Christmas outfit.
...If you're attempting to pass as "normal," Tharja, your old outfit was less conspicuous.
...You're that manic woman from last time. You won't deceive me into thinking you're "normal," especially dressed as a reindeer.
...Tharja? You still have that same obsessive look in your eye. And those clothes wouldn't even be "normal" on my planet.
...L'Arachel. You said you're a "Harvest Festival Princess," correct? Do you realize Earth is harvesting organs from its colonists?

state.text: ...A "Harvest Festival Princess"? L'Arachel, do you know where Earth's harvested organs come from? Or is this a trap--?
L'Arachel, you're dressed...for a Harvest festival? This is a trap, isn't it? I knew I shouldn't have returned here--!

case.state: A scientist...is the princess of a Harvest festival? How twisted are Earthlings that you'd celebrate us being slaughtered--!
Emi...? What have you done to yourself? When we last met, you were upbeat and in good health...don't go down this path.

state.text: ...Is that you, Emi? I hope this isn't some attempt to prove yourself...I once made the same mistake.
...Emi, have you started dressing and acting this way to impress others? I once did the same thing...I'm not proud of those days.

case.state: ...Emi, if this is some rebellious phase you're going through, I'd advise against it. I was like you once, and I only survived because of my size.
...Emi, you shouldn't be acting like this. A girl your size won't last in streetfights and gangs--take it from my own experience.
That's a cute costume, Estelle. Mejare has Halloween, too, though we're taught that no monster is as frightening as men.

state.text: On Mejare, "witches" usually refers to man-sympathizers...but we do have Halloween. You look nice, Estelle.
Hello, Estelle. I'm happy to see Halloween is mostly the same on Earth--women dressing in cute costumes.

case.state: Oh, it's you again, Estelle. I see Earth's dress-up custom for Halloween is no different than Mejare's--we retained a lot of Earth holidays.
Misato, that's...very stark makeup. It almost looks like how Mejare depicts men--ghastly skeletons of death.

state.text: ...Minus their size, that makeup looks much like Mejare's images of men. Taut features stretched over fearsome skeletons...
...Misato, this makeup is for Halloween? It looks akin to a sacrifice ritual--my homeworld always showed men as barbaric skeletons.

case.state: ...Is that you, Misato? You were quite beautiful before, but... is this whole planet a death cult? Mejare always shows men performing sacrifices...
Oh, it's you, Jessie. I hardly recognized you in such an impressive dress...I'd have expected you to just put on a Christmas hat.

state.text: Do most Earth women dress up so elaborately for Christmas, Jessie? Mejare celebrates it, as well...with hats.
...I see Earth takes its Christmas celebrations very seriously. Especially since you dressed so casually when I last met you.

case.state: I can only imagine the looks I'd get if I wore such a flashy outfit for Mejarian Christmas. Is it an Earth custom to dress up to this degree?
I see you've...died since we last met, Weiss. My apologies...what happened at your wedding?
...Weiss, have you--died? That's a grim reminder of fate--were you marrying a man? Did he kill you?
...Well, now. It's good to know women can keep their forms after death...I assume you died at your wedding?
...Weiss? You--you died at your wedding? I knew trusting men to that extreme was dangerous--!
...An outdated model, now a ghost...I didn't think your situation would be so literal.
...Hello, "Megu." I was actually curious to meet Megumin again, but I suppose I'll have to settle for your crude image of her.
...Is that you, Aella? I see your weaponry has progressed since we last met... though kinetic guns are still not on par with laser equivalents.
Hello, Pinkie. I see you're celebrating Earth's Easter...is it typical for women to dress as rabbits in observance of this?
It's hard for me to know what's personal and what's cultural on Earth holidays...do women usually dress as rabbits for Easter? Or...just skimpy?
It's good to see you again, Estelle. I'd heard this planet has warm summers--that looks like the kind of outfit I might wear myself.
Is that you, Estelle? I used to enjoy Mejare's summers quite a bit, though they were more mild than Earth's. I even had a hat just like that one.
...Weiss, did you say you're here for a tan? My homeworld tends to prefer fairer skin as a beauty standard.
It's nice to see you again, Weiss. You seem more experienced than last time--and you have a new outfit to show that.
Here we go again. I just don't understand.
You can't run away from your problems, Florina...I've tried.
I appreciate women that stand their ground against their fears...
Running away doesn't solve anything...your fears can always run faster.
Oh, for God's sake. I have far more reason to fear men, and I flew all the way here to face them...
Wha--how could anyone be so--are you serious?
What a disgusting woman, offering so bluntly...wait, you're letting her?
Unbelievable that someone could be so lecherous...wait, what? Don't let her touch you!
Wha--Jura, you don't even know this woman! Don't let her near you! Doesn't this place have rules about that?
Earth was devastated many years ago, so it started using its colonies as organ farms. Mejare is the uterus colony...so there's no men.
We've come to know a few men, actually...but Earth's organ-harvesting is why Mejare is nothing but women.
Mejare is just one of Earth's many colonies. It was intentionally settled as women-only for Earth to harvest reproductive organs.
Jura wanted to come here because we don't know much about men. Earth harvests uteri from Mejare, so there's no need for them.
This is how Jura treats everyone. She's quite proud of herself...and to be fair, no disasters have struck because of her.
I'll start reprimanding Jura when she starts endangering others during combat. For now it's just an annoyance.
I'm the squadron leader, yes, but Jura is second-in-command. Besides, she tends to get more serious when on missions...
Jura's second-in-command. She usually does her job...she just tends to get distracted with this sort of thing during downtime.
...Revy seems the type to act on that, Jura.
...Are you sure you want this woman touching you, Jura? I don't want to have to pry her off you.
I don't think Revy responds well to being teased, Jura. Fair warning.
...This isn't going to end without some physicality.
You take orders from this man, Rinkah? ...I guess this is a clash of cultures. No man is commanding me.
Hmhmhm...I'm sorry. It's just that...I would never take orders from a man.
Corrin's your commanding officer, Rinkah? I've fought beside men, but taking orders...no, thanks.
I knew Earth would bring some culture shock, but watching a woman take orders from a man is...well, laughable to a Mejarian.
So you two are classmates? I'd say you're not wearing the same uniform...but that may just be a cultural clash.
Shouldn't schoolmates be wearing identical uniforms? ...Maybe that's just a Mejarian custom.
I see classmates on Earth don't wear identical uniforms. That must be yet another Mejarian indoctrination practice.
I always had to wear a uniform to school on Mejare. If you two are classmates, I guess that's not a requirement on Earth.
Ah, so you two are comrades? I imagine Corrin is the officer, given her more professional look.
It's always good to see two strong women working together. Corrin's wearing armor, so I imagine she's your commanding officer.
Is Corrin your commander, Rinkah? You're speaking like she is, and she's more dressed for the part.
It's nice to see that, even on Earth, women fight together. And apparently the officers wear armor there, too...
I see you brought a friend along for moral support. Either that, or Lyn dragged you here for some sort of exposure therapy.
So...whose initial idea was it to come here? Either you're trying to be more confident, or Lyn is trying to make you that way.
Shame can be crippling, so I can see why you came here. Unless, of course, Lyn just dragged you herself.
I've never seen such a timid woman...I'd expect living around men to make you tough. Did you bring her here, Lyn, or did she bring you?
You two...are sisters? I...I had no idea Earth families were so sexually outgoing.
I was an only child...but I'm fairly certain Mejarian sisters wouldn't play this game together.
Sisters? ...So this is how Earth handles familial relationships.
I understand you grew up together as sisters, but...do you really want to strip naked in public together? Is this normal on Earth?
...What exactly is your relationship? Something related to magic, or just romance?
I see one of you dragged the other here...probably Zizou dragging Sola. Do you two have...a relationship?
Are you two a couple? You certainly seem like opposites...but many Mejarian couples are like that.
I see Earth women are also capable of forming companionships with each other. Good to see, even if you seem very different.
...Sisters? I knew soldiers lacked all common decency, but to drag your siblings into this...
A military woman...and her younger sister. As if I needed confirmation soldiers were depraved.
Soldier women always seem to show me new lows. Bringing their young sisters to strip poker, for instance.
You two are sisters? What kind of disgusting--well, a military woman fits the bill.
Jura, this woman is clearly unhinged. Don't antagonize her.
Jura, we don't know what this woman is capable of--either magically or mentally. Leave her alone.
Don't tease this woman about her obsessions, Jura. Can't you tell she won't take it as a joke?
...Jura, we don't know the extent of this woman's magic. We do know that she's mentally ill, and not afraid to use it.
...Mei, Mei, and Meia. This has to be some stupid prank on the part of this establishment...
...Are there any other "Meis" I should know about? This has to be some sort of joke.
...So, both of you are named Mei. I'll let you figure that out, and count myself lucky to have an "a" to set myself apart.
Hello to both of you...the two Meis. Playing with one similarly-named woman is confusing enough--I can't imagine how you must feel.
...Mei, Mei, and Meia. This has to be some stupid prank on the part of this establishment...
...Are there any other "Meis" I should know about? This has to be some sort of joke.
...So, both of you are named Mei. I'll let you figure that out, and count myself lucky to have an "a" to set myself apart.
Hello to both of you...the two Meis. Playing with one similarly-named woman is confusing enough--I can't imagine how you must feel.
...I've heard that men and women can be siblings on this planet. Are you two sister and..."brother"? Your faces look alike.
...Jolyne, is that man your..."brother," is the word? A male sibling...you and Jotaro have similar bone structure in your faces.
...Jolyne, do you know this man? You seem more surprised than unsettled by the energy he gives off...
...For some reason, I feel the same strange presence from both Jolyne and Kira...a man might be intimidating, but why her? ...Jolyne, do you know this man?
You're awfully dressed-up for this game. Seems pointless when your clothes will come off anyway.
Is that the kind of outfit that attracts men? You'll have an easy time finding a man, then, Jura.
Makeup...don't see the point. Talk to Jura about it...
All dolled-up...just another form of dishonesty.
That's correct. Our commander, B.C., named it. Why?
...You seem rather distressed over the name. Take it up with our commander.
That's correct. Are you interested in its specs, or just the name? Our commander came up with it.
Yes...it's a fusion ship from male and female vessels. B.C., our commander, named it...I offered "the Sonnet."
Earthlings really are clueless about their own colonies...or perhaps it's because you're a man. We're not aliens.
Is this xenophobia or ignorance, N? Mejare was settled by Earth women. Jura and I are humans.
Ignorance of your own planet's colonies... typical of an Earthling, and a man. We're humans like you.
...Up until recently, we were taught men were aliens. I can only assume Earthlings are taught such about their fellow humans on Mejare.
...Jura, I haven't seen you in the gym lately. Considering you want to show off your nude body like this, I hope you're finding the time.
You were quite eager to come here when I haven't seen you exercise lately. Don't sit around scheming and eating Barnette's cooking when you should be staying fit.
...Jura, you usually join me in the gym for a bit when I'm on the treadmill. I haven't seen you recently--was this why?
...There are too many conflicts of interest for me to pursue romance. It's just part of being an officer...I'm sure you understand, Erufuda.
...I've explained this numerous times to Jura, but I'm in an awkward place for romance in terms of the chain of command. It's not feasible...
...There are few crew members who hold equal authority with me. You had a high status in your world, correct, Erufuda? Then you'd understand.
...Jessie, if you're not serious about your advances on ~player~, you seem to be irritating Tharja.
...Jessie, you should leave ~player~ alone. Tharja is obsessed with them and clearly mentally ill.
...Tharja, Jessie is an older woman who's just flirting. There's no need to guard ~player~ with this much jealousy.
...Tharja, Jessie has a child who's around your age. Why do you feel so threatened when she addresses ~player~?
You work as a model? You and Jura here should talk.
You work as a model? Isn't that you've always wanted, Jura?
Seems Earth women are capable of being vain, too, Jura...and models. Have fun with this girl.
This "academy" of yours sounds like a school...Mejarian schools are just government propaganda.
So, you go to school with men? Must be a pain getting them to sit still during a lecture.
I'm told you're into government. Mejare's is in need of reform, to put it bluntly.
I'm told you're into art. If you want that life-sized portrait, Jura, here's your chance.
This "academy" of yours sounds like a school. I dropped out of school...
I'm told you're into art. I know Duero painted Parfet something once, so maybe you two should talk.
You have a roommate at this school of yours? I'd never be comfortable without my single room.
You work as a model? So does Jura here. Fire away.
You work as a model? This is your chance, Jura. Make connections.
You go to school with men? Sounds distracting.
You're a student...I dropped out of school. Bad times.
I hope this "high school" of yours is a little less indoctrinating than Mejare's.
You're a "witcher"? What do you think, Jura? Was it for owning an anatomy book?
You're a "witcher"? Mejarians who associate with men get called witches...like us.
The word "witch" gets us a little touchy sometimes...I apologize.
The same person, both male and female...that shreds any doubts I had about men and women being the same species.
I wonder what Hibiki would look like as a woman...probably taller, honestly.
Male and female...you two would make perfect test subjects for Tarakkian scientists.
The same person, one born on Mejare and the other on Tarak.
I'll be honest...you both look like women, and I'm not sure which one is prettier.
You look like Paiway's first attempt at makeup.
So much makeup...I don't wear any. Just gets in the way.
See what too much makeup leads to, Jura? You shouldn't concern yourself with it.
...Do I have to be involved in this? I didn't even lose...and I don't want the ship seeing this.
The focus is on Jura. Don't rope me into this...I don't want my pilots seeing me here.
It's Jura's turn. Just take two pictures of her and be done with it...she won't care if the ship sees her here.
Can't you just photograph Jura? This could reach the ship...
We're both fighter pilots on the Nirvana, a fusion ship. I'm commander; Jura is second-in-command.
We're part of the fighter Dread team of the Nirvana, a ship created by the fusion of male and female machinery.
We're pilots for the Nirvana, a ship created in an energy fusion accident. Which reminds me...I have scheduling to do.
I'm the leader of our Dread squadron on the fusion ship Nirvana. Jura is second-in-command...as you can see by her attitude.
Your planet has no men, either? ...Maybe Mejare isn't the only uterus colony Earth has.
You're kidding--Gensokyo has no men? But then--perhaps Earth has more than one colony for uteri.
Gensokyo has only women, as well? Mejare was established for Earth to harvest uteri--that might be its plans for you, too.
I'd watch Earth carefully, Miko. It plans to use Mejare as a uterus harvest planet--if Gensokyo has no men, they might use it, too.
I'd be surprised if Jura parted with her boots too quickly...the only thing she loves more is her dress.
I doubt it. Jura has plenty of small things, Sei...she's just getting started.
I wouldn't bet on that, Sei. You should be able to see all her jewelry left...
Jura loves her own body, Barnette, her dress, and her boots, in that order...so they've probably got a while to go.
Tease me? Yes. But this place provides a particularly good avenue for it.
...Tease me and call me boring? This is more than usual, but yes, she does.
...You'll have to be more specific, Sei. If you mean calling me a sourpuss, yes, and even more so today.
A strip poker game is the perfect opportunity for Jura to call me both perverted and boring, if that's what you mean.
No, she just has absolutely no shame...and a supreme confidence in her body.
It's less that she wants to strip and more that she's convinced she's the most attractive woman in the galaxy.
No, she doesn't normally strip in public...but as you can see, she clearly has zero qualms with people admiring her.

state.text: ...I think she just sees this as an opportunity to get more women to ogle her, Sei.

case.state: Captain? I'm the squadron leader...our captain is an elderly woman named Magno Vivan.
...I'm not the captain, I'm the Dread leader. The Nirvana's captain is older than any of us.
The Nirvana's captain is a wise old woman called Magno Vivan. I'm just the squadron officer.
I'm just the Dread team leader. It'll be a long time before I'm our captain's age...
Cute name similarities aside, Jura, this doesn't seem like the kind of woman who laughs things off.
I think everyone will remember the difference, Jura. Unless you start threatening people.
...Jura, please try to evaluate someone's character before flirting with her.
Height, hair color, and general demeanor should be enough to tell you two apart, Jura.
Don't antagonize her, Jura. I can respect a woman who understands the value of silence.
You could do to learn from me or her when it comes to occasionally being quiet.
You can't learn anything from talking, Jura. Kyoko's being smart, listening in on us...
She does have my temperament. Don't take that as an insult, Kyoko...more women should listen to others.
That's an elegant dress...your outfit is like Ezra's, and your sword like Jura's here.
You dress like Ezra...you kind of look like her, too. But the sword is distinctly Jura.
You look pretty good with that sword. Jura, learn from this woman and actually use your sword properly.
As long as you've got that sword, could you teach Jura how to use it? That rapier of hers is just for show.
This is a card game. Why'd you come armed with...whatever that thing is?
You look pretty good with that sword. Jura, take instructions from this woman so you can actually put that rapier to use.
Fascinating. That sword looks like it's made from the lasers our rings use.
Assuming that style exists anywhere, it's too conspicuous. This coloration blends into machinery.
She can be as bubbly as she wants. I doubt she has the responsibilities you or I carry.
She looks young, Jura...and in a better position. She can afford to be happy, so let her.
Wherever she comes from, I'm sure that pattern is optimal. She must wear it for a reason.
I don't think people will be confused. This woman seems a lot more well-known on this planet.
One letter can make all the difference...just like one mistake.
If you actually got us confused, I'd have Duero check your eyes before you posed a danger to the team.
I trust my second-in-command to track the subtle differences between Mei and I.
Oh, good, another of me. Now I can take a day off of bossing Jura around.
Two Meias? Look at that, Jura. The worst day of your life.
Playing with more than one of me is sweet. Have you extended the same love to Jura here?
I'm glad you like me enough to play with more than one of me, ~player~. Do you like Jura, too?
Two of me? Give Jura some attention, too, ~player~. She's not a bad person at heart.
Wha--don't bring up Misty. It's not like she'll understand.
You--I--Misty and I are not an item. I just give her advice.
You know perfectly well Misty's into men, Jura...and also that she's too young.
Why do you try to twist my relationship with Misty into love? She just...needs guidance.
You just want attention...
I wanted a challenge, and I get you.
...Insufferable.
For God's sake...
Is it Moon's turn again? Perfect, no reason to care...
Walking Mejarian propaganda, this girl...look what men have done to her.
I know a male doctor who'd like to inspect you for diseases, Moon...and the limits of female physiology.
You wear quite a bit for a girl so eager to strip. At least that gives me work time...
...I'm glad you're here, Misato. You paint a more flattering picture of an Earth woman with experience with men.
You should know that Moon fits the Mejarian stereotype of a woman who sympathizes with men, Misato. You're a much more respectable example.
It's nice to see, in Misato, an Earth woman who's had sex with men and hasn't become a shambling wreck. Moon is the shambling wreck.
This is quite the mixed message about men. You seem well-adjusted, Misato, but Moon might represent the result of prolonged male contact.
...Navi, do you know this woman? You're all excited...does she live on Planet Hyrule, as well?
...Is there something about Nayru we should know, Navi? You're acting as if she has some authority on Planet Hyrule...
Nayru is from Planet Hyrule, too, then? I see women can vary dramatically there...you're quite excited, Navi.
Two women from Planet Hyrule, then? And not very similar...apparently Nayru holds considerable authority over Navi.
You're a goddess? Don't be so vain.
You're a goddess because you live in the sky? There's a lot more to the universe than that.
A "goddess"? I'm sorry if I ever called you vain, Jura. This is a new one.
You have some competition for extravagant dress, Jura. And vanity, apparently.
I feel your pain. I command a short, overconfident man myself.
Well, this is one way to grow closer to your colleagues. I sure wouldn't want any crewmates here.
Surely a goddess wouldn't need a man to help her.
You study human culture? What exactly are you?
You study human culture? I could probably learn from you...
You study human culture? Duero has an anatomy book you might be interested in reading...
"Pearl"? Jura's already a big fan of yours.
And you call me chilly, Jura. At least I show my face.
You look like that outfit has never come off.
You can show your face, Raven...I know being open with people can be hard.
Clearly I need to show less emotion, then.
You're right. I could really improve my stoicism by watching her.
A concession? I thought you were going to tease me all night.
I'm sure she has her reasons. Stoicism is important for a leader...
You're certainly acting more cheerful, Raven. Perhaps I should follow suit...
Something about this game lightened you up in a hurry. That was supposedly why I came here...
Well, Jura, if you had doubts stripping can improve a woman's spirits...if it worked for Raven, there's hope for me.

state.text: Something about stripping has brought out a lighter side of you. Now everyone will expect that of me.

case.state: I'm not sure I'd want to date someone who'd agree to it in a seedy place like this.
Unless she's heading to Mejare soon, I can't see that relationship working out.
You seem far more interested, Jura. She is blonde, after all.
Maybe you could flirt with her and bring her back. Barnette could use some target practice.
Maybe if she agreed to join the crew...but what from I hear, she hunts pirates.
That's quite the outfit. You may have competition, Jura...but then, you like that.
I've heard Earth women dress like you to attract men. Mejarians do it to attract each other...
Well, you're certainly devoted to matching colors. I wear what I have.
A martial artist? You must be proud of your...assets. Both of them.
I can see two reasons why you and Jura are going to get along this evening. And your martial arts skills aren't one of them.
You're a martial artist? Even with...er...you're not off-balance at all?
...Are you really a martial artist? You must have quite the developed musculature...on your back.
You're...a little pale. Are you feeling alright?
So pale...muscular, but...you look sickly.
And you call me pale. This woman's marble-white.
...Is there no sun on your planet? I'm...so sorry.
That's a vivid hair color...look, Jura, another one.
You're a fiery one...she's how I picture your and Barnette's daughters, Jura.
My crewmates and I all have different hair colors...you've certainly got the energy befitting yellow.
Genetic engineering on Mejare has resulted in some pretty outlandish hair colors...your yellow betrays an intense personality.
You work in a team of women? Well...seems Earth and Mejare aren't that different after all. You've even got the fire of Jura here.
Good to see a woman who can carry herself, apparently...you've certainly got the spirit for it.
I hope you realize the kindness I'm doing you by dressing this way, ~player~. That other Meia is wearing my favorite bodysuit.
I decorated myself like this for you, ~player~...just so you know. That bodysuit is much more comfortable--and sleek.
Did you have to invite a normally-dressed clone of me, ~player~? It's just making me miss my bodysuit even more.
...~player~, do you have something to tell me, picking both of my costumes? For the record, I prefer suits.
Wouldn't you agree a bodysuit is a better look for me, ~player~? It's practical--and it reveals my figure without showing skin.
If your idea of a perfect Valentine's Day is spending time with me in two different outfits, ~player~...that's really flattering.
That Cupid costume is ridiculous enough in front of a mirror. ~player~, you're embarrassing me.
...Well, ~player~? Do you prefer me in a bodysuit or a ridiculous Cupid outfit?
Cupid Meia? ...~player~, are you trying to engineer some sort of clone-threesome with me?
Mirrors didn't do this justice. Seeing me in that Cupid outfit from every angle...how do you like me better, ~player~?
That Monster Girl outfit is certainly revealing. You should know, ~player~...I'd prefer a partner who likes me in my suit.
...Are you trying to decide which outfit you like better, ~player~? I am not dressing up like that all the time.
I'm not sure how to feel, ~player~, knowing that you don't think Valentine's Day is romantic enough with only one of me.
...Two of me, and we're both in Cupid outfits? I can only help you so much in finding love, ~player~.
Normally I'd like you liked me by choosing a clone, ~player~...but I think you just want a Cupid's help.
You do realize this is just a Valentine's costume, ~player~? Picking more Cupids won't magically bestow you with love.
I hope you're not expecting us Cupids to find love for you, ~player~. Unless...you're saying you want me around.
...Are you done insulting us? You weren't even brave enough to fight when you were armed--and stay away from Jura.
I'm sick of you running your mouth. Insult me if you want, but don't you dare involve my second-in-command.
Leave Jura out of this, Revy. Your quarrel is with me--but, of course, you're a coward who picks on those weaker than her.
