Don't you dare lay a hand on my pilots, Revy. I suppose you're too cowardly to fight me.
Is it true you're a swordswoman? Jura, this girl might make a good practice partner for you.
Jura, have you been practicing with your rapier lately? Apparently this girl has sword experience--you should spar with her later.
Hello again, Weiss. That's a different dress than when we last met--the colors are closer to what I would wear.
Hello, Weiss. I hope your family is well...is that a different dress? It looks darker and more practical, like something I'd wear.
That's an elaborate outfit... what's Earth's view of Easter? On Mejare, it represents our founders' divine voyage.
I'm curious just what Easter means on Earth. On Mejare, it's the day an angel led us off Earth to escape men.
Easter on Mejare is the day the angel Gynos led us to our new homeworld. What does it mean to Earthlings?
I didn't know Earthlings celebrated Easter. Mejare's Easter is the day we left to found the colony--led by an angel.
That's an unorthodox look for Valentine's...perhaps you feel more comfortable encouraging others' love than finding yours.
That's an interesting choice of outfit, Ochako. I suppose a hero would rather cheer others' love than risk her own heart.
Dressing as someone who encourages others to find love...we're of the same mind, Ochako. Both reluctant.
A Cupid makes others fall in love--just like a Valentine's cheerleader. I struggle with my own feelings, too, Ochako.
I understand black cats are a symbol of misfortune here. Mejare's equivalent is men.
A black cat. Mejare usually uses a man's silhouette to show bad luck--to the surprise of no one here, I'm sure.
I didn't know Earth had such a hatred of black cats. Mejare would have you believe our misfortune comes from men.
Black cats for Halloween, rabbits for Easter...Mejare barely has any animals. We blame bad luck on men.
It's good to see someone who shares my fashion sense...on most days.
Bodysuits can get uncomfortable, wouldn't you agree? I hear you normally wear one.
You pilot a mech? So does Hibiki...and he's learning. But he always dresses the same, unlike you.
So, what's planet Korea like? Never heard of it...is this how people dress there?
You're a pilot, too? Mechs, Dreads, they're all fascinating...even though you're not dressed for the part today.
Easter has nothing to do with rabbits on Mejare. What's so signficant about them on this planet that you'd dress as one?
On Mejare, Easter is the day our founders' divine journey from Earth began. Here, you...celebrate rabbits?
...I take it the rabbit is some sacred animal to Earthlings? Why would you dress as one on Easter?
Why are you dressed as a rabbit for Easter? Mejarian Easter is very much about Mejare--so I'm not sure what Earth honors.
I've heard passersby call you "Dahlia." Is this more deception on your part, Ini?
I'd compliment you on the dress, but I'm curious why some workers here think your name is "Dahlia"...Ini.
That's a nice dress for a woman who deals in deception. Is this "Dahlia" I keep hearing about your alter ego?
I happen to like sundresses and parasols...it's a shame I share a fashion sense with you. Is "Ini" your real name, or "Dahlia"?
...Is that you, Moon? So skin-bleaching procedures exist on Earth...not that it's helped your personality.
Bleached skin...are pale women seen as more promiscuous on Earth? That's how you want us to treat you, after all...
Ugh...not you again. You can bleach your skin and dye your hair, but your lack of self-respect is still sickening.
...Moon? What unnatural procedure did you submit yourself to to bleach your skin? You're not even acting different...
...Hello, Juri. I'm surprised a vagrant thug bothered to dress for summer as she searched for victims.
Juri...I don't suppose you've mellowed out since we last met. Even if you've dressed for the season.
You again...your original outfit would probably have kept you cool in summer. Do you have your original attitude?
Of all the women I had to meet again... seasonal dress never struck me as one of your priorities. Not over starting fights.
I see wedding dresses aren't much different on Earth. But... you usually marry men, correct?
If you ask me, Earth women should take Mejare's lead and marry each other. Men are superfluous with today's technology.
Sometimes I've wondered about getting married... but no woman would marry a pirate. I suppose your fianc is a man?
A gown...Mejare's wedding dresses are a bit sleeker, but the real difference is the other woman at the altar.
You again...the horrible aura you give off is even stronger now. You feel connected to this place somehow...
Monika? Dressed up for Valentine's Day, and giving off even worse vibes than usual. Like we're all pawns to you...
Even dressed up for Valentine's, you make a pit in my stomach. How can a schoolgirl give off such murderous energy?
You again? Today? The look in your eyes is even worse than before--why do I get the feeling it's tied to this place?
Not again...somehow, your aura is even worse today. Overt murderousness rather than passive.
Not you again. Our last game made me feel nauseous...perhaps the summer breeze will help.
You? I was hoping for a relaxing summer's day, and I find the girl whose very presence unnerves me...
...Not the ominous schoolgirl again. She never hurt anyone, and yet just being near her claws at my stomach.
...You can dress in casual summer wear all you want, Monika. I know you're still up to something...our last game made me nauseous.
You look cute in that outfit, Nagisa. Mejare has maid cafs like that, too.
It's been a while since I saw a girl dressed in a maid caf outfit. They exist on Mejare, too...in scattered locations.
...I can't stay stoic when a sweet girl like you dresses up. I visited a few maid cafs on my homeworld...
As if we didn't know it was Valentine's Day, Nagisa comes dressed like that...Mejare's maid cafs were packed around this time, too.
Nugi-chan? You must work for this bar year-round...do you serve ice water?
Hello again, Nugi-chan. I see you work summers here, as well--I'll take some ice water next hand.
...If you wouldn't mind continuing to serve drinks, I'd like a glass of water. Does the Inventory make for stable employment?
Is that you, Nugi-chan? You really do work for this establishment...ice water, please.
Rinkah, you look... ghastly. This is how a Mejarian might dress up to show girls what men look like.
What's the meaning of this horrifying fire spirit makeup? Like men in my planet's propaganda...!
...How long did it take you to create this costume? You're a walking fireball--not unlike Mejare's pictures of men.
...Rinkah? My God, you look horrific. I didn't know the "Flame Tribe" matched Mejare's depictions of men...!
...That's about how Mejare would have you picture men. Hellish, fiery ghouls. Is Halloween that important here?
...Is that you, Rinkah? Flame Tribe, indeed...eat women's livers, and you'll match how Mejare depicts men.
I see you've taken the Mejarian approach to armor this Halloween: cover the shoulders, and leave your body exposed.
I'd claim that armoring only your shoulders is ineffective, but Mejare is guilty of that, too. Is it purely for Halloween?
I doubt pure shoulder armor will protect you from the horrors of Halloween. And you're a ground warrior, not a pilot.
Metal shoulder armor seems like little more than excess weight. But then, this is just a Halloween costume, correct?
My crewmates and I all have different hair colors...our outfits tend to vary, too.
Genetic engineering on Mejare has resulted in some pretty outlandish hair colors...you've got some strange outfits yourselves.
You work in a team of women? Well...seems Earth and Mejare aren't that different after all. Besides those bizarre outfits.
Good to see a woman who can carry herself, apparently. And dress herself in different ways.
Did you get dressed up for this? I know a few Mejarians that are obsessed with fashion...
Oh, it's you, L'Arachel. I see not even a holy woman is above spending a day at the beach...while still armed.
Hello, L'Arachel. Even in casual swimwear, you bring a weapon along...not unlike me when we encountered an island planet.
Perhaps we're more alike than I thought, L'Arachel. I've kept my weapon on me even as we've gone for swims, too.
It's nice to see you again, L'Arachel. You must not be fully committed to beach leisure if you've brought your staff.
Shouldn't a "magical girl" fighter know how to swim? Unless that inner tube is just for relaxation.
Are you proclaiming your love of cheeseburgers, or can you not swim? I'd expect that from a "magical girl."
Hello, Sayaka. I'm surprised to see you with an inner tube--I can teach you to swim if you would like.
...Do you not know how to swim, Sayaka? It's a great full-body exercise--a fighter like you could benefit from it.
Hello again, Sheena. I have a blue swimsuit that's just like that one...though I don't fill it quite as well.
That one-piece swimsuit looks just like the one I have for Mejare's summers. We've encountered a few planets with beaches...
You look very nice in that swimsuit, Sheena. I dress for summer in a one-piece of my own, but you wear it better.
I have one swimsuit to my name, and it's a blue one-piece...it looks like yours. Of course, I don't have to stuff my breasts into it like that.
So, you're wealthy enough to vary your attire? I grew up wealthy...didn't last.
My crewmates and I all have different hair colors, too...none of us have white, but maybe money does that to you. As well as letting you change outfits.
Genetic engineering on Mejare has resulted in some pretty outlandish hair colors...seems you could afford a wardrobe change, too.
I should have expected a wealthy woman to change her wardrobe...I would, too, if I owned anything.
You work in a team of women? And your outfit is different...we don't really have uniforms, either.
Good to see a woman who can carry herself. And has the finances to vary her outfit.
Hello again, Raven. I agree with the new outfit color, but a fighting woman shouldn't let her hair grow.
Is that you, Raven? It's good to meet you again...but I see you're getting sloppy. You ought to keep your hair short like me.
White is a good color, Raven...but why haven't you cut your hair? A warrior can't have it getting in her eyes.
You keep brushing your hair out of your eyes, Raven. I understand wanting to look beautiful, but it can't limit your ability to fight.
Hello, Zizou. I hope your business of being a goddess is going well...you seem to have the free time for a day at the beach.
I wasn't expecting to see a magical goddess at the beach. I trust you've been hard at work.
Oh, it's you, Zizou. That's quite the casual outfit for a goddess, even at the beach. Have you developed any new magic?
Shouldn't a goddess of magic be too busy for a day at the beach? You look like you're enjoying yourself.
You're awfully dressed-up for this game. Seems pointless when your clothes will come off anyway.
Is that the kind of outift that attracts men? If so, Jura will have an easy time finding one.
Makeup...don't see the point. Jura certainly does, but I've never seen eye-to-eye with her.
All dolled-up...just another form of dishonesty.
Hello, Emi. It's good to see you again--are lemons an important cultural symbol on Earth this time of year?
...Is that you, Bernadetta? You look much older than last time--are you serving as an officer now?
...Bernadetta? You look like you've graduated since we last met--and you've grown a few inches, as well.
Mavis...? You're that girl with vampire powers. If you're still learning about humanity, many girls on our ship wear Halloween costumes like yours. You're--filling it out nicely.
Oh, it's you, Mavis. Are you just here to celebrate Halloween this time? Some of my crewmates wear costumes like that, with their figures just--spilling out.
It's good to see you again, Mavis. I see you've learned about human holidays--I have crewmates who stuff themselves into a few slings for Halloween.
...You're Yunyun, right? You wanted us to be your friends. I don't know if Halloween is a social holiday on Earth like it is on Mejare.
...You're the girl who was part of the "Crimson Demons." If you're still looking for social gatherings, I guess Halloween is a good opportunity...it is on Mejare, at least.
...I thought Marinette was Ladybug.
...So what you're saying is, Marinette made her public debut before Samus?
...What's "1981"? Sounds old...Marinette doesn't look old, especially not older than Samus.
Should you be talking about Samus and Marinette like this? I'm totally lost...
What...does that have to with anything?
...I don't even know what Street Fighter 1 is.
There's an industry for these...things?
I don't know what it was before, so I don't think revolutionizing it would mean much to me...
...Protagonist? You're talking like she's fictional.
What are you going on about? Gaming? Protagonists?
...What's "1981"? A year? By what measure? What are you talking about?
Should you be talking about Samus like this? She's standing right here.
I see you've got a good sense of style, Haru. I once owned a dress just like that--and a hat, too.
You called this the "Dapper Date"? It's not unlike how a woman might dress up on Mejare...I owned something like it.
A hat and dress...I liked to keep things simple and cute, too. Back when I could afford an outfit like that.
I assume this "Dapper Date" of yours is with a man. I can't understand that...but we do share a taste in dresses.
So, you're wearing Earth festival dress for Valentine's Day? That's valuable cultural information... do men like the pattern?
I see there's a traditional dress Earth women wear for Valentine's Day--and it comes in all sizes. Men like it, then?
I see..."Earth women don a traditional red dress for Valentine's Day festivities. Unknown if red attracts men."
Red is a passionate color--just what I'd expect from a dress Earth women wear on Valentine's Day. It must get men's attention.
What exactly is your fascination with ~player~? Do you know her from somewhere?
Is there a reason you're fixated on ~player~? What's the meaning of this constant attention?
Whatever your ulterior motives are, you're making it awfully clear you only care about ~player~.
I don't know why this girl is fixated on you, ~player~, but I would be wary of her.
Why are you always addressing ~player~? Do you know her from somewhere?
I was under the impression we were all strangers...but you seem very fixated on ~player~.
~player~, do you know Natsuki? She's always addressing you like you're close.
On and on about ~player~. If you two have personal issues to resolve, Natsuki, this isn't the setting for it.
...~player~, what is your relationship with this woman? I suggest you make yourself clear so she leaves us alone.
I don't appreciate this unhinged woman threatening me, ~player~. Perhaps you should address her infatuation elsewhere.
Why is this woman obsessed with you, ~player~? I could tolerate that...if she weren't threatening the rest of us.
...I'm glad to see woman-woman romance is alive and well on Earth, but not when it escalates to threatening strangers in fits of jealousy.
...~player~, please inform Tharja that I am not looking for romance with any woman here...and that her threats are getting tiresome.
What exactly is your fascination with ~player~? Do you know him from somewhere?
Is there a reason you're fixated on ~player~? What's the meaning of this constant attention?
Whatever your ulterior motives are, you're making it awfully clear you only care about ~player~.
I don't know why this girl is fixated on you, ~player~, but I would be wary of her.
Why are you always addressing ~player~? Do you know him from somewhere?
I was under the impression we were all strangers...but you seem very fixated on ~player~.
~player~, do you know Natsuki? She's always addressing you like you're close.
On and on about ~player~. If you two have personal issues to resolve, Natsuki, this isn't the setting for it.
...~player~, what is your relationship with this woman? I suggest you make yourself clear so she leaves us alone.
I don't appreciate this unhinged woman threatening me, ~player~. Perhaps you should address her infatuation elsewhere.
Why is this woman obsessed with you, ~player~? I could tolerate that...if she weren't threatening the rest of us.
...~player~, please inform Tharja that I have no interest in men beyond the scientific...and that her threats are getting tiresome.
...Is this what falling in love with men does to women? It's unhealthy...and irresponsible on your part, ~player~.
Two Juras? Well, you've certainly dolled yourself up to earn this.
I guess all that teasing really did the trick, Jura. ~player~ loves you enough to put another one.
Good. Twice the vanity, half the responsibility.
I don't make any effort to look beautiful, so I see why ~player~ would want two of you instead...
Rabbits seem to have quite the hold on Earth's version of Easter...you remind me of our young nurse, with her frog puppet.
You're not going to count a stuffed rabbit as clothing, are you? I'm surprised they're such a symbol of Easter here...
Our nurse Paiway carries around a little frog doll herself, but it doesn't represent any holidays. What's the rabbit's significance?
I understand rabbits breed rapidly. Is Earth's Easter a fertility ceremony? Is that why they're important?
...You didn't know this was strip poker? You can't seriously be ignorant enough to get this far into the facility without realizing that.
...Well, I was looking forward to asking questions to a normal Earth schoolgirl, but this place was apparently too much for her.
Such an aggressive...w-wait, who's this? ...Your classmate...it would take a strong bond between schoolgirls to follow you here.
How could an Earth woman be so shy around men?
Didn't you grow up around men? What's the issue?
If you want to learn about men, talk to Dita. She's obsessed.
For an Earth woman, you seem uncomfortable around men. Are there still tensions between the sexes here?
I understand you're young, but are you really so...inexperienced with men? Didn't you grow up around them?
I was raised entirely without men, and yet there's Earth girls who seem just as clueless. I don't know how to take that...
Not to be rude, but it seems you're living proof that, even on Earth, the sexes can be clueless about each other.
...A satellite is a scanning instrument placed into orbit. They're trivial next to space travel--they don't even self-propel like a Dread.
...Just as this moon orbits Earth, a satellite is any scanning instrument placed into orbit. They just use gravity to move--simple next to a Dread fighter.
Satellites are just orbital scanners for planets. They're the first space technology ever designed--you should see my Dread.
...Satellites are among the most primitive space technology, Nami. They're orbital scanning instruments--my Dread is far more advanced.
This girl is from Poke...whatever? So...these games star real people?
...What makes you think I know what "Star Wars" is, either?
...Money? These games make money? All the money on Mejare goes to the state...
Should you be talking about ~name~ like this? If she wants to bring up...whatever-mon, let her do it.
...The what series?
...I don't even know what a princess is.
Super Ma--what? What's a "princess"?
...Do you two know each other, Chiaki? Is this woman famous?
Are you and ~player~ colluding over something, Kyu? Or are you...hm. A woman and a fairy...interesting relationship.
Always whispering to ~player~...fairy or not, I suppose you're both women. Strange romances on Earth...
I suppose your connection with ~player~ is romantic? Better a woman with a fairy than with a man.
I can only assume you and ~player~ have a very Mejarian relationship, Kyu. ...If fairies count as women.
You're constantly whispering to ~player~. Are you two...in one of the man-woman relationships I've heard about on Earth?
A man and a woman, constantly huddling up and colluding. I can only assume you're in a relationship...unthinkable.
Always talking to ~player~...you and he must be seeing each other. I guess public strip poker is a man-woman idea of romance.
Am I right to assume you and ~player~ are in a relationship? A man and woman...you must know his tube inside and out.
...You've never played poker before? What do Earth women do during downtime?
You've never played poker before? Gascogne would have a field day with you...
You've never played poker before, and you start with strip poker?
Men aren't all that dangerous. Just simpletons.
Surely you've grown up around men. I don't have that benefit.
I never thought an Earth woman would be so shy around men...
Nayru? There's--w-what's this all about? Duck!
Nayru, there's--a figure behind you! Get down!
Wha--Nayru, behind you!
I--Nayru, get down! There's--some shadow!
...Yunyun, what do these "demons and monsters" you mentioned look like? My homeworld characterizes men in a similar way.
These "demons and monsters" you mentioned...how and why are they attacking people? Mejare believes that men would destroy female society by infecting us with disease.
I don't mean to pry, Pyrrha, but you asked if I had any questions about the man you were interested in. What did you find appealing in him?
...Pyrrha, can you describe the man you took an interest in? What do you typically look for in male partners?
When I asked you about men earlier, I wasn't trying to learn your personal secrets. It was what you found attractive about the man in question.
It's not a big change you have to make for yourself, Laevatein. But it can help build trust between you and you subordinates.
Well, probably not your own combat ability, Laevatein. But since you function within a team, trusting each other is essential.
..."The wrong reasons," Laevatein? I'm sure they'd be happy to see their commander open up a bit.
I guess that sort of corruption exists on every planet. We just have to fight it when we recognize it.
That dispels any notions of Earth being the utopia Mejare is not. Every society has its issues with corruption.
Loss is what brought our crew together. Our homes, our lifestyles, our loved ones--we rely on each other for those things now.
Any common experience will bring people together. For our crew, it was loss--the loss of our old lives. For us and the men, it was a mutual enemy.
You're a lot of woman. I'm not sure if Gascogne could measure up to you...
Earth women can get pretty tall, it seems...but so can Mejarians, looking at Gascogne.
I think Gascogne's still got an inch on you, so don't feel self-conscious about your size.
Do men like tall women? I'm about middle-of-the-pack in that regard...and Gascogne seems even taller than the average man.
You're carrying yourself a bit uneasily for your height...maybe I'm used to Gascogne's confidence.
Wha--what are you doing?
Don't wave that thing around! Crazed lunatic--!
I'd recommend a different weapon--agh! A bounty hunter--?
Where's you trigger discipline--agh! Damn men's weapons--!
Why are you--agh! I knew this whole game was a setup! Earth--!
Here we go again...take cover.
Don't you care about safety?
After surviving the first volley, you'd think a woman would know better than to push her luck.
You're doing it again?
Is this "darlin'" of yours a man? That would explain a lot.
Have you had a baby with this "darlin'" of yours? I'm still not sure men are capable of making one.
I've gone through electroshock...and you need some.
I'll just look away...
I guess there's no changing you...
Firing straight up? That's right out of Hibiki's playbook...I'd rather have him here.
At least those can't hit anyone else...
At least you're running out of clothes...
I can't believe you've got more bullets than clothes.
How could anyone be so fond of those racketous men's weapons?
Well, you're certainly full of energy. Might even rival Dita, though I could never picture her playing this.
Wherever this Australia planet is, its food must be nutritious. You're energetic.
You're pretty energetic. That's good to see in a pilot, and I suppose Dita proves discipline isn't a necessity.
I'm still not sure whether our ship's energy core uses "magic," with what it can do...what's powering that scepter?
A student in a school full of magicians...I wonder if it's not simply the Paksis's energy under a different name. How does that rod work?
Such an earnest young girl...but so airheaded. Akko, what's the nature of your "magic"? Does that scepter have a power source?
The way you bounce around... you're like one of my trainees. What's the source of that rod's "magic"? A core?
I can't say we're similar, Akko, but you do remind me of Dita. She's a pilot-in-training...and her enthusiasm exceeds her skill.
A naive young girl, hopelessly optimistic, wielding powers she doesn't have the skill for... you're just like my trainee Dita.
...You don't have an obsession with men, do you? I have a trainee, Dita, who's like you in every other way...
I can tell you work hard, Akko... but perhaps your talent doesn't always match. Dita, one of my pilots-in-training, is like that...and very optimistic.
...Is there a reason you brought a knife?
I'm watching you. Why do you have that knife?
Make any sudden movements, and you'll be on the wrong side of that knife.
Don't you dare try anything with that knife.
...Well, we know what your favorite color is, don't we? Even your hair is purple...
Purple hair, purple outfit...even on Mejare, purple hair is a bit outlandish.
I have some crewmates who wish their hair was a more exotic color, like your purple. I suppose I should consider my blue strange...
...Is that purple hair your natural color? Where are you from?
...What exactly makes you a "Monster Lord"? You look human to me...though looks are often deceiving.
When I heard a "Monster Lord" would be playing, I expected something...beastly. You look like a woman, if a decorated one.
A "Monster Lord"...any woman who describes herself that way must be dangerous. Even if she looks human.
...I'm told you're a "Monster Lord." You're certainly decorated, but only men from Tarak would call women monsters.
I suppose it's the behavior that makes the monster. I never thought the man-eating woman Tarakkians feared really existed.
Just when I was hoping Mejare and Tarak could reach peace, I meet an Earth woman who really does eat men's organs. Unreal...
You should know that Tarak, the planet of men, believes women consume men for sustenance. We ought to show them how Earth is to blame there.
A woman who sees men as food...no inconvenience to me, but certainly to peace with Tarak. You're exactly how they describe us.
You've lost, Alice...wait, what are you doing?
Why are you hesitating? Is there some small item you've hidden? ...In an unsavory place?
Alice, you've lost. Underhanded tactics don't impress me, whatever you're doing.
...I don't like this. A so-called "Monster Lord" claiming not to be defeated...what are you planning?
You're from "Japan"? Never heard of it...must be a remote planet.
Whatever this "Japan" planet is, it seems to produce real oddities...
You're an "idol"? Mejare has idols...big pear-shaped statues we're told to honor.
"Virtual idol"? Are you some kind of projection? You're flickering.
Your planet must be pretty verdant for you to dress like that. Mejare uses too many natural resources...
Your planet must be pretty verdant for you to dress like that. Tarak is a wasteland...
You have Barnette's fashion sense...that is, less is more. Though it seems your world has more nature...
You have Barnette's sense of style...that is, skin is always in style. Seems you live in a world with vegetation...
Is it true you're a "princess"? I'm told you hold some authority...which makes me question why you're here.
I'm told you're a ruler of some sort...shouldn't you be ruling?
I hear you're an authority figure where you're from. I'm sure your subjects appreciate you spending your time like this.
My experience with authority has always been that they don't deserve their power...you being here reinforces that.
Now are you done? Or are you going to summon vines and perpetuate this?
You've lost, Amalia. You are naked, after all...unless you've got more plants to summon.
Stripping your flowers now? Any more vegetation we should know about?
Is a bush next? Are you stripping flowers and replacing them with branches?
Taking another inch off of the stems? Surely you can think of another way to waste our time.
In case you were wondering, that's twice that you should've lost now.
Congratulations. You've now lost several times over, even as a cheater.
For someone so petrified of being naked, you've done a poor job of avoiding it.
You work as a model? So would Jura, if we were law-abiding Mejarians...
You work as a model? Probably what Jura wants deep down...
You remind me of Jura. Always bragging about her looks...although she might be more justified in doing so.
What's a hedgehog? Some kind of animal?
"Hedgehog"...? Mejare doesn't have many animals...
Something about you looks off...like you aren't quite human. But then, I used to see men that way, too.
This "academy" of yours sounds like a school...Mejarian schools are just government propaganda.
So, you go to school with men? Must be a pain getting them to sit still during a lecture.
I'm told you're into government. Mejare's is in need of reform, to put it bluntly.
I'm told you're into art. Jura would probably ask you for a life-size portrait.
This "academy" of yours sounds like a school. I dropped out of school...
I'm told you're into art. I know Duero painted Parfet something once, so maybe you two should talk.
You have a roommate at this school of yours? I'd never be comfortable without my single room.
You work as a model? So would Jura, if we were law-abiding Mejarians.
You work as a model? Probably what Jura wants deep down.
You go to school with men? Sounds distracting.
You're a student...I dropped out of school. Bad times.
I hope this "high school" of yours is a little less indoctrinating than Mejare's.
So...you go to school with men? Surprised they can sit still long enough.
What's a college? ...What's a community?
Everyone is educated by the state on Mejare...they certainly fed me a lot of stories about Tarak.
This "college" of yours sounds like a school. I dropped out of school...
You look like a military type...though a rather unintimidating one.
I know you military types. You claim to protect, but only when it suits you.
Oh, perfect. A soldier. Try not to kill anyone for fun before the game is over.
You'll have to excuse my dislike of woman soldiers. The ones I know enjoy indoctrinating children and shutting down housing districts.
"Titans," huh? Those Harvest motherships can get pretty big.
So, you report the news? Mejare's news agencies are all state propaganda.
I'm not a fan of the media...my family has had some bad publicity on Mejare.
You're reporting this? The last time I appeared on television, I was a little girl...
I think I appeared on Mejarian television not too far back. We were raiding an armory.
Good to see a woman who shares my fashion sense...though it looks like a tight fit.
You come from the middle of Earth? I didn't know its population lived underground.
You don't look quite human...and it's not just the ears.
You're an..."elf"? You're going to have to explain what that means.
You were trapped...in a computer? I guess we were trapped in the Paksis once...
You live in a...muh-more-puh-guh?
Is this "muh-more-puh-guh" how Earthlings pass the time? You should be working.
So, you're...some sort of "princess"? Not sure I know what that is...
So...does "princess" mean "light dresser"? That would make more than a few of my crewmates princesses.
...Could you explain what a "princess" is? I'm...not from Earth, so I don't know its titles.
Is a "princess" a position of power on Earth? You'd think an authority figure would wear more clothing...
This girl gives me the creeps...
What's with that look in your eyes? Like an animal playing dead...
"Yandere"...must be from some archaic Earth language.
You're looking a little sickly. Did ships from Earth do this to you?
Why is your skin pink? Do you have a medical condition? Earth is no stranger to poisoning populations it doesn't care for...
You're short like Paiway...and you look a little sickly with that skin. Were you poisoned? Did Earth do this to you?
...Are you alright? Your skin...it's pink, and it looks unhealthy. I wouldn't put it past Earth to do this to undesirables...
"Black Canary"? Maybe I should get a professional name...to inspire fear.
"Black Canary"? I've never seen a canary, but I thought they were yellow.
"Black Canary"? I wish Mejare had canaries...
You're from a...muh-more-puh-guh? Use real words.
You're an avatar? As in, not really here? Where are you projecting this from?
This "virtual" business is new to me. Why not just come here for real?
My crewmates and I all have different hair colors...pure black is an interesting choice, if it's intentional.
Genetic engineering on Mejare has resulted in some pretty outlandish hair colors...I don't think I know anyone with pure black hair.
Good to see a woman who can carry herself, apparently. That black hair is imposing...as is your stark outfit.
You work in a team of women? Seems Earth and Mejare aren't that different after all...though no pilot of mine has pure black hair.
My crewmates and I all have different hair colors...we don't base our identities off of that. Although it would seem your outfit is branching out.
Genetic engineering on Mejare has resulted in some pretty outlandish hair colors...say, you look a little different than before.
Good to see a woman who can carry herself, apparently. And is it just me, or did you dress up for this?
You work in a team of women? Well...seems Earth and Mejare aren't that different after all. Besides the outfits.
Something about your outfit seems unusual for you...strange, since I've never met you before.
These "vampires" of yours sound fearsome. The Harvest probably wants blood from somewhere, too...
Vampires suck blood, huh...there's probably an Earth colony for blood out there somewhere.
I wonder what the blood colony's people must look like. Probably blushing all the time.
So, a man helps you fight vampires? I work with a few men...out of necessity.
I dropped out of school...hope it's treating you better than it did me.
I'm told you're a lawyer. I assume that means you work with the law? Mejare's laws are absolute.
You "practice law," correct? Where I come from, laws are handed down...and no one can argue them.
What does a lawyer do, exactly? Mejare doesn't allow women to argue the laws...if we could, men might be considered human.
Mejare doesn't allow legal arguments...and being a pirate, I'm on the wrong side of them. But law is what you work with, correct?
...You're not wearing much, even compared to me. Does that improve flexibility? (You know there's a new Cammy, right, ~player~?)
An Earth woman dressed as revealingly as one from Mejare...is it easier to move in just a leotard? (Personally, I find the newer Cammy more attractive...)
...Does that leotard help your flexibility as a fighter? There isn't much to it. (I can't believe I'm stuck with the older, less attractive Cammy.)
You're dressed like a Mejarian imperial...maybe leotards give a better range of movement. (~player~, I find the newer Cammy's backside much better-looking.)
...I hear someone coming.
...Footsteps? I hear something...
...Cammy, do you hear that? Like an approach...
...I don't like this feeling I'm getting. Someone's coming.
...You're not wearing much, even compared to me. Does that improve flexibility?
An Earth woman dressed as revealingly as one from Mejare...is it easier to move in just a leotard?
...Does that leotard help your flexibility as a fighter? Maybe I should wear one...there isn't much to it.
An investigator, you said? You're dressed more like a Mejarian imperial...maybe leotards give a better range of movement.
...You claim to be some sort of "Pegasus Rider," correct? I've never heard of such of thing...is it a kind of ship?
A "Pegasus Rider," you said? I ride ships...but I'm not familiar with a "Pegasus" model.
...I pilot a Dread ship. What kind of vessel is a "Pegasus," exactly? You said you ride one...
Similar armor to mine...but I'm not sure what a "Pegasus Rider" is. What kind of ship is a Pegasus?
You said you had sisters helping you? That's nice...I was an only child.
Catria...do you enjoy being with your sisters? I never had any...
...It's nice to hear you have sisters helping you, Catria. My family was small...I was an only child.
You have sisters who share your job, correct? My parents only ever had me...I spent a lot of time alone.
...I was told an alien life form would be joining us, but you look no different from a human woman.
...Over time, Mejare and Tarak have seen the opposite sex as alien life. Is that the case with "Saiyans"? You look perfectly human.
...I was expecting this "Saiyan" to look more like the alien life they claim you to be. We've never discovered aliens ourselves.
...Are you really an alien? If you differ from a human woman at all...well, this would be the game to inspect your anatomy.
Sorry to be insulting, but you look rather unevenly-proportioned. You should exercise more.
What's with that look you're giving everyone? This is just a game.
I'm trying not to comment on your body...Mejarians tend to be judgmental enough.
Something about you seems off. I'd suggest you relax.
A test subject...that's how Earth sees its colonies.
I see you've got my affinity for words.
Portals sound useful...even faster-than-light still takes a while.
Women shouldn't be afraid to speak their minds.
Hearing you loud and clear.
What are these "video games" you play? Sounds like something Dita would distract herself with instead of attending flight practice.
You go to school with men? They don't seem able to focus for long enough.
You're a student...I'm a dropout. Let's leave it at that.
...What am I looking at? Are you human? You look like...some sort of robot.
You beep whenever you move. Are you some sort of robot? More advanced than what we have...
Er...what are you, exactly? Is that a mechanical suit, or...are you a machine?
Are you...a machine? Our most advanced robot is Pyoro, since he can talk...you're on another level.
What a diminuitive girl...it's almost as if you're deliberately trying to act vulnerable. Our young nurse is a better specimen.
Why is there a child at this table? I wouldn't play this with our young nurse, and I hardly want to do it with you.
We have an eleven-year-old nurse on the Nirvana who dwarfs you in both size and personality. Some woman you are...
..."Chihiro"? That's it. You're about the size of our child nurse, and even she is more assertive.
You look like you're in great shape. I respect that in a woman...very much.
Not to be too forward, but...your legs are so muscular. What's your training routine?
Wow...whatever you do to exercise, I'd like to learn it. You look fantastic.
You're a lot of woman, and in a good way. Could I get your frame with enough training?
Your build is impressive...and I wouldn't say to that to any strange woman.
You said you were a "Street Fighter," correct? I suppose that would get you into shape.
You said something about street fighting? I've been in street fights. I'd rather not go back to that, but if you like it...
You said you're a street fighter? That's a harsh life...I lived on the streets when I was younger.
Street fighting isn't the kind of thing I'd glorify, but if it makes you happy...just take care of yourself.
You're a "witcher"? A Mejarian judge called Jura a witch...for possession of an anatomy book.
You're a "witcher"? Mejarians who associate with men get called witches...
The word "witch" gets us a little touchy sometimes...I apologize.
Wh-what's the meaning of this? Why are you lugging an axe around? Disarm yourself!
...Stay away from me. No woman carrying an axe is of sound mind.
Are we supposed to ignore the bloody axe beside you? I'm armed, even if I don't look like it.
I knew Earth women were capable of being ruthless killers, but I expected something more subtle than carrying an axe around.
I heard that suitcase you were carrying is some kind of mechanical firearm. Women shouldn't use those in the first place.
Wasn't that briefcase some kind of weapon? You're a fool to make it that obvious...mechanical guns aren't for women anyway.
It serves you right to have to turn over that suitcase-weapon I saw. A woman's firearm is inconspicuous.
If you were smart, you'd have a smaller, concealed weapon than that suitcase they took. Kinetic firearms are for men.
You're a..."princess"?
What's a princess? Some kind of leadership position?
A princess...is that like the Grand Ma?
You're royalty? I don't like it when people assume they're better than others.
I hear there's a male version of you. I'd hate to see the male version of me.
Mejare calls women witches for sympathizing with men. Personal technology is quite standard there...so I don't see why you're called one.
I was told you're capable of magic, but you seem much more comfortable with technology. Perhaps that's your culture's name for it...
For a supposed "witch," you hardly seem different than a wealthy Mejarian woman, with all that personal technology.
I should've expected I'd become the subject of some wealthy woman's sexual research. Your technology hardly seems "magical," though...
Mejare has hovering chairs, personal tablets, and emotion cubes, plus robots. I fail to see how technology makes you a "witch."
It's good to see someone who shares my fashion sense...
These bodysuits can get uncomfortable, wouldn't you agree?
You pilot a mech? So does Hibiki...and he's learning.
So, what's planet Korea like? I've never heard of it.
You're a pilot, too? Mechs, Dreads, they're all fascinating.
You're a..."princess"? You look like you're about to cast off that dress and go running.
What's a princess? Some kind of leadership position? You seem more like a dressed-up athlete.
A princess...is that like the Grand Ma? She's certainly not as athletic as you look.
You're royalty? I don't like it when people assume they're better than others...though you might have an athletic edge on me.
So, you solve mysteries...with some men? Men don't seem smart enough for that.
So, you solve mysteries? The Paksis is one big glowing mystery.
I'm told you get captured a lot. Allies are important to have...but a woman should be strong on her own.
You look like you've got my temperament. Did someone elbow you into doing this, too?
You go to school with men? They don't seem able to focus for long enough...and you don't seem happy to be here.
You're a student...I'm a dropout. Let's leave it at that...since you seem annoyed regardless.
You're barely bigger than Paiway. Children aren't allowed here...and you seem miserable about it, anyway.
"Dark Magician Girl"? That's some sort of title, right?
Don't you have some sort of first name? "Dark Magician Girl" is too long to say in the heat of battle.
Dark Magician Girl? Children aren't allowed here.
..."Default-chan." I do everything I can to gain the crew's recognition, and this woman's entire existence is the bare minimum.
Just what does "desu" mean, anyway? It must be from some archaic Earth language...the same way this girl is archaic.
You may be the walking antithesis of a Mejarian. A girl who's made no effort to look beautiful, and is completely subservient to men.
...~player~, why are you wasting my time with this woman? I don't know what desu means.
...I always have my subordinates make eye contact when I speak to them. If it were you, I might let it pass.
...Are you alright, Muffins? You seem to have your mind elsewhere...as well as one eye.
...Muffins, you should look women in the eye when they speak to you. I shouldn't have to tell you th--oh. Excuse me.
Your name is "Muffins," correct? I heard a worker here refer to you as "Derpy." ...Was he insulting your lazy eye?
You're a pirate? They certainly dress much differently on Earth...
I'm a pirate, too...small universe we live in.
An Earth pirate? Well...the outfit is certainly different, and apparently the manner.
You're a..."princess"? For nobility, you don't seem too informed...
What's a princess? Some kind of leadership position? Then why are you here?
A princess...is that like the Grand Ma? She'd never lower herself to games like this...
You're royalty? I don't like it when people assume they're better than others...though I suppose you're lowering yourself by playing this.
Even for an Earth woman, that looks like pretty old-fashioned dress. Your manners are similarly classical...
I could have sworn I saw you at another table than this one...guess it must have been a similarly passive woman.
How'd you lose that bit of your finger? You seem rather demure to be in combat...
You don't seem very assertive. I wouldn't think this game would attract a shy woman like you...
It's good to see a young girl so dedicated to fitness. That would already make you a good pilot--and g-forces can't rush blood to your legs.
You're Emi, correct? I enjoy running myself...and I always look for fitness in new recruits. Most women would use disability as an excuse.
A young girl, undeterred by her disability and passionate about fitness...you might make a good trainee on my squadron.
...Have you considered being a pilot, Emi? Not only do you keep fit, but you don't have the issue of blood rushing to your legs in combat.
...I'm not impressed with this introduction to "elves." You should take better care of yourself.
...I assume "pudgy" is not the natural build of elven women. How did you let yourself get in such a sorry condition?
...You must understand that Mejarian culture values slenderness. Perhaps elves are different...or you're just undisciplined.
What a grotesque figure. Excess fat everywhere...are all elves like this, Erufuda?
Is it true you're part of a magic-using family? I don't subscribe to notions of royalty, but I can see why they'd hold power.
A noble...Mejare has imperial leaders, but I'm not in their favor anymore. And you can use magic?
Pirates aren't the type to recognize nobility. Still, I'm curious about the "magic" I've heard your family can use.
I hear you descend from a line of women with magical powers. It wouldn't surprise me that nobles hogged that for themselves--nor Earthlings.
This "magic" of yours sounds pretty interesting. Can it be taught?
I'm told you're immortal. Is that in the sense of never aging, or never dying at all?
If you really can wield magic, I'd be honored to learn it...it sounds useful.
The Paksis has proven to me that powers beyond human ability exist...so I'm willing to believe you might have some.
I was told you were a spacefarer, as well...and a pilot. Good to see a woman who understands my situation.
Is it true you're a space pilot? So am I...I'd love to discuss formations or maneuvers after the game is over.
Someone said you're a pilot. I never expected to meet a woman like that here...what's your ship like?
I heard you're a space pilot. I command a Dread squadron myself...what is it that you do?
Someone told me you're a space pilot. I've really fallen in love with piloting myself, though I only have a few years' experience...
I'm told you were cryogenically frozen for some time...that's also true of Misty, a young girl I know from Pluto.
Is it true you were in cryosleep for a number of years? So was a man I know...he looks younger than me, but he's over a hundred years old.
Someone mentioned you were in cryosleep for some time. It sounds uncomfortable...maybe you don't want to talk about it.
You were cryogenically frozen, correct? Several of my crewmates were, as well...technically making them older than any of us.
...You're aware you need clothing to play this game, right?
Did you just come here from a finished game? You've got almost nothing on...
And they say Mejarians dress revealingly. You barely dress at all.
If you meant to come dressed in a cat costume, it seems to be missing a few pieces.
Not to be rude, but I still can't comprehend this. Are you shaving...the rest of it?
...Is the bottom fur next? Did you really come here naked?
To meet a cat-woman hybrid here, and that she's not even wearing anything...I assume what's around your groin is fur, too.
You've only lost once before, but I think I know what's coming next. If it, too, is fur...
You certainly paint of different picture of Earthlings than the one I'm used to...
You seem awfully shy to be playing a game like this. Or is that your motivation for doing so?
How'd a shy woman like you end up in this place? Do you even know how to play poker?
You said you rode in on a "pegasus"? Mejare has few animals, but I've never even heard of that one.
You'll have to acquaint me with what exactly a lawyer does...otherwise your boasts mean little.
You seem very proud of your family name, Franziska...but I'm afraid I'm not familiar with your profession.
Our commander, B.C., uses a whip...is that related to this "attorney" business you keep boasting about?
Is there a reason you seem to hold yourself above the rest of us? Granted, I've never met an "attorney."
You remind me of Parfet, though you seem a little more outgoing...but just as unkempt.
You remind me of Parfet. She wears glasses, too...and she sometimes neglects hygiene.
You're like if Parfet and Paiway had a child together...and didn't teach her how to clean herself.
You've got Paiway's build..and Parfet's glasses. Are you old enough to be here? You should have cleaned yourself, regardless.
You look a little unkempt. Women need to take pride in their bodies as well as their minds...Parfet gets like that, too.
So, tell me about these "Phantom Thieves." What is it you do?
These "Phantom Thieves" of yours sound like pirates. What do you steal, exactly?
Parfet is into computers. You said you were, too, right? Something about "Phantom Thieves"?
You're from planet "San Fransokyo"? Just rolls right off the tongue...I'm sure Parfet would like working with you, if you do engineering.
You do something in engineering, correct? You and Parfet would hit it off...once she learns to pronounce "San Fransokyo."
Good to see someone who shares my fashion sense...sort of.
These bodysuits can get uncomfortable...although you seem quite comfortable in yours.
Hard to take someone seriously when they won't show their face...at least the rest seems comfortable for you.
I always appreciate being able to look a woman in the eye. The rest of our styles match, at least.
Mejare doesn't have many animals...and I wish it didn't have spiders.
...I'm sure you're well aware of your condition. There's been burns among our crew, and we haven't shunned them.
...You don't seem comfortable with your burns. Some of my pilots have suffered similar injuries...
...Some of my pilots have been burned...I won't press how you got yours.
...I'm sorry about your burns. There's no need to address them further...but know I've seen similar injuries on crewmates.
You look like Paiway's first attempt at makeup.
So much makeup...I don't wear any. Just gets in the way.
So much makeup...Jura is always trying to convince me to try some.
Good, you're wearing enough makeup for both of us. Saves me the trouble.
A schoolgirl? You're dressed conservatively...either that means you're modest, or you've got something to hide.
For a young student playing strip poker, you're surprisingly bundled-up in that sweater. Heavy dress always makes me think women are hiding something...
Haru, correct? Nice to meet you...you seem kind enough. Of course, that heavy outfit might hide another side of you...
You seem rather mature for a schoolgirl...but anyone who plays strip poker is probably hiding something, as your dress implies.
"Magic," huh...I'd have my doubts, but the Paksis feels like magic sometimes.
Do you really use magic, or just sufficiently advanced technology?
So, you're a witch. We got called witches on Mejare, but that was for suggesting men were human.
So...you went to school with men? Surprised they can sit still long enough...but magic sounds like a good motivator.
A boarding school? Everyone is educated by the state on Mejare...but not about magic.
A boarding school? I dropped out of school...though Mejare's didn't teach magic.
Is that headband some sort of designation? Not to be rude.
So, you're a "ninja"? Sounds like the telepathic people Hibiki was stuck with.
You're awfully quiet. Not that I take issue with that...
So these "ninjas" have their own society? What separates you from a typical human?
"HK416"...a codename to match your stoicism. I was told you're some sort of expert on men's kinetic weapons.
It seems women of my temperament aren't unique to Mejare. Though you're a men's weapons expert rather than a pilot...
It's good to meet another serious woman...but I don't share your interest in men's mechanical guns.
Mejare has long dismissed men's kinetic weaponry in favor of laser rings. Serious women should seek command roles.
A stoic, serious woman like you...you're better suited for piloting or command than a fascination with men's guns.
You look like a military type, based on those weapons. Guess you can't trust a soldier to leave them behind, even here.
You've got a sweet expression for all those weapons you're carrying. It's unsettling.
Is there a reason you brought weapons here? What kind of place is this?
You're a military woman? You've got the uncomfortably sweet expression of one, for sure.
...Are you intentionally stumbling over your words? I have a hard time believing anyone is this stupid.
...I have a crewmate, Dita, who's something of a ditz. I know what a believable ditz looks like, Ini...
...This performance you're putting on is a bit much. And women who feign stupidity are hiding something.
...I don't think anyone here will judge you for playing this, Ini. There's no need to act ignorant.
I'm told you're into art. Duero seems that way, too, even if he only shows it to Parfet.
You're a student...I'm a dropout. Take that how you will.
You go to school with men? Besides Duero, I can't picture a man sitting still.
You're into art, you said? Artists are good to have around...they tend not to kill people.
So...those ears are real? I wasn't aware Earth had...subspecies of woman.
Let me get this straight. You're a "Therian"...and that makes you some kind of rabbit hybrid. No such thing on Mejare...
Those aren't seriously...real? Your ears, I mean. Mejare doesn't have rabbit-women...
Those ears are something else. Rabbits are rare on Mejare...and rabbit-women don't exist.
What a nuturing woman...you remind me of my crewmate Ezra, who squints the same way. She just had a baby.
So cheerful...good Fama material. I have a crewmate who just had a baby, and she's got the same squinting, caring eyes.
You seem like a sweet woman. You have the same squint and cheeriness of Ezra, a crewmate of mine who recently had a baby.
Caring, considerate, and constantly squinting...it's like Ezra's here with me. She's a crewmate of mine who just had a child...
What a flirtatious woman...and on the older side. I don't suppose you have experience with men?
...I should be able to learn a lot about men's sexuality from you. Be it from your age or your flirtatiousness...
An older woman on this planet must have dated men before. I might have some questions about them for you...
I expected to see girls my age here, but I suppose older women makes more sense. You'll make a better resource on men, anyway.
So, you're...a "clown"? You shouldn't put yourself down like that...unless it's some kind of profession?
What exactly does a "clown" do for a living? Are you some kind of public entertainer?
So, clowns...entertain people? All the entertainment on Mejare tends to focus on the evils of men.
I heard you were a "clown," which sounds a little degrading. You don't seem too broken up about it, though.
..."Vest trick"? That doesn't sound like it's going to make me laugh.
...If your jokes couldn't make me laugh, Joey, I'm not sure a "vest trick" will.
...Is your "vest trick" still an effort to make me laugh, or are you just trying to entertain now?
It might be best if you tried to make others laugh instead, Joey. ...In fact, it might be vest.
...Is your next act to slip on the peel? Even I've seen that.
...So you're done trying to make me laugh. Unless you're about to slip on the discarded peel.
...Good. As a warning, slipping on the peel won't make me laugh, either.
I feel like an immovable object next to a woman whose whole existence is humor. ...You're not about to slip on the peel, are you?
Let's see how this goes...it's the magician's turn again.
...I'm watching this latest act, Joey. Let's see what you can do.
...Well, Joey? Don't keep the audience waiting.
Let's see your ultimate act, Joey. Unless there's something bigger planned for when you lose again.
I'm told you spent some time in prison. So have I...so you have my sympathy.
I've been in prison, too...not just for piracy, but also starting fights on the street.
Another former prisoner? Well...any woman with a distaste for authority can't be all bad.
You certainly have the eyes of a woman who's been jailed. I was a street thug once, so far be it from me to judge you.
What's that mute mechanical...helper behind you? Some sort of personal robot assistant?
...Is Stone Free the name of that robot assistant behind you? It's a lot bigger than Pyoro...
The Nirvana has its own robot assistant named Pyoro. How exactly do you keep summmoning yours?
For an ex-convict, it must have been difficult to acquire that personal robot assistant of yours, Jolyne...I'm impressed.
...Is it true you're a "mutant"? Forgive my ignorance, but you look quite human to me.
For a supposed mutant, you look very human. Maybe it's an Earth custom I'm missing...
I was told you're a mutant. Considering your very human appearance, I think that warrants an explanation.
Would you mind explaining what they meant when they said you're a "mutant"? Is that just a term for some subset of Earthlings?
Bad start. But you have plenty to lose, I'm sure.
Something tells me you came to this game prepared.
What's first on what I'm sure is a long list?
You're certainly not one to go right for large items...so I'm not expecting much.
It begins. Expect a long journey to nudity, everyone.
Going to remove some clothes this time?
Why you bothered with your rapier is beyond me. You want to be naked.
I'm actually a little curious how much clothing you've prepared for this...
Fashion is definitely your first love. I'm curious how you plan to pace this out...
Get it together, Jura. Unless you're just losing on purpose...
At least try to win. Don't paint a picture of us as ditzy exhibitionists.
Where's your focus? I make you play poker with me and Gascogne so you'll sharpen your tactical skills...
Come on, Jura. Don't roll over and die. You're smarter than this.
I know you like showing off your body, but at least make them earn it.
I expected better from you...this is getting sad.
I'm glad you put a little more effort into piloting than into this...not that I'm satisfied with your piloting.
This is pathetic...cards or piloting, I taught you better than this.
Please tell me you're losing on purpose. I'd like to maintain some respect for your intelligence, if not your modesty.
The moment you've been waiting for. Well, give our friends a good show.
I've given up all hope regarding your skill. Just get to stripping.
First you drag me here, then you make sure to disappoint me...
...Just get it over with.
Honestly. You're just being coy to save face.
Don't give me that. You're broken up about losing--you just pretend not to care.
Good attitude. Just stop trying so you can claim losing doesn't bother you.
If this game is all luck, shouldn't we be a little more even? Or are you just trying to save face?
Nothing subtle about this woman...from her threats to her outfit.
What an indecent woman...and worse, outright menacing.
At least you're not wearing enough to drag out your idle threats.
Is this how Earth women begin games? Threatening everyone at the table?
Such a barbarous woman...like Mejarian soldiers. I guess it isn't men's influence...
This never ends. I can only assume this is what getting too close to men does to a woman.
So much dirty talk...do men just turn you into sex fiends? Should I stay away from them?
I wanted to believe Earth women could be well-adjusted growing up around men, but you're confirming all my stereotypes.
Sex-crazed, violent, and completely unsubtle. You're the image of what they said trying to live with men would do to us.
An older woman? You might be able to tell me about Earth family life...I've routinely been told I look old myself.
Most of the women in here look a lot younger than you...if it makes you feel better, women think I'm older than I am.
It's suprising to see a middle-aged woman here. I just turned 20...though rookie pilots usually place me a few years older than that.
This isn't the kind of game I pictured an older woman playing. Then again, I get judged as older than I am...must be my temperament.
You dress just like Dita, with that exposed midriff.
You save the world? ...Alright then.
You save the world? Earth doesn't need saving, as far as I'm concerned.
What was that transformation you did earlier? That was impressive...you had a full suit on!
Didn't you come here with a pink suit on? How'd you take it off so quickly? All I saw was light...
Did you...transform earlier? What was that all about? I'm curious...
Weren't you wearing a suit like mine just before? ...Besides the pink. How did you transform out of it?
Who are you? You're speaking as if none of us can hear you--and to someone we can't see.
...Who are you always addressing, Kizuna? Clearly it's none of us, what with your commentary.
...Kizuna, was it? You seem to be talking to someone...just no one at this table. And with plenty of comments about us.
Vaguely luminescent...and speaking to someone we can't see. You're not giving me many reasons to trust you, Kizuna.
Someone said you're with a woman...who's the Oma going to be?
Someone said you're with a woman...have the two of you gotten pregnant yet?
You're dating a woman, correct? I suppose Mejare's cultural practices originated somewhere on Earth.
I heard you have a female partner. I'm glad to see Mejare's culture represented here--though I suppose Earth women invented it.
Someone said you're with a woman...Rebekah and Ezra recently had their baby.
Is it true you have a female partner? I didn't know Earth women did that, as well, but Mejare had to get it from somewhere.
Someone said you're with a woman...Jura and Barnette sure get along.
Someone said you're with a woman...I guess Mejare got its inspiration from some Earth women.
Someone said you're with a woman...I should see if Valore is taken.
You're a..."vampire"? You look human to me.
Do these "vampires" really suck blood? Right out of the Harvest's playbook...
So, vampires suck blood. Earth probably has a blood colony out there somewhere...poor souls.
So, you're a detective? Mejare has detectives...but they mostly investigate enemies of the state.
So, you're a detective? Anyone who focuses on discovering secrets is probably hiding a few themselves.
This academy of yours sounds like a school. Are men any good in school?
This academy of yours sounds like a school. More nuanced than Mejare's, I hope.
You seem about as expressive as I ever get.
You look like Paiway dressed up as a fairy. Are you old enough to be here?
I think I read about fairies as a girl. They protected Mejarian children from marauding packs of men.
A fairy? Earth never fails to surprise me with its species variety.
...Are you really a fairy? I'd need to see something spectacular for you to match the stories I've heard.
Are you and ~player~...in some sort of relationship, Kyu? If I had a partner, I wouldn't be playing strip poker.
Kyu, you're always addressing ~player~. Are you two...close? In some strange romantic way?
I assume ~player~ is your partner, Kyu? Public strip poker is a strange means of expressing love...but then, I don't know Earth culture.
You and ~player~ already seem to know each other, Kyu. I can't say you dress similarly...but I assume you're partners.
You raid tombs? All of Earth is ancient history is Mejare, not just dead queens.
Well, you certainly look fit, which is good to see in a woman.
Tombs, you said? Not for me...too cramped.
I had heard rumors about Earth's aversion to sexuality. A holy Mejarian would not mind exposing herself...or other women.
...It's strange how a "holy woman" would take issue with sexuality, as you seem to. On Mejare, the female form is worshipped...
Earth's idea of "holiness" seems much more conservative than Mejare's. A woman's naked body is one of our most sacred images.
A religious leader from Earth...I'm not sure what you worship here. We find nothing unholy about women's bodies, but you seem to.
What are you waving that thing around for? Guns aren't children's playthings!
Put the gun down, would you? What are you so afraid of?
...An acerbic, bestial woman waving a racketous mechanical gun around. Just how I pictured Earth women.
I can understand wanting to be armed in a seedy place like this, but you're taking this too far. And don't wave it around!
I must say, Launch, this blue-haired version of you is much more...tolerable.
You're certainly more pleasant like this. I'll try to make sure you don't sneeze again.
That blonde version of you was crass and rude. You're much more polite...though it's to the point of being demure.
I can't say I support women being total pushovers, but I'll take this polite version of you over the crude blonde one.
Do you have someone to support you? This switching can't be good for your mental health...or physical.
Your blonde version seems liable to get you killed. Do you have friends? Colleagues? Are you alright?
I'd hate to see you wander around with your...condition. Are you sure you're safe, always switching as you do?
Earth women are full of surprises...do you want to live on the Nirvana, just to have some support?
Bless you--oh, no. Don't tell me...
Not this again. The blonde version?
God bless you--oh, damn it. She's changed back...
Bless--damn it, that was Launch. Here we go again...
Mejare could do with more vegetation... we've had to terraform for every inch of it. This woman has the luxury of dressing in it...
...Is there a certain culture of nature on Earth? To wear foliage as clothing like that...Mejare struggles to grow crops.
...That's a very natural outfit. A far cry from Mejare's synthetic suits...perhaps Earth has more greenery than we do.
..."Leafy." Very direct...is there a faction of Earth dedicated to preserving its plant life? Mejare could use that...
Interesting gun, but I'm not sure why you felt the need to bring it.
I wasn't going to say anything...but that one eye is rather distracting.
I guess women come in all shapes and eye counts on Earth...or are you not from Earth?
No depth perception? You'd make a poor pilot.
...What kind of freak genetic hybrids are they developing on this planet? Are you an animal or a woman?
...So the extent of Earth's genetic and organ experimentation reaches animal-woman hybrids. Your name is..."Leggy"?
You're...not an animal, nor a woman. Is this the result of Earthlings experimenting on our harvested organs?
I...thought we knew what Earth's agenda was in harvesting its colonies' organs, but...producing lamb-women was not among that.
You're some kind of hunter, correct? I suppose a pirate isn't far off from that.
So, what's this planet Pandora like? More verdant than Mejare, I hope.
Planet Pandora, was it? I think I knew a woman named Pandora once...
It's my understanding you're a witch. How well can you control this magic of yours? You don't seem comfortable at all.
Lotte, was it? If you're really a witch, I hope you're using that intelligently...you look uneasy already.
If you're really a witch, that sounds awfully destructive. Are you sure you can control yourself? You look nervous.
You look more like a nervous schoolgirl than anyone capable of controlling "magic." Some confidence would be reassuring.
So, you're some kind of covert agent? I'd be lying if I said I was good at sniffing those out.
Speaking of covert agents...I think we gave B.C. a newfound respect for women.
The Nirvana's had its share of covert agents. They tend to warm up to our cause.
You fight with light? I suppose the Paksis isn't all that different...
You fight with light? We've had our issues with hostile red light in the past.
That's an elegant dress...your outfit is like Ezra's, a bridge operator on our ship.
You dress like Ezra...you kind of look like her, too.
You look pretty good with that sword. Maybe you could give Jura some private lessons...or another dress, at least.
Barnette's got green hair, too...but that's with the help of Mejarian genetic engineering.
Green hair isn't that strange on Mejare. One of my pilots has it. What about Earth?
Is your hair naturally green? That'd be impressive for an Earth woman...
You said you come from the plains? Sounds nice...Mejare's not very verdant, and Tarak's even worse.
You come from the plains, you said? My parents took me to the plains when I was a little girl...it was fun to run around.
The plains, you said you lived in? Somehow I doubt the Earth I know has any green left...
You don't have the figure I'd expect of a woman playing strip poker. Shorter women respond better to exercise, you know.
You need to take better care of yourself. A girl your age should not be chubby--especially when it's easier at your height.
I'm told you dropped out of school. So did I--all the more reason you should keep yourself fit. Women will try to take advantage of you.
It'd be rare to see such a chubby girl on my homeworld. We value a slender figure--exercise is good for health and beauty.
Is that a camera? Paiway, our child nurse, is always skulking around with hers...so this is nothing new.
A camera? Are you really going to photograph us all? ...Whatever.
Are you trying to blackmail us with that camera? I've been in the media for far worse than this.
I hope you don't think you're going to embarrass me with that camera. I'm not exactly from here, anyway.
This is a card game. Why'd you come armed with...whatever that thing is?
You look pretty good with that sword. Maybe you could give Jura some instruction.
Fascinating. That sword looks like it's made from the lasers our rings use.
You...what are you? Where are your eyes? Can you even see the cards?
Are you some kind of apparition? Smacks of the Paksis's work.
I wasn't going to comment on the floating, but...you're floating. What are you, exactly?
...I hope you don't think the floating and lack of eyes is normal to us. Or maybe it is on Earth...
That's quite the outfit. I thought my suit was revealing.
If that suit is meant to be a disguise, this "France" planet must be taxing on the eyes.
Hm? Someone else with blue hair...
You're from planet "France"? Well...it's certainly got an aroma.
Did you slip into your native language before? That's a little cute.
Despite our differences, humans throughout the galaxy did agree on a language...
Was that a taste of what they speak on planet France?
Funnily enough, I'm here to learn about supposedly "normal" people, too. Mejare is quite the outlier for not having men.
Other than your fangs, you seem like a normal woman to me. I'm investigating Earth women's behavior myself...
...If you're here to inspect human behavior, Mavis, I may not be the best candidate. Apparently the women of Mejare are unusual.
It seems we have similar goals, Mavis. Mejarians aren't normal, either, apparently...so I'm here to learn what is.
Someone said you gave up on school. So did I...
You look like you get a lot of exercise. Always good to see in a woman.
You said something about a killer? Earth's no stranger to killing, as far as I'm concerned.
One look at your outfit tells me we'll be here a while.
Our names are pretty close, Mei. Whose do you think is better?
You work in climate science? Tarak could use a woman like you...if women didn't terrify them.
You work in climate science? Maybe you could convince Mejare to allocate its resources better.
So, what's planet China like? Never heard of it.
You...freeze people? Misty was in cryogenic sleep, but...your way sounds dangerous.
You've got to slim down. A woman has to stay fit.
Congratulations, ~player~. These used to be my rarest lines, but there are more obscure situations now than having a clone of me.
More than one Meia? You must really like me, ~player~.
More than one of me? Honestly, ~player~, that's a little flattering.
I see Earth has also perfected cloning technology.
I'm glad you appreciate me enough to play with more than one of me.
More than one Meia? That's...a little cute, ~player~.
More than one of me? Considering my responsibilities, that would really help.
Would you look at that, ~player~'s figured out the offline version. And apparently is very fond of me.
More than one Meia? How flattering. Be sure to try out Jura, too.
I never thought I'd say these lines. I'm glad you like me so much, ~player~. That's sweet.
Two Meias? Give Jura some attention, too, ~player~. ...But thank you.
Hmhmhmhm. I never thought someone would like me this much, ~player~...
So, what's planet Switzerland like? Never heard of it.
You're a doctor? The Nirvana could use you...our only doctor is a man.
You're a doctor? The Nirvana could use you...I don't trust Duero's knowledge of women sometimes.
You're a doctor? The Nirvana could use you...Paiway's just a child nurse in training.
What exactly is the meaning of this muggle word you keep using? In reference to us, usually...
Based on your tone, I assume muggle is some kind of insult. The least you could do is explain what it means.
Whatever "muggle" is supposed to insult, Merula, I think it's lost on us without an explanation.
"Muggle"...you keep using that word. I'm not from Earth, so perhaps you could explain its meaning.
...What's a lawyer?
You work in law? Mejare has one law...obey the Grand Ma.
There are no law practitioners on Mejare. Only the state judges, and how badly they punish you for associating with men.
Planet...Japan, you said you're from? And a politician, at that...not my type.
What a strange woman...you said you're from a planet called Japan? ...And you're its leader.
I wasn't expecting a political leader to make her appearance here...not that I know the culture of this "Japan" planet.
A politician? Diplomacy was never my strong suit...and you're from Planet Japan?
One look at your outfit tells me we won't be here long.
Are you counting each bandage as one layer? If not, this'll be over soon.
...I really wasn't counting on seeing nudity this quickly. At least it's a woman.
...Did I just walk in on a game that's nearly over?
We've encountered another Earth child with esper-like powers, but he didn't demonstrate control over electricity. How many of you are there?
...So Earth has more esper children than the one we saw. Is this your ultimate goal? To create an army of superhumans?
...Another Earth child with ESP...or so you claim. I see your goal is to become a race of superhumans and justify your xenophobia...
...I'm starting to see Earth's true plans. All its children are being experimented upon to produce a generation of espers...sickening.
I'm told you hold some authority in a military organization. I hope you're using that responsibly.
A military woman? Excuse me for not being impressed.
You don't seem quite as fiercely repulsive as the woman soldiers I've come to know.
Military...nothing worse than having a soldier around. Try not to kill anyone.
These "Evas" I've heard of actually seem like impressive technology.
You said something about "Evas" before? My Dread sounds a lot more reliable...but still, they sound fearsome.
These "Evas" sound like they're not to be trifled with. It's a good thing the Earth I know doesn't have any.
I have to wonder how our Vandreads would fare against these secretive "Evangelion" mechs Earth has...I hear they're much larger.
"Evangelions"...what is Earth under threat of that you need specialized mechs to combat it?
I don't doubt the need for special technology to combat a threat--we do the same with our Paksis. But what do the Evas fight?
...Misato. If you command these Evangelion mechs, then what are they meant to defend against? It must be fearsome, as well...
Tarak and Mejare developed their Vanguards and Dreads to combat each other...what did you design the Eva mechs to fight?
It's poker, not pokermon.
You train pokuh--what?
These Pokemon sound interesting...Mejare doesn't have many animals.
You capture animals for your own amusement...sounds a little cruel, but Mejare treats men that way.
These Pokemon nipping at your heels sounds like Pyoro when he's making his rounds.
I know a woman named Misty...well, a girl named Misty.
I know a girl named Misty...she's from Pluto.
"Misty"...we have a young girl from Pluto on our crew who's named Misty, as well. She's the only one who has experience with men...
Are Earth women taught about men from a young age? We have a Plutonian girl named Misty on our crew, and she knows how to cook for them...
Somehow I've become the "Big Sister" of a girl named Misty on our crew. We picked her up from Pluto...and she knows men better than we do.
...I don't suppose you know how to woo men? We have a "Misty" from Pluto who does, despite only being fourteen.
They said you're a student...but something about you seems intense. Like you know more than you let on...
I'm told you're a student. The uniform matches...but something in your eyes doesn't.
I know this is rude, but...something seems off about you. What did you say you did? You're a student?
For a supposed student, there's something about the way you carry yourself that makes me wary...like you're one step ahead of us.
The energy you give off is still perplexing. It's as if nothing can faze you--but only because you're here.
I don't know what it is about you that makes my skin crawl... but I can't ignore it. It's like you're one with this place.
A pilot needs to be able to sense danger quickly--and you're still triggering that instinct. It's as if this place is doing it to you...
...What are you? I get the feeling you'd be harmless on Mejare, yet standing right here...I can't describe it.
What exactly is your fascination with ~player~? Do you know them from somewhere?
Is there a reason you're fixated on ~player~? What's the meaning of this constant attention?
Whatever your ulterior motives are, you're making it awfully clear you only care about ~player~.
I don't know why this girl is fixated on you, ~player~, but I would be wary of her.
...Are you feeling alright, Moon? You're acting very overeager.
...You want to strip? More so than the rest of us? Like a rookie with an inflated ego...
...Moon. What's this shouting and eagerness all about?
You're eager to be here...I don't like women who seek constant attention.
...You can't be serious.
...Excuse me? Are you really so impatient you can't take this seriously?
...Can't you take this seriously? Can't you pretend to do so?
...I wasn't expecting my stereotypes of oversexed Earth girls to be confirmed. Play seriously.
You just want attention...
I wanted a challenge, and I get you.
...Insufferable.
For God's sake...
Is it Moon's turn again? Perfect, no reason to care...
Walking Mejarian propaganda, this girl...look what men have done to her.
