I know a male doctor who'd like to inspect you for diseases, Moon...and the limits of female physiology.
You wear quite a bit for a girl so eager to strip. At least that gives me work time...
So, you feast on men's energy, or something to that effect? Way to confirm what Tarakkians already think.
You're certainly shapely. Is that how a "succubus" lures men into her traps?
Is all that really necessary? And are those real wings? I heard you say you were a succubus...
You might actually give Jura some competition with that figure. She's hunting for men herself...
I can't claim to be an expert in distinguishing male and female...but you seem very feminine, Ping. What are you doing?
..."Ping," was it? From Planet China? I thought you were a man...but you seem more like a woman putting on a performance.
...Is this a cultural tradition on Earth? Women imitating men? You're so clearly deepening your voice.
Men imitating women have fooled me...but women imitating men isn't very convincing, Ping.
I've been making an effort to distinguish the sexes better, "Ping"...and imitating men is not flattering for a woman.
Are you a student...? I went to state schools on Mejare when I was a little girl...
You seem awfully shy to be playing a game like this. Are you going to be OK?
How'd a shy girl like you end up in this place? Do you even know how to play poker?
Are you a student...? How do men behave in school, anyway?
How'd a shy girl like you end up in this place? You don't even look like an adult.
Are you a student? I dropped out of school...
I didn't expect to encounter a pirate from this planet. Do you hide your headquarters in low orbit, as well?
An Earth pirate...with a crew of her own, as I understand. We hide our base in the asteroids surrounding Mejare--what about you?
I see Earth pirates can dress as revealingly as Mejarian ones. If you haven't considered it, this planet's moon might make a good base of operations.
This planet has a very large moon. The Magno Family pirates have found success in hiding off-surface--what about your own crew?
Why are you always addressing ~player~? Do you know them from somewhere?
I was under the impression we were all strangers...but you seem very fixated on ~player~.
~player~, do you know Natsuki? She's always addressing you like you're close.
On and on about ~player~. If you two have personal issues to resolve, Natsuki, this isn't the setting for it.
...Where's your body, exactly? You look like the Paksis energy core of our ship...
You look like a miniature Paksis. Any relation?
You look like the Paksis sprouted wings and shrunk.
Are you big enough to hold the cards? Some sort of alien, I suppose...your body looks like our Paksis core.
I was told you're some sort of Oracle? I'm not sure I believe in fate...what can you predict?
...If you're truly an Oracle, I'm curious what you see in my future.
An "Oracle"...well, you're certainly tranquil enough for that. If you can forgive my skepticism, I'd like to know what you see for me.
I've always subscribed to the notion that fate is what we make for ourselves...but I've never met a so-called Oracle. What do you see for me?
I can appreciate musical talent in a woman...my Fama had a nice singing voice.
Do you plan to play that harp? I...very much appreciate music, ever since my Fama used to sing to me...
My Fama always sang to me when I was young...but I didn't inherit that talent. Women who have it are always a pleasure.
If you could share your harp's sound with us...I'd like that. I loved when my Fama sang to me as a girl...
I see you've got my affinity for words.
Hearing you loud and clear.
Women shouldn't be afraid to speak their minds.
At least your hair is expressive.
A maid? I had a maid growing up...I wish we had paid her more.
Being a maid is looked down upon on Mejare...just a stepping stone to finding the Oma of your children.
Mejare looks down on maids...Mejare looks down on a lot of professions.
Mejare looks down on maids...but they're held in higher regard than pirates.
What's with the honorifics? Strange language you must speak at home...
What's with the honorifics? Maybe Mejare could do with that kind of politeness...
...Is this the result of some cruel Earth experiment? You have extra arms grafted onto you.
...My God. Earth would turn a woman loose into the streets after grafting extra limbs onto her? I'd probably be shouting, too...
...I should've expected to see women who have been experimented on and cast aside by Earth's uncaring government. Are you alright, Orendi?
Constantly shouting, with two extra arms...I can only imagine what other victims of Earth's failed organ transplants may be wandering about. Are you in pain, Orendi?
You're a goddess? Don't be so vain.
You're a goddess because you live in the sky? There's a lot more to the universe than that.
Jura would probably describe herself as a "goddess"...
I thought Jura dressed extravagantly...now we have a goddess.
An engineer, and a user of "magic"? Hm...if there's any truth to that, I'm sure our ship engineer Parfet would love to meet you.
The crew has an engineer of our own--Parfet. But she doesn't claim to use any "magic"...
This "magic" of yours seems at odds with the logical nature of engineering. But I'm just a pilot...perhaps you and Parfet could talk.
If only our own engineer, Parfet, had access to this "magic" of yours. Not that I trust it in the first place...
So, you work for an old woman too.
I hear an old woman is your superior, too...and that she's not as kind as the captain.
Old women can be difficult to work for sometimes, wouldn't you agree?
So you do unsavory work for this old woman you know? I work for an old woman, too...she approached me.
You're from some kind of ninja village, was it? And what's a ninja, for that matter?
These "ninjas" of yours sound a lot like the telepathic people Hibiki got stuck with...
Not to be rude, but what's the significance of your facial markings?
Facial markings...I think Rabat's people have some, too. Not that I trust them.
You're a..."princess"? With a brooch and everything...you look the part.
What's a princess? Some kind of leadership position? The crown leads me in that direction...
A princess...is that like the Grand Ma? That's who rules Mejare...
You're royalty? I don't like it when people assume they're better than others...the title doesn't make the woman.
You study human culture? What exactly are you?
You study human culture? I could probably learn from you...
You study human culture? Duero has an anatomy book you might be interested in reading...
Jura's a big fan of pearls...or really anything that shines.
You're a teacher, correct? I always find myself having to coach new Dread pilots, so I wouldn't mind advice.
Mejare's teachers are all state-employed and deliver anti-men propaganda. But as squadron commander, I've had to teach rookies myself...
A teacher...I remember liking my teachers in school before I dropped out. I never thought I'd be teaching women piloting.
So what is it that you teach on Earth? Mejare teaches about the horrors of men...and I teach how to pilot Dreads.
...The classic Penny? Is this your way of calling me outdated, ~player~?
So, you're a teacher? ...Wait, no. You're not...you're just the classic Penny, risen from the grave.
I'm told you're the classic version of Penny, but if you ask me, you're simply the child version.
"Penny Classic." The newer Penny looks more mature, ~player~...you shouldn't be stuck in the past.
Pink hair...and pink skin. What kind of experiments is Earth conducting to do this to you?
Whatever experimentation Earth conducted on our harvested organs to give you pink skin, it also seems to have given you boundless energy...
I wouldn't put it past Earth's Harvest to try and create pink-skinned, excitable breeds of women...but it wouldn't have been my first guess.
Such endless enthusiasm...if I were the pink-skinned product of strange Earth experimentation, I'd be even more morose.
...You're tall for a woman. Might give Gascogne a run for her money.
So, what's this "America" planet known for? Tall women?
You report the news? I was on the news as a little girl...wish I wasn't.
You're a reporter? It's been a while since I had a positive media appearance.
You're a student, yes? And what does this Academy you attend teach you about?
My school experiences...weren't the best. But I'm curious what you've been learning in this Academy of yours.
You're certainly shy...that's normally what I expect from students. What is it you've been taught, exactly?
A student? I dropped out of school...I had to learn piloting the hard way. What's taught in "Beacon Academy"?
You don't quite seem dressed for the occasion here. Unless you'd rather just get it over with.
Do you just like challenging yourself, based on how little you're wearing? I just rushed over in what I usually wear.
At least you seem to like the attention. Based on your outfit, you're going to attract a lot of it.
You've got enough energy for both of us. Neither of us is wearing very much, though...
Well, Mika, you said you were going to win this game. How far can you stretch that outfit?
I didn't plan out how to make my flightsuit last...you're here to win, apparently, so let's see yours.
I hope your grand strategy isn't to amaze us into losing. I already don't see much clothing left on you.
I'd heard Earth women dressed conservatively...I did not expect to find one wearing even less than me. Unless you're hiding a master plan.
You seem to be out of options. Or...is your plan to have Nadeshiko tag in for you?
I think I may have figured out your plan. Once your meager clothing is gone, your partner will take over.
For being so confident at first, you're already down to nothing, it seems. Is Nadeshiko here to take over?
I see what you were planning now. You and your partner must do everything together--so she'll fill in from this point.
I'm interested in what a fashion designer might have to say about my suit...though I'd prefer the opinion of the newer Rarity.
I've always interpreted fashion as meaningless fluff. What's a designer's opinion on my bodysuit? ...Even if you're the old Rarity.
Fashion...a pastime for the rich and privileged. Still, I'm curious what a professional thinks of my bodysuit...an outdated version of a professional, anyway.
It seems even fashion designers can go out of fashion. Eclipsed by a newer version of yourself...still, what's your opinion on my suit?
And Jura calls me chilly...
You look like that outfit has never come off.
You can show your face, Raven...I know being open with people can be hard.
People say I never smile...are you the same way?
You're certainly acting more cheerful, Raven. Perhaps I should follow suit...
Something about this game lightened you up in a hurry. That was supposedly why I came here...
Jura told me this place would put me in a better mood...well, it's worked for you, Raven.

state.text: Something about stripping has brought out a lighter side of you. Now everyone will expect that of me.

case.state: Why do you have wings? Is this the result of some Earth experiment with the organs it harvests?
Wings--and they're twitching. Clearly not decorations...Earth's organ experimentation has gone further than I realized.
I should've known there'd be bizarre artificial evolutions of humans on Earth...this woman has wings.
Not content to sustain themselves with harvested organs, it seems Earthlings are inducing new evolutions into their women. Hence Remilia's wings.
If Earthlings are managing to graft wings onto themselves, I can only imagine what strange modifications they've made to the Mejarian uteri they've stolen.
Is there a reason you felt the need to come armed to a friendly card game? Especially with men's mechanical sidearms?
I see Earth women are still stuck with men's clunky kinetic weapons.
If you're so into weaponry, try Mejare's laser rings. They're a lot quieter than those racketous male ones.
You'd get along with Barnette...if you seemed capable of getting along with anyone. She likes men's mechanical guns.
You sure like to talk big...as long as you've brought those clunky men's guns to a card game.
...Is there a reason you keep waving those clunky kinetic guns around? Women should know better than to use male weapons.
...You don't need to start any fights. I certainly don't want to hear the racket of those men's sidearms you've got.
I'll never understand Barnette's fixation on clunky men's guns...or yours.
...I want to believe you're more than a trumped-up thug waving her first firearms around.
On and on with the shouting...are you really just some belligerent drifter?
I have no patience for aimless thugs. Are you really nothing more than that, Revy?
A drifting thug, waving guns around, trying to intimidate strangers...far too familiar. Unless you're actually more than that.
So, you're some sort of enforcer at this Lagoon Company. I like a competent woman...but leadership might teach you discipline.
I can believe you're your company's muscle--a good shot is worth my respect. Have you considered some leadership?
I don't doubt your aim, but you could use some discipline. Gascogne put me in charge of the squadron to teach me some.
Some leadership responsibility might calm you down, you know. I was an aggressive rookie with good aim, once, too.
I saw that your arms were extended just as I came here--like they were made of springs. What was that?
You're more than just a boxer--I saw your arms retract as the game began. Explain yourself.
"Ribbon Girl." A strange title for a woman with strange springloaded arms...I'd like an explanation.
If you could retract those springloaded arms, then you can extend them. I'm watching you--and feel free to explain.
...Normally I would not badger you about your condition, but how do you intend to strip?
...Some of the women in my command have suffered arm amputations. I won't press the issue...but how will you strip?
...I don't suppose you can strip with your legs. That's my only concern with your condition...
...This was congenital? I'm sorry...pilots can suffer debilitating injuries. ...How will you remove your clothing?
You have the fashion sense of Barnette, one of my pilots...that is, less is more.
You have the sense of style of Barnette, one of my pilots...that is, skin is always in style.
Dark skin, and a revealing outfit...you remind me a bit of Valore, another Dread team leader. Well, revealing outfits remind me of many young Mejarians...
"Rinkah of the Flame Tribe," was it? Perhaps Mejare's first colonists took their fashion sense from your minimalistic style...
Is your relative lack of clothing part of the "Flame Tribe's" aesthetic? Mejare feels the same way.
Minimalistic clothing...you'd fit right in on my homeworld. Though the animal pelts would turn heads.
You're a..."princess"? ...With magic?
What's a princess? Some kind of leadership position? I guess magic would make you worthy of it.
A princess...is that like the Grand Ma? Well, she can't use magic...
You're royalty? I don't like it when people assume they're better than others...but magic might give you a good reason to think that.
You're a..."princess"? ...Of space?
What's a princess? Some kind of leadership position? Who in space makes these decisions?
A princess...is that like the Grand Ma? I thought you were just out in space...
So, you travel through space, too...how's it treating you?
It can get lonely out in space, wouldn't you agree? Even with a whole crew at your side...
You fly through space on an observatory? Sounds...strangely luxurious.
There's certainly a punk rock scene in some of Mejare's seedier bars...but I've never seen it combined with animal training.
Punk rock...I used to listen to those sorts of acts all the time. Granted, they didn't involve "Pokuh-mon"...
My parents used to claim your sort of punk music was "poison"...but I don't think they meant the use of venomous animals.
Mejare has an underground scene of punk musicians... breaking the mold, singing about sex with men. None of them were animal tamers.
Why are you carrying ammunition? What kind of place is this that small girls are armed?
Even young girls have bullets on them here...I knew this place was a bad idea.
Ammunition? Where's the weapon for it, and why is a young girl like you carrying it?
I was going to say you look too young for this place, but the bullets on your hip let me know you've got bigger problems.
You look a little on edge...especially with that red streak of hair. Were you engineered to have that?
That's an interesting streak in your hair. Mejarians have unusual hair colors, but not on specific parts...was it engineered like that?
That red streak of hair...is that natural? I've never seen piecemeal hair color engineering like that...
That red streak of hair seems to betray your attitude. With a piecemeal coloration like that, I wonder if you were engineered with technology beyond Mejare's...
You're a bit behind the times, ~player~. This is the old version of Ryuko...the one I moved offline, in fact.
Another older version of a character? Oh, yes, Ryuko...her being retired was my doing, actually.
That's an interesting red str--oh, wait, you're old Ryuko. My submission moved you offline, you know.
You shouldn't live in the past, ~player~. This Ryuko has been replaced...in fact, I was the one who retired her.
...Are you alright, Saki? You're all clammed up.
You look like a schoolgirl. Are you sure you want to be here? Is someone making you do this?
Are you alright...Saki, was it? You look so nervous...
Saki? That's you, right? You've hardly said a thing...and you're turning red.
You look like you've seen better days...and are about to see worse ones. Are you sure you want to be here?
Pint-sized and crass...street thugs always have difficulty integrating into our crew. I would know.
The Magno Family gets a lot of your type off the streets. They have trouble working with others...I did.
I see Earth society produces an underbelly of young women on the streets, too. Our crew has to whip them into shape...
...A loudmouthed, cocky thug fresh off the streets. Our crew takes in a lot of your type, and they get put in Reg moving crates.
...I've always been wary of the kind of overly-optimistic persona celebrities put on. I used to have one myself.
...In my experience, the cheery manner of an idol is meant to mask something. I did it myself when my family was famous.
An idol? ...I know how celebrities can hide issues beneath their image. I did.
I wouldn't expect a media star to play a game about revealing yourself...they have secrets like the rest of us. My family was the same way.
Even my cheeriest crewmates are hiding insecurities. Celebrities can be even worse with that--I would know.
Hunting space pirates? Some pirates have a good reason for what they do...
Oh, you're not from Earth, either? ...And you hunt space pirates. I see.
So, you travel through space, too...and hunt space pirates. Good luck with that.
There's a pirate named Rabat I wouldn't mind you catching for us...since you travel through space.
Good to see someone who shares my fashion sense...and origin.
These bodysuits can get uncomfortable, wouldn't you agree, Samus? Even out in space...
So, you travel through space, too...and you hunt space pirates? I'll keep that in mind.
For a young schoolgirl, you seem a little uncomfortable in that uniform...and you have an older woman's tranquility.
I'd rather not play strip poker with a young schoolgirl still in her uniform. You do strike me as mature for your age, though.
You say you're a schoolgirl, but you don't seem quite as immature as that would imply. Even I was excitable in school.
Sanako, was it? You've got a mature aura about you for a girl still in school...that only makes me mildly more comfortable stripping you.
I've never seen a schoolgirl act so calm and reserved...there's a parent-like calmness to your eyes.
What exactly is a "Magical Girl"? You seem to use it as if it's a title...do you actually have powers?
A "Magical Girl"? If you've got special powers, it'd be worth my time to see them.
Normally I'd doubt a woman who called herself a "Magical Girl"...but the Paksis itself is extraordinary.
With what we've accomplished with the Paksis's help, I can believe a woman when she calls herself a "Magical Girl." Now I'm curious...
You're a pilot? It's nice to meet you! We should discuss squadron formations.
These "Gundams" of yours sound a lot like Vanguards. I wonder if my Dread could combine with them...
Oh, wow, another mech pilot! We should talk after the game.
You're a pilot? I only took up piloting a few years ago, but I've really fallen in love.
It's good to see a fellow pilot! You even look a little like Belvedere, one of our bridge operators.
A mech pilot, hm? I pilot a Dread myself...but recent events have forced me to learn mech operation.
Are you sure you want to be here? You look young...and very naive.
A schoolgirl? And a bright-eyed one at that...this is making me uncomfortable.
What a cheerful young girl. You certainly look old enough to be here...but I'm not sure you're mature enough.
You know what you're getting into, right? I don't want a schoolgirl crying and wasting my time.
Please don't subject us all to your ongoing relationship issues with ~player~, Sayori. I get enough of that from my subordinates.
I have to manage my pilots' problems often enough, so don't expect me to play marriage counselor for you and ~player~.
...You seem a bit obsessed with ~player~. If you two have issues, you could work them out elsewhere.
...Sayori, are you in some kind of relationship with ~player~? Reminds me of when my pilots get too comfortable with each other...
I admit, your enthusiasm is infectious. You remind me of Dita, one of my pilots...always playing with her alien dolls.
It's like a schoolgirl version of Dita...oh, she's one of my subordinates. A sweet girl, but not responsible enough.
You're how I imagine Dita, one of my pilots, in school. She can be a handful, but she always keeps up our morale...
I can't be too critical of someone so optimistic. Dita, one of my pilots, is cheerful, too...as she chases Hibiki.
That's quite the outfit. Might even make Jura jealous.
I've heard Earth women dress like you to attract men. Mejarians do it to attract each other...
Well, you're certainly devoted to matching colors. I wear what I have.
...About as much on as Barnette ever layers. And she has a certain reputation for baring it all.
You look like a military type...I hate soldiers.
I know you military types. Always looking for a state-approved means of harassing people.
I know you military types. Happy to shut down and kill, never there when it's time to rebuild.
You'll have to excuse my dislike of woman soldiers. The last one I met had her knee in my back.
Someone else with blue hair...too bad you're a soldier.
It can get lonely out in space, wouldn't you agree? ...Apparently not with a "Borg collective." I apologize.
Oh, you're not from Earth, either? ...What's this "Borg" all about?
Your "Borg" sounds a lot like the Harvest...taking whatever they want.
We used to think men were just a collective, too...maybe I shouldn't make fun.
Good to see someone who shares my fashion sense.
These bodysuits can get uncomfortable, wouldn't you agree?
Your "Star Fleet" sounds nice. Humans are all scattered on different planets where I'm from...though we don't have to deal with this "Borg."
So, you travel through space, too...and the "Borg" sounds suspiciously similar to the Harvest. We'll watch out for them.
..."Genie" doesn't refer to "offline character," does it?
"Genie" must be some artifact from Earth folklore. Much like how you're an artifact of this game's past.
Is "genie" some kind of Earth race? The way you refer to yourself as "half-genie" is suspect...I wonder if your current incarnation maintains this.
Does "genie" just mean "dark skin"? Amarone never calls herself a genie...
Does "genie" just mean "dark skin"? Valore never called herself a genie...
Does "genie" just mean "dark skin"? B.C. never calls herself a genie...but then, she doesn't exactly count.
You're a trained medic, correct? That would be useful on our ship--our only female medical staff is a young nurse.
"Sharla," was it? Our ship's only trained doctor is a man, so female medical talent would help.
Duero, our ship's doctor, is competent enough, but I'd prefer a female medic--that's you, right? We're also shorthanded on pilots.
This planet "Australia" of yours sounds rough around the edges. Just like Tarak...
So, what's planet Australia like? Never heard of it.
Australians sure have a unique...manner of speaking.
...How exactly did this "Australia" develop its dialect?
Decorated dress for an assassin...pirates tend not to draw much attention to themselves, either.
So, you're an assassin? I can appreciate getting the job done quickly...and quietly.
An assassin...it's the M.O. of our squadron to not draw attention to ourselves. Dreads are sleek and silent.
An assassin, you said? One of the reasons I prefer Mejarian laser rings is their subtlety.
Hm? The classic Sheena...well before my time, and it shows. Play the new one, ~player~...
...~player~, are you aware there's a newer version of Sheena available? Clinging to nostalgia is unhealthy.
I'm sure there's better opponents to pick than an outdated version of a character, ~player~. Give feedback on the newer Sheena.
The old Sheena? This must be an offline game...by a player who's stuck in the past.
Good to see someone who shares my fashion sense...though you look like you're in a hurry to remove it.
These bodysuits can get uncomfortable...but you seem quite comfortable yourself.
You look like you're having fun already, even despite that strange green skin.
I was about to ask about your green skin, but it just seems to be your natural complexion. You're certainly having fun as we speak.
What are you smirking about all the time? Just comfortable in your own...green skin?
Aren't you from Earth? Why would you come armed to this place?
What's a woman doing with kinetic weaponry? They're as unsubtle as the men who use them.
I have a pilot who collects antique kinetic guns like yours. She'd probably love to inspect that.
...You're clutching that gun tightly, but if you'd be willing to part with it, I have a subordinate pilot who collects them.
The way you're clutching that gun tells me you and my pilot Barnette would hit it off. She collects those mechanical firearms.
Is that an antique men's submachine gun? One of my pilots, Barnette Orangello, has taught me enough about them to know that...she has a collection.
What a hyperactive girl...can't you calm down?
Are you even listening to the game's rules? Just speeding around like a fool...
So energetic...you remind me of our overenthusiastic rookie pilots. Settle down.
I'm getting shades of Dita's energy from this girl...Shimakaze, right? Relax.
...You're the soul...of a warship. Hm...in a way, our Paksis energy core is the Nirvana's soul...
Interesting notion, being the embodiment of a ship...our Paksis core is like that. But it isn't a girl.
You could say the Nirvana has a consciousness of its own, with our Paksis core...but it's not walking around as a young girl.
Ships having souls isn't too far off from what our Paksis seems to be for the Nirvana. Still, you're a strange specimen...
You should know, Shimakaze...my Dread is the fastest in our fleet. I, too, value speed...
A ship obsessed with speed...we're not so different, Shimakaze. My Dread has a similar reputation as the fastest.
Speed and evasion are ship traits I can respect. I value them, too...my Dread is built for speed.
It's not often I speak to a ship, let alone one built to be quick. My own Dread is the fastest we have...

Personal accounts can be the most illustrative...you had your daughter with a man, correct? How did you know he was the right choice?
Your daughter has a male parent, correct? Or--father. What did you look for in a man who'd raise your children?
Choosing the Oma of one's daughter is an important moment for Mejarians. But if you had yours with a man...why him?
You seem interested in the history of this planet. My homeworld leaves men out of Earth's history...are there any legends about men and women?
I could learn a lot from a woman who's studied Earth's mythology. Have cultural perceptions of men and women changed over time?
You study mythology, correct? Mejare's stories always centered around conquering men--do Earth's involve man-woman relationships?
My homeworld has little in the way of mythology compared to Earth. Do you know much about the cultural history surrounding men and women?
Slender, long-legged, and with a taste for revealing clothing...you would get a modeling job on my planet in no time.
A fashion model...I was given modeling offers as a child. There's a large industry for your body type on Mejare.
Do you find your modeling work lucrative here, Elesa? The Mejarian fashion industry seeks out slender women like you.
I see Mejare's taste in both women's bodies and outfits is present here. If you're ever struggling financially, consider a job there.
Megumin, correct? I'm sure you're anxious to demonstrate your magical powers, but children don't belong here.
Why is there a child at this table? Supposedly being prodigious at magic does not mean she's mentally mature enough for this.
...What kind of establishment lets adults strip naked in front of children? Magical powers or not, this is inappropriate for her to see.
...Megumin, this place is adults-only. If you want to discuss "explosion magic" with us, then it can wait until after the game.
...Why have the others referred to you as an "angel"? You look like a normal woman.
...There must be an alternate meaning for "angel" in Earth culture I'm unaware of. You look normal...and angels don't impatiently demand sex.
...I can only assume "angel" is sarcastic Earth slang for promiscuity. Unless you have another explanation.
...I'm told you're some sort of "angel," but nothing about you looks supernatural. Do you know what that's referring to?
...As I said, I'm from the Mejarian system. We've never encountered alien life--how long have you been on this planet?
...Has Earth been communicating with your species for a long time, Starfire? Mejare was completely unaware of aliens' existence...
...Unbelievable. Earth first established colonies to find alien life, and yet it discovers it before we do. How long have you lived here?
...I have so many questions. When did your race first make contact with Earth? Mejare's had no such meeting with an alien species...
Is it true you're from an all-woman culture here on Earth? Perhaps this is the origins of Mejare's colonists...
...Diana, are these "Amazons" an Earth society that rejects men? You may be the precursors to the women who settled Mejare...
...You come from an all-woman society, right here on Earth? How long has this been established? We may be descended from the same women...!
"Wonder Woman"...are there really enclaves of Earth women who live away from men? Perhaps that's the missing cultural link between our planets...
I'm always pleased to see a young girl who's devoted to exercise, but your skin looks quite unhealthy. Have you visited a doctor?
A schoolgirl who's already committed herself to fitness is great to see...but what's given you your blue skin? Are you breathing properly?
Still in school...I wish I'd started taking my fitness seriously that early. Then again, your skin color suggests you may be exercising too hard...
Blue skin...are you suffering from some form of anemia? I hope that doesn't affect your athletics...
...Jessie. Where is the man who impregnated you? Does he not mind what you do for a career?
Where is the father of your child, anyway? Has he accompanied you here--or on porn shoots, for that matter?
I'm surprised the man who fathered your daughter allows you to work in pornography. Maybe men don't place much stock in monogamy...
Pornography is a strange choice of career for a married woman. Does your child's father not consider that cheating?
A ghost? ...Well, the Paksis can make images appear. Anything is possible.
I...was under the impression all my opponents would be alive. Maybe this is the Paksis's doing...
W-who are you? A ghost? ...The Paksis creates apparitions sometimes...I don't know how you're here.
...You barely have a body to show us. I wonder if the Paksis can make ghost-like images...
How did you die in the first place, Spooky? If you don't mind me asking.
To learn here and now that an afterlife exists...if you're really a ghost, that is. Did you die of natural causes?
...Forgive me if this is too personal, Spooky, but what was the cause of your death?
I would still sooner believe you to be some apparition from the Earth's Paksis, sent to confuse and scare us...how did you die, exactly?
I can see our similar names getting confusing, but it's a pleasure to meet you, Mei.
Mei and Meia...I should consider myself lucky there's no similarly-named woman among our crew.
Pleased to meet you, Mei. We'll have to listen carefully so we know which one of us others are addressing.
Our names are quite similar, Mei. I hope that doesn't interfere with conversation as the game progresses.
You remind me quite a bit of our ship's lead engineer, Parfet. She's always excited about our machinery--and she wears baggy clothing, as well.
Our ship's engineer will be happy to know that there's women just like her on Earth--not just in dress, but in unbridled excitement over technology.
Large, obfuscating eyewear...baggy pants...heavy boots...a positive attitude. It's like looking at our engineer, Parfet, right here on Earth.
You're just like our ship's engineer, Parfet, right down to your clothing. I respect her intelligence very much, even if she's too upbeat for me.
By your defensiveness, I get the sense that you're small even by Earth standards. Is this a side effect of your magical powers?
At first I suspected that Earth's resources led to smaller women, but this seems like a personal issue of yours. Does "explosion magic" stunt growth?
If your body hasn't developed as much as the typical Earth woman, is it possible that it's from your magic? It might drain the body's energy.
Even at eighteen, you're as developed as our eleven-year-old nurse. Is it possible that "magic" has warped your body?
You're...a little pale. Are you feeling alright? And you're not wearing much...
So pale...muscular, but...you look sickly, despite how little you're wearing. Trouble breathing?
And Jura calls me pale. You're marble-white. And you don't really have the wardrobe for this game...
...Is there no sun on your planet? You're certainly dressed for it.
That's a vivid hair color...but the mechanical arm is more striking.
You're a fiery one. I'm sorry about your arm...or I would be, if it didn't look superior to my own.
My crewmates and I all have different hair colors...none of us have mechanical arms.
Genetic engineering on Mejare has resulted in outlandish hair colors...maybe we could regrow your arm.
I'd say I'm sorry, but...that mechanical arm looks pretty useful.
Good to see a woman who can carry herself...and perhaps lift herself, too.
I shouldn't pry as to how you lost your arm...but is that mechanical replacement useful?
You're a fiery one. Like if Barnette and Jura had their child...hopefully she'd have her arm.
I was wondering why a butterfly was being dealt cards. Do you actually have clothing to lose?
...I wasn't prepared to meet a sentient butterfly here. How exactly do you plan on "stripping"?
...Are you really participating in this game? I could accept a talking butterfly providing commentary, but you don't have clothes.
A talking insect...Earth's experimentation reaches new depths. How you plan to strip, "Flutter"?
...Yuelia. Why would you join this game as a butterfly and almost immediately change back? Were you trying to rattle us?
Why did you even come to the table as an insect if you're so quick to project a human form? Just to demonstrate your powers?
...Yuelia. Have you actually changed shape, or was that butterfly some sort of hologram? Either way, why did you drop the act so quickly?
Flutter--er, Yuelia. Was that butterfly form just a means of making an entrance? You dropped it at the first opportunity.
Are you sure you want to be here? Not to be rude, but you seem absentminded...a naive girl still in her school uniform.
..."Amy," correct? I don't know how a carefree schoolgirl found herself here, but I don't want to see you get taken advantage of.
Hello, Amy. I'm surprised to see a young schoolgirl playing a game like this...I hope someone knows you're here.
"Amy," was it? I'm not sure why...but I get the sense that no one is looking out for you here. Be aware of your surroundings.
...Chun-Li, is it just me, or do we sound...somewhat similar? You're just a bit older than I am...
...When you speak, I keep thinking I'm hearing a recording of my own voice. We sound a bit alike, don't you think?
...Forgive me if this sounds strange, Chun-Li, but we sound alike. I wonder if my crewmates might mistake your voice for mine.
...Have you noticed we sound similar, Chun-Li? If I took a more upbeat tone, we might match.
...For some reason, your voice reminds me of how I sounded when I was younger. I suppose it's just coincidence.
...Lotte, have you noticed we sound a bit alike? I had more of your nervous tone when I was a girl.
...This may sound strange to you, Lotte, but your voice sounds just like me when I was a girl. Can you hear it a bit?
Mhmhm...Lotte, have you noticed our voices aren't much different? Listening to you speak brings back memories...
You look like you haven't gotten any sleep. You need to take better care of yourself, even at your young age.
"Tomoko," correct? It's important for a young girl to respect herself and her body's health. You look exhausted and disheveled.
What's a young girl like you doing here in a seedy place, looking tired and unkempt? You need rest, Tomoko.
..."Tomoko," correct? Are you alright? Do you have a place to sleep? I hate seeing a girl your age in places like this.
...You keep speaking in slang. I assume it's popular among young Earth girls, but it's difficult to determine what you're saying.
...Are you intentionally using as much jargon as you can to confuse us? I might learn some Earth phrases if you explained them...
...What a strange girl. I should make a note of all the unusual phrases you're using and try to decipher them later.
...There must be a subculture among Earth girls that lends itself to strange sayings. Are you even interested in making conversation?
It's so strange for me to see wealthy schoolgirls in uniform anymore...they don't tend to join pirates. Of course, I'm proof that it can happen.
...I'd say a wealthy girl in her school uniform would never join our pirate crew, but that's exactly who I was once.
Is it true your family is well-off? Mine was, as well, but I still ended up as a pirate. Don't take your wealth for granted.
Hello, Maki. The Magno Family pirates recruit many drifters your age...I was rare example of a wealthy girl, like you. It can happen to anyone.
Is it true you're some sort of robotics expert? Our ship's lead engineer, Parfet, says she sometimes feels alone in her interests.
You're "half-genie," correct? I'm not familiar with the term...I wouldn't think that pointed ears would warrant a separate race.
Aside from your pointed ears, you look like a human woman, Shantae. What's the meaning of being "half-genie," as you claim?
...Could you explain what the goals are of this "Fairy Tail" guild you claim to be a part of? It sounds vaguely like mercenary work...
"Lucy," correct? Your "Fairy Tail" organization may provide some insight into Earth's economy...is it a mercenary guild?
I assume your belt is next. It's interesting to see another woman with a whip...our vice captain uses one as a weapon, not that she fights much.
...Our ship's vice captain is a woman named Buzam. She carries a whip for self-defense, much like you do...well, I assume yours is for that purpose.
Forgive me if this is too personal, but...how did you lose your arm? Was it a combat injury?
You're quite upbeat for a woman with a robotic arm...did you lose it while on a raid? I'm lucky to have had no lasting injuries...
..."Komi-san," correct? You haven't said anything...are you alright? You have the same look rookies do on their first flight...
...You look nervous, Komi-san. You haven't said a thing...I've met girls in my Dread team who get like that, but only when faced with a dogfight.
What a terrified young girl...it reminds me of pilots on their first mission, wide-eyed and scared speechless. Are you alright, Komi-san?
It's nice to meet you, Shamir. You don't seem interested in this game...you mentioned being on a mission, correct?
Hello, Shamir. I can appreciate a woman who's mission-focused, but I'm not sure how playing strip poker could be a part of that...
Surely you weren't recruited as a warrior in your current state. How have you been allowed to become so chubby?
If you're really a warrior, then I imagine you weren't always so overweight. How have you gotten to this point, where your stomach is hanging out?
So grossly out of shape...I can't imagine you were like this when you first became a warrior. Is this the result of peacetime complacency?
...Azami, are you alright? You look pale...and I'm told you have a prominent scar. Are you worried about showing it here?
...I came here to ask questions about Earth's people and culture, but I suppose you won't be giving me answers.
...I'm glad Mejare has mimes, as well, so I understand what you're doing. You certainly wouldn't explain yourself.
...Nanoko-chan, you seem uncomfortable here. You can't expect to be set at ease unless you speak up about it.
...Nanoko-chan, you're fidgeting and avoiding eye contact. If something is bothering you, you should make it known.
What an elaborate outfit...it's as if you're trying to totally hide your appearance. I hope you're aware you're playing strip poker.
You're displaying a lot of Earth fashion...I might be inclined to ask about it if you weren't hiding your entire body in it.
...What--monstrosity are you? With a human voice...it's like a vision the Paksis might give me, of a twisted and warped woman...
...Are you...a human being? You have a voice, and a form, but it's so distorted...our Paksis core has given me visions like this.
...Ryuko? Your uniform--w-what's this intense energy?
...Your outfit completely changed with that uniform's shape-shifting. Can it still survive if you remove pieces of it?
I was hoping to see this...do you plan to take that uniform apart? If it's a living being, can it separate?
...I can sympathize with a young girl rebelling against authority. But to think a teenage rebel would wield such power... w-what's happening now?
...I, too, chose to rebel against oppression. But how did a teenage girl gain access to such weaponry? ...And what's it doing now?
Knowing you, I'm sure your panties will come off in spectacular fashion...not unlike the man in my squadron.
No matter what you do, even taking off your underwear, it seems to be with intense passion. It reminds me of the male pilot on my team.
You only ever talk about eating French fries--in addition to eating them as we speak. What else does your diet consist of?
French fries can't be the only thing you eat--you'd be in an even worse state. What other "human food" have you discovered?
I often coach my Dread team members on issues of fitness. Can you describe your diet, Erufuda? Maybe I can offer advice.
I'm told you attend an officer's school. I serve as a junior officer myself, but in a pirate crew--I have no formal education on the subject.
Bernadetta, yes? You're quite shy for a woman who's attending school for military command. I'm not formally trained, but I lead a team of Dread fighters.
...Are you really a robot? You're so humanlike in look and mannerisms...even our navi robots are distinctly mechanical, though one of them has emotions.
...If you're really a robot, Earth's advances in the field are far beyond our own. We've only just created a robot with emotions by pure accident.
You're quite fixated on money. It was years ago that I even had any Mejarian credits to my name...now our crew just stockpiles it.
...You're a shopkeeper, I take it? I haven't handled money in years...our crew doesn't take jobs.
If you're here for some kind of sales pitch, I don't have any Earth money. In fact, I only handle Mejarian money when we find some on a raid.
The closest thing our crew even has to money is food certificates. I won't be involved in any of your business ventures this evening.
...An "animate" statue? I see...you must be some kind of host body Earthlings create to house the organs they harvest before transferring their consciousness.
...What's the meaning of your "animate" status? Perhaps you're a test body to ensure the quality of harvested organs, or some experimental golem...
One of this planet's political leaders...I'm told you reside in a cold region. Mejare is a temperate planet, if you couldn't tell by my outfit.
I'd heard you were the leader of one of Earth's colder regions. That would explain your heavy dress...my own planet is climate-controlled.
It's my understanding that Earth's temperatures vary wildly based on region. I'm glad Mejare doesn't have that issue--I'd hate to dress for the cold the way you do.

state.text: What's the meaning of that ridiculous mask? Not to mention the reckless way you're swinging her machete around--!
Why are we set up next to an unhinged woman with a mask and machete? She's not holding it like it's for self-defense--!

case.state: Komi-san, I've noticed that you occasionally use men's language in your writing. We only use kana on Mejare--it's fascinating to see men and women's coexistence in culture, as well.
Earth's style of writing is fascinating, Komi-san. You fuse men and women's language--Mejare doesn't use those more complex characters. A mixed letter system for mixed genders...
I'd never considered this, but the same way men and women live together on this planet, you write using a combination of our languages. Tarakkians use those kanji letters to encode messages.
Is it true you're a swordswoman? My deputy ensign carries a rapier, though I'd prefer she practice more.
I'm told you're an experienced swordswoman, even though you're a young girl. I don't care for edged weapons myself, but one of my pilots uses a rapier.
I don't know what your intentions are, but you'd best keep that knife to yourself. It's sad a child managed to get a hold of one in the first place.

state.text: Why is there a mentally unstable child permitted to run about this place with a knife? I won't hesitate to defend myself.

case.state: Why have you drawn your knife? In fact, I don't even see a sheathe for it. You're clearly not well.
"PA-15"...a codename? I'd expect a professional to have a better sense of gun safety.
You're far too animated to have that weapon out. Are you really a professional the way your codename implies?
"Pok-uh-mon"...I've never heard of such creatures. And they're apparently common on this planet?
I wonder if these "Pokuhmon" creatures are invasive species that have resulted from Earth's experimentation on regular animals...
Why are you hiding yourself? One of our bridge members dressed in elaborate costumes to shield herself from men's germs...
You're Myriam, right? That box looks like something Celtic might wear--a crewmate of mine who was afraid of the men we brought on board. Why are you inside it?
...Are you hiding from us in that box? One of my crewmates wore a bear costume in fear of men infecting her. An Earth woman can't possibly be scared of that...
...You're "Stella," right? I saw you enter through some kind of portal--what kind of technology is that using?
You were the girl who came in through a portal, aren't you? Our crew has encountered wormholes in the past, but you seem to have harnessed that technology for yourself. How?
...Yunyun, can you explain this "Crimson Demon" clan you claim to be a part of? You said you were going to be its Chief.
It's a pleasure to meet you, Yunyun. You said you were to become the leader of your "Crimson Demon" clan, right? How does it operate?
...Neptune, are you not an Earth citizen, either? You've mentioned a "Planeptune" being your homeworld.
You're from "Planeptune," right? Is that a region of this planet, or its own unique world like Mejare?
It sounds as if you have a reptuation for exercise at your school. That's nothing to be ashamed of--my crewmates feel the same way about me.
My pilots often joke that I'm more easily found in the gym than my bed. It sounds like your classmates have the same opinion of you, Emi.
You're some kind of military official, aren't you? You mentioned something about keeping your emotions in check...is that part of your service?
You're Laevatein, right? A general and a princess...you were talking about how you were required to temper your emotions. Why?
Emi, do you solely focus on running in your exercise? Lately I've been trying to manage both slimming my waist down and building muscle.
My exercise schedule has been rough lately due to enemy attacks. Do you follow a regimen for building muscle, Emi? I've been trying to do that while keeping my measurements down.
Megumin, can you demonstrate your "Explosion Magic" here in a controlled manner? We've encountered Earthlings with some supernatural abilities before, but nothing like you claim.
This isn't the first time an Earthling has demonstrated superhuman powers like your "Explosion Magic." Can you perform it here and now, without endangering anyone?
Has Gamindustri always been such a religious planet? Our crew has encountered other colonies that have strong traditions of worship.
Religion isn't particularly strong on my homeworld. We're encouraged to honor the Mejarian Empire instead. Has Gamindustri worshipped like you say ever since its foundation?
Galatea, is your level of sentience unique among Earth robots? It's far beyond any AI we've been able to mass-produce on Mejare.
If it weren't for your exterior, I would have thought you're a normal woman with the emotions you display. Has Earth produced other robots like you?
How much of the mythology you study is still present in Earth's culture? Does a religious element still exist today?
From what you've described, it sounds like Earth has a rich mythological history. Has that led to a modern religion of any kind?
You're part of a band of travelers, right? Do you lead this group? I spend a lot of time forming combat strategy for my Dread team.
...Megumin, are you the head of the party you adventure with? I lead a pilot assault team, most of them around your age.
As I understand it, you train animal species called "Pokmon" at a high level. You speak as if it's a widespread practice.
Just how common is it to be a "Pokmon trainer" on Earth? Apparently you compete at the top level, whatever that entails.
...Komi-san, have you always had this communication problem? Or did you develop it later in life?
Did you have an easier time speaking to others when you were a girl, Komi?
So, based on these "Grimm," you haven't secured this whole planet to live on. Mejare's enemies are all offworld, and its military is built around space combat.

I'm not sure Mejare's imperial forces would be equipped to defend against "Grimm" creatures inhabiting large parts of the planet's surface. Most combat takes place in orbit of Mejare or the nearby Tarak.
You're a celebrity for your combat prowess, aren't you? I took to piloting well myself when I joined the Magno Family.
I understand you're a famous fighter on this planet. I remember rising through the Magno Family myself--I'm the youngest pilot of my rank.
...You're not just a normal woman. You've got sharp teeth, and you smell of smoke. What's the meaning of this?
...You're Bowsette, aren't you? I know enough about Earth women to know they don't have fangs. What's going on?
I never learned much about the computer games you play. Are they just your hobby outside of goddess duties?
You seem more enthusiastic about playing computer games than your role as a goddess. I've hardly tried any before.
Good game, Emi. I'm glad to have gotten the chance to meet you--an Earth girl who takes good care of herself.
...You're out, Emi. This was fun--I think you've improved my opinion on Earth girls quite a bit.
Have you learned how to cook all the food you've been eating? That would at least translate your gluttony into a useful skill.
I hope you've been preparing all this food you eat yourself. That would at least let you appreciate it properly.
Even though you were created by an artist, it seems like you're free to go where you please now if you're here. Is that true?
You've mentioned the gallery you were housed in quite a bit. Are you free to live as you choose now if you've come here?
I'd expected to find more outgoing women here who could teach me about men. But...if you can't speak, you probably don't have much sexual experience, do you?
Even girls who can speak don't always communicate their feelings well when it comes to sexuality. You're still...inexperienced, aren't you?
I'd hoped to learn from Earth women's sexual experience here. But another outsider's perspective might be equally valuable--what have you noticed about the way men look at you?
Another outsider to Earth sexuality, but one who's still observed it, might actually be perfect to ask on this visit. So...have you noticed whether men find you attractive?
Now that you're showing more skin...I don't see any scars. We're both lucky to have avoided that, or worse.
Your work sounds as dangerous as mine. Neither of us seems to have suffered any permanent injuries, but...the risk is always there, and it can happen in an instant.
Since you work in combat yourself, you must know the feeling...any battle could be your last. We're lucky to not even be injured.
I understand that you didn't plan to have her, but do you and your daughter... have a good relationship, at least?
I hope that your pregnancy being unplanned didn't leave you bitter towards your daughter. Now that she's older, do you get along?
...Your daughter would be around my age now, wouldn't she? Even if you didn't mean for her to be born, I hope you've appreciated each other since.
...It can't be good for a girl to think of herself as an accident. Do you and your daughter treat each other well, despite that?
It sounds as if your society is largely women with a handful of men. That's an interesting parallel to our ship, with the three male prisoners we have aboard.
...Men aren't common on your world, right? But a handful exist. With the men we've captured, we've created a similar situation aboard the Nirvana.
...Yuri, can you tell me about the stories you read? Literature would reveal a lot about Earth's culture.
If you do a lot of reading, then you should be familiar with Earth literature. What do the people on this planet write stories about?
So, there are more Earthlings with supernatural powers...you're not even touching the ground. You have some command over spirits?
...I shouldn't be surprised to see a floating girl with spirits around her. We've already met Earthlings with telekinesis. Who are you?
...You're Perona, right? Another Earthling superhuman...how are you levitating? And what are those ghosts you bring out around you?
It makes sense that Earth has pirate activity of its own. And if the population has superhumans, the body count must be even higher. What are you trying to achieve, exactly?
Perona, what's the goal of the Thriller Bark Pirates? Battles with Earth's government must be intense if you all have supernatural powers.
You work in a team of "huntresses," don't you? If you don't have a weapon, I suppose you fill a supporting role.
...I suppose you're the medic on your "huntress" team, or other support. Those in combat would carry weapons.
...Aren't you a "huntress"? You're unarmed. Unless you support the fighters on your team, much like our regisystem.
Bulma, you're married, aren't you? To a man. I'd like to know how men and women treat each other in a relationship.
The "Vegeta" you keep mentioning. Is he your--husband, is the word? I'm not familiar with married men and women.
...What are you? Some kind of projection...I wouldn't put it past the Earth Paksis's abilities, but for what, to create a virtual barfly?
...Is this what Earth creates with its Paksis energy? Some sort of projection of a sleazy woman to entertain bar patrons?
...Penny, are you really some kind of android? You look and act just like a human girl...Earth's robotics are far beyond our own.
If you're really the fighting android you claim to be, then Earth really has unmatched technology. Our only sentient robot was an accident, and he doesn't look human.
...If you're really a goddess, then what exactly does that entail? What do you rule over?
What exactly is your role as a goddess, and what is your relationship with normal humans?
..."Permadeath"? That sounds like the game of life, if you ask me...
...I assume that means they don't come back. You could fight in real life if that's what you're after.
...Isn't the point of a game to escape from reality? Real life has permanent death.
...That sounds like the kind of game one couldn't play for long. Women die all the time in real life--with "permadeath."
You're, uh...a little pale. Are you feeling alright? And you're not wearing much...
So pale...muscular, but...you look sickly, despite how little you're wearing. Trouble breathing?
And you call me pale. This woman's marble-white. And she doesn't really have the wardrobe for this game...
...Is there no sun on your planet? You're certainly dressed for it.
That's a vivid hair color...it matches yours, Jura. But I can't say the arm does.
You're energetic...how'd you lose your arm?
My crewmates and I all have different hair colors...none of us have mechanical arms.
Genetic engineering on Mejare has resulted in outlandish hair colors...maybe we could regrow your arm.
I'd say I'm sorry, but...that mechanical arm looks pretty useful.
It's good to see a woman who can carry herself...and perhaps lift herself, too.
...What do you think, Jura? Should we have our arms replaced with robotics?
I guess it's been a common trend for our crew to be forced to retreat several times before pushing back.
...It's your turn, ~name~. Even if we weren't stripping, it's been interesting to hear what Earth women have to say for themselves.
...You shouldn't write off a weakened enemy, you know.
This really isn't so stressful compared to my job. With crewmates, it might even be mundane.
I might've been more prepared for this than I realized. Managing a fleet of excitable young girls versus a table of embarrassed ones.
...Jura, would you like to play a poker game together sometime, like Gascogne does? We don't have to strip.
The pessimist in me sees all the ways I could lose each round. I'd been getting better about that--it must be the men rubbing on me.
...It's you, ~name~. The cards speak for themselves.
...I liken this sort of thing to piloting, but it used to be fighting. I think I could impress if we had crew sparring sessions.
Maybe I should call formation delta-four. That's when our lower-ranked pilots fall in behind me.
...Are you ready, ~name~? I can't say I was happy seeing you clothed at this point.
Another woman...that's a lot easier.
Another woman...not a problem for me.
Let me get something out of losing tonight...
Give me something to see so my mind doesn't drift to my crewmates. Like the one next to me.
Good thing someone loses every round.
...I'm sure you're just flustered, ~name~.
This is such bare-bones poker...it's hard to know what's bad luck and what's poor decision-making.
...If you're feeling nervous, I won't begrudge you taking some time to stretch...
Maybe I should temper my expectations of civilians. The women in my life need to follow orders, after all...
I don't have much to learn from your body the way I do with men...so I hope this game is competitive.
Luck will likely turn against someone else soon enough, ~name~. Keep your spirit up.
I feel just as helpless watching poor luck pile onto another woman...
I've been quite fortunate in this game so far...that only breeds the fear that luck will turn.
...Pull yourself together, ~name~.
Bad luck, ~name~...my team is often put on the backfoot, as well.
Have you considered changing tactics, ~name~? Speaking of tactics...
...I don't like watching women just throw their pride away, you know.
I don't know what Earth women think of nudity, but you shouldn't throw a legitimate game just to display it...
Bad situations are rarely isolated. Just ask a pilot...
...Are you taking this seriously, ~name~? It can be hard to tell with you.
You don't quite seem like pilot material...
...~name~, is this just going to keep happening?
I'm too used to my officer's duties. I feel the need to chastize you into playing better...
I wouldn't accept a woman under my command playing so poorly, you know.
My Vandread relies on ramming speed, you know...I prefer tearing through opponents in a hurry.
...~name~ lost again, I assume? I'm busy.
...~name~ lost again, ~player~, not me. What is it?
Are you watching the dealer, ~name~? Make sure they aren't cheating you to see you naked.
I wouldn't put it past this place to rig the game in favor of stripping a particular woman.
The stress of one mistake can cascade into several. I know that too well from coaching my trainees.
I demand the very best from my pilots, ~name~...and also from my opponents.
...~name~, have you seen my stylus? ...Never mind. It's your turn again.
Again...are you feeling alright, ~name~?
I tell my pilots that they're their own biggest obstacles. That may be the case if you feel frustrated.
It's easy to forget how close you are to being topless when the woman next to you is hemorrhaging clothes.
...If I can handle standing here topless, then you can handle a few losses in a row.
...Pull yourself together, ~name~. Don't second-guess your decisions based on bad draws.
Any woman can shoot down an enemy--or watch her strip. It's how she handles defeat that defines her.
This game might be mostly luck, but I can offer advice if you're not sure what to exchange, ~name~. I don't like watching a woman fumble with herself.
I shouldn't have put my tablet down if ~name~'s just going to fold like this...
Perhaps you'd make a better pilot than poker player.
Consecutive losses...some of my pilots would be irate over this. Barnette in particular is hotheaded.
...If you were a Mejarian, I might suggest you found me distracting.
...As you might imagine, I'm not interested in trading rounds with you at the moment.
A lot of rookie pilots start to choke just when they have their opponent beaten.
Again...? I know how frustrating this can be, ~name~.
...This is the rhythm of your sex with men, isn't it? Once he sees an opening, he just--pounds away at you.
I hope you're taking this seriously, even if I'm already naked.
...It's a bit late for me to give you any advice, don't you think?
...Didn't this planet invent poker? Don't make excuses.
...I try not to let anything faze me, but losing like this always gets me fed up. Are you the same way?
...This is sort of like having to talk my pilots through making repeated mistakes.
...~name~. Would men typically cheer you taking off your clothes so quickly? I used to be like that myself.
Don't just fade away like that.
Got complacent with me out of the game?
A pilot needs to keep track of many different things at once.
You can do it, ~name~. You're not out yet.
Come on, ~name~, you can win.
Don't give out on me now. My crewmates never have.
That was a good streak. I almost forgot about you, ~name~...almost.
You went a while there without losing. If that was more skill than luck, then you have my attention.
I was wondering which of us would lose first.
I suppose it's tempting fate to point out that I still haven't lost yet. You were doing well yourself, ~name~...
I play poker all the time, ~name~. You'll need more luck than that...
I wish this game were more indicative of skill. I could use streaks like that to see if you might make a good pilot...
I was keeping tabs on you. That was enough time without a loss for each of us to strip and then some.
That was a nice run. A while longer, and I could attribute it to skill...time will tell.
...You've got a pirate's mentality. You've been dancing around us, weathering the rounds while everyone stripped.
Consider this an assertion of my authority. I don't appreciate lucky streaks.
If that streak got me out of my armor, I might have felt threatened by it.
You lasted a while, ~name~. Unfortunately, it doesn't seem to have penetrated my armor.
As Dread team leader, I'm used to breaking girls' rebellious streaks. This isn't too different.
I was just about to comment on how well you were doing, ~name~.
That was your first loss in a while. Something about a woman beating the odds is very--well, attractive.
I don't let any woman blow past me that easily, you know.
I don't suppose your mind wandered off to men to prompt this sudden loss.
You were doing well, ~name~. I wonder if you could show that kind of luck in a cockpit.
A rookie pilot usually has her lucky streaks, too...before her own ego sinks her.
...When was the last time you lost a hand, ~name~? That has to have been at least seven rounds.
You've been pretty lucky these last few rounds, ~name~. It's a good trait to have in a pilot.
Did you mean to go so long without losing? Some women don't mean half the things they do in poker.
Even simplified poker like this takes intelligence to succeed at...I wonder if Earth has a colony for harvesting brain tissue.
It's hard for me to judge a woman's talent in a luck-based game like this. But I can see how you handle a bad situation.
Between your winning streak and your silence, I'd started to forget about you, ~name~.
...We can only offer so much commentary on the cards, can't we? If you'd folded on a bluff, it'd say more about you.
...You were playing great, ~name~. I imagine it's luck when you lose and skill when you win?
This is a great game we have going, don't you think? Competitive back-and-forth is just what I was hoping for.
I wonder if the dealer is above playing favorites. You had an impressive winning streak while I'm stuck without a bra.
This is reminding me all too much of Gascogne's long winning streaks against me in our poker matches. Not that I had to strip for her.
Another loss at last. Winning is nice on its own, and women stripping doesn't present awkward questions about my sexuality.
...You're not disappointed, are you, ~name~? You'd been winning for more than a few rounds.
...I know it's been some time, ~name~, but you lost. I can give you orders if you'd like.
One of the first things we learn as pirates is that it only matters how a fight ends.
I guess my nudity wasn't distracting you very much. Girls who seem oblivious to sex tend to get made fun of on Mejare.
...You were doing well, ~name~. I don't have a rank over you, but stripped down to nothing like this, I feel like I can address you as just--me.
A good poker game gives us time to work through our thoughts. I remember Gascogne sitting me down for one when I was fighting other recruits in reg.
Stuck naked like this, I think I was worried about you the most. You hadn't lost in a while.
It's not just ability that matters, but your attitude. I always watch how my crewmates handle a sudden downturn.
I'm not used to a civilian holding such an advantage over me.
You really have been playing well, ~name~.
You've outplayed me all night.
I needed more runs like yours.
You had a streak. Now close this out.
That was an impressive streak. I should introduce you to Gascogne...
Don't stop now. A pilot goes for the kill.
...Oh, I didn't lose the hand. Take a look--I had full expectations to.
I won with a high card...that never feels right.
I don't enjoy winning because my opponent had something even worse than I did...
...Hm. We both had just a high card...I once won a hand against our quartermaster like that. She praised me, but...
...A high card. That's about as satisfying as an enemy dodging into your misplaced shot...
I wonder how battle-sharpened the average Earth woman is...winning with a high card is certainly unsatisfying for me.
...I won with that? I should've spent the hand working...
...I won with a high card...I hate winning on a fluke. Games should be about dominating your opponent.
...It's not often I'm afforded a break. Your hand managed to do it.
With my only small item gone, that was a lucky break...
...Hm? I expected to lose that hand...you'll have to wait longer to see my shoulders, then.
That's unfortunate luck, ~name~. I can't honestly say I outplayed you that round.
I'll be honest--that was a lucky break on my end. You can see how my own hand wasn't much better.
My hand wasn't strong myself. The line between victory and defeat was as thin as my flightsuit.
I see you're not as strict as I am, ~name~. I make sure to punish my pilots' mistakes.
I had already resigned myself to losing that round. I shouldn't be so defeatist next time.
Mhmhm. That's why you never give up hope, in poker or in piloting.
Oh...? You had a high card as well, ~name~...it really could have gone either way for us.
...It looks like you were just a bit out of position, ~name~.
...I really thought I'd be showing my breasts this round. Just look at my cards.
How considerate of you to rescue me from removing my bra, ~name~. It's almost like being saved by a squadmate.
...That was close, ~name~. My bra will be staying on for another round.
Oh? ...I had to double-check our cards. It doesn't get much closer than that.
...Hah. I was fully prepared to take the hit that hand.
...Did you throw that hand to make fun of me, ~name~? Maybe the women here can be just as vindictive.
...It looks like you saved me from stripping fully naked, ~name~. I'd only make that sacrifice for a crewmate-- maybe men have forced women to stick together here.
...How ironic that an Earthling would save me from baring my body further. The forces I've met want to tear me to pieces.
...That was a tense round. Look at my cards--I nearly lost.
...I didn't expect to survive that round. Playing a high card is like flying out with the kamikaze set--full missiles, and only enough fuel for one trip.
...Just a high card. I wouldn't expect to succeed on a mission if I flew out with one missile.
Ehehe...mhmhmhm. I really thought I was done for there--I need to be more optimistic.
...I had to double-check our cards. I just barely won that hand--I'm sure that's small comfort for you.
Mhmhm. Look at my cards--you were this close to knocking me out.
...I had a high card. Are you looking down on me, ~name~?
...I still won. I guess even a pirate's worst can beat a civilian's best.
Mhmhm. I made a habit of edging out my crewmates for higher piloting positions, too.
...I can't get much closer to defeat than that. Good luck next round, ~name~.
...Oh? I thought I'd lost for sure. Earth finds new ways to surprise me all the time.
...I trust this sort of thing doesn't embarrass you.
I wonder if Earth women feel shame...the way that men must treat them.
...If you're nervous, know that women aren't always as judgmental as you might fear...
You've lost, ~name~...a rookie pilot of mine might start making excuses here.
...Don't delay things, ~name~.
I keep having to stop myself from giving you orders...
I'm so used to our crew...either I'd be ordering you to strip, or being ordered to strip myself.
To see women strip, I need only to shower after a mission...
...For the record, I'm scouting for any potential pilot candidates here.
I can't imagine Earth women take stripping lightly. Men are always around...
I wonder how competitive Earth women get...or if this is all in good fun for you.
You cost me my eyepiece...I'm not feeling so sympathetic anymore.
...Move us along, ~name~.
Half-nude women are not a rare sight on the Nirvana...one of my finest pilots essentially wears a swimsuit with shoulder pads.
You can't have come here and been that embarrassed to strip...
I'm not sure if Earth is a strange planet, or if this place just attracts unusual women...
I feel much more involved in this game now that I've lost clothing myself...
Poker is a game of wits, you know...now that I think about it, whichever planet is Earth's brain colony would be quite fearsome.
...Was that poor luck, ~name~? Or did you take an unneeded risk?
...I'm sure your body is fine, ~name~. You're very beautiful.
You aren't hard to read, ~name~...it is my job to sense what girls are thinking, you know.
~name~, you're up. I'm curious how you'll handle high-pressure situations.
Even though this game is mostly luck, it's not a helpful mentality...
You've got the worst hand, ~name~. Did you expect as much?
Almost any game will boil down to skill. That said, I'd much rather make this a target shooting competition.
Singling women out of the group like this reminds me of our pilot rollcall. Speaking of which...
Every round, there's a part of me that has to remember this is strip poker...
...Are you ready, ~name~? You should have chosen what to strip ahead of time.
...You seem quite relieved ~name~ lost, ~player~. As if you're grateful for every hand you win.
...Is something wrong, ~name~? Just take some deep breaths.
If you'd like, I can offer advice about what cards you should have swapped.
I don't normally make so much conversation, even in poker games. Something about this place must make everyone talkative.
...Have you played this game before, ~name~? On my homeworld, it's considered a lowlife pastime.
I'm grateful for every round I survive with my bra on. There's only so much one can do here.
Earth's Harvest cubes can be intimidating. Its women, far less so.
~name~, did you exchange the same sort of cards you usually do?
Let's see how an Earth woman handles herself when the stakes rise...
Maybe sharing a sex is enough to feel camaraderie on this planet when men surround you. On Mejare, it takes more than that.
...It takes a moment to check everyone's cards, doesn't it? If we could trust a computer, electronic poker would be quicker.
...It's strange to talk to a civilian woman. I haven't spoken to anyone but a pirate, outlaw, or soldier in a long time.
I do appreciate an Earth woman's insight. We have a refugee girl from Pluto who seems to know about men, but she's fourteen--I can't ask her.
...I'm so used to ranking either above or below the women I speak to, always trapped on the ship. But here, we're both just...girls.
It'll take more than the looming threat of nudity to rattle me, ~name~. I lead a squadron because of my cool head.
...Is it rude to look another woman in the eye while your breasts are out? My homeworld considers it quite intimate, but pirates can't get hung up about that sort of thing.
...Whenever you're ready, ~name~.
Playing cards with the breeze on my breasts...our typical tactics are to surprise and flank the enemy. Earth has a knack for putting us on the defensive.
...It's a nice change of pace to not have to give any orders. Everyone just follows the rules.
Always riding up...don't worry about me, ~name~. It's your turn, anyway.
I guess it's been a common trend for our crew to be forced to retreat several times before pushing back.
...It's your turn, ~name~. Even if we weren't stripping, it's been interesting to hear what Earth women have to say for themselves.
...You shouldn't write off a weakened enemy, you know.
This really isn't so stressful compared to my job. With crewmates, it might even be mundane.
I might've been more prepared for this than I realized. Managing a fleet of excitable young girls versus a table of embarrassed ones.
Maybe I could play one-on-one poker games with my pilots to get to know them better, like Gascogne does. Jura would be a good start.
The pessimist in me sees all the ways I could lose each round. I'd been getting better about that--it must be the men rubbing on me.
...It's you, ~name~. The cards speak for themselves.
...I liken this sort of thing to piloting, but it used to be fighting. I think I could impress if we had crew sparring sessions.
Maybe I should call formation delta-four. That's when our lower-ranked pilots fall in behind me.
...Are you ready, ~name~? I can't say I was happy seeing you clothed at this point.
Another woman...that's a lot easier.
Another woman...not a problem for me.
Let me get something out of losing tonight...
Give me something to see so my mind doesn't drift to my crewmates.
Good thing someone loses every round.
It's like I'm back home, watching women strip...
Agh...~name~. W-whatever I let slip out, please don't think too much of it...
It's OK, ~name~. Don't take losing as hard as I do.
At least the pressure is off me for once.
Losing here isn't so bad, ~name~. I feel better now.
No one likes a whiner, ~name~.
I've lost and masturbated to completion. You have nothing to complain about.
A tie...there's no better game I could've asked for between two friends.
Mhmhmhm. We tied...this is some game we're having. After all this time meeting strangers...
...We were supposed to meet new people, and we end up in a showdown--tying. Unbelievable...
...Ties are so rare in this game. We really are having a clash--I can't let you overtake me.
...This is almost like a dogfight, the way we're clashing. You'd never beat me in a Dread, and you won't do it here...Jura.
...A tie? This keeps getting better. Jura, you may be my second-in-command...but you're also my friend.
...A tie. This couldn't get any better...defeating you will truly be something special.
...Mhmhmhmhm. Mhmhmhmhm! We tied. Come on, let's keep going.
...We tied. This is why I love going one-on-one...you're truly worth defeating.
...A tie. Even with all the one-on-one poker I've played against Gascogne, we've never, ever tied. Come on...next round.
...We tied. This really is a showdown...let's do the round over, shall we?
...We tied. This game was truly meant to come down to the two of us...wouldn't you agree?
...Oh, a tie? The chances of that...they're low. Astronomically so.
...A tie? I've played so many poker games with our quartermaster, and...this has never happened.
...Oh, a tie. That's so rare...I believe Mejare ranks the suits for this purpose, but what's the rule on Earth?
...A tie. Is there a suit ranking? Either that, or we should just reshuffle.
...A tie. Let's just redo the round--there's no point in arguing about how to split hairs.
...Huh. A tie...if this had happened in my games with Gascogne, it might shock even her out of lecturing me.
A--a tie? Damn it, to see something so rare, and I wasn't even participating...
...A tie. This has all the makings of an intense game of poker, and I've already lost...
...Did you two just tie? That's never even happened to me, with all the poker I play with Gascogne...
...What's the problem? A tie? Damn it, and after I have nothing left but to watch people strip...
...Unbelievable. A tie? I have no stakes left, so I say both of you strip...
(No fun at all, is he? It's OK...we have each other.)
(What a killjoy--but no one ever said men were fun. Just relax...)
(Oh, such a tease. Try thinking of shooting his ship down--that'll be fun.)
Y-you--I lost so badly, and now this...
As far as I can tell, anyway. You're male, right, Corrin?
We don't have the best track record with spotting disguised men, so honesty about your sex would be helpful.
