As you can see, we're not very experienced in telling men and women apart.
Give him some space...it's probably embarrassing.
You seem uneasy about this. Didn't you grow up around women?
I never thought a man could be so uncomfortable with nudity. A year ago I was convinced you didn't wear clothes.
For a man to be so uncomfortable around women...you really are a model Tarakkian.
Get over yourself. I didn't know any men until I was nineteen, and you don't see me all flustered.
I thought for sure men just saw clothes as a means of avoiding women's germs. You seem to really want them on.
I never thought a man could be so uncomfortable with nudity. A year ago I was convinced you didn't wear clothes.
Agh--! What is that floating blade? You're another Esper, like that Earthling child--!
Wha--what's the meaning of this? A floating, talking blade? So Earthling Espers have powers beyond telekinesis--!
Wha--a hybrid, and another Earthling with telekinesis? With--a talking blade? Explain yourself!
I--I now have more questions. Earthling Espers we've encountered, but ones allied with talking swords...we have not.
..."Warmbloods"? I see...you're not from Earth. Neither am I...though I am still very much human.
...I think I understand. You're not human...and you're not from this planet, either. To think I'd meet alien life here...
"Warmbloods"...is that the name of your race? Men are alien enough to me, but meeting an actual alien life form...
Ah, I see. You're not an Earthling in the first place--we've never encountered an alien species in our exploration.

state.text: Don't try to distract me with stories about your colleagues! As if I'd let my guard down around a man with a weapon out--!
"Dynamike"? Don't waste my time with nonsense--you expect me to listen to a man with explosives on his shoulder?
Why wouldn't I take you as a terrorist? A rocket launcher goes far beyond a personal sidearm!
Carry it around for self-defense, I assume? Don't insult my intelligence!
If you would never fire it, then why bring it at all? And in such a cramped space, with innocent bystanders--!
It's reckless to bring explosives into such a crowded area, regardless of whether you plan to fire it! Why do you even have it?
And what might drive you to kill someone? That woman being a pirate from one of Earth's hated colonies?
Unless you have to kill someone? If you're here to eliminate a few Mejarian aggressors, then just say it!

case.state: ...I specifically meant a hostile man, but it's true that many threats exist. Can you describe what you've encountered?
My homeworld is all-female, though it seems it's the only human settlement that's like that.
You don't know how you got here? You're obviously concussed, or at least something like it. Can't you ask someone to escort you to a hospital?
...You can't be serious. I knew men could be hardheaded, but even the man in my squadron might admit he should get his concussion checked.
You don't know? My crewmates call me stubborn--I think I'd excuse myself from a mission if I were confused where I was.
We go by "the Magno Family," after our captain Magno Vivan. Who or what is this group resisting?
We're named after our leader, as well--"the Magno Family," like her former congregation. Do you oppose your government, or a foreign enemy?
"Raynor's Raiders." So, you're more akin to our captain, the priestess the Magno Family is named for. Who do you "raid"?
It must be thin fabric, then. Why even wear it?
You've just lost. But why are you wearing the blindfold, then?
...So what's your reasoning for wearing it? Some kind of Earth fashion statement?
...Do you care to explain that?
See better? I'd like an explanation for that...and why you wear it in the first place.
I would like to look you in the eyes. Men are mysterious enough without being mechanical.
You do have functioning eyes, yes? Or did your creators not bother with those?
You're not afraid to look me in the eye, are you? I'm just a normal woman.
Don't think I forgot about that thing...but you're free to look me in the eye and call me a liar.
...Right. Well, you're certainly amiable, but so was a man who cut our engines and sold us out to the Harvest.
...Well, keep up the friendly act for long enough, and I might start to believe it. That's how a man tricked me the last time...
...I admit it's hard to be suspicious when you're so laid-back. Rabat didn't waste much time with that facade...
...You have to understand. The last friendly man I met quickly chucked a robot at my face.
That was a sword? You had it holstered like one of those kinetic men's guns Barnette collects...
A blade? I would've expected a scabbard for that...and a holster for the mechanical guns men use.
You had a sword holstered? It looks like it's made of energy...but at least it's less threatening than men's mechanical guns.
Oh. I thought you were carrying a kinetic sidearm...men on Tarak always seem to use those, not that I understand it with the racket they make.
Duero is one of our male prisoners--a-agh! What just happened? Jotaro! You did something!
The Nirvana has a few male prisoner on b--wha--what? Something flashed by--!
Mejare is all women. Duero is a prisoner from the male planet Tarak--ngh! Jotaro! What was that flash all about?

state.text: You're right. Duero is among our male prisoners--agh! What just flashed by? Answer me, or you'll be joining our prisoners!

case.state: ...Right. You could try to act that way, then.
Then I suggest you stop leering at me like a killer.
I consider men in general to be a threat, so maybe it's just my nerves. I invite you to convince me of that.
...Then stop carrying yourself like one. This game is uncomfortable enough already.
You're a strange specimen. Male, wings, living in the sky?
You live in the sky, was it? There's a lot more to the universe than that.
So, what's an "angel," exactly?
Whatever that item is, it's rather decorative for Tarakkian men...the common citizens, anyway.
Is that military attire? Tarakkian soldiers' garb can get rather decorative...but only the soldiers.
Your outfit is decorative for a man. Tarakkians tend to wear rags.
I guess I can understand wanting to keep your face hidden in a strip game...wait, you're taking it off already?
...Oh, so you aren't concerned with hiding your identity. I thought you might just have wanted to maintain some anonymity here.
That's all?!
Come on...
Sure I'm no fun, Jura? Look at what this man's got for us.
Give me something...
Just an extra...
...Starting small...so men have modesty, too.
...I expected as much, but obviously I'd hoped for better.
...The revelations will come.
...Just filler...
...Just your ~clothing~? Men aren't any bolder than we are, apparently...
...It would seem men strip just as women do. Delaying the inevitable.
...I know so little about men, yet you manage to bore me.
...Perhaps it was too much to expect men to strip in an unconventional way.
...This shouldn't surprise me. If men are truly human like we are, then you'd be similarly averse to nudity.
...I understand not wanting to expose yourself right away. Perhaps you could provide me with verbal descriptions of your body.
...Never has a man bored me before.
Tarakkian men are proud warriors, and even they seem sheepish about their nudity. Perhaps it's universal in humans.
You'd think men's accessories would be fascinating...
...Showing even the slightest amount of skin might prove interesting.
...I see you're not making this easy. Normally I only view women as worthy competitors.
...I hope to see a man nude quickly and easily. But you can only put your opponent on the backfoot here in one sense.
...Why do men have those bumps on your necks? Are they what make your voices deeper?
...I suppose part of men being human means they're often mundane.
Maybe we should have put our prisoners in uniforms.
...That's all, is it? I've come back from worse odds, and against men braver than you.
...I thought men were more daring than this.
...I had more patience for this sort of thing with my suit on.
...That makes my underwear inadequate just looking at it.
...That's not the part of men's bodies I was interested in.
...It'd be rich for me to complain about smart decision-making.
I should just do some work in my head. I know the formations, anyway.
...I wouldn't expect a man to be generous, even to a woman in my position.
...Oh, do you have a competitive streak, as well? That's fair enough. I even know another man who's the same way.
I guess nothing short of your tube would feel equal to my breasts.
...He's just taking off something small, isn't he? Leave me alone while I fix myself.
...I really never pictured myself losing to a man.
...Something small. You wrote me off a long time ago.
...Oh. That's a smart move, it's just...I was starting to get caught up in my own feelings.
You're still wearing your ~clothing~...I must have barely been a part of this game to you.
I've slipped so far behind you. Normally men being around has improved my luck.
...You're mocking me. But now that I've had to strip naked for you, I guess whipping your tube out would mock me just as much.
...I didn't have an interest in men's fashion when I still had my clothes on.
That's all...?
Come on...
And Jura says I'm no fun.
Give me something...
Just an extra...
How boring. Can't you satisfy a woman's curiosity?
Even now, you refuse to give me an inch...
I masturbated for you, and you're still only down to your ~clothing~...
Still? I lost this badly to a man?
...Women are more fun.
(Sssh. Ignore him. Focus on me...on us.)
(Men are overrated anyway. We both knew that already.)
Y-you would mock me like this...?
(~name~ always did come across as boring. I think the men of the Nirvana are more handsome anyway.)
...Glad you took it in stride.
...I would've preferred it if you focused on flirting with women, if anyone.
Sex is no obstacle for your affections, is it? Good to know...
Should I tell Barnette you're flirting with men now, too? Actually, she probably already knows...
I guess it makes sense that Earth would be facing several hostile forces of its own. That must be what prompted its development of the Harvest.
Yes, it's an Earth colony known as Mejare. I understand it's somewhat remote, and it was colonized late into Earth's expansion period.
...I was hoping to study a more human man during my time on Earth.
...Human men are already mysterious enough. You seem to have a whole host of mysteries to yourself.
...I see you--or your species--is fascinating, Dust, but even human men still elude me...this is all a bit much.
Do you...have much in common with human men? That's who I came here to observe--an alien with floating blades is well beyond that.

state.text: I'm not interested in who a man thinks deserves explosives shot their way. Consider this a warning!
The only one threatening to kill anyone is you, especially if you think yourself the judge of who gets fired on. I'm watching you!
Like who? If you have violent male colleagues, then I won't treat you any different--you have my warning!
Tch! I'll be watching you for sudden movements, as I'd watch "Bull," or any other man wielding explosives!
You've had a rocket launcher your entire life? This is nonsense--just be aware that I'm watching you.
Your entire--stop trying to distract me! Strange remarks won't distract me from watching your movements.
...As long as you're holding that thing, I find that hard to believe. And don't talk about my underwear--!
Tch--a man holding explosives and talking about my "panties" is about as uncomfortable as this can get. Don't move...
A likely story...I'm quite familiar with the "tests" both men and Earthlings put us through. Don't make any sudden movements...
I'm the one on a hostile planet, when men themselves are so often hostiles...you are testing me. And I'm watching you...
If you "aren't like that," then why did you bring it at all? Men...!
I find it hard to believe you'd bring explosives without a plan to use them...and I suggest you abandon whatever plan that is.
Is that so? I have faced down male soldiers with more intimidating weapons--don't think I'll hesitate to subdue you.
Perhaps Earth women wouldn't "mess with" you, but a Mejarian is quite familiar with men's weapons. Do not test me.
I could say the same. That doesn't change the immediate danger is poses in such an enclosed space--be warned that I'll fire.
I've dealt with more destructive weapons myself, but I focus on the present. Take care not to make threatening moves.
I don't know what to think, other than that you're a hostile on a foreign planet. By all means, convince me otherwise.
What I think is that I have every reason to consider you a threat, so tread carefully. You are not the first man I've dealt with.
And I am on this planet in peace, but instead I'm faced with an armed and dangerous man!
Then take a moment to consider my feelings, here on a hostile foreign planet with a clear and present danger!
I would relax if you would set down your weapon. A simple request for the average male soldier, but not for an insane suicidal rocketeer...!
How easy it must be for a man with explosive rockets to tell a woman to relax, especially when he's on his home planet. Set it down!

case.state: ...I won't insist on it any further. I can't believe I'm showing concern for a man in the first place.
...It's your decision. A year ago, I would've considered a wounded man a good one.
We've been defending ourselves from fleets of unmanned drones. Pinpointing a central leader ordering the attacks would make the fight much easier.
...So, you're close to the enemy leader and seek to depose him. Our enemies have been the aggressors, but they've only sent robotic fleets. We have no main force to attack.
Our crew has had to adjust to our new roles as freedom fighters--we were just trying to survive before. It sounds like these enemies have kept you fighting for a long time.
We've never considered ourselves heroes. It's noble of you to step in even if invaders weren't targeting you.
Multiple enemies...we only ever signed up to be pirates, and we got thrust into our current situation. Some of us feel frustrated picking fights we can't win.
...Your clothing has a visual feed? Earth really is more advanced...
...I'm going to stop asking questions. Apparently Earth technology is beyond my grasp...
...I'm not sure if that counts as cheating. Why not just use your eyes?
...I have a visual feed, too. It's called my eyes.
The more you talk about this 2B woman, the more curious I become. Is she an android, too? Or...gynoid.
And "2B" is a gynoid, yes? I'd very much like to see Earth's mechanical interpretation of women...
Earth has harvested enough of our organs to design a female robot. It's only fair I should get to meet this 2B.
It's a shame "2B" couldn't have come here. Apparently she has my temperament...and I'd like a conversation with a gynoid.
If that's true, my crewmates' comparisons of me to a machine are surprisingly accurate. I'd like to meet her.

state.text: If I really would get along with this "2B," then my stoicism is paying dividends. Bring her along next time.
Possess what? You're not making sense--I should've known to be wary of men!
Just when I thought I might trust a man here--! I don't know what a Stand is!
How can you project some strange instant energy and then have the nerve to ask questions? Men...!
What's this nonsense about a Stand? Be aware that I'm armed--and accustomed to fighting men!

case.state: Showy...like it was an effort to impress a "cute" woman.
I don't see what was so manly about it. If you're trying to impress me, you need not appeal to your gender.
Tarak is known for its ruthless efficiency, so flinging your sandals doesn't strike me as manly--it strikes me as flirting.
Well, it reminded me of one man I know...but I think you're just being theatric to catch my eye.
You look like you've got a lot on your mind...and that it's not going to stay there.
Small, talkative, male. You and Hibiki might as well be...what's the word? Brothers?
This is going to be a long game if you're going to talk this much.
Let's get on with it. I know men have bodies under there somewhere.
I'd better learn something about male anatomy tonight, or the whole thing will be a waste.
Let's keep the game going...
I'm no expert on how men layer...Mejare would have us believe you walk around naked.
...Everything a man takes off tonight is suspenseful...I know that dangling rod is waiting for me.
...I have to wonder how many layers separate us from...the tube.
...Isn't it in Earth culture for men to try to impress women?
I suppose this highlights how similar our bodies are, for the most part...it's not as if men have scales.
So much talking every round...it's like our robot helper's chattering.
...I don't have all night. Why would a man doll himself up?
I do have responsibilities tomorrow, you know.
If you've no attachment to that, one of my trainees is obsessed with men. She'd want it for her alien-collection.
...I'm accustomed to women accessorizing themselves, but men doing it is new to me...
Tarakkian men would disavow and nonessential accessories--unless they're military decorations.
I once believed men didn't even wear clothes...such would limit your ability to infect Mejarians with your germs.
Duero, our male doctor, is smart enough to play poker...but he barely wears more than his labcoat.
I wonder if I could more easily gain your attention with food. That seems to work on our prisoners.
I don't like waiting around...especially for a man.
I should have taken tonight's patrol duty.
Say what you want about Hibiki, the man in my squadron...he doesn't waste any time.
Men from Tarak certainly wouldn't waste their time with accessories. ...Well, maybe our navigator would. I'm told he was upper-class.
At least Tarakkians don't dress as wastefully as Earth men. It's a desert planet, so I don't think they can afford to.
I take it the reveal of my shoulders didn't excite you.
There's nothing I hate more than a man with a smug look on his face.
This is among the best shots I've taken from a man. Second only to a bandit chucking our navi robot at my face.
I never thought a man would decorate himself. I guess we really are the same species.
Losing to a man...I can only attribute that to dumb luck.
I'm glad the man that ended up in my Dread team has more backbone.
...I've come back from worse odds, and against braver men than you.
Men's street clothing isn't too different from women's, other than the cut. I don't suppose you'd show cleavage.
I'm been searching for Dread pilots, but we do have some leftover Vanguards--men's crafts. Of course, you'd have to let yourself be taken prisoner.
I wonder if I'd get better answers about men if I asked women. I know some men tend to embellish their own actions.
...It's a long way back to the ship.
I thought my being topless might inspire a bolder move from a man. You must not all be so easily goaded.
...I'm losing to a man. It's bad enough being saved by one.
...You don't seem very interested in me. Do Earthlings see colonists as alien species? That was how we once viewed the men of Tarak.
You should be glad it's me you're playing against. I have a pilot with a gun collection and a short temper.
I wonder if Tarakkians wear those decorated uniforms not for vanity, but to put more layers between them and women's fangs.
If I weren't concerned about him blabbing to the crew, Pyoro would have been useful to bring here. He has much better data storage, and records of all the crew...
I was always happy just to compete with other girls. Against a man, my whole pride as a woman is at stake.
You don't need to take pity on me, you know. I've been in my share of firefights against your sex.
...You really are toying with me. If we were in a dogfight, I wouldn't tolerate that.
...Women are supposed to be submissive to men on this planet, aren't they? I'm in that sort of position right now...you clothed, me naked.
I guess men have been challenging me in all sorts of ways since we took them in.
...They always warned us men had no mercy.
...Have you ever considered having a child with another man? I've heard men on Tarak do so using machinery, but they usually don't form couples.
...I already felt vulnerable around men. At least there used to be a thin flightsuit between us.
...Does Earth's government issue men any small items with your personal data on them? Tarak citizens all carry one--soldiers' combat knives or mechanics' dogtags, for instance.
Give me something to work with here...
You're so cruel...
This isn't easy for me, you know...
Even this isn't enough for you? Fine...
I've only met a few men. I'm not asking for much here...
...You should know you have a rare moment here to capture my interest.
For me to be outplayed so thoroughly...
For me to be so soundly defeated...I didn't know men were smart enough for deception.
To rout me, and then make me cum in front of you...incredible.
You've been toying with me this whole time, haven't you?
Damn you, ~name~...
(What a nasty little tease. I'll take care of you, Leader.)
~name~--how'd I lose to such an extent?
Y-you...were toying with me--with both of us...!
(Pay her no mind. We're both more beautiful anyway.)
That's not very reassuring. If it starts to involve me, I'll fire on you. Do I make myself clear?
I don't need your reassurance. Unless your body can withstand laser shots, keep it away from me.
Don't talk down to me. I'm armed--so for your own sake, don't involve me.
Don't treat me as some helpless civilian. I'm not interested in fistfights, and I'll shoot if yours comes near me.
...Oh, of course. You're just friends...Earth women don't see each other in that way.
...Right. Women's relationships are usually more intimate where I'm from...but not on Earth.
...Oh. You're just friends. You can blame my Mejarian upbringing for imagining other things...
...Only friends? Of course...I forgot I was on Earth. Mejare must be unique with how women see each other...
...I see. How many "past lives" do you have, exactly?
...Hm. So even the "Ini" I met wasn't the first alias you've adopted. How many are you up to?
...So, you've lived behind an alias for some time. I'm surprised you returned to a place you've been, then...I suppose "Ini" is a another pseudonym.
It's not surprising that a criminal would live behind a mask. First your personality, and now it turns out "Ini" was a fabrication, too...
...That is a mechanical rifle, isn't it? It's certainly lethal, but it's still centuries behind in both efficiency and stealth.
"Underestimating"? It's not a matter of power--it's resource efficiency, and the way shots can be heard and traced. Either way, it's superior to your axe.
It was your decision, hm? That's good to hear...women should take charge of their lives.
I see. I was muscled into coming here myself...but if you chose this, then I'll be less worried about you panicking.
Good--I was hoping you were here of your own volition. Consider this a trial by fire.
That's just what I was hoping to hear. Women have to choose to be pilots themselves--otherwise they'd panic and get us killed.
...Erufuda, you are in no position to tell someone that exercise is unnecessary. Stay out of this.
...Erufuda, you are not qualified to offer any fitness advice to either me or my pilots. This is a private matter.
This is between me and a subordinate, Erufuda. And you are the last woman Jura should listen to for exercise advice.
...I see. I'm afraid my piracy is limited to the material. Maybe you could help explain the methods, Ryuji.
...Is that so? We tend to steal...food, fuel, and weapons. Care to explain how you do this, Ryuji?
...You really don't seem the type. Ryuji, you seem excited. Care to explain how this is done?
...That doesn't sound like it would help people. Maybe you could elaborate...with the assistance of your male classmate here.
Not as good as she should be. If I had my way, she'd toss it and practice with a laser ring instead.
Not enough to make up for always lugging it around on missions. A laser ring is all she should need.
She herself will admit she doesn't practice enough, Penny. Of course, practice with a laser ring would be better.
She's decent enough with a laser ring, and that's all she would ever need as a weapon. The rapier is superfluous.
...I maintain the professional opinion that her rapier is suboptimal next to a standard laser ring.
Pirates don't exactly get the height of privacy...and I should've figured you'd gang up on me.
I swear Jura shows me respect when we're actually piloting...this is her chance to enlist help teasing me.
...Right. I should've known you'd both start pestering me...I'll be planning flight practices.
Yes, Sei, I've seen Jura naked...she's indeed very beautiful. Have fun irritating me with her.
Jura is a colleague, not a friend. Pirates don't get to choose who they work with...which is a good skill regardless.
We're more coworkers than friends...and we don't get a choice in coworkers. We ended up working with men, after all.
"BFF"? Oh...friends. We met and work together out of circumstance more than anything...
I'm not terribly fond of Jura's approach to work, so friend is a stretch. She's tolerable as a colleague.
It seems that's the peril of working in the military. Pirates aren't so quick to cast their comrades aside.
Well, unlike the military, we don't consider our members expendable. Personal teasing isn't worth a reprimand.
Pirates are united by being outcasts. I couldn't discharge Jura like in the military--she has nowhere to go.
Then you understand our distaste for the military, Misato. Respect is earned among pirates, and lives aren't just numbers.
...Just as I presume her every move, Jura thinks I'm secretly a pervert because she's obviously one.
Don't pay attention to her, Sei. She doesn't understand how not everyone is as sex-obsessed as she is.
This is how Jura rationalizes my work ethic. She presumes I'm as lustful as she is and merely trying to hide it.
...Don't let my suit fool you. This is standard Mejarian fashion...Jura just wants to pretend I can't be more disciplined than she is.
As if I'd let a soldier see me sweat. Any plans Jura had failed when you came along.
Perhaps on a lighter table, I'd feel embarrassed. Against military personnel, I only know competition.
Embarrassed? Not with a soldier skulking around. Jura's teasing is none of my concern now.
With a military woman haunting this table, Jura's matchmaking is the least of my concerns. I'm watching you.
For once, I agree. Wearing small things is clearly part of the game...so she's free to choose them.
I take no issue with what Jura's doing. Pirates need to be resourceful...and my second-in-command should be sharp.
It sounds as if you're jealous of Jura's forethought, Sei. You started with plenty on yourself...

state.text: Using what we have to win is not dragging out the game. This is the kind of resourcefulness I expect from my subordinates.

case.state: Why did you bring a sword in the first place?
That's not really clothing, Lyn.
This is just a game...on your home planet, I assume. Why are you armed?
You don't practice enough with your rapier, Jura. It just weighs you down.
...Speaking of swords, your laser ring would've been a better weapon to bring than your rapier, Jura.
I--don't bring up Kahlua. We barely know these people.
You--don't tell her our life stories, Jura. Kahlua has nothing to do with this.
If you knew I liked spending time with Kahlua, why didn't you just leave me with her again?
Any charm I had has been crushed by being dragged here...and leave Kahlua out of this.
I and the other pirates I work with clash with Mejare's military on a regular basis. ...Do you do something similar, Jolyne?
It's hard to be a pirate and not grow a distaste for soldiers. ...Oh, are you a pirate, too, Jolyne?
I pilot for a pirate crew. Hating imperial soldiers comes with the job. ...Did you face prison time for something like that, Jolyne?
I'm part of a pirate crew that raids Mejare's military. You would, too, if you lived there... do you have a similar story, Jolyne?
You smell like alcohol. I thought it was Jura at first, but no, it's you.
Do you drink a lot? You smell like it.
You smell like alcohol...you really shouldn't drink. It's bad for you.
...A goddess? Nayru, you look more sleepy than godly. What's she talking about?
...Are you sure she's a goddess, Navi? Nayru, I'd like you to corroborate this.
Goddess? She helped create your planet? Nayru, what's the meaning of this?
You're not serious? I was told she's an Oracle, but a goddess? Nayru, is this true?
...Pay attention, Rin. Soldiers will always resort to violence if you question their loyalties.
Leave the schoolgirl out of this. The last thing she needs is an authority figure feigning sympathy.
This is a soldier's early effort to indoctrinate you, Rin. She doesn't care about the fringes of society.
...Do you see, Rin? Soldiers have no regard for the humanity of a criminal, and they won't for a disabled girl, either.
...What's a combo? ...What's a bug?
...And this revolutionized things, somehow?
These things run on computers, right? If there was a bug, why didn't they fix it?
An observation, not an insult. It's just unusual for me...clothes aren't readily available for a pirate.
...I wasn't insulting you. The clothes I have are stolen, so this is unusual for me.
You have to understand...none of us owns very much, being pirates. We all wear the same thing every day.
Varying your outfits is not a privilege pirates have. It just stuck out to me, that's all.
Can't it? You seem to be doing a good job.
I'm telling you, I don't know what "Super Mario" is. Slow down.
I've made it twenty years without knowing about it, so I think it's not all that important.
...Why are you doing this to me? I was just being polite...
What's wrong? It's just a belt. Are you alright?
If you're so shy, maybe you shouldn't be playing this...I don't want to see a woman all broken up.
...Don't ask me how you're going to get all the way down to nude.
I'll just hope you manage to win. Stripping looks physicially painful for you.
...Florina?
...Is she disqualified, then?
Well, that didn't last long.
Well, that's one down.
Looks like men have a use after all...thinning the herd.
The point of my suit is functionality. It doesn't encumber me.
Are you saying you wear that for fun?
My suit is standard-issue. I don't get to complain about comfort.
What exactly is Jerusalem? A man's name?
I understand spiders' importance. I still don't like them.
I've lived in apartments infested with spiders. You'll have to forgive my distaste for them.
I don't like my armor so much as I need it.
Tomatoes? That would fly over a Tarakkian's head. They only eat synthetic pellets.
If not for my responsibilities, actually, I'd probably wear a sundress.
...You were designed? You're a robot? I would expect a gynoid to adapt to piloting quickly, yes.
...Wait. You're robotic? I thought you were merely being professional--no wonder you'd adapt.
You're--a gynoid? You had me completely fooled--Earth has masterful robotics. I'd like to see how one handles a Dread...
..."Designed"? You're not seriously a machine? Unbelievable...a robot piloting a Dread would be capable of fantastic manuevers.
"Designed"? You're...some sort of gynoid? Even still, you look and sound human enough to make your own decisions.
...You mean to tell me you're a robot? Just when I was happy to meet another woman who took herself seriously...
"Designed"? "T-Dolls"? So you're not a human woman--and Earth's robotics are far more advanced than I realized.
...What are you saying? You're a robotic woman? You're speaking like you have no free will!
Of the many complaints my pilots present me with, their laser rings failing has never been one of them. What primitives have you been fighting?
Fragility? Laser rings don't jam. Whatever energy-primitives you've been fighting pale next to planet Mejare.
...You realize I say kinetic weapons are for men is because they're all planet Tarak has the resources for? I think you've been fighting limited-technology peoples.
...Mejare is winning its war with Tarak, the planet of men, because Tarak doesn't have the supplies to get its energy weapons right. I think that applies to your enemies.
I know for a fact Earth has access to energy weapons that eclipse even Mejare's. What backwards planet do you live on where they haven't been perfected?
I have a crewmate who collects kinetic guns as antiques, but it doesn't define her. I hope you don't mean that literally.
...I'm not sure how serious you're being. Commitment to a profession is one thing, but to weapons themselves?
...Your weapons define who you are? Even as a pilot, I wouldn't define myself by my Dread--what makes you say that?
...You say you're defined by your weapons like it's a point of pride. You shouldn't limit yourself like that--but I'm curious why you do.
...Silence, destructive power, and to not degrade oneself with a man's weapon.
You sound like my crewmate Barnette, endlessly praising kinetic weapons. They're for men, and not nearly as refined--or destructive.
Just like Barnette--women who grow attached to mechanical firearms will never hear a word against them. No kinetic weapon ever destroyed a planet.
"Simple, cheap, and reliable" are words I'd use to describe my bodysuit. Energy weapons can tear through entire vessels.
Perhaps you might have a point if you're tied down in ground combat for days. I deal in space battles, and no kinetic weapon can vaporize a mech.
...I never asked for the advice I needed, either. No one ever does.
...Women will never get the advice they need unless it's forced upon them.
...The advice that got me off the streets was told to me. Harsh realities always are.
...If you only listen to advice you ask for, you'll never be anything but a dropout.
...Thanks. But it's common on Mejare.
Blue hair is run-of-the-mill on Mejare. There's prettier faces underneath than mine.
...Matches my eyes? If you say so...women usually call my eyes cold.
...Thank you. Yours is nice, too.
It covers everything, but it hides nothing.
Don't be ashamed. It's a perfectly sensible choice.
Bodysuits are comfortable and efficient, but they leave nothing to the imagination.
Your whole figure is on display, Marinette. Of course, on Mejare, no one minds.
Rude? You're awfully defensive after some honest comments.
...At least you love your home planet. Quiz me on Mejare. I won't pull any punches.
...So is a "country" some kind of special planet I should know about?
If you keep insisting on addressing her in public, then it is my business. Half my job is defusing relationship issues among my pilots.
My subordinates get into petty dating issues all the time...this tiff with ~player~ sounds a lot like that.
You've made it all of our business. My pilots often have relationship issues...honesty is the best solution.
My pilots tend to date each other...I know what's going on here. I suggest you confront ~player~ about your feelings here and now.
If you keep insisting on addressing him in public, then it is my business. Half my job is defusing relationship issues among my pilots.
My subordinates get into petty dating issues all the time...this tiff with ~player~ sounds a lot like that.
You've made it all of our business. My pilots often have relationship issues...honesty is the best solution.
My pilots tend to date each other...I know what's going on here. I suggest you confront ~player~ about your feelings here and now.
...Those guns are for men. Mechanical ones. On my planet, we use laser rings instead.
What I meant, Revy, was that men use those kinetic guns. Women should use laser rings, like on planet Mejare.
I was arguing for my planet's laser rings, Revy, not avoiding firearms altogether. Men are obsessed with noisy mechanical guns.
What? Of course women should be armed--but with my planet's laser rings, not the loud kinetic guns that men use.
...You actually have a job? And you're a pirate, at that...how many of you are there?
Huh. An Earth woman, but a pirate... How many members does Lagoon Company have?
...You're a pirate, then? That's...a pleasant surprise. How big is this Lagoon Company?
...That's not the answer I was expecting, but I'm glad to hear it. If you're part of a pirate band...well, how large is it?
Leadership is a mentality. Try learning how negotiate...that way you could make a trade deal with Mejare and lose that heavy holster.
If you expect leadership from yourself, you'll start doing it. Negotiation is a good first step...
Even you're starting to feel the weight of that holster. Negotiation is a good leadership skill...try defusing company arguments.

state.text: Even with no one to lead, you can build up your skills. Try negotiating yourself out of your next fight...just to save on bullets.

case.state: ...You didn't notice? Well, that proves my point, doesn't it? Look closer at my hand.
I'm surprised you'd admit that. We know who would've won a shootout, then--here, look more closely.

state.text: If you don't see my ring, then you now see my point. My hand is my holster--no need to swing that weight around.

case.state: Not exactly the sharp eyes of a markswoman. But that's the point--they're inconspicuous.
You...forgot. It sounds as if you don't interact with normal humans very often.
...So you aren't used to appearing as a human before others. How often do you meet normal humans?
...Are you saying you're forgetful, or you spend most of your time away from normal people? Otherwise it'd be habit to transform.
...I see. Is this game your attempt to socialize with normal humans? You wouldn't forget to transform if you were used to this.
...You're a "goddess"? You must be, if you're so removed from humanity that you'd think a transforming insect is less alarming.
...I can believe you're a "goddess" if you can transform into an insect. Why you thought that'd be easier to accept is beyond me.
...A "goddess" with a perfectly human form. We'd be none the wiser had you simply started like this.
...A butterfly goddess, disguised as a human woman, who thought her transformation would not be alarming. Earth is more than I bargained for.
..."Mom"? Like a Fama, I assume...I lead a pilot team of girls your age. I just want to make sure you're alright.
...I'm not sure what "mom" means, but if you're so sure of yourself, I'll leave you alone. I have my own pilots to worry about.
"Mom"...that sounds a lot like "Fama." In any case, I'm just used to being responsible for girls your age.
..."Mom"? I was just showing concern, Tomoko. I was in your position once, and I mentor other girls who've been, as well.
Why would I make you feel great when I'm concerned for your safety? If you have a home, you should be there.
Praising you was not my intention, Tomoko. I'm saying you should reconsider the choices that led you here.
I would "make a girl feel great" if she were using her missiles efficiently. You need to head someplace safe.
I want you to re-evaluate yourself, Tomoko. Why aren't you getting proper rest? Self-care is important.
...I had a chip on my shoulder at your age, too. Hanging out in seedy bars, trying to make a name for myself.
Trying to start fights just from simple advice...you really do remind me of myself from a few years ago.
...I used to assume the worst of everyone who reached out to me, as well. You should kick that habit sooner than I did.
...I wouldn't show concern to a girl with larger breasts? You're just picking fights...a lot like I used to do.
...I suppose an Earth super soldier would be quite defensive about her weapons' secrets. Your friend is behind you...
Combat...I took to piloting out of necessity, but I ended up enjoying it very much. I only had my crewmates to train me...
I'm a fighter pilot...that's not too far off from combat. I received that training informally, though, from crewmates.
A school just for combat...you don't seem like military. I received all my pilot training from my shipmates.
A combat academy...I'm a pilot. I wonder if I'd be better had I gone to a school instead of just receiving training from shipmates...
...So, you lead some kind of religious faction on "Gamindustri." It's unusual for planets to not have a unified society...do the other nations have their own "goddesses"?
...I see. Mejare's society is unified, like most planets...are the nations of "Gamindustri" divided over religion? Are you the only goddess?
That's true, but every extra inch of your body requires your heart to work that much harder.
Perhaps I misspoke. If there's less of your legs to travel along, then your heart can use that power elsewhere.
It's not so much that your legs are amputated as that they're shorter. By the same principle, taller pilots's hearts have to work harder to circulate blood.
I agree. The way you talk about it makes it sound like it was an accident rather than something you were born with. Is that correct?
I'm glad you see it the same way. I'm sorry if this is too personal, but your legs aren't congenital, are they?
Am I right to assume that you were born with normal legs, then? Since you agree that it shouldn't have deterred you.
I understand that that's not the kind of decision you can make as soon as it's offered. Still, it's surprising restraint on the part of Earth's military to have never offered it before.
Has the prospect really never come up for you, even in school? I would have figured Earth's military might send recruiters out for that sort of thing.
I'd hoped you'd at least considered it before, perhaps as part of Earth's forces. I can show you the ropes if you're interested.
"Protect the land from destruction"? What's happening to it? Maybe the ecological devastation I've heard about on Earth is already underway.
Your land is being destroyed? Colonies have suffered terraforming accidents, but this is Earth. Then again, I've heard about this planet suffering damage to its surface...
Some women look down upon exercising as ruining the female form rather than enhancing it. That attitude might be unique to my homeworld.
A fit body isn't always seen as the feminine ideal, at least on Mejare. I don't agree, obviously, and perhaps Earth doesn't, either.
That's a mature attitude for your age. I didn't start to learn that until I took a leadership position, and even then, I was worried about not being liked.
I wish I'd learned that earlier myself. I grew up constantly worrying what others thought of me, and it continued even into my squadron leadership.
...Yes, you should probably temper your energy in the halls. That reminds me of an apprentice pilot of mine--she's always full of energy herself, crashing into the man she likes.
One of our trainees is a young girl who's always running around herself. In fact, she tends to tumble onto the "Mr. Alien" she has so much affection for.
"Arceus"...is that related to the Arcana? Our captain used to be a priestess, and she still has a set of tarot cards.
"Arceus"...? I've never heard of that...is it your term for the Arcana, as in tarot cards? Our captain was once a priestess--maybe we still have ties to Earth's religion.

state.text: I'm surprised you recognized it--Earth must have laser weapons, too. In that case, I'm sure you can recognize my position.
There's a difference between a personal sidearm and a civilian waving around a murder weapon. The fact you even know it's a weapon means I can be clear about defending myself.
...I see you're familiar with laser weapons. My first duty is ensuring the safety of myself and my team, including such threats as unhinged civilians. This is your warning.
Tch! "Work." I won't hesitate to subdue you if you start to act on your threats.
...Your "work"? If this place's security isn't willing to remove dangerous thugs, I'll do it myself. I suggest you stay put and be quiet.
I have a "problem" with your weapon and your attitude, not your mask. You're wasting your time by playing dumb.
The mask isn't the issue, and you know it. I'm not going to keep humoring you if you keep threatening us.

case.state: ...Is that why you're eating them? Of all things, French fries...is your world really so devoid of seasoned food?
...French fries. What an odd food to get addicted to...most women would prefer sweets. I imagine you don't have those in your world, either?
That explains why you're shamelessly eating them. Still, are they really the height of human cuisine to you? What did you eat in your world?
So your stoicism is not just a personal choice, but part of your culture. I used to perceive men the same way, like all Mejarians.
Muspell...so emotion is frowned upon by your people as a whole. My homeworld sees men as beasts whose only feelings are rooted in fighting.
...I'm sorry. Did something happen to your sister? I was an only child...
Your sister...? I never had any sisters--I'm sorry if I brought up something uncomfortable.
...A robot built from stone? Or with merely a stone casing...for a robot, you have very human mannerisms.
...Why would a robot be built with a marble exterior? In any case, I'd prefer that over the golem I suspected--and you seem quite human to me.
...I actually believe you. If this "mana" energy is related to our Paksis core, it would explain why piloting my Vandread with our male pilot tires us out.
...As much as that sounds like an excuse, I've encountered something like that. Controlling my combined Vandread mech with our male pilot leaves us both exhausted.
...It exhausts you? Earth's Paksis core was responsible for the powers we saw--as well as ours, letting our male and female ships combine! And when we pilot them, we start to feel drained...
...I call them prisoners, but they've become valued crewmates. I imagine the men on Gamindustri have shown their worth, as well.
...They've become our allies out of circumstance. I never thought I'd value a man's help...were you the same way once?
Horror...I don't need to seek that out in fiction. The way you write about men and women being together here...what's that like?
...I used to read a lot before I fell out of it as a teenager. Maybe it's better to ask if there are stories specifically about men and women.
"Devil Fruit"? That sounds like a nickname for a drug. How many other people have "eaten" it?
...Tell me more about Devil Fruit, then. Where did you get it, and how common is it for people to have tried it?
...Servants? You're not the first Earthling we've met to demand servitude. You can look elsewhere.
...I have no intention of being your servant. Our crew's mission is to prevent Earthlings from subjugating us.
Hm? Oh, of course--Gascogne is our ship's quartermaster. A tall woman, and one I respect very much.
...You're right, I should've explained. Gascogne runs the regisystem on our ship...she first took me in when I joined.
Oh, don't worry, it was a positive comparison...Gascogne, our ship's quartermaster, happens to be built much like you.
I'm sorry, I was talking to myself a bit there...Gascogne handles our ship's supplies management. I have nothing but respect for her.
...Alice? What's the meaning of this light?
...A light show? First the Harvest, and now monsters...
W-what's this light? Like a Harvest attack all over again...!
...Alice? Just disappearing in light like that...
I thought you just weren't including that.
Pilots need better presence of mind than that...
You need to be better aware of your options. It's a dangerous universe out there.
...You're in combat training at a school, yes? I wasn't formally taught, but I'm a fighter pilot.
...Strange topic, apparently. Is is true you go to school for combat? I was trained as a pilot...informally.
...Moving on from hair, I'm told you're receiving combat training. I didn't go to school for it, but I happen to be a fighter pilot.
...Perhaps we could bond over combat instead. Aren't you in school for that? I'm a fighter pilot...informally trained.
Agh! Who's this? What's going on?
Wha--damn it, I should've known this place was dangerous!
A fight? Damn it, I didn't even see what provoked it--!
Cammy! What's--damn it, where's the exit?
...These women really seem intent on stripping you. Just stay away from me...I don't need more fistfights.
...It's been a while since I was this close to a fistfight. No need to be any closer...
...This is just going to keep happening. I can tell...once upon a time, I was like this.
...Best to distract myself from the ongoing fistfight. At least I'm not involved this time...
You...have leotards to just give away? It's fine. One of my subordinates wears them, though I consider it a little much.
...I'm not going to ask you for clothing. Besides, my crewmate Barnette might have some...since she loves them.
I'm not asking for your charity. I could borrow one from my crewmate Barnette...but the way it shows off her backside is racy even for me.
...That's not necessary. Besides, the way they ride up and leave my backside exposed is...well, my crewmate Barnette seems to enjoy it.
Winged...horses. The animal, you mean? Mejare doesn't have much wildlife...
Interesting...I've never seen wings on any of the horses in books. And Mejare has few animals in general...
...I see. That must be a species unique to Earth...Mejare doesn't even have normal horses.
You use animals as tools of war? Mejare has few animals in general...and that doesn't sound effective regardless.
I'd like to know more about these "video games." They sound interesting, if impractical.
Something about these "video games" sounds familiar...like a lot of the women here would know them, at least.
Parfet's good with computers. Maybe she'd like "video games" like you do...
"Video games" honestly sound like our flight simulations. Never liked those...not real enough.
So, do you play these "video games" of yours in school? Sounds better than Mejarian propaganda classes.
O-oh no, I don't want to be a bother...my build doesn't even compare.
N-no, you don't have to, Chun-Li. I was just being complimentary...you look much better than I do.
T-tips? I don't want to impose. And I certainly don't stack up to you...
T-that's not necessary...I just need to work harder, I'm sure. There's no need to compliment me, with the way you look...
Perhaps you should explain what a Grimm is. Still, a small weapon is better than no weapon at all.
..."Grimm"? If Earth is infested with creatures that need ground firepower like that, I'd like to know about them.
...Hm. We value vessel superiority over ground firepower...but Mejare doesn't have "Grimm." Why do they require so much firepower?
...So Earth's surface isn't as tame as Mejare's, even in this dimension. Is a "Grimm" some sort of feral creature?
"Tear up the Grimm"? I'd still prefer a small weapon I can slip past guards...but what are these "Grimm" creatures?
What's a "crown"? Is it the only thing that symbolizes your title?
Your crown...is that some kind of symbol of authority? I'm not following the politics here.
Is that crown what marks you as a "princess"?
A "crown"? You've no need for titles or jewelry, Daisy. You should be an athlete...
...I don't have money. I was just making conversation.
...I'm happy to discuss the finer points of piloting, but you're mistaken if you think I was making an offer...or have money at all.
...I wasn't looking for a business transaction. My crew doesn't use money regardless.
...I see money is primarily how you operate, then. My crew has none...and you can forget I said anything.
Trying to throw us off? I was watching that from the beginning.
You seemed the type to leave that on just to lure people into a false sense of security.
Smart to leave that on until now. Some of us probably got complacent...I've tried not to.
Clever. But don't think I hadn't noticed that.
...I see. I'm afraid my piracy is limited to the material. How do you do this?
...Is that so? We tend to steal...food, fuel, and weapons. What are your methods?
...You really don't seem the type, but that's...fascinating. How exactly do you achieve that?
Uh...that doesn't sound like it would help people. Maybe you could elaborate?
...Just an observation. I'm sure there's nothing more to you...and if there is, this game is well-suited to revealing it.
...I look forward to you proving me wrong about your hidden side, Haru.
...Right. I'm sure if you are hiding something, that'll be evident soon enough.
...Well, this whole game is meant to strip away what we hide from others. So we'll see.
Is that so? Well, I apologize, then...I recommend leadership roles to sharpen your mind.
...We'll see about that. Have you considered training your mind with leadership positions?
...If that's true, then you shouldn't be complacent in your stupidity. Try being a commander or a manager.
...I see. I didn't consider myself smart until I took command of the squadron and women started praising me. Try something like that.
Uh...I don't think that's necessary. You twitching them is evidence enough, and I've never handled animals.
U-uh, no, I shouldn't...I can see them moving. My experience with animals is limited...
...You're very sweet, Jenetta, but that's alright. I'm not used to animals...
There's...no need for that, but thank you. My only experience with animals is in zoos and alleyways...
..."Motherly"? Oh, yes...that's the Earth word for a Fama, isn't it? I could take you to meet Ezra if you wish.
...They're called Famas on Mejare, but "motherly" has a nice ring to it, as well. Perhaps you'd like to meet her?
I could invite you to meet her if you wish. Aren't "mothers" Earth Famas? ...I read that somewhere.
You could meet Ezra if you'd like...there's room on the ship. For the record, "mother" is just as sweet a term as our "Fama."
...I see. People say I don't laugh enough, so maybe you'll be of assistance there.
...I'm not known among the crew for my sense of humor, but I invite you to try.
Hm. Never had a stable job myself...well, not one they pay me for. But if you could make me laugh, I welcome it.
I certainly don't want to be here, so if that's true...I could use a laugh.
Really? I thought I looked like a pirate, Jolyne...just a simple bodysuit, and my hair is messy.
Is that so? Perhaps it's a cultural difference...on Mejare, even messy hair and a basic-looking suit would signify an outlaw.
My bodysuit is plain, and my hair is barely brushed. Where I'm from, that would be evidence of a delinquent... maybe not on Earth.
Plain clothes and messy blue hair...that's what makes a woman look like a thug on Mejare. It's obsessed with beauty.
...Jura, don't make a show of disarming yourself.
...Jura, Earth is a hostile planet. If you're going to disarm, don't announce it like this.
...Jura, take this planet seriously. They might be waiting to see us disarm.
Jura...don't toss away your weapon like that.
That's actually more substantial than I expected of you. Those boots are your pride and joy...
I figured you'd wait a while for that...you're never without those boots.
You love those boots...maybe without them on, you'll focus on the cards.
Your boots? If anything were staying on, I figured it'd be those...
I don't know what I expected. Well, no. I expected this.
Seems about right for you. Can't say you're not having fun.
This really is the perfect game for you. The less thought you put into it, the more you get to flaunt your body.
I figured they weren't part of the dress...never watched you disrobe very intently.
Only Jura knows for sure, but that should be the last of the small things...
Normally she wears more jewelry. This is probably the end of things...
If you're getting annoyed with her teasing, that's probably the last of it. And she's not putting in much effort otherwise...
Your accessories just keep on going...but I think that's the last of them. You can never be sure...
Hm...well, you're certainly cheerful. I've often thought about being a Fama myself...but that isn't so simple.
Well, you may be older than me, but you're certainly more cheerful. I wouldn't mind being a Fama like you...
Piracy isn't the kind of profession hospitable for having daughters...but I'd like to be a Fama one day, like you.
Some of my crewmates have told me I'd make a good Fama, so it's nice meeting a woman who's had an older daughter.
...You're starting the exhibitionism a little early, don't you think?
...Are you exposing yourself on purpose?
Perhaps presenting like that will prepare us for the nudity to come. Considerate of you.
Kyu, you're...showing. Actually, you probably know that, don't you?
Bless...you?
God bless you--er...Launch?
Wha--where's Launch? Who are you? What just happened?
Bless you--uh...Launch? Your hair is...blue now.
Why did you bring a sword in the first place?
That's not really clothing, Lyn.
This is just a game...on your home planet, I assume. Why are you armed?
Jura has a sword like that...but she doesn't practice enough.
I won't be counting my laser ring...I'd rather not make a show of disarming myself.
...If you did either of those things on a regular basis, you'd be in better shape.
You would have a body that shows exercise if you actually got any. Making excuses won't fix that.
...Some of my pilots insist they hit the gym, despite their backsides growing plumper each week.
...You can tell whatever story you'd like, Mae, but your body will always reveal the truth.
Words, huh? Sounds nice, but I'd like to see you try to reason with Mejarian imperials.
Don't be so high and mighty. If you're capable of fighting evil, you're capable of perpetrating it, too.
...Can't you give me a straight answer?
...I'm a pirate. So I have to deal with military types on a regular basis.
Mejare's military isn't known for its commitment to human rights. So I work with pirates.
...I guess that was presumptuous of me. I don't know what Earth's military is like, but Mejare's is corrupt. I'm a pirate...
...I pilot for a pirate crew to stage raids on Mejare's military. So I'm not fond of them, considering the crewmates of mine they've killed.
You smell like alcohol. Have you been sipping some this whole time?
Do you drink a lot? You smell like it.
You smell like alcohol...you really shouldn't drink. It's bad for you.
The typical response of a woman with something to hide.
Your sudden panic is very convincing.
...The least you could do is make an effort to convince me of that.
...Right. That's obvious from the worry on your face.
..."Management"? Are you even listening to me?
I wasn't told about any stripping-order rules. What's this nonsense about "management"?
..."Management"? You're on a different planet than the rest of us, so to speak...
...Now the management of this place is contacting you? All I wanted was to meet a well-adjusted Earth woman...
...This isn't an eyeglass. Despite that, I can't claim to be an expert on the matter...I come from a planet of all women.
...This is a fashion item. It has nothing to do with my ability to spot a woman, I promise you.
This isn't a lens. That said, I lead a squadron of pilots--it's my job to notice insecure young girls.
If you'll look closely, there's no lens. My Oma's company designed it as a fashion item...not that it was ever sold.
...I am from a different world. Humans developed space travel centuries ago, Nami.
...What are you saying? Earth has settled dozens of extraplanetary colonies through space travel. Has that been kept hidden here?
...Of course there's "space sailing." That's how Mejare and other Earth colonies were settled--don't you have that?
...You're unaware of space travel? No wonder Earthlings are xenophobic--centuries-old technology is being hidden from you.
If you keep insisting on addressing them in public, then it is my business. Half my job is defusing relationship issues among my pilots.
My subordinates get into petty dating issues all the time...this tiff with ~player~ sounds a lot like that.
You've made it all of our business. My pilots often have relationship issues...honesty is the best solution.
My pilots tend to date each other...I know what's going on here. I suggest you confront ~player~ about your feelings here and now.
...Yes? I'm listening, Nayru.
...Nayru?
...Take your time, Nayru. I can't imagine foresight is easy.
...I'm also interested in the process of seeing the future, by the way.
Whatever power your music has, I'm not one to back down from a challenge. Let's hear it.
Music is reward enough, whatever strange side effects you might give it. I've withstood worse.
I've undergone electroshock, Nayru. Whatever your music can do, I doubt it's worse than that...or not worth the listen.
Try me. If I can't handle some strange music, I'm not fit to pilot anyway.
Whether or not you are, you seem awfully touchy about it...not what I would expect from a deity.
Do people question your divinity often? You seem defensive for someone so above us mere mortals.
Surely a goddess would feel secure enough not to worry about a mortal's accusations.
You may have the power of a goddess, but it seems your ego is all too human.
I've seen enough of the supernatural to believe you, but I figured a goddess would be more...secure.
What's a "crown"? Oh, it's that...jewelry.
Your crown...is that some kind of symbol of authority? I don't like politics...
Is that crown what marks you as a "princess"? A woman who relies on a title should rethink her identity.
Jewelry marking your inflated importance...politics disgust me.
Your hat--? I see. So you're not human at all...whatever power you just wielded wasn't.
Where'd your hat go? I see...your maid did something. I don't put much stock in bloodlines, but it's clear you're something other than human.
Wha--your hat--? Disappeared...you're not human at all, whatever your bloodlines happens to be.
Wha--what'd she do? Your hat...I see. So the wings aren't your only inhuman attribute...you can save the talk of heritage.
You really need a Mejarian laser ring. You could conceal it...and it wouldn't make as much noise.
Get yourself a laser ring. You'll thank me, and so will your eardrums.
Doesn't your job require stealth? Our laser rings make a lot less noise...and are harder to spot.
I couldn't care less about those things...now that they're gone. I feel obligated to give you a laser ring and teach you about stealth.
...That didn't explain anything. You must be some kind of Earth service robot...or a fighting one.
...You're mocking me. I'll regard you as a gynoid for the time being...a potentially hostile one.
And what is the "ARMS ability"? I should consider you a battle robot until proven otherwise.
..."Stretchy." Or mechanical...I would not put it past Earth to send combat gynoids after us.
I see. And what is this "Flame Tribe"?
Just making conversation...I'm not interested in fashion. But what's this Flame Tribe, exactly?
I'm assuming you belong to this "Flame Tribe"? That sounds interesting.
What's a "crown"? You seem fancy enough already...
Your crown...is that some kind of symbol of authority? I still don't know what you're supposed to be ruling over.
Is that crown what marks you as a "princess"? Or just your claim to...space?
...Does that jewelry mark you as ruler of your observatory? Wherever it is in space?
...I was just commenting on your hair color. If you're worried you'll be judged for your ancestry, I'm above that.
...An innocent comment, and this girl reveals she's partially alien. Well, I won't treat you as less human for it.
...I think you may have divulged more than I knew from that. Alien or not, I respect your humanity.
...You're partially alien? Well, that's no business of mine. Earth hasn't respected Mejarians' humanity...
...Listen. I'm not the most talkative woman myself, but you look miserable. Don't suffer quietly.
...You're blushing, Saki. That doesn't exactly inspire confidence.
...Your defensiveness still leaves me in doubt. You can tell me if something's wrong. I'm used to reports like that.
...My pilots lie to me all the time, Saki. And they're better liars than you are.
...Saki. I can tell when someone is distressed. It's part of my job.
...I'm not so good with words, but...my crewmates ask me advice often. You can, too.
Sector...? Not sure how your federation organizes space, but I come from Mejare.
Planet Mejare. It's...less than stellar.
I come from Mejare, the planet of women...not a healthy place.
Planet Mejare, Earth's uterus colony. What sector it's in is beyond me...
...That was never my intention. You ought to be more trusting on your home planet.
...Of course an Earth woman interprets genuine curiosity as a threat.
...Did you think I was threatening you? I had a feeling Earth women were xenophobic.
Tch. If you're going to let your Earthling xenophobia inform this conversation, then forget it.
...Leave it to a soldier to immediately threaten violence when her loyalties are questioned.
You're threatening me now? You're already a model Mejarian imperial.
I used to start fights in these sorts of places...I'd like to move on from that.
...I should've known you'd threaten me just for saying that. You're a walking stereotype.
Shimakaze, you've caught fire. I knew something like this would happen--!
Oh, for God's sake, you were playing with matches? I told you to calm down!
Hyperactive children are bound to--agh! How'd you start a fire?
I don't want to deal with you bouncing off--agh! Fire! You idiot!
Even you don't understand yourself...well, I'd wager the Paksis is similar in that regard, too. As are human beings.
There's nothing wrong with your confusion, Shimakaze. Humans don't understand their own existences much, either.
You don't even understand your own existence...well, it'd be wrong to say humans do, either. You're not weird for that...
...It's alright, Shimakaze. In fact, wondering about your own existence is a very human trait...
...Really? That's what's fascinating to you? Men?
...I really thought magic would be more fascinating to an Earth woman than the opposite sex.
...Or you could focus on men instead. Are they really so interesting? Didn't you grow up around them?
...Even in a society of magic, I see men capture the minds of Earth women. What's so appealing about their tubes, anyway?
Good...I was worried about that thing. I thought you were planning on making more ghosts.
Why'd you bring that knife in the first place if you're a ghost? Is that how you died?
I hate knives...or anything sharp. But at least you weren't here to make us ghosts.
...At least you didn't cling to it. Then I'd really be worried.
I do question how you can hold the knife if you're really a ghost...but I'm just glad you're dropping it.
There's no reason for that. Bodysuits are slim and practical...
What's wrong with the way you are now? You look good, and it stays out of your way.
I suppose heroes don't have much more choice in their outfits than pirates do...but bodysuits are good to have. I'd never complain about mine.
That's too bad...still, I would recommend keeping the suit. They've always served me well...
...Wait, I wasn't sure at first, but--are you levitating?
Wha--wait, how are you levitating like that? What's going on? Ochako?
...Ochako, why are you floating? Did I miss something? I was looking at the cards...
...I'm sorry, are you floating? W-what's this all about, Ochako? I should have paid more attention...
Neither do I...but that's no reason to be ashamed. I'm not going to let anyone relish it.
Do you think I do? You look perfectly fit...don't give them the satisfaction of seeing that this bothers you.
I hope you're not implying that I do. All the same, being embarrassed is just going to encourage them to twist the knife.
People usually assume I do because of my suit...and you dress rather similarly. Don't give them the satisfaction.
Wha--what are you...
...Vriska?
V-Vriska? What's...happening to you?
...Vriska? Vriska!
Not again. Why are you doing this?
Oh, great. Another vortex.
The people you meet in these sorts of seedy dumps...
Ugh...not again. This is going to give me a headache.
I don't even want to beat you. Not if you're going to keep this up.
Even watching you strip is exhausting.
The stripping is bad enough, but I can barely tell what you're saying.
...I'd be fascinated if you even seemed in control of this.
You're like a living Paksis...without the warmth.
I didn't think my opponents would be this hard to understand.
You're rather defensive for such a wealthy woman...maybe I would've been, too, had it lasted.
So defensive...I guess I can't understand the mindset of a woman who was wealthy into adulthood. Mine dried up.
There's no need to shout...I wasn't attacking you for it. I would've liked to keep my childhood wealth...
...I see your situation has left you rather indignant. I was attacked for being wealthy, too...after I lost it all.
What's a "tiara"? ...Must be that jewelry. Why do you wear it?
Your tiara...is that some kind of symbol of authority? Wherever it is you live.
Is that tiara what marks you as a "princess"? Or just for decoration?
Does that have any value? ...No, I'm not going to steal it.
A challenge just makes me more curious. How can I be sure you're capable of it yourself?
You're rather elitist. I relish anything that's challenging to overcome...how about a demonstration?
If you're so smug about your abilities, I'd like to see you put them to use.
Are you really capable of magic? Showing some off might deter me...or interest me even further.
...Oh. Well, can't say I'm surprised.
...That's about right for you. The letter of the rule rather than the spirit.
...Thrilling, Jura. Good first impression.
...You're lucky we're in mixed company.
I still wouldn't call that exciting.
They might be fashionable, but that doesn't mean much when it's all coming off anyway.
Only you could be so excited to strip that you've based your strategy around it.
Try not to fall over. Wouldn't be the first time.
...Right. Forgot who I was talking to.
...You're right, that was stupid of me to say.
...You're full of surprises.
Should've known this sort of thing is your arena. Shame a dogfight isn't.
...I knew you'd do this, and it's still getting tiresome.
True to a pirate's nature, you've stolen precious time from all of our lives.
Unless Earth women are big on jewelry, this feels more like cruelty than teasing.
Apologize to them, not me. I see you naked in the showers...mostly because you make me.
...I see you won't budge. Though given how planet Mejare is all women, my eye for disguises probably isn't the sharpest.
...I see your facade isn't going anywhere. Though Mejare is a planet of all women...if you were to dispute your disguise with anyone, it'd be me.
...Well, I can't claim to be absolutely sure you're a woman. My planet has no men...so I haven't seen many of them.
...If I could have my eyepiece back, I'd like that. Otherwise, you might have a point...I did grow up in a world of only women.
...Well, I can see how beating you is going to be an issue. That's not even clothing.
It's called Strip Poker, not Disarm Poker.
Oh, great. This sort of thing was what you had planned...
...I don't know why I expected you to follow anything but the letter of the rules.
Should've figured you'd just tease instead of take the game seriously.
...Don't flirt with me. I was just complimenting your play...
...Don't make this weird, Jura. We're colleagues...and you're taken.
...I know you flirt with everyone, but it still catches me off guard.
...Look, don't say those sorts of things. I know you're joking, but Barnette's still going to get in my face about it.
I figured you wouldn't care. This is far more exciting for you, after all...and you shy away from leadership opportunities.
Considering your track record, I knew you wouldn't mind losing out on another chance to show leadership.
For my backup squadron leader, you sure don't have much experience...it leaves me uneasy.
More teasing aside, you really ought to practice leading the squadron more.
How could I miss it? It's basically a big warning sign to passersby that you're going to flirt with them.
I wouldn't congratulate myself for spotting a garish piece of jewelry right on your neck.
Isn't that thing uncomfortable, on top of being distracting?
You're not exactly the most subtle woman on Mejare, Jura.
You're counting things like your rapier? Come on, Jura, we're supposed to be stripping clothes.
...Follow the rules, Jura. That sword doesn't count as clothing.
I've lost my entire bodysuit, Jura. The least you could do is strip actual clothing.
...Oh. So this is how you're going to play.
Your...boots? I know you like them, but do they really mean that much to you?
Your boots? My eyepiece is personal...you just like the fashion element.
I wouldn't consider that personal, Jura. Not unless someone died to give them to you...
Didn't you steal those off a soldier? I suppose if you really find the encounter that meaningful...
Your accessories are running thin. I won't be losing for much longer...and I don't appreciate being teased.
I just felt it appropriate to let our hosts know what's coming next.
I don't approve of beating around the bush, Jura. I'd rather cut right through it.
It seemed as if our hosts were getting sick of your teasing, so I didn't let them get their hopes up.
I won't pretend spotting your choker was particularly clever of me. It is just below your face.
I'm too used to your looks to get distracted.
If spotting something so obvious made me proud of myself, I wouldn't be here today...my arrogance would've gotten me killed.
You're not that hard to figure out, Jura. You wear even your sex life on your sleeve.
You're not exactly the type to keep secrets, Jura.
...You didn't notice? Well, that proves my point, doesn't it? Study your opponent closer next time.
I'm surprised you'd admit that. We know who would've won a shootout, then--of course, it's gone now.
If you didn't see my ring, then you now see my point. My hand is my holster--no need to swing that weight around.
...That attitude is why you never improve your piloting skills.
You'd be a much better Dread pilot if you gave your own skills the credit they deserve.
Give yourself some credit. You're playing very well...and obviously you're reading my moves.
Can't you just admit a game takes skill for once? You're always downplaying yourself to save face when you lose.
I really thought you'd wait a while for something like those. But I suppose feet have never been much of a concern for you.
Don't ask me why you'd concern yourself with fashion on your feet of all things. Shoes are just there to protect...
You're attached to those things. Surprised you'd jump straight to that...
Trying to throw us off? That's actually quite substantial...but I see some other things that aren't.
Well, that explains your confidence. You should know only the cards can save you.
Layer all you want. It won't save you from repeated mistakes.
Piling on the accessories seems more like a not-losing strategy than a winning one.
You should know wearing decorations to get out of answering for your mistakes doesn't impress me.
It never ends with you and your trinkets. Enjoying how much more clothed you are than me?
Can't help but twist the knife with my situation, can you?
You must really relish this opportunity to taunt me as I stand here topless.
I imagine the only thing more satisfying to you than teasing everyone is how I'm half-naked as you do it.
A good challenge is all I ever wanted from you, so I'm happy.
If you're really this good at cards, we should play all the time...
And you're just toying with me, stripping your rapier...this is great.
I'm really, honestly surprised, Jura. I've always wanted to have a rival for this sort of thing.
Anything's possible...especially if your opponent is convinced you can't win.
Don't get complacent, Jura. One inch is all an enemy needs.
Haven't I always told you to stay vigilant? Now's the time.
You'd be surprised how quickly a lead can vanish...especially when you think it can't.
I'm perfectly fine with being nude. I keep losing, so it's all I deserve.
I certainly don't relish it like you do, but I can live with it.
I'm not a lecherous exhibitionist like you. I'm merely tolerating my nudity.
Yes, Jura, I love being naked in public. I'm bursting at the seams with lust. Absolutely.
I'm sure your body will be much more thrilling than mine.
I work hard in the gym to make my body presentable. Yours is all genetics...and probably still better.
You're really excited about this dress drop of yours, aren't you? I suppose you have plenty to be proud of.
At least you've found something you're truly passionate about--flaunting your own indecency. But I suppose your body justifies that a little.
Figures you'd start with that. I've got no right to complain...I would've lost had you walked in here naked.
It's not much, but strip whatever you want, Jura. I would've lost all the same.
I should have known you'd strip things like that. We're going to be here all night.
Of course you'd start with that. I'd be concerned for your health if you didn't.
If you're trying to get my attention, feet don't interest me.
You'd best hope Earth people appreciate feet, because I don't.
Now I'm curious if Earthlings like women's feet. I'm indifferent...even like this.
Feet take a lot of abuse...even yours. So I wouldn't call this titillating.
You really need to learn how to mind your own business.
You don't have the right to know everything about me, Jura.
I have you on a need-to-know basis. We're still just colleagues, after all.
I'll never understand why you insist on flooding your work environment with sex and gossip.
It would seem that's the last of your trinkets. Better start playing seriously, Jura.
If you weren't taking this seriously before, now's the time. Don't give up!
No more accessories, it seems...but that's better. Now I want to see what your skill can manage.
Only that dress can save you now...that, and your own wits. I have my doubts about your underwear situation.
So this was your stripping plan. I guess I expected something like it...
Shame I couldn't hang around to analyze your stripping choices when they mattered to me.
If that's what you consider clothing, you've got this game locked down for sure.
Just your rapier...I should have expected this sort of teasing from you, but it wouldn't have mattered if I did.
Valore? W--where'd you get that idea?
Valore? That's your hypothesis? ...I'm afraid not.
...Valore's even more of a professional colleague than you are. I could never...
Valore? I...I couldn't look at her that way. We're in too similar of positions...
You know, I'm actually in a good mood. Try not to ruin it.
If you're wondering why I'm always serious, it's because you constantly do this to me.
If you haven't noticed, Jura, you're the one making me miserable half the time.
How sportsmanlike of you. I'll remember this.
You have no idea how glad I am to see all those ridiculous accessories go. But then, I also want you to win...
No, thanks. Jewelry isn't for me...especially your kind.
Jewelry has no place in my life...unless my eyepiece counts as jewelry.
I can't stay mad at you when you've got every right to make fun of me. I should have beaten you, or at least kept even...
...I don't appreciate your aggression, Caulifla. Or is that a Saiyan trait, as well?
...I don't mean any harm in my curiosity. I would hope you're a peaceful race, as well.
...Mejare has made enemies of its sister planet Tarak, as well as Earth. It was not my intention to add Saiyans to that list...unless we're given a reason.
...If you're a visitor to this planet, too, then you would do well to be more polite. I meant no hostility.
...It's true that adulthood is an attitude rather than an age. But you could still mature in that respect.
...Perhaps women would treat you like an adult if you responded in a more adult manner.
