Eighteen? Earth's food supply must be scarce...still, you could stand to be more mature about the confusion.
...If you want to be treated like an adult, then don't throw a childish fit.
...I'm sorry. What are the limitations of magical powers? Perhaps you could develop a spell to...develop your body.
...Hm. If magical powers can warp reality without limit, then why not use yours to grow taller?
...So magic doesn't stunt growth. Well, why not use it to accelerate growth? What are magic's limitations?
...My apologies. I thought the limits of magic would be in the body's ability to host it...but if that's not true, surely there's a maturation spell?
...What are you doing? I already don't understand how you're speaking--!
...Flutter? What's this all about? I feel some sort of energy--!
...What? You can't issue a warning without an explanation, Flutter--!
...Oh? What are you planning to do? Some kind of energy is gathering...
...I haven't asked Parfet about her childhood, but ending up as a pirate tells most of the story. What happened to you?
...I see. I suppose you won't be explaining it, then. Is this just a personal quirk of yours, or something that many girls do here?
...Komi-san. I'm addressing you.
...Komi-san. I understand you're nervous, but it's rude to not speak when spoken to.
I'm curious why you chose a whip as a sidearm as opposed to a gun, or even an edged weapon. It doesn't seem practical.
A whip seems much harder to use than a typical weapon, on top of being less lethal. Why do you use one?
There's no need to--ahem. I see...it's nothing you would have shown as you stripped. My apologies.
Your enemies present enough danger in combat without you endangering yourself. Most injuries occur when skilled women become complacent.
No matter how skilled you are, it's foolish to disregard safety. That's exactly how accidents happen.
I'm sure you're quite talented as an operative. That's exactly why you should take your job and your safety seriously, so as not to waste it.
..."Blastia"? Is that some sort of mineral? We have a crystal energy core of our own, but we don't call it magic.
...No, I haven't heard of "Blastia." Unless that happens to be Earth's name for our Paksis crystal...
She's not sure what planet she's on...I met a lot of women in your state behind Mejare's bars, too. I'll try not to bother you.
It's as I feared...she's beyond help. Many thugs on Mejare's streets started to forget where they were, too.
...With your mind? That's not actually surprising, given what we've seen of Earthlings' abilities. We met a child who seemed to command wormholes from his seat.
...With the way Earthlings modify themselves, there may be no distinction between the mind and technology. We met a telekinetic Earth child who seemed to summon wormholes.
...I don't know what "experience points" are, but we describe men as being abominations, too. Are those points what you call your currency?
...We would have called men abominations, as well. Maybe you could explain what "experience points" are.
What's that thing? Oh, right, a bee.
Mejare does have bees...women need to maintain their flower gardens, after all.
How'd a bee get in here? ...How'd I get in here?
...I'm surprised you have such a strong bond when you're so quick to belittle others. How did you two meet?
...You were smart to bring small items. Did you know that this place rewarded doing so?
Riquer...every battle, she seems to suffer damage to her left wing. Jura, she's part of your sub-team. Give her a talk about defensive strategy.
I was hoping this game wouldn't devolve into a fashion discussion.
Tch. If I get desperate enough, perhaps I can count my laser ring as clothing.
...This is exhausting.
...I understand that my suit is rather revealing by Earth women's standards.
...I feel even more exposed watching you take that off.
...Remember, Jura. If anything happens while neither of us were around to lead the Dread team, we'll both be answering to the captain.
...I have no comments to make on fashion. Skintight clothing doesn't lend itself to small items.
I didn't have much of an eye for fashion, even on my homeworld. I just wore the dresses my parents gave me.
...Maybe one of my more sociable crewmates would be better suited for this sort of thing.
...I'm not the one stripping, ~player~. Or are you just staring at my breasts?
I feel a bit divorced from the smart small-item tactics of the early game now.
...That's the smart choice, no matter how clothed your opponents are.
I guess there isn't much strategy besides removing your small items first. That suits me--I can stay calm under pressure better than I can strategize.
...You haven't noticed me much this game, have you? I've just been throwing my clothes off.
...I guess I haven't made playing naked look very fun.
...The back of my hair is getting messy. I always just brush my bangs...
...I would've done the same thing in your position. I'd even be grateful to be so clothed while studying a nude Earth woman.
I wouldn't have to let you do the talking if I knew more about fashion, Jura. Even when we find clothes on a raid, you take them all.
...Wearing small things...that's the most strategy this offers.
...Maybe I should have brought something like that.
I hardly recognize some of these accessories...it must be Earth fashion.
...There's no sense in going bigger...
...I don't have much to lose in the first place.
...Wearing that sort of thing is really the best play one can make here.
...I'm glad I brought this.
...Things can only get more interesting.
I can't provide much fashion commentary beyond bodysuits...
A pirate tends to forgo what accessories she can...well, the average pirate does.
...Hm. Get a move on.
...I'm not known for my patience in combat.
...Our crew can be touchy about vanity. It depends on whom you ask.
I won't be counting my laser ring...I'd rather keep it on, in fact.
One has to wonder what the game design philosophy is behind allowing players to pile on small items.
...You were smart to bring small items. Did you know that this place rewarded doing so?
Riquer...every battle, she seems to suffer damage to her left wing. Jura should speak to her about defensive positioning.
I was hoping this game wouldn't devolve into a fashion discussion.
Tch. If I get desperate enough, perhaps I can count my laser ring as clothing.
...This is exhausting.
...I understand that my suit is rather revealing by Earth women's standards.
Just something small...
...I think I'm seeing how to win this game, and it isn't a poker face.
...That doesn't look important.
This is another reason I didn't want to fall behind early. Standing around shivering in my underwear, waiting for the small things to thin out.
Now that I think about it, a Mejarian soldier wouldn't wear much more than I did. But she wouldn't accept any men's presence.
...Damn. My stylus must be piled up into my suit. It'll poke me when I put it on again.
...I should use these rounds to get some stretching in.
...I feel even more exposed watching you take that off.
I'd have more patience for this if I weren't risking the Dread team being attacked tonight. Jura's not there to lead in my place, either.
...I have no comments to make on fashion. Skintight clothing doesn't lend itself to small items.
I didn't have much of an eye for fashion, even on my homeworld. I just wore the dresses my parents gave me.
...Maybe one of my more sociable crewmates would be better suited for this sort of thing.
...I'm not the one stripping, ~player~. Or are you just staring at my breasts?
I feel a bit divorced from the smart small-item tactics of the early game now.
...That's the smart choice, no matter how clothed your opponents are.
I guess there isn't much strategy besides removing your small items first. That suits me--I can stay calm under pressure better than I can strategize.
...You haven't noticed me much this game, have you? I've just been throwing my clothes off.
...I guess I haven't made playing naked look very fun.
...The back of my hair is getting messy. I always just brush my bangs...
...I would've done the same thing in your position. I'd even be grateful to be so clothed while studying a nude Earth woman.
I could make better conversation in this game if I knew about fashion. My sub-commander insists we give any nice clothes we find to her.
This really is going to take me a while...
I hate vanity...and now I'm hating you.
This is what I get for playing badly...
Mocking your enemy after they've lost is poor form.
This game was supposed to loosen me up. You could use some of that...
To be so far ahead of me...have you considered a piloting career?
After all that time I took to finish, you're still so clothed...
Your play has been excellent...it's giving me goosebumps.
I really thought tonight would be an easy win...I sold Earth women short.
This place attracts the best women around, it seems.
(She's just jealous of Mejarian beauty. Yes, that includes you...silly.)
(Have I ever told you how beautiful you are, Meia? ...I mean, Barnette's still a little cuter.)
(Since ~name~'s being no help, how about you focus on our cutest crewmates?)
~name~--y-you...I...Jura...
..."Arc rounds"? I'm not familiar. In any case, I'm not making a sales pitch. Do what you wish.
...If you're not interested, I won't push the issue further. That said, I haven't heard of "arc round" technology.
...I considered changing my name once. But I was afraid of forgetting who I was in the first place.
...You say that so casually. There's times I'd like to forget, but then I'd never have learned from them.
...If you change your identity just to hide from your past, then you won't understand either anymore.
...I did my best to hide who I was for a long time. But the only way to escape one's past is to face it.
Perfect. There's two drunks running around.
Well, now it's a race to see who blacks out first.
Jura can drink for a while. I suppose we'll see if Earth booze is powerful enough to topple you two.
Soldiers really are irresponsible. What are the odds they're both drunks?
Unbelievable. Two soldiers, both irresponsible alcoholics.
Soldiers, exotic hair, alcoholics. It's like watching a stranger look in a mirror.
At least Misato's got the height to down those drinks. Don't ask me how Sei's doing it.
At least Misato's just drinking beer. Sei's hard liquor is something else entirely.
Are you drinking? ...I didn't even know this place served alcohol.
Are you drinking? ...Don't even think about joining her, Jura. I'm not carrying you out of here.
Drinking...just like a soldier.
Are you drinking? The state-approved Mejarian libations are all full of hormones...
Half-naked and liquored-up seems like a bad combination...
Are you drinking? ...Well, keep it to yourself.
Tch...be glad there's no men here to take advantage of you two.
What a young girl needs is responsibility. You should leave this place before a man shows up...
Thank God this game is all women...please don't listen to her, Rin.
...Rin, I'd hate to see a girl like you taken advantage of. We're lucky there's no men here...drinking would make you vulnerable.
I'm--just as confused. The "best part" is something called..."birth control"?
...Nothing about the term "birth control" sounds like the best part of sex. What is it?
I--you're confused, too, Rin? So this isn't just an Earth term--what's "birth control"?
...Birth...control? Do Earth women make birth some kind of erotic experience? ...Rin, what is she talking about?
...I remember that. We fell for such a simple trap...all three of us got along much better after that.
...I wasn't unscathed that day myself. I was searching for you two with bandages still around my eye.
...It wasn't just you two. I think I warmed up to you a little myself after that...it was too close of a call for all of us.
...The entire assault team could've been killed that day. We had twenty-five injured pilots...but everyone made it out alive. I couldn't believe it when I found you two.
That's right...the entire Dread team seemed to get along better after that. But I still wasn't prepared to walk in on you two in the briefing room a few days later.
...It's true. I couldn't stand either of you back then...and no one could stand Barnette, right from the moment she came aboard the hideout with her gun collection.

condition.saying: Meia doesn't seem to get much attention

case.state: I'm not interested in their attention, Jura. Leave me out of this.
...Jura, don't drag me into personal romance. The men's attention is not my concern.
I--tch. What an obnoxious woman.
I'm not--tch. Fine.
If only you could ignore me more often...
Ignore--never mind. You're baiting me...
Tight clothing is common on our planet, but revealing clothing is moreso. Technically, this is a flightsuit.
This is a flightsuit, Jessie. We're from another planet, not "space." Mejarians wear many things.
Is that your perception of women from other planets? We all wear "spacesuits"? This is for piloting my Dread.
Don't women wear many different outfits on Earth, Jessie? Mejarians are the same. This is a piloting suit, not a spacesuit.
Tight clothing is common on our planet, but revealing clothing is moreso. Technically, I was wearing a flightsuit.
My suit is for flying, Jessie, and we're from another planet, not "space." Mejarians wear many things.
Is that your perception of women from other planets? We all wear "spacesuits"? I wear that suit to pilot my Dread.
Don't women wear many different outfits on Earth, Jessie? Mejarians are the same. I was wearing a piloting suit, not a spacesuit.
Done what? Should I not have said that? I don't--oh.
What do you mean, Mahiru? Is she--o-oh no, you don't have to. It's fine.
...Does Chiaki really like video games that much? Does--oh. Oh dear.
Now I've done it? What do you me--oh. Oh. Uh...please don't.
Jura just carries that for fashion's sake. Not that it's particularly useful next to a laser ring, anyway...
We use violence when necessary. Mejare's government are the real aggressors...
Mejare's military is full of the violent types you're looking for. We fight to survive.
Swords are too heavy. They'd just weigh me down in combat...like I keep telling Jura to remember.
A pilot has little use for a sword. Even our ground raids usually end far too quickly to get in close.
...You're certainly trusting. I suppose you can tell how Jura's not actually very skilled with that thing.
No. A pilot should focus on just that, not playing with knives.
My job is to pilot a Dread. Any time I could spend with a sword would be better used for that.
No. I don't share her fascination with swords--a pilot's job is to destroy targets quickly and from a distance.
No. A sword is a limited ground weapon, and we try to avoid ground engagements in the first place. We're pilots.
...Jura is always trying to set me up with women. She doesn't understand I lack the time for that.
I don't have the desire nor the time for a relationship. You can save the niceties.
Maybe if you did any work, you'd understand why I don't have the schedule for a relationship...
...She thinks because she has time for a girlfriend, we all do. I'm not interested.
...If a few conversations in the communal spa makes us friends, then sure. We're friends.
Is that all it takes for a woman to be your friend? Some time in the spa together? ...Fine, then. Friends.
Jura's definition of friend is certainly looser than mine if a spa visit is all it takes. But...I can live with that.
We've been through a lot more together than a few spa trips. But if that satisfies you...then we're friends.
Laid? What kind of...is this the vulgar language Earth women use?
I'd be a lot less sour if you stopped pestering me...and cleaned up your vulgar slang.
It's a leader's job to be sour. Subordinates and soldiers seem content with...sex-talk.
Wha--what are you talking about? I would never be with a woman who--who phrases romance as getting laid.
...Of course I haven't. Don't you know where we're from? Jura's been making it abundantly clear.
I'd be far more ashamed if I had been with a man. Pirates or not, we're still Mejarians.
As if I would even want to be. Mejare is the planet of women...and we still adhere to that.

state.text: It seems you've spent more time honing your gauntlets than your listening skills. No Mejarian has been with a man.

case.state: ...The last thing I need is a drink.
...I do not drink. You understand that?
...Keep offering drinks, and you'll really see me mad.
...I can't drink...I have responsibilities. Unlike you.
Don't worry--I've learned not to be too trusting. Actions are more important than whatever she says.
Misato isn't the first military woman who's tried to make herself sympathethic. We'll see what story her actions tell.
How gullible do you take me for? We'll see how Misato conducts herself and decide from there.
I always start from place of distrust for soldiers. If Misato's corrupt, she'll make it obvious soon enough.
Don't even think about sharing drinks with her, Jura. You do enough of that back on the ship.
Don't you dare touch her beer, Jura. I know how you get...and Barnette's not around.
You can strip all you want, Jura, but you're staying sober tonight, you hear me? Don't join in with this woman.
We've got a long flight home, Jura...so don't touch Misato's beer. You don't handle it as well as you think.
...Some sort of former celebrity, then? Don't feel bad, Nayru...so am I.
...You don't need to deny your past, Nayru. If you're avoiding some former fame...I am, too.
...Does Navi know you from media appearances? If there's a past you're running from...I used to be the poster girl for my Oma's company.
...Seems there's some confusion for all of us. If you're some kind of celebrity in hiding, Nayru...you're not alone.
I don't think she was teasing at all. A soldier's first instinct is to crush any dissent.
That didn't sound like a tease, Misato. This medic business is just her attempt to seem polite.
If Sei really were just a teasing medic, I would hope it'd take more than one insult to set her off.
Misato might buy your saving throw to make that look like a joke, but I don't. You didn't do anything because we're in public.
I don't trust you either, Misato. Especially with how quickly you side with your fellow military personnel.
It figures the other soldier would immediately side with her. You're both despicable.
I don't know what I expected, running my mouth. Even the unarmored soldier is quick to circle the wagons.
Don't offer her alcohol! She's still a child!
I--you couldn't be a worse influence if you tried. Never drink alcohol, Rin.
Don't take it, Rin. Drinking is a disgusting habit.
...Rin, stay in school and don't accept drinks from strange women.
For your own sake, stay in your corner. And you should be ashamed of yourself for giving drinks to schoolgirls.
Are you sure you can handle all those drinks?
I don't know where you're putting all that alcohol. You're tiny.
Sei reminds me of when you got Dita drunk, Jura. Of course, I'd rather forget that evening.
I can't believe you have room for all that alcohol...I'd rather finish them if it meant Rin didn't have to.
Can you really drink all that? ...If it's between Rin and me to finish those drinks for you, give them to me. She doesn't need that in her life.
Where is all that alcohol being stored? ...Give them to me if anyone. Not Rin...
...You're so short, but you can drink more than I ever could...if you need help, let me do it, not Rin.
Are you drinking? ...I didn't even know this place served alcohol.
Are you drinking? Jura drinks too much. Sometimes she's hungover at the next morning's meeting.
Are you drinking? ...Well, keep it to yourself.
I don't drink, Sei...not anymore.
Are you drinking? The state-approved Mejarian libations are all full of hormones...
Half-naked and liquored-up seems like a bad combination...
Drinking...just like a soldier.
Birth...control? What's that?
...What did you just say? "Birth control"? What does that mean?
Birth control? You control birth on Earth? That sounds--barbaric.
...What's "birth control"?
...This is the last time I try to make small talk about an Earth woman's interests.
And Jura wonders why I don't bother talking to people...
...At least you're passionate about it.
What's "1983"? I have no context for Earth years, Chiaki.
...Would you like it if I started rattling off my Dread's specifications?
Ah, yes. The enn-ee-ess. That explains everything. Thanks, Chiaki.
Men are nothing to be afraid of, Florina. Most are simpletons, anyway.
Listen. I've helped stage raids on Tarak's military. Men are easily dealt with.
You don't have to be afraid of men, Florina. They probably relish that.
You've got to assert yourself around men. They'll try to lord themselves over you otherwise.
Jura...? She's the closest thing to a friend I have, yes. But we're colleagues. What's this about?
...Why is an image of Jura worrying you, Nayru? ...Not that she's my friend, necessarily.
...Jura is my colleague, but it depends how you define friend. More importantly, what are you so agitated about?
...What did Jura scheme this time that's got you so worried? She's more teammate than friend, but...
Friend? ...You mean Jura? What did she hide from me this time?
Friend? ...You must mean Jura, though that's stretching the definition. None of her schemes are ever good for me.
...I assume you mean Jura. It was bad enough dragging me here, and now she's planning something else?
...Jura, you mean? I guess I spend the most time with her...but she's always scheming something.
...Why are you being evasive? I pirate for a living--of course there's going to be conflict. It's why I asked.
Are you surprised to be seeing fighting? That's what I do...it's why I wanted to know my future.
My future is always uncertain, Nayru...that's the nature of being a fighter pilot. And the reason I even asked.
Why do you think I asked about my future? I could die any given day...that's the risk of being a fighter pilot, and a pirate especially.
...I understand you may not like fighting, Nayru, but that's what a pirate does. It's why I wish to know the future at all...
...You said this was "Din's Power"? It's certainly intense...it sounds like a ritual.
Nothing more appropriate, huh...it sounds like something we should chant to.
Hmm...it sounds like a song some primitive tribe would dance to. Fiery.
So, "Din's Power"...energetic, like a bubbling pot. But why is it so appropriate?
...This is somber. And it just came to you? It's like death...
...The "Elegy of Emptiness," you said? It sounds as if it's trying to live up to the name.
Hmm...like a funeral dirge. Or perhaps the war bells that preceded it.
Harsh notes...but with little tying them together. It feels like it's dying.
..."Farore's Courage," this was called? It reminds me of piloting...
...Oh, this is nice. It's freeing...like the first time I piloted.
...You seem uncertain about this. But the tune is nice and bubbly...like flying.
So, you know the woman who wrote this? You called it Farore's Courage...it sounds like flying feels.
I'd be hard-pressed to find music that didn't make me feel a certain way...I see why it's named after sailing.
Are you sure? Hmm...it sways like a boat on the ocean. Fitting for the "Song of Storms."
Swaying back and forth...like a stormy sea. I'm sure if you give it time, a feeling will emerge for you, too.
...I didn't think you'd be so quick to dismiss it. To me, it's as its name implies--a gentle storm.
...Four people? And three of them men? I couldn't imagine...the three men with us are surrounded by a hundred women.
...You're the only woman? Small as it is, I couldn't work like that...
Working with three men on a ship full of women is awkward enough for me. I can't imagine being alone with just men...
...And you're OK without women around? Even with all the women around them, the three men we have aboard...are quite the presence.
Who is this Rock you keep mentioning? It sounds as if he irritates you...as men tend to do, in my experience.
...This "Rock"... If you've had to deal with a frustrating foil of a man, then you have my sympathy.
...It sounds as if you could start by defusing your relationship with "Rock," whoever that is.
...If this Rock is a man you find yourself having to work with, despite your differences...well, I have a crewmate like that, too.
...I don't want to fight you, Revy. I don't know why you want to fight me. You could probably make a nice guide to Earth culture.
I'm sorry for not backing down when you bark at me. You sound like you're opinionated...which would help me learn about this planet.
I wasn't interested in fighting the first Earth woman I met, Revy. I think you could teach me a lot about this place.
Maybe Earth women cower when you shout at them, but I've been shouted at for a long time. Perhaps we could get along, and you could teach me about Earth.
And invite a sucker punch? No, thank you. We deal with enough Earth robots as it is.
My squadron already has its hands full with killer Earth machines. Just stay where you are.
My squadron's mission for months now has been to identify hostile Earth machines. I don't need to feel your arm.
I'd rather not put myself in such a vulnerable position against yet another hostile Earth mech. Why not throw a piece of yourself here?
I see. Well, as I said, you look like a normal woman. What need you have for a disguise still eludes me.
...Either way, I don't see why you would need a disguise in the first place. Nothing about this form suggests you're a "goddess."
If the insect is your disguise, then why do you need one? You look like a woman in ornate clothing, not a goddess.
With that transformation, I don't doubt some sort of "goddess-like" power. But this form already disguises you as a normal human woman.
...Again, what women are you interacting with where that would be the case?
...I can only imagine the perspective of the women you work with. Butterfly-catcher hobbyists?
Your prior experience? Women have responded well to you transforming in front of them in the past?
...I have a hard time believing that. Complete strangers haven't been shocked by you transforming into a butterfly and back?
...You're mocking me. Fine--I won't waste my time asking any more questions.
You...hadn't thought of that. If you're not going to take me seriously, then I won't bother.
"Whoops"? ...You're certainly a goddess in the sense that you think the questions of mortals are beneath you.
...If you're just going to mock me for asking questions, I'll take the hint. I suppose I'm not worth a goddess's time.
Demonstrating strange powers without explanation does not put mortals in a charitable mood, Yuelia.
...Is that a threat? I'm already wary of the powers you've shown--as most mortals would be.
...Are you saying I should treat a "goddess" with respect? You should learn now how mortals act when threatened--it isn't "nice."
I'm well within my rights to demand an explanation of your powers. A goddess may not understand, but mortals value their safety.
...Why is that? I'd be wary of being crushed or otherwise attacked.
...I'd much prefer to stay at human size. An insect form may be good for eavesdropping, but you could be stepped on.
...More convenient? Even if you can fly, a butterfly's motion seems more limited. Your body is much frailer...
...Being a butterfly seems far less convenient. You're vulnerable to even a casual smack from a bystander...
...Complete strangers don't mind? Who exactly do you associate with?
I'm sure even I'd get used to you transforming over time, as well. Or do you really mean women you've never met before?
...Are you referring to your colleagues, or are you really saying most women you meet aren't alarmed by your transformation?
Most people don't mind, even upon first meeting you? ...I should've figured a "goddess" would be difficult to figure out.
...The Student Council? You use that uniform to battle your own school...what have they done to you?
...What do you mean? Your enemy is the Student Council of your school? Just how authoritarian is it?
If it helps me understand Earth's culture as a whole, then I wouldn't mind an explanation at all...but you don't seem cooperative.
...If the "Internet" is important to Earth's culture, then yes, I'd like that. Surely you can summarize if you're so familiar with it.
There's no need for that. I understand wanting to be armed in a place like this...
That's--not what I wanted. Someone might take advantage of you here--you shouldn't disarm yourself completely.
I...why would you even bring it if you'd so quickly discard all of its ammunition? There's nothing wrong with being armed...
...What are you doing? You're supposed to always treat guns as loaded. I didn't begrudge you for having a weapon.
What is your world like if you're constantly jumping between them? And how did you get that ability?
...A "Warp Key"? No, I don't think so. He was using the same Paksis energy core we use to power our ships.
If you're not in conflict, why do you all exist as separate nations? Planets typically unify to ensure stability.
You're already peacefully coexisting? In that case, it makes sense to unify. My own homeworld would have collapsed if it were split into nations.
G-forces can be intense with a Dread's rapid acceleration, so every small advantage matters. But it's not purely how I'd choose a pilot.
Obviously, height doesn't determine a pilot's success, but our Dread fighters' main tool is their acceleration, which puts a lot of stress on the body. It was worth mentioning.
It occurred to me because a man about your height has recently joined my squadron. It's a marginal benefit, but a Dread's acceleration is difficult to adapt to.
...I'm sorry. Women under my command have lost limbs in combat. I wasn't always sure what to say to them.
...I see. Being a fighter pilot risks injuries like that every day. Not all of my pilots have come out unscathed.
I'm sorry. I've come close to losing a limb myself on several occasions, and some of my pilots have been less fortunate.
I see. Earth must not yet be unified as a planet in this time. Mejare is one society, as are most Earth colonies.
...So, Earth must still be split into smaller nations in this time, as historical records indicate. My homeworld has enough issues even as a unified planet.
...If you don't have a global military, then this must be an Earth from pre-colonial times, before it was united. Planets like Mejare are almost always one nation.
Oh. Are you in a relationship with a man? I could gain some insight on how men and women date from a young age.
Are you dating the man you crashed into? I hadn't given much thought to relationships between male and female teenagers, but that makes sense to look into.
...Wait. Emi, are you dating a man? I've usually considered men from the perspective of having children with them, but obviously romance starts at an earlier age...
I actually had a similar experience myself. I nearly died of brain trauma in a battle a few months ago, and I've tried to be more open with my crewmates since.
I understand. Not long ago, a crash lodged refuse from our energy core into my head. According to our doctor, I was clinically dead for several minutes--that changed my perspective on things.
That's exactly what taught me to trust my crewmates. Just a few months ago, I was shot down in a battle and nearly went into a coma. I had some time to reflect in that moment.
In that case, a civilian probably has to deal with those attitudes more than I do. For a pilot, there's a certain expectation of fitness.
Since you're a civilian, you probably hear it even more, then. That was the case for me--slimmer, sportier girls are stereotyped into becoming Omas.
I'm sorry to hear that. Since I became a pilot, that attitude's been less prevalent--when I was a civilian like you, the ideal woman was well-endowed.
...Combat training, but not for armed service? What exactly are the duties of a "huntress"?
...Is a "huntress" some sort of paramilitary role, then? Where else would combat training be officially sanctioned?
...If you're not being trained for military service, then what do huntresses do? I'm surprised the armed forces tolerate that activity.

state.text: ...Tch. I didn't come to this planet looking for conflict. And if it came, I expected an organized assault.
...I was so concerned about Harvest operations on this planet, and instead the threat is a lone attacker.
...Out of all the ambushes this planet's elite could have plotted, I encounter a knife-wielding maniac who'd just as easily target an Earth woman.
I've made myself clear. Whatever you've come here to prove, you won't.
I maintain the safety of myself and my pilots. Whatever your goal is, this is your warning.

case.state: ...You call priestesses "Hex Maniacs"? So there isn't much respect for superstition on this world.
...Our captain is over a hundred years old, but that might be the first time someone has called her a "Hex Maniac." I guess priestesses don't hold much clout here.
How ironic. The men we captured from Tarak love our food, as well--they only ate tasteless synthetic pills before.
...So, you came from a world of tasteless food and appreciate Earth's cooking. Our prisoners are the same way with Mejarian cooking-- nothing grows on Tarak, so they only eat nutrition pills.
...That's not as strange as it sounds. The male planet Tarak has no real food at all--just synthetic pills. The man on my Dread team gorges himself on women's cooking.
Even boiled vegetables would be a delicacy on Tarak, the planet our prisoners came from. Before they met us, their entire diet was nutrition pills--I certainly hope they don't get fat.
...Our quartermaster lost her older sister helping refugees evacuate. It's the one thing that seems to bother her.
Gascogne, our quartermaster, served under her late sister in Mejare's military. I think losing her is why she does her best to stay collected.
And Mejare has many war hawks who'd like to see the male planet Tarak wiped out. I've learned it's just propaganda.
The women of Mejare would call themselves a "peaceful race" that's merely defending itself from the aggression of the men of Tarak.
"Is likely"? If you were constructed somewhere, surely there would be design documents, or an engineer responsible.
Isn't there documentation on your design? Such a lifelike robot would surely have engineers taking credit for your creation.
I see. And...after that, what did you come to understand about them?
But...you understand them now. What was it about men that you finally made sense of?
...I'm not sure I've found any, either. But they seem to bring good fortune wherever they go, especially in a battle.
...I didn't say I was interested in them. I'm not sure if I am or not. But every battle they take part in, we suddenly find ourselves cheating the odds.
Romance might drive at the heart of the issue. I already have some experience working alongside men as colleagues.
...I'm not looking for romance, but that might show men and women's relationships most clearly. I already know what men are like professionally.
Are you saying these fruits are just growing out in the open, where anyone can pick them and gain superpowers? Maybe Earth's government has been studying Paksis energy's effects on plant life.
So they are plants. If they're rare, maybe you stumbled across some kind of farm for fruits exposed to Paksis energy--probably research by Earth's government.
I've made myself clear. What happened to your previous servants if you treat them with such respect?
I already serve under a woman who's earned my respect. Why are you shorthanded in the first place?
Actually, the way she breaks in rookies is by playing poker with them. Not strip poker, mind you, but the social effect is the same.
Gascogne's usual way to dress down a new recruit is to play poker with them... normal poker. So you remind me of her in many ways.
Speaking of Gascogne, she's an avid poker player, especially with the new crew members. Of course, she doesn't strip them.
She plays poker all the time, too...normal poker, with new pilots. But I suppose part of me wouldn't mind strip poker with her...
Uh--! And you're--removing a ribbon? You've revealed enough about your body this round already...
..."Monster Lord," without a doubt. We've never encountered alien life, and yet here it is on Earth...
My God! The living, breathing caricature of beastly women that Tarak paints...!
Ugh! I should've known to take such an outlandish title more seriously...!
You look a little incensed. Surely you understood this was part of the game.
No need to get all angry. You have plenty of clothes to lose still.
You're turning all red. You'll never win this if you lose your composure so early.
You have...cat ears? Earth is a strange planet...
What's wrong with having cat ears? It makes you unique.
I was wondering why you waited so long to take that off. I don't see what the issue is, but...sorry.
...If it makes you feel better, Blake, you still look nice. I'm sorry about your ears...whatever the reason is that you hid them.
Who was that woman, Cammy? You'd draw your enemies here and endanger us all?
Cammy! Don't you dare shrug that off! I demand to know who that was and why you drew her near us!
You've made some enemies, and you'd put us at risk by coming here? That wasn't some random thug!
That woman deliberately targeted you! What kind of mission is this that you'd draw them near civilians?
Your hand-to-hand skill really is excellent...what's your training routine like?
That said, to see you handling them like that...you're in fantastic shape. How do you train?
...If only I were as muscular...and as skilled. How'd you train that you can fend them off so easily?
Still...you fight incredibly, and your body is well-toned. Do you have any exercise advice?
I--I really didn't...
...You don't have to do that.
...I really wasn't that curious. Please don't start...
...Oh, dear. I just lit a fire, didn't I?
...I've done my best. How do you get your thighs that muscular?
...I exercise, but clearly not like you do. How did you get your thighs so...thick?
Diet and exercise are about all I've been doing. Your legs look like they could shred your pantyhose...how can I reach that level?
I've...tried to stay toned, but the rippling muscles on your legs...I have no clue how to achieve that.
...It's better in general if I don't get close, Jenetta.
...No, it's better if we stay at arm's length. Just strangers...
...I appreciate the openness, Jenetta, but I'm not...the same way.
...It's fine. Let's get to know each other before we start...touching.
...You lost me at dog. As in, those snouted things in zoos?
...Hilarious.
...I just now remember what a dog is, so you should've picked something else.
...What's a dog? Wait, those fanged things...Mejare has very few animals running around.
...I didn't understand any part of that.
...Maybe you should try another one.
...You need to take some responsibility for your own protection.
...We both know what Earthlings are capable of, and still you take the risk.
...I don't plan on having to use force, but you shouldn't underestimate these people.
...I might understand some bravado in your Dread, but we're vulnerable down here.
Somehow I doubt that's the end of your teasing.
Looking at your outfit...this is far from over.
At least you're enjoying yourself. I think I'm starting to see what you're going for, stripping-wise.
I'm starting to spot some more likely stripping candidates...this'll be a while.
Yes, she really is my second-in-command. I swear I've gotten her to focus on piloting occasionally.
I know Jura doesn't seem like much of a pilot at the moment, but you have to understand how much she loves her body...
Try not to let this teasing get to you. Jura's very proud of her body...she wants to make you beg for it.
Yes, Jura's really my second-in-command...because piloting is second among her priorities.
Why do you wear all that, anyway? It just looks cumbersome...I'd lose track of it.
I'd be tripping over that dress if I wore it...and I'd get those accessories caught on things.
You look perfectly fine without all those accessories on. Why not just go around like that?
You've no need for anything beyond what you're wearing now. Might even be worth cutting the dress closer, just for ease of movement.
...You seem to be referencing things, but I have no idea what they are.
I'll be honest. Half the time I have no clue what you're referring to when you speak.
I'm really out of my element here. I suppose an Earth woman would better understand what you're always referencing.
...What are you always talking about? You seem to be speaking around us more than to us.
Who--you--I--you don't even seem all that concerned. What's going on with you?
...Is this another strange Earth experiment? Launch! Explain yourself!
Am I just supposed to accept that this happens to Earth women? What's going on, Launch?
...You seem like this has happened before. That's good--now explain it to me.
That gun is pretty interesting...shaped like a man's kinetic one, but fires energy like a woman's.
Barnette would have liked to take a look at that gun...
I have my own experience combining men and women's weapons together...not with guns, though.
...I see. I'll keep that divinity in mind.
I really wasn't interested in it, but alright, then.
Divine or not, it's a bit of a cheat.
How does one bond with a sword, exactly? ...Stupid question, considering what the Paksis has done to our Dreads...
...I'm willing to believe it. But actions speak louder than words...especially for an Earthling.
...I'll just be quiet and let your behavior speak for itself, Misato. But Earthlings put me on edge already.
...I'll keep that in mind, Misato. I'm already wary of Earthlings in general.
I haven't had positive experiences with Earthlings, either...so a soldier just alerts me even further.
Drinking is disgusting...I would know.
You have a nice figure, Misato. Don't ruin it with booze.
Despite the alcohol, I guess you still have the professionalism to work for this "NERV," whatever it is.
Drinking...it's the sort of thing I'd expect from a military woman.
...I'm just going to ignore you from now on.
That's it. I'm ignoring you.
...You're not worth my attention.
...I'm done with you.
...I can see where this is going. I have nothing to learn about Earth from you.
Unbelievable that Earth would hide knowledge of its colonies from the general populace. Mine is Mejare, settled only by women.
Earth's leaders may not have told you this, but it has colonies throughout the galaxy. Mejare, the planet of women, is my homeworld.
Anpathos, Melanus, Tarak--settlers have been spreading out across the galaxy for generations. I come from Mejare, the planet of women.
Even among Earth's colonies, my homeworld is unusual for only having women on it. The male planet is close by...
A leader should know not to let words bother them. I would think a goddess would understand that.
Hm. Despite your title, it seems I could teach you about leadership. Don't break stoicism over a taunt.
If you were the leader you claim to be, Palutena, you wouldn't let words affect you in the first place.
Perhaps you're not prepared for the power you wield if a subordinate's questioning rattles you.
...Never mind. I think loud, obnoxious firearms suit you perfectly.
...You don't sound like you're going to change your mind. Loud guns for a loud woman.
...Never mind. It's not worth my time...your guns match your own volume.
...You seem happy with them. They make a racket, as do you.
Sorry if this is forward, but...you're very fit. It's impressive.
You didn't even have to strip to show your muscles, by the way...they're impressive.
What kind of exercise do you do? Your abs are toned...I'd like to get that fit.
Certainly doesn't look like you wear much. Your abs are showing...and they're hard to ignore.
...Senketsu? Your clothes are--is he that eye on your shirt? ...Well, our ship's energy core is alive.
"Senketsu"? Wait, that eye on your uniform--! Fascinating...does that afford you some kind of benefit?
What's Senketsu? Oh, I see--that moving eye on your shirt. We've had inanimate objects come alive...like our ship's energy core.
Senketsu? Wait a minute, that eye on your uniform is moving--! Earth continues to impress with its technology...
You seem like the type that people would take advantage of...until you have nowhere to go but places like this.
...I spent my teenage years in bars and alleyways, too. I don't want anyone else going through that.
You just don't look like you want to be here. I hate to see a woman alone in a seedy place...
It's my job to worry about women... especially ones who look like they don't belong. Don't you have a home?
I suppose medics are a little less reprehensible. Maybe you could help train Paiway.
How thoughtful of you. You don't happen to provide training to nurses, do you?
Actually, if you're a medic, the Nirvana could use you. Our only doctor is a man.
...A medic. That's not as bad...our ship's infirmary is understaffed at the moment.
Are you sure you can handle all those drinks?
I don't know where you're putting all that alcohol. You're tiny.
You remind me of when Jura got Dita, one of our trainees, drunk. She was as happy as ever...just slower.
Wha--and now you're fine? What's the meaning of this? Who are you?
I--how's it out already? Did you control that? Explain yourself!
How can you--treat a fire so casually? Shimakaze!
I--you--what's going on? That fire was unnatural--and so are you!
It must be, for you to bring it here. How many do you own?
I'm glad dying hasn't ruined your appreciation for knives. And I'm curious how many you have.
If that's your favorite, how many do you have? ...And for what purpose?
...How many knives do you have, exactly? Were you a chef before you died, or just a murderer?
Just from looking at you, you don't have a body to be ashamed of. It's no issue...
What's wrong? Your figure is fine. I assume being a "hero" keeps you in shape...
Why would you be ashamed of your body? Maybe Earth women are more modest...
But then...oh, right. You were tricked into coming here, yes? I was dragged...
You look fine, Ochako. Don't let others put you down about a figure you've worked for.
And you seemed so unassuming...just an embarrassed girl.
Seems that outfit should have tipped me off about you...but it's rather normal on Mejare.
How could such a flustered girl be hiding away incredible powers like that?
To levitate under your own power...I need a ship to do it. And you seemed so innocent...
...I really wasn't interested.
I know what panties look like. Put your skirt down.
I think you're the only one demanding your panties be shown.
...Good to know you're not as modest as you look.
...Er...alright then.
...Whatever you just did, can't you actually strip?
I wouldn't call that stripping...or part of the physical realm, for that matter.
...I can't believe what I'm looking at.
Can't you just take off your damn clothes? Honestly.
Why even play if you're not going to follow the rules?
For God's sake...this is preposterous.
I got dragged here. You don't see me making a fuss about stripping.
Just...why? Are you afraid to show off your body? It can't be that bad.
Doesn't that take more effort than just removing your clothes? Are you hiding something about your body?
Are you that afraid to be naked? Is there something about your body you're trying to hide?
For all your bluster and lightshows, you actually do seem fairly skilled at cards.
You're pretty good at this game. Why do you insist on acting so strangely?
Underneath all your costume-switching, you actually seem to know what you're doing.
...That does look useful. I wonder what you'd think of the Paksis.
...Oh my God. I wonder how your power compares to that of the Paksis...our energy core.
...You didn't disappoint. I've learned to believe in the supernatural, after seeing what our Paksis can do...
...Impressive. I don't have those sorts of powers...but the Paksis certainly does.
...Well, you know I'm out of accessories.
The one small thing I have is gone already...
Wish I had all the little things you do...it'd really help here.
Must be nice having a bunch of little things to lose...you know good and well my eyepiece was it.
Oh, for God's sake...your feet are fine.
Yes. Your feet are beautiful, like the rest of you.
As if you need my approval to pad your vanity.
If you want me to pay you compliments, show up to flight practice early.
All the same, I'd appreciate it if you didn't show up to flight practice fifteen minutes late.
You'll have to excuse me for being concerned about a pilot whose first priority is her makeup.
How you do one thing is how you do everything. You've got to bring focus with you wherever you go.
You can't blame me for being concerned. You're usually playing with your hair when I check your status.
Wha--you can't--you're not serious?
N-no underwear? That's a little much even for you, Jura.
You're not serious? Have some decency...
I refuse to believe that, however skimpy it may be. I'm in a bodysuit and I wear underwear.
This is getting ridiculous...obviously you don't wear a bra, but nothing to cover your groin?
I might as well consider it just clothing. Your skills with it are going to fade if you keep ignoring your weapons training.
I've noticed you haven't been practicing with your saber the way you used to. Soon it really will be nothing more than a fashion item.
You're lucky no one has attacked us so far. Not only is Barnette not here to provide firearm support, but I haven't seen you training with that thing in weeks.
If you wanted to come armed, you should've brought a laser ring. We're not in a properly organized team with Barnette--and frankly, you haven't been practicing lately.
Is it wrong to say that fantasies of men have taken up time you used to use for saber training? You're going to get rusty, and it'll only be useful for intimidation.
I remember your saber skills being impressive the last time I actually saw you using that thing. Lately, it's become the fashion accessory you're treating it as.
...I'll start having fun when I start winning.
I don't...like that sort of talk, alright? Let's just move on.
I'll drop it for now. Maybe I'll have more fun if I strip more...hopefully not.
I guess we'll see if stripping more puts me at ease...or the total opposite.
Maybe I'd let you lead the squadron if you demonstrated any desire to.
Forgive me for being less than faithful in your leadership when you're usually applying makeup during our formations practice.
You could've asked to run tonight's patrol instead of dragging me out here to strip in front of strangers, you know.
Well, Jura, you tend to spend all your time doing things like this instead of practicing.
Just take it easy. She's almost done teasing...because she probably couldn't fit any more jewelry on her person.
I could never wear a choker like that...my armor is restrictive enough.
I only own one thing that people might call jewelry...I certainly wouldn't, though.
Must be nice, having all those small things in a game like this. You came prepared...
I was looking forward to keeping pace with you, but apparently you're more interested in showing off your stolen goods.
I just want a clean game, Jura. Can't you take this seriously?
You shouldn't have come armed in the first place...this is just a game, and I'd like to enjoy it.
Don't give the very first impression of yourself as a cheater. I was hoping to get a good game from you.
I figure no one wants to hear me complain.
It's not my place as a leader to start complaining. I leave that to my subordinates.
You didn't really want me to start whining, did you? I should've played better to save myself this discomfort.
I like how cold the ground is. Keeps my senses sharp.
Nothing would please me more than walking out of here without having to expose myself, just to stick it to you.
You won't be seeing me naked tonight...that's the plan, anyway.
You'll stick to seeing me naked in the showers and like it.
Talk is cheap. Let's keep playing.
I'll be having a lot more fun when you're out of my hair for the night.
I only have fun when I win...so I guess I'll have to do that.
You'd be better able to read me than most, I suppose.
It's not as if the others knew what to expect from me. I'm still not sure whether you do.
I'm just saying your defeatist mindset holds you back.
You just say those things so you don't have to try. You're smart, Jura...don't hold yourself back.
All I hear when you say that is a fear of failure.
You're only doing yourself a disservice when you put down your intelligence...
Very funny. Don't be surprised when you have to say that sincerely.
Don't make fun. I plan on getting you to match me for real.
If you haven't noticed, Jura, I'm not finished yet.
Tease while you can, Jura. Your cockiness is usually how you end up losing.
If these people can't spot it for themselves, there's no hope for them.
I hope our hosts are sharp enough to see it for themselves.
I think I know. But maybe I should just let you have your fun.
Clear as day, as far as I can tell. Unless you feel like being even more of a cheat tonight.
It's alright. I appreciate a challenge, and I'm glad you're giving me one.
I'm not mad in the slightest. I've always wanted good competition out of you.
My second-in-command should keep me sharp. Keep it up, Jura.
A good challenge was all I could have hoped for in this game. I'm satisfied with this.
I...of course not. Men are just a curiosity...
I--have a scientific interest in men, but...that's too weird.
A man? I might be standing here naked, but...that isn't for me.
...Men are far too bestial and bizarre for that sort of thing. Is that why you brought me here?
...I could never...be with a man. I'm private enough with other women...
There's just no changing you. But I'm going to keep on trying.
One day I'll manage to make you care about your actual profession.
Is there no way I can make you fit piloting into your life alongside fashion, makeup, and Barnette?
You really are impossible to work with. But when you're proving yourself superior like this, maybe I need to change.
In case anyone missed it, Jura decided to count her armbands as a strippable item.

I understand that Christmas is special, but not to this degree. On Mejare, it's just a celebration of the year's conclusion...is it something else here?
...What is Earth Christmas celebrating, exactly? Mejare just sees it as an annual festival of cheer...
I see. Have you actually been in combat together? And against whom?

...You call your subordinates friends? Mejare's nobles would never dream of that...and neither would I.

So...you're friends with this woman? Lovers? What is it?

Good on you, Lyn. Don't let your friends make mistakes.

I see. While we don't have "goddesses" on Mejare, our ship's captain is actually a former priestess.

Our Dreads can be equipped for atmospheric entry if necessary, so air superiority could be established. How have you been combatting them?
While they're primarily spacecrafts, Dread fighters can be fitted for atmospheric use. The men's Vanguards are even all-terrain. What weapons have you been using in these battles?
Originally, I was a grunt, being sent out on foot raids and working in the munitions hold. But I wanted to stand out, and the quartermaster told me piloting was competitive.
I was just a regisystem grunt at first, doing manual labor. But I was too competitive, and I got in fights--our quartermaster told me to channel that into the front lines. I agreed.
...You sound unhappy with how your group functions. A designated commander might help keep everyone organized.
I understand wanting to remain as equals, but if you find yourselves disorganized, electing a leader might be necessary. Even pirates recognize that authority is needed to make decisions.
You should always want what's best for yourself and your planet. A year ago, I would have said it was impossible for men and women to coexist.
If our crew could come to understand that men are human beings, then people can come to any understanding. What use is treating corruption like it's insurmountable?
That's right. There's a lot I used to regret, but I'm glad that it eventually let me meet them. I would never have explored the galaxy otherwise.
That's right. It wasn't until recently that I appreciated that bond. Together, we've learned men are human, and that humans exist throughout the galaxy.
You can keep the booze. So the dead's emotional energy signatures are preserved as "ghosts"...how did you die?
I don't drink. If you're really a ghost, then you can explain how you died, and what kind of energy your body is manifesting as.
Don't bullets put you on edge?
I guess you've never suffered loss.
This is ridiculuous. Why am I being forced to watch a woman commit suicide?

If one of my pilots pulled a stunt like this, I'd...lecture them, probably.

What? No, I know a woman named Parfet. That wasn't an insult--she's our chief engineer.
...I do like parfaits, but I meant a crewmate of mine named Parfet. You seemed similarly into machinery.
Hm? Oh no, I meant our chief engineer Parfet. She does good work...and she's heard that joke before, don't worry.
That suit is obviously one item. Don't "heroes" play by the rules?

I was wondering why you were waiting to take those off...

This "Second Impact" sounds like what the Harvest wants to do to Mejare.
I heard something about the Earth you know going through a "Second Impact"...the one I know isn't in great shape, either.
Whatever this Second Impact of yours is, it sounds devastating. I wonder if the Earth you know is in a worse state than the one I do...
Who--oh. Your wrestling partner was still around...why do you need help?

How tight are those boots that you need your partner to help get them off? That just seems impractical...

...Of course, I know Dita can handle herself when the enemy is bearing down. What about you?
Hm. Dita may be a ditz, but she hasn't gotten anyone killed when it matters. How do you fare under pressure?

Soldiers are so enamored with their toys...

We're of similar minds. My squadron has plenty of differing opinions--Jura values defense, and Dita power.

I see. And how would you rank your own abilities among all these people?

I keep bracing myself for the next hand, only to remember that stripping comes next. It's like interrupting a dogfight each shot to make small talk.
...Maybe the game will progress after this.
...Mmn. Stripping gives you a chance to stretch your body out. I should follow suit, even if it's not my turn.

When I was younger, I always equated clothing with vanity. I liked the image of thugs showing their midriffs and stretching their legs out.
I can't offer much insight on fashion. When I was young, I liked the punk bands that wore tattered shirts and ripped jeans, and the girls at school thought I was scary.

I should load a full schematic of the Nirvana onto my work tablet to try to make sense of how the Paksis affects both it and the Dreads. Perhaps run a spectral analysis...
If there's one thing I never tolerate, it's complaining-- especially when others have it worse. Case in point: my bare breasts.

...What is it, ~player~? I'm waiting for ~name~ to move on. Aren't you?

I should remind Parfet about fitting our Dreads for handling the high-density gas nebula we're approaching. She's always wrapped up in the Paksis...
...There isn't much to say.
I'm starting to realize how much conversation I made with Gascogne when she'd sit me down for poker. The silence must draw words out of people.
I thought I'd win this game, or at least keep things close. There'd be betting rounds where I could read your faces like I do my pilots'.
Perhaps our Dreads have customizable parts for the same reason girls like to mix and match their outfits.
...If there's anything I don't like about my suit, it's so tight that sweat can dry onto my body by days' end. I'll have to shower when I get back.
...I wonder how I'd look in your ~clothing~. I haven't worn street clothes in a long time.

I can work with this if you move around a little...
In and out...out and around...
Just do what you've always done, Meia...
Fantastic game. If only I were still a part of it...
Impressive for you to still be so covered...

It's common practice on our crew's raids to use the buddy system. We can't allow a man to catch us alone...
It's good to see young women stick together here, as well. Working in pairs is important on our crew's raids, as well as in dogfights.
I always advise raid team members to stick together, as well. A wingwoman is important when piloting, and a partner when boarding.
Just as you'd want another girl here with you in a place like this, my Dream team members always pair up. Pirates can't work alone for long.
...I knew coming here that Earth women were used to men, but it still doesn't sit right with me...
You're so casual about letting him touch you...a man getting hold of us is a death sentence in my home system.
...How can Earth women be so relaxed as a man undresses them? I was always spun stories about men picking me up, forcing me to the ground...
...Be careful that he doesn't accost you. I never know what men are thinking, even if the women on this planet don't seem to fear them...
I suppose many holidays lose sight of their origins over time. I'm glad you've found your own significance for it...and I hope your daughter values that.
That's just as valuable as any historical tradition. I hope you and your daughter are on good terms.
...That's nice, as well. I was born in June myself...and I'd like to have a daughter one day. I hope she's friendly with you.
...Meme? This must be another obscure Earth term I wouldn't know.

It was a slow process for me, as well. But others tend to open up if you do so...a younger girl we took in even started calling me "Big Sister."
...Our goddesses aren't someone we name as a physical being. She once told me that gods only sit in Heaven and watch us.
...She claims that what she learned from her practice is that gods don't appear before us. They only watch over us in silence.
I should appreciate more how my own crewmates treat me as an equal. I was a celebrity as a girl, right around the same age they were.
I was a child celebrity. Most of our crew were girls right around when I was--some must remember seeing me on billboards. I'm grateful for that equal treatment, too.
Most of the time, he does back them up, against all odds. I suspect he wouldn't be as popular if his stunts didn't wipe out the enemy.
Somehow, his stunts keep working out in our favor. Dumb luck seems to be a recurring quality of men, in fact.
He's gotten better about putting actions to his words. I'm often impressed with his tactics--they have no business being as effective as they are.
I guess I'm used to thinking of men as a monolith. Our three prisoners are actually quite different from each other.
That's true. I need to break the habit of reducing men to identical animals. Even our three prisoners are unique-- one is more stoic, and one is more easily flustered.
It's essential that pilots operate in teams. I knew I couldn't fight with my wingmates, so I focused on mastering my Dread...I was given command so it wouldn't go to my head. Do you lead your team?
There are no solo pilots, especially in a pirate outfit. I think I was made a team leader so I wouldn't get overconfident...what about you?
...Do you lead your huntress team? I was given command of a Dread squadron soon after learning my ship--I think they wanted to challenge me.
I thought you worked as a huntress because the military wasn't concerned with Grimm. Where are these combat vehicles coming from?

...That all sounds more like a military than a small team of fighters. Much of the Magno Family is former military, or we otherwise captured ships--where are you getting all these resources?

Is your "darlin'" OK with you risking accidental suicide?
One date with the Harvest would teach you the value of life.
Unbelievable that someone could be this careless.
I take back anything I've said about Hibiki being stupid. This is ridiculous.
